title: eCommerce Marketing Coordinator
description:
Over the last two decades Dave, “The Father of Biohacking” has worked with world-renowned doctors, researchers, scientists, and global mavericks to uncover the latest, most innovative methods, techniques and products for enhancing mental and physical performance. Dave has personally spent over $2 million taking control of his own biology – pushing the bounds of human possibility all in the name of science evolution and revolution. He is a four-time New York Times bestselling science author, host of the Webby award-winning podcast The Human Upgrade, and has been featured on the Today Show, CNN, The New York Times, Fast Company, Vogue and more.
Bottom Line:
We are here to unleash you, to upgrade you, to provide you the opportunity to wake up everyday knowing you are making a difference in the world. If you like the words “can't”, “try” or “impossible”, you should think twice about applying. We don't “try”, we “do”, or “do not”. We carefully choose - as a team, to do what will help the “most” people. If you're ready to fearlessly upgrade your abilities, take risks, and take responsibility, this could be the place for you, plus - we have a lot of fun!
The eCommerce Marketing Coordinator:
In this role, we are seeking a highly organized and proactive eCommerce Marketing Coordinator to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a keen eye for detail and a passion for ensuring that marketing initiatives run seamlessly. You should be a skilled communicator, adept at collaborating with cross-functional teams and managing multiple tasks simultaneously. Your ability to implement marketing plans, coordinate with various stakeholders, and maintain precise schedules will be crucial in driving the success of our eCommerce portfolio.
You Will:
Support the eCommerce Marketing Manager with marketing coordination across the eCommerce portfolio.
Ensure marketing deliverables are scheduled and executed with assets and due dates on Monday.com.
Implement eCommerce marketing plan, including collaboration with other marketing channel owners
Write technical and creative marketing briefs for email and social media.
Setup and manage marketing calendar in Monday.com in collaboration with eCommerce Marketing Manager
Manage coupon code setup in sales platforms (i.e. Shopify or Woocommerce)
Manage Facebook and Instagram, including content creation, scheduling, and comment and DM management
Ensure creative media Photo and Video shot list is created, captured, edited and stored and deliverables are completed on-time and high quality.
Support the eCommerce Marketing Manager with reporting and calculating commissions for affiliates and other data analytics as needed.
Updating and uploading new SKUs for company websites e-commerce platforms.
Prioritize brand and product presence online through owned and partner channels by optimizing product listings, brand stores, online content, etc.
Create & assist with digital marketing campaigns that drive traffic and engagement to website and other digital channels
You Should Have:
3+ years of professional eCommerce experience in a marketing role or similar position, preferably within the wellness, lifestyle or biohacking industries.
Experience with Shopify &/or Woocommerce
Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Proficiency in marketing tools
Attention to detail and a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Compensation -
Based on this position and the requirements above we are offering an annual salary of $60,000 for this position.
Benefits -
We offer 16 days of paid vacation, sick pay and holiday pay. In addition, as an employer we pay 100% of our employees premiums for Medical, Dental, Vision.
**All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States and are required to have U.S. residency at the time of application.
https://daveasprey.com/
Dave Asprey Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Marketing Assistant, Young Readers
description:
We are looking for a Marketing Assistant to join the Random House Children’s Books Trade Marketing team to assist in the development and execution of marketing materials and campaigns across the board book, picture book, and middle grade (including graphic novel) list. Random House Children’s Books is home to bestselling and award-winning trade authors and illustrators, from Suzanne and Max Lang (creators of the Grumpy Monkey series) and R. J. Palacio (author of Wonder), to Emily Winfield Martin (The Wonderful Thing You Will Be), Louis Sachar (Holes), Christopher Paul Curtis (Bud, Not Buddy) and more.

Reporting to the Assistant Director, the Marketing Assistant will work closely with the Young Readers team, especially the Picture Book and Middle-Grade Managers, as well as with the School & Library Marketing, Audience Engagement, and Publicity teams to develop materials and execute cohesive plans to reach booksellers and parents of young readers.

This role includes responsibilities that require in-office participation when handling marketing mailings, so the ability to commute (when needed) to our 1745 Broadway location is essential.

Responsibilities include:
Develop marketing copy for select frontlist and backlist campaign materials
Create seasonal documents in support of select campaigns, including plan templates, display setup forms, and project lists
Develop ad briefs, including targeting and copy suggestions, for programmatic display and social ad campaigns
Create and route campaign announcements and recap documents to be shared across the company
Act as liaison between the Young Readers team and the Audience Engagement team by effectively communicating digital engagement opportunities to the team, maintaining a good relationship with the advertising team, and advising on strategy and optimizations where necessary
Track campaign details, maintain vendor information, and process invoices for the entire Young Readers marketing team budget, working closely with the Senior Director to manage the annual budget document
Create distributions such as proposed print quantities of marketing materials, working back with sales to establish estimates and orders
Develop and execute marketing campaigns for select frontlist and backlist titles
Collaborate with design, digital marketing, school & library marketing, and publicity to ensure cohesive marketing plans and messaging
Perform administrative tasks and provide additional support to the Assistant Director and other members of the Young Readers team as necessary

Requirements/Qualifications:
At least 1-2 years of experience in marketing. Book marketing is preferred
Interest in working with books for young readers (books for kids ages 0-12) a must. Experience working with children’s books a plus!
Highly organized with the ability to communicate effectively and efficiently
Self-motivated worker comfortable working independently as well as with a team
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and remain solution-oriented
Willingness to learn and collaborate

The salary for this position is $48,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results. Please apply using our online application process, and please include your resume and cover letter.
Penguin Random House job postings include a good faith compensation range for each open position. The salary range listed is specific to each particular open position and takes into account various factors including the specifics of the individual role, and candidate's relevant experience and qualifications.

Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Our range of benefits include, but are not limited to, Medical/Prescription drug insurance, Dental, Vision, Health Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Pre-Tax and Roth 401(k), Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance, Life/AD&D Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Student Loan Repayment Program, Educational Assistance & generous paid time off.

Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children's publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 300 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children's Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.<http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/>

Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Influencer Marketing Associate
description:
Who We Are - MANSCAPED® is a leading men’s grooming and lifestyle consumer brand on a mission to introduce and elevate a whole new self-care routine for men. What began as the category creator of below-the-waist grooming has quickly evolved into a global omnichannel powerhouse available around the world on manscaped.com, Amazon, and in major retailers including Target®, Walmart, and Best Buy. As a company, we’re more than just ball jokes (though, rest assured, there’s plenty of those). We proudly uphold seven core values – accountability, authenticity, collaboration, fun, humility, inclusivity, and innovation – which define our brand identity and drive our success. As a people-centric employer brand, we are deeply committed to fostering the growth, happiness, and holistic well-being of each individual on our team.
Who We’re Looking For - Reporting to the Manager, Global Influencer Marketing, we are seeking a Influencer Marketing Associate to join our Marketing team. This role requires experience prospecting outreach targets, building external relationships, and ensuring influencer deliverables are achieved.
Keys to Success - As a member of the Marketing team, success will be measured based on three key actions. 1) Doing your job; setting and meeting appropriate goals that ladder up to the long-term Company vision and the short-term Company targets. You are expected to align on these goals with your manager, and then deliver on them. 2) Doing Your Job, the Right Way; At MANSCAPED® we strive to be ideal team players. That means striving to live up to the Humble, Hard Working & Smart framework. 3) Engaging (in both directions) with Radical Candor in a way that seeks to improve the performance of yourself and the team around you.

Responsibilities:
Research new influencer marketing opportunities across YouTube, Instagram, TikTok and by using tools like Upfluence
Effectively prospect targets identified by key demographic and audience segment criteria
Send high volume of outbound emails to establish first contact with influencers and/or agencies
Manage campaigns on “for trade” basis, as well as be comfortable negotiating with influencers/agency partners
Onboard influencers with unique tracking process, and document accordingly
Build and maintain your own dedicated influencer marketing roster and book of business
Understand performance metrics and isolate what’s working
Assist in daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting
Assist internal workflow and communication necessary to execute influencer marketing deliverables
Ensure influencer marketing roster curates value and drives high ROI
Other duties as required
Qualifications:
1+ years of digital marketing experience with track record of success
Will also accept related experience in media buying, audio/radio, business development, Sales, or Public Relations (PR)
This person must naturally love influencer and/or podcast marketing
Sports knowledge is a major plus
Basic understanding of Google Analytics and KPI metrics
Comfortable writing and sending high volume outbound emails per day
Excels at researching and outreach techniques to secure relationships
Able to build quality partnerships based on “for trade” campaigns, or be able to negotiate campaign costs and deliverables
A team player, with a willingness to adapt and test new approaches to solving problems
MANSCAPED® Benefits:
20 Vacation Days
40 Hours Paid Sick Leave
Paid Mental Health Days
9 Paid Holidays
Pet Insurance
Life AD&D + LTD Coverage
Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA + FSA
Employee 401(K) Plan with Employer Match
Monthly Utility Allowance
Employee Discounts

title: Development Assistant, Content and Copy
description:
The Museum of Modern Art is seeking a Development Assistant, Content & Copy to join the Membership team within the External Affairs department. Content is a key element of our member engagement strategy. This role will assist the Manager, Member Engagement in development and execution of an annual plan to engage members through email, mail, social, and web channels. We are seeking an individual with excellent writing skills and a passion for modern and contemporary art.
Responsibilities:
Gathers information from appropriate stakeholders across MoMA to synthesize and communicate programs and engagement opportunities to our member community.
Builds an annual content calendar based on Museums’ exhibition schedule, tent-pole events, and key cultural moments.
Oversees monthly content creation aligned with the annual calendar.
Drafts monthly newsletters and event invitations to communicate member benefits and drive engagement.
Develops copy for monthly renewal solicitations and acquisition campaigns across direct mail, email, ads, social media, and moma.org.
Maintains team-wide creative resources, including images, brand and copy guidelines, and past materials.
Analyzes results of initiatives to identify optimizations for content and communications plan.
Performs any other duties reasonably related to the functions described above.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree and one to two years experience in an editorial or marketing organization.
Prior experience with copy creation, content planning, and social media marketing preferred.
Prior experience in a museum or cultural institution is a plus.
Excellent written communication skills.
Attention to detail. Ability to follow and meet deadlines.
Reports to: Manager, Membership Engagement
Salary: The salary for this position is $54,941 per annum.
Application instructions: To apply, please visit MoMA Jobs. Applicants should submit a resume and a statement of interest.
Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Statement: Equal Employment Opportunity has been, and will continue to be, a fundamental principle at the Museum, where employment is based upon personal capabilities and qualifications without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, pregnancy, genetic information, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital and civil partnership/union status, alienage or citizenship status, creed, genetic predisposition or carrier status, unemployment status, familial status, domestic violence, sexual violence or stalking victim status, caregiver status, arrest or conviction record to the extent required by applicable law, credit history, or any other protected category as established by applicable law, including the New York City Human Rights Law (“NYCHRL”)
This is a unionized position at MoMA with covered employees represented by Local 2110, UAW, AFL-CIO.

title: Internal Communications Summer Analyst
description:
Internal Communications Summer Analyst
Job Number:
3248131
POSTING DATE: Mar 8, 2024
PRIMARY LOCATION: Americas-United States of America-New York-New York
EDUCATION LEVEL: High School Diploma/GED
JOB: Administration

DESCRIPTION
The Internal Communications Summer Analyst will support integrated internal communications planning and execution, including editorial services and administrative tasks. Responsibilities include project support to evolve our internal communications platforms and channels; content planning across all Firmwide Communications channels in close collaboration with team members; and copywriting in a deadline-driven environment. This program runs from June 3-August 16th, 2024.

Job Responsibilities:
Provide strategic communications planning and execution support for engaging and communicating with internal audiences across the Firm.
Prepare written and visual content for Morgan Stanley's intranet site and other formats, covering business, events and Firmwide initiatives.
Participate in meetings, take and publish notes and assist in follow-ups on key projects
Manage the publishing calendar, collaborating with the team to schedule when content is run.

Support ongoing assessment and measurement of our internal communications programs.

Demonstrate a proven ability to work independently and as part of a team, and to balance a workload of multiple assignments for various parties in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication skills
Professional demeanor and positive attitude
Ability to work confidently under pressure and multitask
Proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel

title: Growth Marketing Associate
description:
At Devoted Health, we’re on a mission to dramatically improve the health and well-being of older Americans by caring for every person like family. That’s why we’re gathering smart, diverse, and big-hearted people to create a new kind of all-in-one healthcare company — one that combines compassion, health insurance, clinical care, service, and technology - to deliver a complete and integrated healthcare solution that delivers high quality care that everyone would want for someone they love. Founded in 2017, we've grown fast and now serve members across the United States. And we've just started. So join us on this mission!
Job Description
A bit about this role:

We’re looking for a Marketing Associate to join our Growth Marketing team. The growth marketing team is responsible for acquiring new customers and strategically deploying a multi-million dollar advertising budget. We work cross-functionally as a team to achieve growth and ROI goals, while building a culture of intellectual honesty, analytical rigor, collaboration, and entrepreneurialism.
Responsibilities would include:
Work across multiple growth marketing channels, including direct mail, digital, and nurture, on campaign operations, creative development, and quality assurance
Collaborate with Creative & Copy to produce beautiful marketing materials that advance the Devoted brand and generate successful results
Ensure 100% compliant, error free marketing materials
Work cross functionally with creative, sales, and analytics partners to develop relevant marketing materials, test new concepts and messaging, and improve the prospective customer experience
Use Monday.com to manage creative requests with our in house video, design, copy, and compliance teams
Leverage Looker and google sheets to track channel performance
Communicate frequently with other marketing team members and have visibility with senior leaders
Required skills and experience:
1 to 3 years of experience in marketing or business operations
Basic understanding of digital marketing and an interest in learning more. You’re excited about things like ad copy, personalized content, and landing page design
An understanding of marketing KPIs (such as acquisition costs and conversion rates) and an interest in testing new concepts to improve these metrics
An extremely keen eye for detail and the ability to keep multiple projects organized and moving forward on schedule
Experience with project management tools (ex: Monday.com or Asana)
Experience with any of the following marketing platforms is a plus, but not required: Facebook Ads Manager, Google Ads Manager (Google Search and/or YouTube), Google Analytics, HubSpot, Instapage
Persistence in problem-solving; willing to “try things out” and iterate to find solutions
Flexible and willing to adapt approach based on performance and business goals
Proactive, self-motivated learner who enjoys honing their craft and becoming better each day
Collaborative team player, ability to work well with others, excellent communication
#LI-BC1
#LI-Remote

Salary range: $65,000 to $75,000 annually
Healthcare equality is at the center of Devoted’s mission to treat our members like family. We are committed to a diverse and vibrant workforce. If you lack a specific credential for this position but believe that your strengths and life experiences will propel our mission, we would love to hear from you.

Employer sponsored health, dental and vision plan with low or no premium
Generous paid time off
$100 monthly mobile or internet stipend
Stock options for all employees

title: MEDIA RELATIONS STRATEGIST
description:
Job Title: Media Relations Strategist
Job Type: Full-Time
Reports To: Director of Media Relations
Location: MO, IL, NC, or TX, Remote, M-F, Central Time
Restriction: This opportunity is for candidates residing in or relocating to MO, IL, NC, or TX
Compensation: $36,000 to $40,000 Annually + Benefits
The PR and Content Division of Intero Digital is looking for a Media Relations Strategist. The ideal candidate is expected to evaluate situations through the lenses of the company’s core values including situations that cannot be addressed in this list. Time allocation is indicative and subject to change based on organizational needs and project priorities. Flexibility and collaboration across departments are essential.
The Core Values
Know Your Impact
Lead With Integrity
Deliver the Extraordinary
The media relations department is fully focused on media relations (building relationships with journalists, editors, publishers, etc.) and is the distribution arm of the PR and Content Division of Intero Digital for all earned media including (but not limited to) guest contributed articles and PR pitch campaigns.
Responsibilities
Content Strategy and Management (45%)
Oversee guest contributed content queues, ensuring timely approvals and providing constructive feedback.
Suggest publications that are a match for provided topics and build media lists in MuckRack to match PR campaign themes.
Pitch content to editors and journalists, considering client and publication needs, and follow up on submissions.
Act as the subject matter expert for publications, maintaining up-to-date profiles and tracking submissions.
Review topics and articles for quality and publication fit.
Relationship Building and Maintenance (30%)
Establish and maintain strong relationships with publication editors, journalists and other key contacts.
Proactively address content errors and client edit requests in published content.
Build professional connections beyond day-to-day tasks, adapting to changes within publications, to ensure high acceptance rates and timely publication of client content.
Reach out to publications that we do not currently work with that could benefit our client’s goals.
Client Strategy and Communication (15%)
Support client strategies by understanding account goals, success metrics, and target audiences.
Provide guidance on improving earned media strategy.
Offer insights based on publication trends and performance.
Internal Administration and Communication (10%)
Lead and participate in team meetings, ensuring effective communication and documentation.
Maintain an organized approach to email, Slack, and other communication tools.
Contribute to interdepartmental coordination and support colleagues in their responsibilities.
Participate in completing division-wide rocks, media relations department rocks, or rocks for other departments when needed/asked.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $36,000.00 - $40,000.00 per year
Work Location: Remote

Position Summary
We are excited to welcome a motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Digital Content Coordinator. This role is perfect for someone with a passion for digital media, strong organizational skills, and a desire to kickstart their career in the dynamic world of content coordination. You will be a vital part of our administrative team, responsible for web content entry, social media coordination, and providing support in event coordination. This position provides a fantastic opportunity to gain hands-on experience and build a foundation for a successful career in digital marketing, communications, and more. Join us in shaping a vibrant digital presence and making a positive impact through compelling content and engaging events.
Responsibilities
Web Content Entry:
Assist in updating and maintaining content on the organization's website.
Perform key word searches for search engine optimization.
Work closely with team members to ensure accurate and consistent information.
Social Media Coordination:
Support the development and execution of social media content calendars.
Contribute to the creation of engaging content for various social media platforms.
Monitor social media channels and assist in responding to inquiries.
Event Coordination:
Provide support in the planning and execution of digital events and campaigns.
Assist in coordinating logistics for events, and collaborating with internal teams.
Content Creation:
Contribute ideas and assist in the creation of digital content, including graphics and written materials.
Assist in coordinating larger projects such as photo shoots, videos, and more.
Monitoring and Reporting:
Learn to analyze social media and website metrics and provide basic reports on content performance.
Perform other related duties and responsibilities as assigned/requested.
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's degree or equivalent in education and experience.
Preferred Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, or a related field is preferred but all majors are encouraged to apply.
Other Requirements
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.
Basic understanding of digital marketing concepts and familiarity with social media platforms.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new tools and technologies.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team-oriented environment.
Detail-oriented with a keen eye for accuracy.
Enthusiastic about digital media and content creation.
Open to learning and taking on new challenges.

title: Summer Co-op 2024 - Digital Marketing, CRM
description:
Job Overview:
Summer Co-op 2024 - Digital Marketing, CRM - Burlington, Massachusetts

As a Summer Co-op 2024 - Digital Marketing, CRM in Burlington, Massachusetts at Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP), you will join the Keurig.com consumer relationship management team for a Co-op that gives hands-on experience with a best-in-class CRM system. Apprentice under the Manager of CRM sending campaigns that drive results and build relationships.

Shift/Schedule:
The KDP 2024 Summer Co-Op Program will run from July 10 - December 6, 2024
Full-time; 40 hours per week
Monday-Friday
8:00am until 5:00pm
Hybrid
As a Digital Marketing, CRM Co-op you will:
Execute promotional CRM calendar for Keurig.com including, building, testing and scheduling promotional emails.
Execute subject line and preheader testing for promotional emails.
Competitive Benchmarking against other programs and active swipe libraries.
Conduct miscellaneous reporting projects related to email and push/inbox sends.
Execute ad hoc sends.
Elements of the KDP Intern/Co-Op Program include:
Engaging and partnering on innovative projects to gain experience in a challenging, cross functional team environment
Participate in meet & greets and lunch & learns with KDP executives and other organization leaders
Receive professional development training such as networking, professional skills development and presenting
Be paired with a mentor to enhance your knowledge of other parts of the business and build your network
Complete a project from start to finish and present it and your takeaways to your team, department vice president and other KDP stakeholders
Please note: This position is limited to persons with permanent right to work in the United States.
Requirements:
Must be an undergraduate currently enrolled in a full-time academic program from an accredited college or university, majoring in Business or Marketing related field
Available to work 40 hours per week (M-F, 8am-5pm)
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with a demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize requests, and meet deadlines
Strong communication skills including excellent listening, written, and verbal abilities
Ability to work cross-functionally, be independently driven, and a self-starter
Strong skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
We incorporate HireVue, an automated interview tool, into our campus recruitment process. Please visit this link to learn more about HireVue and how to prepare. *We recommend checking with your campus career center for additional preparation resources such as InterviewStream, Big Interview and more.

Compensation:
$27.00/hour
Paid bi-weekly
$5,000.00 Sign-on Bonus, paid within first 30 days of employment
Company Overview & EEO Statement:
Keurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) is a modern beverage company with a bold vision built to deliver growth and opportunity. We operate with a differentiated business model and world-class brand portfolio, powered by a talented and engaged team that is anchored in our values. We work with big, exciting beverage brands and the #1 single-serve coffee brewing system in North America at KDP, and we have fun doing it!

Together, we have built a leading beverage company in North America offering hot and cold beverages together at scale. Whatever your area of expertise, at KDP you can be a part of a team that’s proud of its brands, partnerships, innovation, and growth. Will you join us?

We strive to be an employer of choice, providing a culture and opportunities that empower our team of ~28,000 employees to grow and develop. We offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development, while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work.

Keurig Dr Pepper is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. title: Marketing Special Events Coordinator
description:
About: Bloomingdale’s makes fashion personal and fun, aspirational yet approachable. Our mission is to guide and inspire our customers to make style a source of creative energy in their lives. We will always strive to make Bloomingdale’s like no other store in the world. Everyone plays a critical role to bring our mission to life. Regardless of position, we believe all colleagues have a voice and access to share their thoughts with every level of leadership. Our colleagues are passionate, driven, entrepreneurial and collaborative. We welcome and embrace diversity of background, thought and opinion while having a lot of fun along the way.

Job Overview: The Marketing and Special Events Coordinator assists in the execution of in Bloomingdale’s Integrated Marketing campaigns, including virtual and in-store events. Involvement with external partnerships to drive brand awareness and customer acquisition to positively impact market share on a localized level. The Coordinator will partner with store leadership in the cultivation of Top Clients and maximization of Bloomingdale’s programs dedicated to top tiers .


Essential Functions:
Assists in the planning and full execution of all aspects of in-store events and animation that support the direction of the Central strategy. Track post-event results and provides feedback to Central partners.
Enhances Central strategy by supporting secured sponsorships, co-branding opportunities and/or community initiatives that build productive local relationships with the intent to build customer base and commerce.
Partners with the Store Leadership team in creating curated experiences to build loyalty and share among Bloomingdale’s top spending “Top of the List” (TOL) clients. Maximize opportunities to delight top clients through experiences and special events. Monitor frequency of visits, engagement and spend.
Collaborates with the Central Media team to develop local media plans, securing publicity and partnering with brand-appropriate social media influencers and bloggers.
Pursues localized opportunities in alignment with Trade Area Marketing and Special Events Leader and store leadership to cultivate customers and build sales. Supports local accelerated growth of focus businesses with event intensification that builds store animation and experience.
Guides General Manager(s) as to productive involvement in outside organizations and events.
Leverages corporate philanthropy giving programs to maximize community impact and fundraising.
May be called upon as point person for external communication locally

Qualifications and Competencies:
We encourage candidates with either a bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience in a related field to apply.


Practices open and continuous communication, values keeping others informed, effectively presenting information in a clear, concise manner
Excellent leadership, facilitation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work across functional lines and at many levels
Ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and Company needs
Physical Requirements:
Hybrid work model that includes in-store and remote work requirements
Requires prolonged periods of sitting, with occasional standing
Event execution requires walking, bending, reaching, hearing and talking
Continuous use of computers and other office equipment
Frequently lift/move up to 25 lbs.

This position may be eligible for performance-based incentives/bonuses. Benefits include 401k, medical/vision/dental/life/disability insurance options, PTO accruals, Holidays, and more. Eligibility requirements may apply based on location, job level, classification, and length of employment. Additional benefit details are available at bloomingdalesJOBS.com.

At Walt Disney Studios, we are seeking a Marketing Coordinator who will play a meaningful role in assisting and supporting the Global Brand Strategy team! As Coordinator on the Marketing Strategy team, working on theatrical and streaming titles for Marvel Studios and Lucasfilm, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining organized workflows and supporting various aspects of marketing campaigns. Organize workflows and support theatrical and Disney+ Marketing Campaigns for Marvel Studios and Lucasfilm titles

Excellent written and verbal communications and interpersonal skills

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
About Appriss Retail
Appriss Retail provides real-time decisions and active risk monitoring to enable our customers to maximize profitability while managing risk. Our solutions are continually adapting to changing market conditions.
We bring 20+ years of retail data science expertise and experience. We serve a global base of leading commerce partners, representing 1/3 of all US omnichannel retail sales activity across 150,000 retail locations across specialty, apparel, department store, hard goods, big box, grocery, pharmacy, and hospitality businesses in 45 countries on six continents.
The company provides compelling, relevant, and profitable collective intelligence to operations, finance, marketing, and loss prevention. Appriss Retail’s performance-improvement solutions yield measurable results with significant return on investment.
About the role
The Digital Marketing Specialist is an integral member of Appriss Retail’s marketing team, helping to develop, execute, and maintain the company’s digital marketing campaigns. The ideal candidate will have a strong creative background, using Canva to create assets for email campaigns, ads, landing pages, and events. The Digital Marketing Specialist will be responsible for managing our email campaigns, including monthly digests, campaign emails, product-related emails, and event emails. The Specialist will also work closely with subject matter experts to create engaging blog content that is optimized for search engines and helps reinforce Appriss Retail’s position as an industry leader in retail fraud and abuse prevention.
What you'll do
Create and schedule posts in HubSpot for our social media channels that are engaging and offer a unique mix of topics and content, with the intent of increasing engagement, followers, and MQLs.
Create and schedule emails in HubSpot for marketing campaigns, digests, product updates, and events.
Work alongside our agency to publish two blogs a month, including topic research, building an outline with SMEs, SEO keyword research, finalizing the blog, photo selection, publishing it on our website, and creating social media posts and emails to promote them.
Use strong creative skills to design images and videos for emails, landing pages, events, and organic and paid social media.
Assist in writing content for the Appriss Retail blog, emails, and social media.
Assist in editing the website in WordPress.
Collaborate with other departments and stakeholders to ensure alignment and integration of digital marketing efforts with overall business objectives and brand identity.
Qualifications
1-3 years of experience building comprehensive digital marketing campaigns using a CMS or marketing automation platform (HubSpot preferred).
Strong creative skills (Canva or Photoshop preferred) for creating branded social media posts, ad campaigns, and videos.
Strong understanding of social media platforms, particularly LinkedIn.
Strong content writing skills.
Excellent writing and communication skills.
Working knowledge of email, landing page, and website design best practices.
Working knowledge of WordPress and Salesforce.
Working knowledge of email marketing best practices and CAN-SPAM compliance.
Must be able to work independently and within a team.
Skilled in PowerPoint.
Basic knowledge of HTML.
Up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in SEO.
Physical Demands - Sedentary

Benefits

Appriss Retail offers competitive benefits including medical, dental, and vision coverage. We offer an immediate vesting 401(k) plan with employer matching, unlimited paid time off for salaried employees, and well-being support including gym reimbursements, a subscription to Calm – Meditation and Sleep app, and paid leave for new parents and family care. As a hybrid global community, we also offer a remote work-first environment empowering our people to work wherever suits their lifestyle.
The pay range for this role is:
55,000 - 65,000 USD per year (Remote - United States)

title: Associate, SEO
description:
Who we are:
Tinuiti is the largest independent performance marketing firm across Streaming TV, Google, Meta, and Amazon, with almost $4 billion in digital media under management and over 1,200 employees. With industry-leading expertise in search, social, Amazon and marketplaces, addressable TV, mobile apps, Influencer, Lifecycle, and more, Tinuiti understands that success requires both strategy and channel expertise. Our goal when we come to work every day is simple - to grow happiness. For our clients, their customers, our people and our partners. Growing happiness guides everything we do and our core values - Unleash Greatness, Never Stop Learning, Ignite Your Passion, Thankful Living, and Inspire Innovation & Change - inspire us to maintain a culture where our people take pride in their work and have fun doing it.
We support 100% remote work for applicants who reside in the United States.
What you’ll be doing:
Monitor daily performance metrics to understand organic search performance across multiple global markets.
Work with Account Managers to create custom Excel or Google Analytics reports for clients.
Identify growth opportunities in core areas such as site infrastructure, keyword selection, or on-page factors optimization.
Track & monitor SEO engagement performance and provide insights to Account Managers.
Assist with the analysis of SEO issues and help develop actionable solutions based on findings.
Lead presentations of produced deliverables and address client questions/feedback.
Provide timely responses to client questions via e-mails or other platforms
Monitor, research, and blog about industry trends.
Assist with promotions, content, analytics, etc.
Proactively listening and participating in cross-division planning and strategies for all assigned clients.
We’d love to hear from you if:
Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you qualify, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.
Requirements:
Monitor daily performance metrics to understand organic search performance across multiple global markets.
Work with account teams to create custom Looker Studio or Google Analytics reports for clients.
Identify growth opportunities in core areas such as site infrastructure, keyword selection, or on-page factors optimization.
Track & monitor SEO engagement performance and provide insights to account teams
Lead or assist with the analysis of SEO issues and help develop actionable solutions based on findings.
Lead presentations of produced deliverables and address client questions/feedback.
Provide timely responses to client questions via e-mails or other platforms
Monitor, research, and blog about industry trends.
Lead or assist with promotions, content, analytics, etc.
Proactively listening and participating in cross-division planning and strategies for all assigned clients.
FLSA Classification: Exempt
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Benefits:
At Tinuiti, we want to ensure you have the time you need to rest and recharge. That's why Tinuitians have an estimated 70 days off per year through our time off programs
Unlimited PTO: We encourage all Tinutians to Own their Offline by utilizing our unlimited PTO by working with your Manager to ensure all deliverables are met.
Holidays: We offer 17 paid holidays, if one of your religious holidays is not covered, please by all means take advantage of your Flex PTO!
Flex Fridays: Meetings are minimized and all Tinuitians have the option to start their weekend early at 1pm local time.
Owning Our Offline: Clients are informed and all offices will be closed for 3 total weeks throughout the year to give everyone the chance to truly unplug.
Healthcare: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & Disability, Flex Spending Accounts
Retirement: Match up to 4% of your contributions at 100% with immediate vesting
Perks and Wellness: Fringe, Forma, Thankful giving, Equity
Learning and Development: Mentor program and more
The hiring base salary range for this role is $55,000 - $60,000. We also offer incentive pay. Beginning Q2 2024, this role will be eligible for our new RevShare program comprising a monthly variable commission opportunity and a discretionary annual bonus.
Grade level and salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. We will provide more information on our benefits and equity upon requests. Disclosure as required by the Colorado Equal Pay for > Equal Work Act, C.R.S. § 8-5-101 et seq.

title: Marketing Coordinator, Executive Education
description:
MARKETING COORDINATOR, Sloan School of Management-Executive Education, to execute a wide range of tasks in order to promote a large portfolio of executive programs with the ultimate goal of driving enrollments and client engagement. Will also represent the brand at conferences and events, be involved in logistics and planning, assist with the day-to-day operations of the marketing team, and perform other activities as necessary.

title: Local Retail Marketing Specialist
description:
Why we will love you
A job at IKEA is so much more than home furnishings. Together, we work to make a better everyday life for the many. It's the perfect fit if you want to contribute, grow, and share your uniqueness. Join our team and start a better life for yourself.
What you'll be doing day to day
As a Local Retail Marketing Specialist, supporting omnichannel growth and brand positioning in a market, you will: Lead the implementation of internal communication strategies within the unit, ensuring seamless coordination and follow-up across all co-worker areas and channels. Collaborate closely with the Local Marketing Manager and Service (Corporate) Office to contribute to the development and execution of a comprehensive local marketing and communication plan across the market, integrating national and local strategies. Utilize market research, including SWOT and Market analysis, for informed business and customer engagement planning. Collaborate with cross-functional partners to execute unit-specific marketing and communication plans using insights from PMA analysis, consumer data, income levels, and infrastructure. Drive recruitment and activation of loyalty club members, such as IKEA Family, focusing on increasing awareness, recruitment, and identification rates. Ensure all local communication channels adhere to marketing communication guidelines and stay updated. Plan, coordinate, and promote customer and community events to enhance visitation, loyalty, engagement, and create an enjoyable in-store experience. Analyze and communicate key performance indicators (KPIs), along with actionable insights, pertaining to loyalty, visitation, and market trends with relevant stakeholders. Assume responsibility for allocating and managing local store activities and community budgets, ensuring optimal utilization for maximum impact.
Together as a Team
Our team is the voice of IKEA. We use words, pictures and videos to tell the story about IKEA, to build our brand and inspire people with our offer. We bounce ideas back and forth, we challenge each other and we are crazy passionate about communication. Of course we’re also the ones who make sure to keep all our fellow co-workers informed, engaged and connected in a constantly changing business environment.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree 5 years of related experience. Good communication skills (verbal and written). Strong organizational and prioritization skills. Self-reliant, motivated, and a team player. Requirements Travel is required for this role. Less than 5- 25% (1 day per week on average)
Apply now!
JOB TYPE: Permanent, Salaried BENEFITS ELIGIBLE: Yes HOURS: Salaried role. Retail environment, must have full open availability including evenings and weekends. The full salary range for this role is $68,000-$99,000 We offer competitive benefits and perks, such as medical and Rx*, dental, vison, 401k, meal deal, store discount, autism coverage, parental leave, pet insurance, education assistance and more.

title: Digital Marketing, Associate
description:
49019BR
USA - California - Mountain View/Sunnyvale
Job Description and Requirements
As a Digital Marketing Associate, your responsibilities may include a range of tasks that contribute to the overall success of Demand Gen and digital marketing initiatives. This internship provides an opportunity to gain hands-on experience in various aspects of digital marketing, including email campaigns, web execution, and more. The ideal candidate should be enthusiastic and have a basic understanding of digital marketing principles and tools, have an analytics mindset, and be self-motivated to take on new challenges.

Responsibilities
Support the execution of email marketing campaigns with Marketo.
Quality-check email marketing campaigns
Creating or editing web content with CMS – Adobe Experience Manager (AEM)
Participate in weekly and/or monthly team meetings.
Assist with miscellaneous tasks that contribute to the overall success of the Demand Gen and digital marketing team.
Be flexible and willing to take on new responsibilities as needed.
Work closely with cross-functional teams
Communicate effectively with team members to coordinate tasks and share updates.

Requirements
Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Marketing, Business, or a related field or new college grad on the above related fields.
1-2 years of proven experience in digital marketing or related field or previous internship experience
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Attention to details.
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and trends.
Must be a fast learner, multi-tasker, independent problem solver.

The base salary range across the U.S. for this role is between $66,000-$98,000. In addition, this role may be eligible for an annual bonus, equity, and other discretionary bonuses. Synopsys offers comprehensive health, wellness, and financial benefits as part of a of a competitive total rewards package. The actual compensation offered will be based on a number of job-related factors, including location, skills, experience, and education. Your recruiter can share more specific details on the total rewards package upon request.

At Synopsys, we’re at the heart of the innovations that change the way we work and play. Self-driving cars. Artificial Intelligence. The cloud. 5G. The Internet of Things. These breakthroughs are ushering in the Era of Smart Everything. And we’re powering it all with the world’s most advanced technologies for chip design and software security. If you share our passion for innovation, we want to meet you.

Stay Connected: Join our Talent Community

Inclusion and Diversity are important to us. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, military veteran status, or disability.

title: Complex Marketing Coordinator
description:
Información Adicional Pay Range: $29 - $34 / hour
Número de Empleo 24024977
Categoría de Empleo Sales & Marketing
Ubicación W New York - Times Square, 1567 Broadway, New York, New York, United States VER EN MAPA
Horario Full-Time
¿Ubicación remota? N
¿Reubicación? N
Tipo de Posición Non-Management
Descripción del Trabajo
Promover la conciencia de la imagen de la marca tanto interna como externamente. Utilizar técnicas de venta que maximicen los ingresos mientras se mantiene la lealtad actual de los huéspedes a Marriott. Reconocer las oportunidades de vender mejores productos a los clientes y vender mejoras a fin de crear mejores experiencias o eventos en Marriott. Alentar a los huéspedes o a las personas que llaman a comprar, o programar ventas de paquetes y recorridos preliminares. Explicar los detalles y requisitos relacionados con asistir a una presentación de ventas a potenciales dueños. Verificar que las personas cumplan con los requisitos de idoneidad para programar ventas de paquetes y recorridos preliminares antes de organizar una excursión para el Club de Vacaciones Marriott. Determinar y otorgar obsequios a los huéspedes como agradecimiento por ser nuestros clientes (p. ej. puntos de recompensa, entradas para espectáculos). Responder las preguntas de los huéspedes con respecto a los servicios e instalaciones del hotel. Recibir, registrar y transmitir los mensajes de forma exacta, completa y legible.

Cumplir con todas las políticas y los procedimientos de la compañía, asegurarse de que el uniforme y la apariencia personal sean pulcras y profesionales, mantener la confidencialidad de la información patentada y proteger los bienes de la compañía. Recibir y reconocer a todos los huéspedes de acuerdo con los estándares de la compañía; anticiparse a sus necesidades de servicio y atenderlas y agradecerles con aprecio genuino. Hablar con los demás utilizando un lenguaje claro y profesional, preparar y revisar los documentos escritos de manera exacta y completa y atender los teléfonos utilizando el protocolo adecuado. Cultivar y mantener relaciones laborales positivas con los demás; apoyar al equipo para alcanzar los objetivos comunes; escuchar y responder de manera apropiada las inquietudes de los demás empleados. Acatar las expectativas y los estándares de garantía de la calidad. Estar de pie, tomar asiento o caminar durante un período prolongado de tiempo. Mover, levantar, transportar, empujar, arrastrar y ubicar sin ayuda objetos que pesen 10 libras o menos. Ejecutar otros deberes de trabajo razonables solicitados por supervisors.

La rango de pago para este puesto es de $29 a $34 por hora y ofrece beneficios de atención médica, cuentas de gastos flexibles, plan 401 (k), tiempo libre remunerado y/o licencia por enfermedad, seguro de vida, cobertura por discapacidad y otros beneficios de bienestar de vida y trabajo. Los beneficios pueden estar sujetos a elegibilidad, período de espera, contribución y otros requisitos y condiciones generalmente aplicables.

Marriott International es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Creemos en la importancia de contratar a una fuerza laboral diversa, así como apoyar una cultura inclusiva que anteponga a las personas. Nos comprometemos a respetar el principio de no discriminación por cualquier motivo protegido, como la discapacidad y condición de veterano o cualquier otra situación protegida por las leyes aplicables.

La misión de W Hotels es despertar la curiosidad y expandir mundos. Somos un lugar para disfrutar de la vida. Estamos aquí para abrir puertas y mentes. Constantemente nos dejamos inspirar por nuevas caras y nuevas experiencias. Nuestro núcleo es un espíritu armonioso y listo para todo, que nos ha hecho famosos por reinventar las normas del lujo en todo el mundo. El servicio Whatever/Whenever es nuestra cultura y la filosofía de servicio que hace realidad las pasiones de los huéspedes. Si eres original, innovador y siempre miras hacia las posibilidades que te brinda el futuro, te damos la bienvenida a W Hotels. Al unirte a W Hotels, te unes a una cartera de marcas con Marriott International. Estarás donde puedes llevar a cabo tu mejor trabajo, comenzarás a cumplir tu propósito, formarás parte de un increíble equipo mundial y te convertirás en tu mejor versión.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
At Walt Disney Studios, we are seeking a Marketing Coordinator who will play a meaningful role in assisting and supporting the Global Brand Strategy team! As Coordinator on the Marketing Strategy team, working on theatrical and streaming titles for Marvel Studios and Lucasfilm, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining organized workflows and supporting various aspects of marketing campaigns. Your responsibilities will include managing essential documents, coordinating internal meetings and presentations, collaborating with various lines of Disney business, and contributing to special projects. The role requires a proactive and diligent individual who excels in multitasking and thrives in a dynamic, high-paced environment.
Job Responsibilities
Organize workflows and support theatrical and Disney+ Marketing Campaigns for Marvel Studios and Lucasfilm titles
Track and organize all information related to campaign for streaming and theatrical releases; including strategy briefs, scripts, screening requests, promotional partnership material, etc.
Participate in team and campaign planning meetings by providing meeting prep for the team, and circulating post-meeting notes to attendees and internal databases.
Collect, coordinate and maintain key department and campaign documents including internal databases, weekly executive reports/highlights for review, and title specific marketing calendars
When required, coordinate transfers of critical and confidential material, implementing security protocols
Contribute to special departmental projects and corporate initiatives as needed
Invoice submissions for each title on an as needed basis
Basic Requirements
Bachelors degree or equivalent experience in Marketing or related field
2+ year of experience in a marketing support or assistant role
Detail oriented and organized in thinking and execution to maintain campaign databases and information
Excellent written and verbal communications and interpersonal skills
Effectively problem solve using resources available, exercising good judgement and discretion
Proven experience with presentation building in both Keynote and PowerPoint and proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and Google Workplace
A multi-tasker who can prioritize multiple projects at once

The hiring range for this position in Burbank, CA, is $51,300 to $66,300 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Brand Marketing Coordinator
description:
Manage and maintain King Features’ Product Approvals System and Creative Asset Center, ensuring all partner products and marketing materials adhere to KFS branding and legal guidelines on a global basis. These support systems are essential to keeping KFS’ Licensing/ Marketing/PR businesses functioning efficiently. Provide administrative support to brand marketing team.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Serve as primary contact in the product development process; establish and maintain relationships with licensees, agents, and brand owners
Manage complete product submission lifecycle in KFS’ Product Approvals System:
On-board new partners by granting them access to the Approvals system and educating them on the KFS submission process over email and during kick-off calls
Read final contracts to understand all rights granted to licensees by brand, characters, product category, distribution channels, final samples required and contract term
Review submissions for King Features’ licensed products to ensure they uphold brand integrity standards and legal compliances; flag any submissions that are outside of contract terms
Route any “story based” approvals to Brand Marketing for review (gaming, publishing, experiential, etc.)
Route marketing, promo and social materials to Brand team for approval
Provide comments to licensees as needed and ensure the corrections are made in resubmission phases; answer partner questions and gather feedback from proprietors when applicable
Facilitate product approvals for international markets with local agent in each territory; gather and communicate launch details to the KFS team
Elevate the quality and style of our products through creative direction that enhances their design, keeping in mind what drives consumer demand (trends etc.)
Manage special permission requests for art usage on one-off products
Confirm delivery of pre-production and final product samples in-house as detailed in each contract, and coordinate delivery of legally required samples to property owners as needed
Provide monthly product submissions by brand report to management
Present “best of” products to leadership in management meeting biannually
Lead organization of inventory in the product closet regularly to ensure final product samples are recorded, archived and accessible
Coordinate charitable donations as needed; closet must be kept organized
Manage the Creative Assets/Style Guides system:
Keep Creative Kickoff documents up to date; schedule Creative Kickoff meetings with new partners as needed
Coordinate the delivery of all final creative files, review for accuracy and load them to the Style Guides system and our team server with corresponding metadata
Adhere to the organizational structure defined for the Creative Assets system to ensure the system remains user friendly and easy to navigate
Work with the Marketing Director to update/replace any creative assets on the system that are not user friendly for all LOBs (must be available in multiple formats)
Notify team and partners when new assets have been added to the system
Perform bi-annual review of the creative assets in the system and make recommendation on which assets should be moved to the vault
Analyze Mediabox system usage monthly and remove inactive user accounts to avoid overages, report account status to management quarterly
Notify Licensing/Marketing/PR teams when product is final by sharing hi-res imagery of the final products and product launch details (date, retailer, territory etc.); save all hi-res product and marketing images to the server
Coordinate social support for all launches with Social Media teams
Maintain current list of trademarks and legal lines for all properties by territory with assistance of legal; provide support in trademark defense and product infringement cases
Assist with updating sales decks quarterly under direction of brand team
Code and process all department invoices, work with brand team to ensure all invoices are input and paid quarterly (appearing on the actuals)

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS:
Looking for an enthusiastic go-getter who seeks to join a small but very active team;
must be willing to wear many hats, eager to learn and grow within the role over time
College degree; 1+ years of relevant work experience a plus
Exceptionally organized, detail-focused team player with highly productive work ethic and a proactive attitude
Excels in written and verbal communication
Appreciation for the importance of process, efficient workflow, and effective communication
Motivated by environment of tight deadlines and high volume of work
High proficiency in programs that facilitate organization including Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Google Docs, Dropbox, Acrobat Pro, ZOOM, and Teams; Mac experience preferred
Fundamental understanding of cultural differences across the globe (trends, customs etc.) by territory

PREFERRED KNOWLEDGE:
Experience using Mediabox Approvals and Style Guide System or similar project tracking/product development program
Basic knowledge of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign and understanding of design principles; Interest in fashion trends a plus
Familiarity with consumer products licensing, product development process and experience with contract tracking systems; previous experience with character licensing is ideal; previous exposure to brand management a big plus
Studio, production company or entertainment marketing/licensing experience is helpful
The estimated base salary for this role is $55,000 - $60,000. The actual base pay offered is dependent upon many factors, such as transferable skills, work experience, business needs, market demands and conditions, including geographic location where the work will be performed, and other factors permitted by law. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future.
This role requires the position to be located in New York, NY with an in-office presence of 3 days a week.

title: Coordinator, Marketing Communications
description:
Hearst has an exciting opportunity for an organized, dynamic team member to join its marketing communications team in New York City as a Marketing Communications Coordinator. As a coordinator, you will be an integral member of the corporate communications team based in New York City, working closely with Hearst’s business units and executives to create informative, engaging content about Hearst’s culture and impact for colleagues and the wider world. You will work with colleagues at every level to promote the company’s objectives and keep audiences engaged via existing and emerging platforms.
The coordinator is a communicator, content creator and project manager. Responsibilities include writing, editing and proofreading copy and newsletters; supporting social channels and special projects; researching and implementing communication tools and strategies; coordinating with the Creative team for the design of content; and tracking of projects. Ensuring the consistency of all messaging and style is key. This position reports to the senior manager of marketing communications and will be in-office at Hearst Tower three days a week.
Responsibilities
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Source and create compelling newsletter content, distributing and analyzing the content via Sailthru. This could include the Hearstlink newsletter , internal colleague newsletters, etc.
Source and create engaging content to amplify Hearst values and objectives such as feature stories for Hearst.com, HearstLive video content, etc. Topic areas include key achievements across the corporation, new endeavors and initiatives, group successes, employee spotlights, ESG topics and more
Source social content from across Hearst’s brands and business units as well as create new social posts across major platforms (LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, X/Twitter), compiling social analytics reports as required
Proofread internal communications such as eblasts and newsletters for adjacent teams (e.g., Corporate HR, Benefits, Technology, Events), ensuring accuracy and that messaging, grammar and tone are appropriate, consistent and follow approved style guidelines
Conduct ad hoc research and peer set audits to inform new tactics to grow readership and engagement
Support development and execution of cross-platform marketing plans, including coordinating and trafficking with the Creative team
Support content updates on technology products managed by the Corporate Communications team (e.g., Hearst.com, MyHEARST intranet and app)
Compile weekly status reports, monitor feedback inboxes, update editorial calendars, schedule professional development webinars, gather data for annual analytics report, etc.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Journalism, Marketing, English, or relevant equivalent experience
2-3 years of experience in PR/communications/marketing (agency or in-house)
Strong content creator and storyteller who understands audiences and brand voice
Excellent writing, proofreading and editing skills including AP style
Outstanding communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work across multiple functions confidently
Ability to manage shifting priorities and stay organized
Knowledge of Office 365, Microsoft Teams, Zoom and major social media platforms; Knowledge of Sailthru or similar platform a plus
Ability to synthesize information and create accessible, cogent newsletters, marketing copy and more
Takes initiative and work independently to meet deadlines and deliver high-caliber work
In accordance with applicable law, Hearst is required to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation for this role if hired in New York City. The reasonable estimate, if hired in New York City, is $58,000–$65,000. Please note this information is specific to those hired in New York City. If this role is open to candidates outside of New York City, the salary range would be aligned to that specific location. A final decision on the successful candidate’s starting salary and eligibility for overtime pay will be based on a number of permissible, non-discriminatory factors, including but not limited to skills and experience, training, certifications and education. Hearst provides a competitive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance, 401(k), paid holidays and paid time off, employee assistance programs and more.

title: Digital Marketing Associate
description:
3+ years of paid digital marketing experience, inclusive of agency experience
Bachelor's degree in a related field
Experience managing digital marketing programs across different devices and geographic regions.
Experience leveraging Microsoft Excel to gather, organize, and analyze data
Excellent business judgment and the ability to think strategically and execute methodically
Able to generate ideas and solve problems independently and consistent with Amazon’s core principles
Proven analytical and quantitative skills with a passion and aptitude for analysis and related tools
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills – written and verbal
Demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external teams
Interest in the technical aspects of digital marketing
Strong bias for action and sense of urgency; strong adaptability to changes in customer behavior, technology, and governing policies.
A track record of teamwork and willingness to roll up sleeves to get the job done
Shopbop, an Amazon subsidiary, is looking for a Digital Marketing Associate who will support growing Shopbop’s global business across Paid Search, Shopping, Organic Search, Paid Social and Mobile Media channels. The ideal candidate will have foundational experience in paid marketing platforms associated with demand generation and growth efforts, with an understanding of related tactics, strategies, analysis, and optimization components. The right candidate will be analytical, customer-focused, thrive in a fast-paced environment with many competing priorities, and partner across teams effectively. They will have a data-driven orientation with the ability to communicate business results and future opportunities. This role sits within the Marketing organization, reporting to the Head of Digital Marketing.

Key job responsibilities

Channel Strategy and Execution:
Assist in the management of paid media channels, inclusive of Paid Search, Shopping, Organic Search, Paid Social and Mobile Media channels
Partner closely with marketing agency to assist with day-to-day channel execution, strategy, testing, budget allocation and optimization in alignment with defined goals.
Maintain a high bar for creative and copy across all paid channels in partnership with digital marketing and creative teams
Work closely with cross functional partners to support business and product priorities
Develop and maintain close partnerships with media partners (e.g. Facebook) to drive channel innovation, expansion and optimization
Stay current and knowledgeable on new developments, trends, and technologies in the digital marketing and paid media space
Reporting and Forecasting:
Maintain ongoing weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting and develop insights based on performance data and channel trends
Drive improvements to reporting and analytics
Work closely with data warehouse and analytics teams to facilitate data requirements for cross channel analytical needs
We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

New York City, NY, USA

An understanding of and passion for fashion e-commerce.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $47,500/year in our lowest geographic market up to $113,700/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Associate Marketing Manager, Young Adult Books (Open to Remote)
description:
We are looking for an Associate Marketing Manager to join the Random House Children’s Books Trade Marketing team. Random House Children’s Books is home to bestselling and award-winning trade authors and illustrators, from Nic Stone (author of Dear Martin) and Karen McManus (One of Us Is Lying), to Nicola Yoon (Everything, Everything and The Sun Is Also a Star), Jennifer Niven (All the Bright Places), Christopher Paolini (The Inheritance Cycle), and more.

Reporting to the Senior Manager, the Associate Marketing Manager will work closely with the with the Audience Engagement, Publicity, and School & Library Marketing teams to develop and execute frontlist and backlist title campaigns to reach booksellers, teens, and crossover readers, to create awareness and drive sales. Additionally, the Associate Marketing Manager will work closely with these groups to promote our books at consumer events and festivals and to continue to build the underlined brand presence.

Responsibilities include:
Develop and execute marketing campaigns for select frontlist and backlist Young Adult titles
Develop ad briefs, including targeting and copy suggestions, for programmatic display and social ad campaigns
Create and route campaign assets and materials
Create distributions such as proposed print quantities of marketing materials, working back with sales to establish estimates and orders
Collaborate with Design, Digital Marketing, School & Library marketing, and Publicity to ensure cohesive marketing plans and messaging
Act as the liaison between Random House Children’s Books and consumer show organizers and other partnership stakeholders through effectively communicating sponsorship agreements and details, maintaining a good relationship with partners, and advising on strategy
Coordinate and lead show-specific teams, comprised of key team members across marketing and publicity, including the management of key show dates, materials, budgets, and deadlines and regular show meetings and their agendas, action items, follow-ups, and notes
Organize staffing, travel, staff materials and resources, and working schedules for each show and attend key consumer shows regularly, virtually and in-person
Represent campaigns, event strategy, and other opportunities in meetings with internal and external stakeholders
Provide additional support to the Senior Manager as needed

Requirements/Qualifications:
At least 3-4 years of experience in marketing. Book marketing is preferred
Interest in working with books for young adults (books for ages 13 and up) a must. Experience working with or reaching YA readers and audiences a plus!
Highly organized with the ability to communicate effectively and efficiently
Self-motivated worker comfortable working independently as well as with a team
Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and remain solution-oriented
Willingness to learn and collaborate
Ability to travel domestically to consumer shows and festivals approximately 3-5 times a year

The salary for this position is $63,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to Company results.
Penguin Random House job postings include a good faith compensation range for each open position. The College of Arts and Humanities at the University of Maryland seeks a marketing and communications assistant to join the college’s MarCom team. Under general supervision, the assistant provides complex administrative support to the assistant dean for MarCom and the overall MarCom office. Work requires comprehensive knowledge of the college; skill in working with issues related to policy, procedures and confidential matters; and involves considerable participation in the work of the supervisor. The assistant also supports publications production, assembles reports, updates stakeholder databases and mailing lists, tracks spending and provides administrative and logistical support for events, social media and grassroots marketing. Reporting to the assistant dean for MarCom, this position partners with the college’s finance and administration staff to manage MarCom spending and interacts daily with members of the MarCom team.
