title: Analyst-Market Info
description:
Job Purpose
The Product Strategy Division sets the product requirements for the next generation lineup of models, guiding the design and engineering teams through the early development phases to achieve the overall business strategy.
Developing the future product requirements needs a highly capable, highly knowledgeable, and highly engaged team. The team will focus on analyzing future society and customer trends that will affect future mobility.
The Analyst will support the long-term strategy creation led by the Manager, Future Market Planning. Activities include market analysis, data analysis, customer research and segmentation of customers.
This position requires high level collaboration between AHM, AHM R&D, HDMA, 4MOC and 4ji to align future customers, products, and strategies.
Key Accountabilities
Data Analysis – Ability to analyze large data sets and develop key insights from the data that is relevant to identification of the target customers. Ability to translate data / key insights into narratives / reports targeted to engineers, designers, analysts and executives.
Research – Ability to research market and consumers, developing key insights that are relevant to the problems and determining ways to attack the market. Can lead research projects including desk research, focus groups or clinics or on-line quantitative surveys. Utilizing extensive experience, judgement, and knowledge of the subject matter, advise the staff on creative matters to ensure the final product output matches the original intention and targets
Sensing - Maintains a thorough understanding of the automotive market, consumers, consumer preferences and company strategy.
Support corporate objectives with critical information for how to compete in the future. Supports long-term department vision and department goals to achieve Division targets.
Qualifications, Experience, and Skills
4-year college degree is required, ideally with a major in business, marketing, economics or related field.
MBA is a plus
Ideal candidate would have some experience doing analysis, ideally with an automotive OEM
Experience in the area of product planning, product development or brand management is preferred
Awareness of the automotive industry, products and technology
Possess critical thinking, business judgement, analytical and presentation skills
Understanding of macroeconomic factors that impact the industry
Proficiency with MS Office is required, especially PowerPoint and Excel.
Ability to demonstrate ideation/concept generation in a fast-paced environment
Consumer research and analysis skills, including statistical analysis skills
Ability to become proficient with planning tools such as MTAB, PIN, etc.
Workstyle
Hybrid
Benefits and Total Rewards
What differentiates Honda and makes us an employer of choice?
Total rewards:
Competitive base salary
Pay will be based on several variables that includes but not limited to geographic location, work experience, education, etc.
Annual Bonus
Overtime
Industry-leading Benefit Plans (Medical, Dental, Vision)
Paid time off, including vacation, paid holidays, sick time, and personal days
401K Plan with company match + additional contribution
Lifestyle Bonus


Career Growth:
Advancement opportunities
Career mobility
Education reimbursement for continued learning
Training and Development programs
Additional Offerings:
Wellbeing program
Community service and engagement programs
Product programs
Free drinks onsite

title: Digital Communications & Content Specialist
description:
Description:
Reports to: Director, Digital Communications & Audience Development
Location: Remote Work
Position Summary:
The Digital Communications and Content Specialist is a creative and results-driven member of the communications team that will support Sabin’s mission and grow its online audience. The Specialist will work with the Director, Digital Communications & Audience Development, and colleagues to conceptualize and manage digital outreach. This position requires a communications allrounder, someone who can create and manage social media calendars, write crisp and punchy social media copy as well as engaging longer blogs, and support email marketing campaigns and website content updates. The Specialist will be responsible for managing event communications, drawing on the skills mentioned above.
This position is a highly collaborative, cross-cutting role working across multiple teams. It requires a strong relationship builder and a “connector of dots” - someone who can maintain a strong creative vision and has an understanding of the latest digital trends, while helping to align and integrate cross-channel strategies to deliver on objectives. They will have their finger on the pulse when it comes to trends and platform changes and seek out opportunities to reach new audiences through influencer engagement and partnerships.
Responsibilities:
Develop, activate, and track digital and social media plans and tactics to promote Sabin’s mission, programs, and strategic initiatives
Craft informative, sparkling content that amplifies global health initiatives and motivates target audiences to act in desired ways on social media, websites, and email campaigns
Co-lead the creation and management of content calendars for various digital platforms including social media, website, and email marketing
Collaborate with internal teams to gather information and create compelling stories that resonate with Sabin’s target audience, serving as the core communications representative for one or more programs as assigned
Team up with core comms members and cross-functional leads across the organization to define and drive implementation of compelling multi-channel creative content
Act as the primary liaison for all communications related to Sabin-led events, working with team members to ensure the selection of materials are appropriate for the audience and are on message, on brand, and of high quality
Support the production of multimedia assets, including videos, infographics, factsheets, brochures, and other materials, to effectively communicate complex immunization and global health concepts
Respond to inquiries or comments from stakeholders on social media channels or through other digital means in a timely and professional manner
Contribute to email newsletters, including conceptualizing ideas and writing and editing
Employ listening tactics to respond to reputational issues on social media, escalating pertinent queries to Communications leadership
Work with the Director to identify and utilize smart paid digital advertising platforms to extend audience reach and develop a plan to sustain them with organic tactics
Work with the Social & Digital Analyst on the communications team to establish key performance metrics and support the evaluation and reporting of social media and other digital campaigns
Stay updated on industry trends, best practices, emerging technologies, and relevant health topics to provide innovative recommendations for digital communication strategies
Manage relationships with external partners/vendors for digital marketing initiatives as needed
Work with staff to build up capacity for user-generated content focused on programs
Other duties as assigned
Requirements:
4+ years of relevant experience, preferably in digital and/or social media roles at an agency or a global health entity
Excellent written and oral communication skills, with storytelling capabilities that move Sabin forward in meaningful and authentic ways
Demonstrated experience writing for the web and social medial platforms
Outstanding creative and content instincts and skills
Validated knowledge and expertise of social media channels, especially Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and TikTok.
Track record of amplifying online reach through partners and influencers
Good understanding of defining digital metrics and evaluating performance
Proactive, collaborative, and able to build relationships at all levels internally and externally
Should be able to present and describe complex ideas and concepts using simple, easy-to-understand language
Super organized with the ability to operate with purpose, urgency and accuracy in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities
Ability to be flexible and work well under pressure and deliver work that is on time and of high quality
Detail orientated, self-directed, and demonstrates a growth mindset
Highly skilled in balancing multiple, complex, concurrent projects.
Proficient in using various digital communication platforms such as social media management platforms (e.g., Sprout Social), email marketing software (e.g., MailChimp), website CMS (e.g., WordPress), Adobe Creative Cloud, and analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics)
Demonstrated project management skills, including use of project management software (e.g., Monday.com)
Global health, public health, or vaccines-focused work experiences preferred
Other:
Must demonstrate interest in furthering Sabin’s mission
Subject to a criminal background investigation
Request for three professional references
Verification of education/degrees
Attributes Important to Sabin:
Diversity, Equity and Inclusion
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking
Decision-Making
Communication and Professionalism
Initiative and Ownership
Productivity and Quality Control
Professional Development/Personal Learning
Sabin’s philosophy is to ensure fair, unbiased, equitable, and competitive compensation and benefits. Using benchmarking and salary survey data, the starting annual salary for this position ranges from $65,800 - $72,500. The exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, training, certifications/degree.
Sabin is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to their race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, disability or genetic information, sex (including gender identity, pregnancy or sexual orientation), marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. EEO/Veterans/Disabled

title: Specialist, CRM Analyst
description:
Location: New York, New York, United States
Category: Marketing
Job Opened: February 22nd, 2024
Education:
Job Number: R-106661
Job Type: regular
Remote: No
job description
Saks OFF 5TH is the premier luxury off-price destination. In its more than 100 stores in the U.S. and Canada, and online, at SaksOFF5TH.com, the company provides the best names in fashion at an incredible value through its merchandise authority, unparalleled brand access and seamless connection between ecommerce and stores.

What This Position Is All About:
As a CRM Specialist / Analyst, your job duties include organizing and analyzing marketing and customer data and helping the marketing team deepen their market influence and build long-lasting customer relationships. This role will work cross-functionally across the organization and will support various teams with customer analytics necessary to support customer strategy, customer journey mapping, promotional planning, product expansion and prioritization of customer experience enhancements. This is a newly created role and will report to the Senior Manager, CRM.
Day-to-day execution of lifecycle marketing communications across the email, SMS and Push marketing channels
Create campaign briefs to ensure content guidelines and project requirements are shared with internal and external partners
Collaborate with ESP, Creative, Digital Strategy, Loyalty QA and Production teams to timely sign off on lifecycle marketing assets
Support the development of targeted segmentation strategies across touchpoints to advance personalization
Perform A/B tests and measure performance to continually optimize our campaigns across channels
Continuously identify opportunities for efficiency and conduct research on best practices and benchmarks to drive best in class email, SMS, push marketing
Assist with the onboarding of new platforms/partners and support technical campaign implementation
Responsible for managing and maintaining the data quality / hygiene of the CRM database
Analyze customer behavior to advise key business stakeholders on new opportunities to acquire new, retain and reactivate lapsed customers
Work with CRM and data team to report on campaign outcomes & help maintain reporting dashboards
Develop CRM reports to measure performance across key markets and channels
Establish and maintain KPI reports and dashboards that communicate key business trends and highlight opportunities for growth and operational improvements
Perform ad hoc responsibilities as required
You Also Have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business, Analytics or similar field
1-2 years of experience in Marketing, Finance, Retail or similar
Knowledgeable in CRM, customer analysis and reporting
Strong background in analysis, able to pull insights and recommendations out of the data to make strong, data-driven recommendations and decisions
Proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and Teams
Shows curiosity, ambition and a willingness to learn
Strong verbal and written communicator
Strong presentation skills, with the ability to present to cross-functional teams and leadership
Strong at project management skills ensuring all deadlines are met and objectives are clearly communicated
Highly organized, analytical and detail oriented
Adaptable to a fast-paced environment

The pay range for this position at commencement of employment is expected to be between $62,500 and $70,000/year; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits), dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if a candidate receives an offer of employment.

title: Paid Social Associate
description:
Tinuiti
Associate, Paid Social
Remote – Full Time
Who we are:
Tinuiti is a performance and data-driven digital marketing leader, focused on every aspect of the customer journey across the quadropoly of Google, Facebook/Instagram, Amazon, Apple, and beyond. We believe success requires specialization across all channels, and our offerings cover the full spectrum from paid to earned to owned media. Our goal when we come to work every day is simple - to grow happiness. For our clients, their customers, our people and our partners. Growing happiness guides everything we do and our core values - Unleash Greatness, Never Stop Learning, Ignite Your Passion, Thankful Living, and Inspire Innovation & Change - inspire us to maintain a culture where our people take pride in their work and have fun doing it.
We support 100% remote work for applicants who reside in the United States.
What you’ll be doing:
Complete and support paid social campaigns, including but not limited to account setup, strategy development, organization, and management.
Support Account Managers with the day-to-day management of clients and tasks
Ongoing use of reporting, analytics, and trend tools for weekly, monthly and quarterly reporting
Campaign set-up and management: target development, creative testing, bid and budget management, and optimizations.
Effectively prioritizes efforts to focus on delivering on the most important things, tracks and reports on campaign results, data analysis and participates in weekly client calls
Consistently looks for ways to improve current processes or introduce new approaches that will contribute to the client’s success
Successfully fulfills the client’s strategy by creating deliverables and recommendations
We’d love to hear from you if:
Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you qualify, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.
Requirements:
1-2 years of relevant paid social media work experience
Working knowledge of Microsoft office particularly Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Experience running paid social campaigns is a plus
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Benefits:
At Tinuiti, we want to ensure you have the time you need to rest and recharge. That's why Tinuitians have an estimated 70 days off per year through our time off programs
Unlimited PTO: We encourage all Tinutians to Own their Offline by utilizing our unlimited PTO by working with your Manager to ensure all deliverables are met.
Holidays: We offer 17 paid holidays, if one of your religious holidays is not covered, please by all means take advantage of your Flex PTO!
Flex Fridays: Meetings are minimized and all Tinuitians have the option to start their weekend early at 1pm local time.
Owning Our Offline: Clients are informed and all offices will be closed for 3 total weeks throughout the year to give everyone the chance to truly unplug.
Healthcare: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & Disability, Flex Spending Accounts
Retirement: Match up to 4% of your contributions at 100% with immediate vesting
Perks and Wellness: Fringe, Forma, Thankful giving, Equity
Learning and Development: Mentor program and more
Compensation:
The annual base salary range for this role’s listed level is currently ($48,000 - $55,000). We also offer an incentive pay based on revenue managed (no cap) Grade level and salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. We will provide more information on our benefits and equity upon requests. Disclosure as required by the Colorado Equal Pay for > Equal Work Act, C.R.S. § 8-5-101 et seq.
FLSA Classification: Non-exempt
Disclaimer: This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may vary based on assignment or group. Tinuiti is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.

title: Marketing QA Associate
description:
We’re defining what it means to build and deliver the most extraordinary sports and entertainment experiences. Our global team is trailblazing new markets, developing cutting-edge products, and shaping the future of responsible gaming.
Here, “impossible” isn’t part of our vocabulary. You’ll face some of the toughest but most rewarding challenges of your career. They’re worth it. Channeling your inner grit will accelerate your growth, help us win as a team, and create unforgettable moments for our customers.
The Crown Is Yours
As a Marketing Risk Operations Associate, you will lead Quality Assurance efforts and support daily operations for our marketing channels across all products like Sportsbook, Casino, Daily Fantasy Sports, and more. You will play a key role in ensuring our marketing campaigns adhere to DraftKings best practices, obligatory state-specific regulations, and ultimately deliver an exceptional customer experience.
What you’ll do as a Marketing Risk Operations Associate
Ensure all DraftKings marketing campaigns adhere to regulatory compliance across all active regions.
Lead comprehensive QA efforts on email, mobile, and app/web merchandising channels to ensure all campaigns are accurate, render properly, and adhere to channel best practices.
Monitor and regularly report on QA and Risk Operations metrics.
Help build and maintain team processes, tooling, and documentation.
Coordinate with groups across the marketing org to deliver ongoing improvements to marketing QA and compliance processes and workflows.
Assist in investigating marketing compliance incidents and implementing follow-up actions to prevent reoccurrence.
Be available to participate in an on-call escalation schedule which may require some weekend and holiday availability based on business needs.
What you’ll bring
At least 1 year of experience in Marketing or Marketing Operations.
Autonomous worker with a strong desire to produce high-quality work.
Knowledgeable sports fan with strong written and oral communication skills.
Exceptional attention to detail.
Proven experience as a self-starter who is comfortable in a fast-paced, quickly changing environment.
A Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Operations, Business, or a related field.
Experience with data analysis and Excel or Google Sheets is a plus.
#LI-MD1
Join Our Team
We’re a publicly traded (NASDAQ: DKNG) technology company headquartered in Boston. As a regulated gaming company, you may be required to obtain a gaming license issued by the appropriate state agency as a condition of employment. Don’t worry, we’ll guide you through the process if this is relevant to your role.
The US hourly rate for this full-time position is $25.77 - $38.65, plus bonus, equity, and benefits as applicable. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range and how that was determined during the hiring process.

title: Research Analyst, Corporate
description:
TelevisaUnivision is seeking a Full Time Research Analyst for Corporate Research in Los Angeles. Responsibilities include compiling and analyzing Nielsen ratings, reporting on competitive spend, and creating presentations for use by TelevisaUnivision Local Media Sales, News, Finance, and Distribution, along with other departments at TelevisaUnivision.
The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate an interest in media and marketing research, have strong math skills, exhibit excellent written and oral communication skills, be a strategic and creative thinker, a self-starter, and a collaborator willing to learn and share ideas. Training will be provided.
Your Day to Day
Analysts will be responsible for tracking and analyzing Media Research data for the executive, sales and programming teams. They are also responsible for creating research reports and PowerPoint presentations with the goal of increasing sales revenue, Local Media (TV/Radio stations and Multi-Market Sales) profitability, and audience levels.
Analyze Nielsen audience data for Univision stations and its competitors on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Produce audience delivery trend reports and highlights for sales, programming, marketing and all levels of management.
Prepare media one-sheets and customized presentations to support the sales effort.
Running competitive advertising spend data across all media (TV, Audio, Digital) for both standard reporting and ad-hoc projects.
Participation in special projects.
You Have
An eye for detail – this is extremely important for both presentations and accuracy in numbers.
Ability to work independently on big projects for long periods of time.
Strong organizational, project management, and communication skills.
Eligibility Requirements
Must be willing to work from a TelevisaUnivision office at least part-time in Los Angeles.
Employment/education will be verified.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.
Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. Please note the national salary range listed in the job posting reflects the new hire salary range across levels and U.S. locations that would be applicable to the position. Base pay Range $45k-60k+ benefits
Our Benefits
TelevisaUnivision believes that a happy, well-balanced employee is what makes our culture thrive. We offer a wide selection of perks and benefits including PTO; tuition reimbursement; wellness and employee support programs; 401K; and life and other insurance plans. This is all in addition to our comprehensive and competitive health benefits package featuring medical, dental and vision coverage options.
Univision is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Marketing and Partnerships Assistant
location: 151 S Grand Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90012
description:

The Marketing Communications Assistant supports the Marketing Department in various aspects of driving ticket sales and engaging new and existing customers.

title: Communications Analyst
description:
Communications Analyst – Marketing Team
Description
As a Communications Analyst, you will work across the Marketing team and with investment banking and equity research leaders to develop and support communications campaigns that enhance the Jefferies brand.
The ideal candidate is hard-working, results-oriented, and most importantly, passionate about learning the ins and outs of communications for a leading investment banking and capital markets firm. The candidate must be creative, yet organized; comfortable working independently and as part of a team; strategically minded yet able to consistently execute. From top to bottom, Jefferies is an entrepreneurial firm that rewards team members with a “roll up your sleeves” attitude. This candidate will join a small, high-performing Marketing team that is working to elevate the brand and visibility of one of the world’s fastest growing and most dynamic investment banking and capital markets firms.
Responsibilities
Contribute to the development of Jefferies’ communications strategy
Plan and coordinate media engagement for research analysts and investment banking leaders
Manage media inquiries around Jefferies deals and research analyst notes
Draft internal communications on key firm deals, milestones and priorities
Collaborate with other team members to develop and execute marketing campaigns that leverage events, digital strategies, social media, advertising, video, email and more
Qualifications
Must be intellectually curious about financial services; prior experience a plus
Extremely organized with strong prioritization skills and attention to detail
Strong writing and proofreading skills
Adept in social media (LinkedIn, X, Facebook, Instagram)
Analytically minded and able to dissect data to pull relevant insights and develop a narrative
Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook
The salary range for this role is $65,000 - $80,000.

title: Associate Manager, Marketing - (Open to remote)
description:
Penguin Random House is looking for an Associate Marketing Manager to join the Direct Market Sales team!

Working closely with the sales team to generate BTB marketing initiatives for all imprints across the company, the role will focus on growing business for the comic shop market. The ideal candidate will be hands-on in the creation and execution of customized BTB campaigns for publications across genres including comics, graphic novels (kids and adult), manga, manhua, and more. This is an exciting opportunity for a highly creative marketer, offering a chance to be involved in the expansion of a unique business, while working with a wide variety of titles!

If you are a creative individual with a passion for comics, this may be the ideal role for you.

Specific responsibilities include:

Create and deploy weekly and monthly newsletters, and maintain marketing database
Oversee the creation of all Direct Market digital and print catalogs
Oversee the maintenance and updating of PRHComics.com
Drive the implementation of key market sales days (Free Comic Book Day, Trick-Or-Read, etc.) and trade shows
Work across divisions to develop campaigns and materials (sell sheets, social media assets, promotion materials)
Work with the Direct Market Sales team on strategizing and planning title and brand-specific marketing plans
Collaborate with Publishers and their teams to implement cohesive campaigns and promotions for the Direct Market
Communicate with Imprint Sales Team to ensure all requisite materials are sourced for seasonal sell-in
Maintain awareness of the comic market and suggest new and innovative ways to market titles to retailers and consumers

Please apply if you meet the following minimum requirements:

Minimum of 3 years marketing experience
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including copywriting and presentation skills
Proven ability to create creative, engaging, and driven BTB marketing campaigns
Ability to effectively interact with employees across all levels of an organization
Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to multi-task, prioritize, and thrive in a busy working environment
Results-oriented, motivated, resourceful, and able to work independently as well as part of a team
Proactive with strong follow-up skills
Proficiency with creating newsletters, Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook
Knowledge of online marketing tools, design basics, and digital analytics a plus
Passion for comics, graphic novels, East Asian comics, and pop culture

The salary for this position is $63,000. All positions are currently eligible for annual profit award or bonus, subject to company results.

Penguin Random House job postings include a good faith compensation range for each open position. The salary range listed is specific to each particular open position and takes into account various factors including the specifics of the individual role, and candidate's relevant experience and qualifications.

Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Our range of benefits include, but are not limited to, Medical/Prescription drug insurance, Dental, Vision, Health Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Pre-Tax and Roth 401(k), Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance, Life/AD&D Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Student Loan Repayment Program, Educational Assistance & generous paid time off.

Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children's publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 300 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children's Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.<http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/>

Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Digital Marketing Analyst
description:
Company Description

Curinos is the leading provider of data, technologies and insights that enable financial institutions to make better, and more profitable, data-driven decisions faster. Born out of the combination of two familiar industry powerhouses, Novantas and Informa’s FBX business, Curinos brings to market a new level of industry expertise across deposits, lending and digital experience solutions and technologies. Treasury Strategies Inc., a division of Curinos, is the partner of choice to help corporations optimize their bank relationships and improve process, controls, and operating efficiency within their corporate treasury department.

Job Description

Curinos is seeking a Digital Marketing Analyst with a focus on providing digital marketing professional services to help our Amplero clients improve their relationships with their customers through personalized and intelligent scientific marketing. In this role, you will enhance the value of our SaaS data and marketing solutions by supporting clients through channel and data integrations, configuring marketing experiments, and aiding client retention and renewal efforts. On a daily basis, you will work with Curinos data science, engineering, product, and client success teams, as well as client data and marketing teams to enable optimized execution and scalability of digital marketing programs.
Curinos is a pioneer in the FinTech space; we have built unparalleled data sets and a range of software solutions that enable financial institutions to unlock customer value in an increasingly digital-first world. Our Amplero solution is an AI-powered platform that banks and credit unions use to deliver highly relevant and personalized marketing experiences to their customers across all owned digital channels (i.e., email, web, app, etc.).
Email and Digital Marketing Implementation
Support business and data requirements and execution for digital marketing solutions and integrations by coordinating with client marketing teams and third-party vendors (e.g., managing and deploying dynamic email and digital templates, automation workflows, and closed feedback loops)
Support data ingestion and measurement by coordinating with client and Curinos data teams
Manage creative artifacts tools and processes that enable dynamic experimentation
Partner with Curinos engineering and data teams to execute implementations and channel integrations effectively
Configure marketing experiments using channel best-practices
Identify and develop processes that improve efficiency
Professional Services
Support project timelines and deliverables for client implementations and expansions of Curinos SaaS data and marketing solutions
Understand your clients’ marketing strategies and data thoroughly, prepare criteria and guidance for analysis projects, and leverage internal reporting tools
Support client relationships by serving as a subject matter expert on digital marketing platforms, creative, and channel best practices
Provide clients with training and timely support for questions about both our solutions platform and digital marketing channels
Internal stakeholder coordination to meet client needs
Identify issues or opportunities for our clients, develop hypotheses, and engage in solutions brainstorming
Ability to travel as needed for client meetings; can range from 0% to 10% depending on the engagement

Qualifications

You are a natural and determined problem solver, adept in marketing experimentation, and committed to delivering value to clients through marketing technology. You are detail-oriented, curious, self-managed, and take the initiative in a fast-paced environment.
Required Background and Skills
1-2 years of experience in email and other owned digital marketing channels, including pre-and post-authenticated web, or mobile app
Project coordination experience with the ability to deliver time-sensitive work across multiple workstreams
Experience working with data sets and data manipulation
Power user of Excel, including familiarity with functions and macros
Intermediate PowerPoint skills or better
Strong written and verbal communication across both client and technical teams
Excellent organizational and time management aptitude
Additional Desired Experience
Involvement in optimizing lifecycle, triggered, and automated marketing programs
Design and results measurement for A/B and multivariate testing, using insights from analysis of prior learnings, market trends, and industry practices
Industry experience in Retail Banking, Consulting, Financial Services, Digital Marketing or Technology
Ability to read HTML and CSS marketing templates
Participation in B2C marketing strategy from conception to execution
Channel integration with various digital marketing platforms
Experience as a trainer of software users
This is a hybrid position, with the ideal candidate located near one of our regional hubs (Chicago or New York City) and able to travel to an office as needed for working sessions or team meetings.
Base Salary Range: $70,000 - $80,000 / bonus potential

Additional Information

Why work at Curinos?
Competitive benefits, including a range of Financial, Health and Lifestyle benefits to choose from
Flexible working options, including home working, flexible hours and part time options, depending on the role requirements – please ask!
Competitive annual leave, floating holidays, volunteering days and a day off for your birthday!
Learning and development tools to assist with your career development
Work with industry leading Subject Matter Experts and specialist products
Regular social events and networking opportunities
Collaborative, supportive culture, including an active DE&I program
Employee Assistance Program which provides expert third-party advice on wellbeing, relationships, legal and financial matters, as well as access to counselling services
Applying:
We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't meet all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have relevant skills or experience, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need!
If you need any adjustments to support your application, such as information in alternative formats, special requirements to access our buildings or adjusted interview formats please contact us at careers@curinos.com and we’ll do everything we can to help.
Inclusivity at Curinos:
We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Curinos is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics.

title: Email Marketing Associate
description:
Description
Onsite in Downtown LA

Established in 1975, Delta Galil Industries is a global manufacturer and marketer of Private Label apparel products for men, women and children, as well as owner of leading fashion brands such as 7 For All Mankind, Schiesser, PJ Salvage, Eminence, Delta and more.
The Email Marketing Associate will coordinate email campaigns for an emerging Gen Z brand representing one of the world’s most influential talents. Highly analytical and performance minded

$70,000/yr - $73,000/yr

title: Junior Content Strategist
description:
Overview:
If you’re looking for a high-energy, inclusive atmosphere and a company that understands the importance of work/life balance, Commonwealth is your match! From generous bonus and 401(k) programs to tuition reimbursement and flexible work schedules, Commonwealth is focused on helping its employees thrive in an environment suited to their needs. On top of all that, the marketing department offers a hybrid work schedule, so you’ll be able to work from home for part of the week!

We’re looking for a junior content strategist to join our ranks. Your strategies and plans will resonate with our existing customers and spur them to take action. If you are a thoughtful strategist who can work cross-functionally without missing details, this might be the role for you!

Reporting to the director of content strategy, or designee, you will support content creation, curation, distribution, and evaluation of corporate and product content to existing customers across various communication channels and content platforms. The right candidate is passionate about telling the company and product stories, is an expert at tackling both the high-level vision and day-to-day tactics, and comfortable delving into data to inform continuous content improvement.

Key Responsibilities
Assist in Crafting Content Strategies:
Collaborating with content strategists to develop content strategies that consider personas, content pillars, and various marketing components
Participating in brainstorming sessions and strategy meetings to provide insights and ideas for effective content planning
Team Collaboration and Messaging Development:
Working closely with marketing teams and senior marketing leadership to understand and contribute to the creation of messaging that aligns with marketing and business goals
Assisting in coordinating with external subject-matter experts (SMEs) to gather information and insights for content creation
Content Planning and Coordination:
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to support the development of content plans spanning multiple business units
Assisting in coordinating efforts with various departments, ensuring alignment with overarching content strategies
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Working with creative teams to contribute to content development and execution
Assisting in integrating insights and feedback from cross-functional teams to enhance the quality and impact of content
Content Calendar Management:
Supporting in managing and auditing the content calendar to ensure that content execution aligns with the established content strategy
Collaborating with team members to ensure deadlines are met and content is published according to the schedule
Content Optimization and Analysis:
Assisting in the evaluation of content data and insights to contribute to the optimization of content strategies
Collaborating with senior team members to act on insights, making data-driven recommendations for continuous improvement and goal achievement
Core Strengths and Skills
Passionate about storytelling, challenging existing ways of thinking, and execution
Generates innovative and engaging content ideas with flair
Successfully managing and balancing multiple projects and partners at once
Ensures precision, maintains accuracy in content creation and execution
Strong in project management and systems
Deep knowledge of using data and insights to guide decision-making
Has a natural curiosity for new and developing industries; Financial industry knowledge a plus
Expertise in verbal and written communication, including exceptional grasp of the English language, grammar, spelling, punctuation, and usage
Experience working on and with cross-functional teams that include writers, designers, editors, and strategists
Understanding of how content type selection impacts performance across channels and audiences
Proficient in content management systems, email marketing tools, and content scheduling and tracking platforms
Understanding of SEO and SEM best practices
Required Qualifications
Experience in communications, marketing, public relations, journalism, English, or related field
1+ years of experience in content creation, execution, and strategy with track record of success
Continuous learner who will keep pace with evolving trends
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills (written and oral)
Excellent time-management, organization, and leadership skills; thrives under pressure.
Have we piqued your curiosity? Can you see yourself thriving in this opportunity?

Picture Yourself Here
At Commonwealth, we believe in a better world. We hold ourselves and each other to higher standards. We take care of one another. That’s why we invest in you—we encourage employee growth both in your career and education; we are building out a robust diversity, equity, and inclusion program; we offer incredible healthcare benefits; and we find plenty of occasions to celebrate. What’s not to love?

We are always striving to be better, and we are looking for employees who share that same mindset. Better people, better coworkers, better leaders, better creators. Bring your best work and your full self to the table, and we will do the same. Together, we can build a better future for our advisors, their clients, our company, and you.

About Commonwealth
Commonwealth Financial Network, Member FINRA/SIPC, a Registered Investment Adviser, provides a suite of business solutions that empowers more than 2,000 independent financial advisors nationwide. Privately held since 1979, the firm has headquarters in Waltham, Massachusetts, and San Diego, California.

Turning our advisors into raving fans starts by doing the same for our employees. We foster an environment of excellence, growth, rewards, and fun in equal measure, which has earned us 44 Best Place to Work awards.

The Fine Print
We care about your online safety as a prospective employee and encourage you to exercise caution when responding to job postings online. Commonwealth will never ask potential hiring candidates to pay or transfer funds as a precondition of interviews or employment, nor will we authorize recruiters or agents to do so on our behalf.

Commonwealth is an equal opportunity employer, making intentional efforts to source talent from all backgrounds.
Min: USD $50,700.00/Yr. Max: USD $56,400.00/Yr.

title: Research Marketing Associate
description:
The Research Marketing Associate is responsible for effectively communicating between the Firm's Research Analysts and Financial Advisors. Will respond to Financial Advisors' questions on companies under coverage, general market activity and industries on the Research desk. Will promote and market Research materials to the Wealth Management Group.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Respond independently to the daily volume of widely varied and diverse inquiries on individual stocks and market sectors from any of the 2,500+ Financial Advisors (FAs).
Attend and listen to the daily early morning Research call and, if possible, the early afternoon Research call, and provide an accurate summary of the call details.
Publish the Select List and other Research marketing materials.
Post daily market comments, rating changes and information on the Stifel portal prior to the opening of the stock market.
Gather financial data from various resources to respond to FA requests to help them service their retail clients.
Respond to a few select international Institutional client requests.
Provide appropriate training in conjunction with other FA training classes.
Perform other related duties as assigned unsupervised with backup resources available.
$71,300 to $80,100 base salary
QUALITIFICATIONS
Exceptional communication skills, self-reliant and able to relay information proficiently in both written and verbal formats.
Manage priorities and tasks in order to meet deadlines and accomplish goals.
Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify complex problems, review related information, develop options and implement solutions.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Minimum required: B.A. in a related field.
Minimum required: 1 year of related experience.
LICENSES AND CREDENTIALS
Minimum required: FINRA Securities Industry Essentials (SIE) and FINRA Series 7 or ability to get fully licensed within 6 months.
SYSTEMS AND TECHNOLOGY
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook.
Bloomberg and /or FactSet experience is a plus.
ABOUT STIFEL
Established in 1890, Stifel is one of the nation’s leading full-service wealth management and investment banking firms. Stifel serves clients from more than 400 offices across the United States and ranks as the nation’s seventh largest full-service investment firm in terms of number of financial advisors. We are also a leading provider of investment banking services to the middle market, a top-ten municipal bond underwriter, and home to one of the industry’s largest research franchises. In addition, our Stifel Bank subsidiary provides a comprehensive range of banking services.
At Stifel we offer an entrepreneurial environment, comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental and vision care, 401k, wellness initiatives, life insurance, and paid time off.
The health and safety of our employees and candidates is very important to us. We continue to monitor the current public health situation and have adjusted our hiring procedures to include virtual recruiting tools that allow us to continue meeting new candidates. We look forward to “virtually” meeting you.
Stifel is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Education
Required
Bachelors or better in FINANCE or related field

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Veeva Systems is a mission-driven organization and pioneer in industry cloud, helping life sciences companies bring therapies to patients faster. As one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies in history, we surpassed $2B in revenue in our last fiscal year with extensive growth potential ahead.
At the heart of Veeva are our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. We’re not just any public company – we made history in 2021 by becoming a public benefit corporation (PBC), legally bound to balancing the interests of customers, employees, society, and investors.
Join us in transforming the life sciences industry, committed to making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.
The Role
Marketing Data Analysts (MDAs) are part of the internal team that acts as the backbone of the client-facing organization team at Crossix. MDAs use sophisticated analytical techniques to tease out the connections between healthcare marketing tactics and patient health outcomes using proprietary, privacy-centric technology. You’ll learn the ins and outs of the rich healthcare marketing ecosystem while observing the direct effects of particular tactics on patient health.
We know diversity is essential to a high-performing team. We are an equal opportunity employer and invite all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, ancestry, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, or veteran status.
Qualified candidates must be legally authorized to be employed in the United States. Veeva does not provide sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B, OPT, or TN status) for this employment position.
This position requires you to work in the office 4 days/week for your first two years. After 2 years, you will have the flexibility to Work Anywhere.
What You’ll Do
Answer healthcare clients’ broad business questions using cutting-edge technology and analytics capabilities
Transform client questions into hypotheses testable with data using Crossix’s proprietary coding language
Link marketing exposure, consumer behavior, and transactional health data to understand changes in patient behavior due to healthcare clients’ tactics in the marketplace
Mobilize a variety of tools and platforms, including SQL, Excel, and business intelligence/data visualization suites
Use data to make patient behavior discoveries
Develop insights using advanced data analysis techniques, predictive modeling, and data visualization
Assess how effectively market tactics make patients healthier
Uncover major storylines and themes from analysis data and, working closely with senior team members, make actionable recommendations to healthcare clients for how to optimize their tactics
Collaborate and communicate effectively in the complex healthcare business space
Opportunity to work with major players in the healthcare marketing business, including healthcare providers, media agencies, and digital & broadcast media publishers
Practice storytelling skills by reviewing results of analytics through a critical lens
Build expertise in client therapeutic areas and marketing initiatives
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree with a minimum 3.0 GPA (we are currently hiring for a July 2024 cohort, so we are looking for candidates graduating in Spring 2024)
Don’t have a university degree? That’s OK if you have the equivalent skills gained through work experience or disciplined self-study
“Can-do” attitude and approach
Willing to learn new skills and use feedback for continual improvement
Entrepreneurial self-starter and team player; hungry for new opportunities
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Quantitative interest, demonstrated through coursework or professional experience
Interest in using data to make business decisions
Exposure to marketing and/or healthcare a plus
SQL and database experience helpful but not required
Located near New York City and able to work in the office 4 days/week
Perks & Benefits
Medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance
Flexible PTO and company paid holidays
Retirement programs
1% charitable giving program
Compensation
Base pay: $60,000 – $75,000
This role offers a comprehensive benefits package. The salary range for this position represents the potential base salary for this position. The actual salary will vary based on market and expected contributions.
Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.
Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances. If you need assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need when applying for a role or in our recruitment process, please contact us at talent_accommodations@veeva.com.

title: Jr. Market Research Analyst
description:
About Mishimoto
Mishimoto is the flagship brand of Resource Intl., an industry-leading engineering firm specializing in performance automotive products. We make the best cooling systems for our favorite performance cars. We move fast, we are driven to win, and we know it is important to be cool, whether it's under the hood of a car or at an awesome place to work. Our state-of-the-art corporate campus is located in New Castle, DE, then Garnet Valley, PA in 2024 with three subsidiary locations worldwide.

Benefits and Perks
Our employees love our workplace because:
It's a gearhead's dream – Design and develop performance automotive products for the car scene.
We make way for play – Attend wine and cheese gatherings and hit up our favorite events, from drift to autocross to classic car shows.
We take a breather – Enjoy an in-house gym, massage chair, and healthy-snack vending machines.
Our workplace is beautiful – Work in an office designed to stimulate creative thinking.
The employee discounts rock – Get exclusive access to Mishimoto products and discounts from our partners.
The bennies – Medical, dental, vision, paid time off, 401(k) w/ 4% match, disability pay, and life insurance.
We score – The bonus program is tied to overall company performance goals.
Dog Days! Bring your dog to work every day!

Jr. Market Research Analyst

What You'll Do:
Objectively gather automotive-related product and market-related data around assigned topics.
Compile, organize and communicate, timely and accurate collected research and spreadsheet data information both in writing and verbally.
Able to follow a schedule and meet deadlines while prioritizing multiple projects at the same time.
Be a creative detective. Uncover new opportunities based on current, statistical market data.
Understand consumer wants from products and what is driving their purchasing decision.
Proactively coordinate with internal resources to ensure company goals are met.

Your Creds:
Bachelor's degree, Business Administration, or related business degree is preferred
1-2 years experience in a related field, such as research analysis is preferred
1-2 years prior experience in a product-related environment, such as manufacturing, automotive or industrial
Understanding of automotive systems and products is required
Detail-oriented mindset
Proficient knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook
Strong communication skills – you know your stuff and you can engage with your colleagues in a positive, productive way.

Additional Necessities:
Incumbent will work in both a normal office environment and garage environment.
Ability to lift 30 pounds.

Mishimoto is made up of people with many different backgrounds and lifestyles, and we like it that way. We invite applications from people of all stripes. description:

Promote awareness of brand image internally and externally. Use sales techniques that maximize revenue while maintaining existing guest loyalty to Marriott. Recognize opportunities to up-sell the customer and sell enhancements to create a better Marriott experience or event. Encourage guests or callers to purchase or schedule preview package sales/tours. Follow all company policies and procedures; ensure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language; prepare and review written documents accurately and completely; answer telephones using appropriate etiquette. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others; support team to reach common goals; listen and respond appropriately to the concerns of other employees. Comply with quality assurance expectations and standards. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance; stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by supervisors.

Be where you can do your best work, begin your purpose, belong to an amazing global team, and become the best version of you.

title: Content Programming Specialist
description:
Content Programming Specialist
Apply Later
Job ID
10079001
Location
New York, New York, United States
Business
Marvel Entertainment
Date posted
Mar. 04, 2024
Job Summary:
Marvel Unlimited is a one-stop destination for over 30,000 comics spanning the entire Marvel Universe. The Content Programming Specialist for the Marvel Unlimited comic subscription app and web service plays a key role in programming, creating, writing, editing, and loading all editorial related to the Marvel Unlimited product using a variety of CMS tools. Copywriting responsibilities include comic articles creation for Marvel.com, Reading Guides, press packages for the Communications team, and any copy related to featured components and content modules in the Marvel Unlimited app. This role also builds and maintains the schedule for all new comic releases in Marvel Unlimited.
In addition to editorial planning, this role partners closely with the Marvel Unlimited Marketing, Design and Social teams by providing creative direction, developing story boards, and sourcing imagery for the development of comic-focused campaigns.
This role acts as liaison with Marvel’s Publishing Operations team to schedule and maintain the digital comics catalog on Marvel.com for Marvel Unlimited and weekly on-sale comics.
Roles & Responsibilities:
Daily and weekly curation of Marvel Unlimited app and web service.
Build and maintain Marvel Unlimited comic release schedule.
Schedule and create articles with SEO and Audience Development interest.
Maintain comics section on Marvel.com.
Provide creative direction, develop storyboard and source assets for Marvel Unlimited sell pages and paid social.
Collaborate and source content for CRM team for newsletters and thematic messaging campaigns.
Work on Marvel Unlimited retention programming including Reading Quests and weekly Reading Guides incentivized by points.
Source editorial metadata and provide editorial support for Marvel’s Infinity Comics.
Work with the product and engineering teams to improve current processes and troubleshoot CMS issues.
Project management and activation of custom comic and licensed publishing projects as needed.
Additional Qualifications:
4+ years of experience in digital content.
Superior editing and writing skills for narrative-driven content.
Familiarity with CMS platforms and content workflows.
Proficiency with MS Office.
Data-driven mindset.
Excellent organizational, project planning, presentation, and time management skills with meticulous attention to detail.
Entrepreneurial mindset, proactive thinker ability to thrive in a sometimes ambiguous, fast-paced environment.
Familiarity with graphic design software (e.g., Adobe Photoshop, After Effects) is a plus.
Ability to prioritize, manage several projects at once and work under pressure.
A rockstar with no ego. You give credit to others where credit is due and take responsibility for misses when they rest with you.
Passion for Marvel comics and a finger on the current comic landscape

The hiring range for this position in New York is $73,185 to $98,175 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Marketing Communications Specialist
description:
About EverCharge
EverCharge is a leading provider of electric vehicle (EV) charging devices and management systems and provides hardware and software EV charging solutions for fleets, multi-unit, and single-family homes. Our turnkey offerings are designed to utilize existing infrastructure to scale EV charging at the lowest cost. EverCharge's load-balancing SmartPower technology maximizes the number of electric vehicles that can charge at once and eliminates barriers, such as data connectivity.
Founded in 2013 and headquartered in Palo Alto, CA, EverCharge operates a factory in Hayward, CA, which supplies EVSEs for its customers across North America.
Our Marketing Communications Specialist
Will be in charge of producing high-quality content that engages customers and builds brand recognition across our various communications and marketing platforms.
You will create high volumes of content to educate the market and establish a preference for EverCharge, press releases, contributed articles, and media opportunities to increase awareness and thought leadership and drive demand.
Responsibilities
Lead the creation and publishing of agreed-upon content; partner with a cross-functional team to update assets as needed and create new ones, including video storyboards, etc.
Create and update web site and assets as needed.
Create user journeys and support them with content to move visitors along the buying funnel.
Collaborate with design, demand gen, engineering project management, and developers to provide a seamless and powerful web experience. Track performance and recommend improvements.
Qualifications:
BSc in Marketing, Communications, Public Relations or relevant field
Cross-functional teamwork
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Solid project management
Prior launch experience
Strong communication skills

The base salary range for this position is between $80,000 and $108,000, based on full-time employment.

title: Growth Marketing Analyst, Paid Social
description:
Location: In Office 4-5 days/week

Who We Are:

Thrive Causemetics is Bigger Than Beauty™: We are an independent, female-owned beauty brand that creates high-performance vegan cosmetics and supports a community of giving. All of Thrive Causemetics' products are free of parabens and sulfates, in addition to being 100 percent cruelty-free. Through its Bigger Than Beauty™ program, every product you purchase results in a donation to help a woman thrive. Thrive Causemetics is dedicated to fostering a collaborative and cross-functional workplace where everyone’s voice matters. We are committed to being pioneers in creating a culture of wellness. Together, we prioritize a strong work ethic while maintaining a positive, exciting environment where people are passionate about what they do.

Who We Are Looking For:

Thrive Causemetics is looking for a data-driven and resourceful Growth Marketing Analyst who is eager to learn new skills. As part of our growth marketing team, this role will work across Marketing, Data Science, Ecommerce, and CRM teams to drive new customer acquisition and retention through performance marketing, focusing on Paid Social channels such as Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok. The ideal candidate is someone wanting exposure to the beauty direct-to-consumer business, focused on social impact, with interest and experience in performance marketing.
What You Will Be Doing:
Launch and optimize campaigns focusing on paid social channels with the goal of hitting revenue, ROAS, and CPA targets across new customer acquisition and retention efforts
Support team in execution for new product launch and promotional campaigns
Budget and plan campaigns to align with our business revenue and ROAS goals
Analyze campaign data and pull insights to inform go-forward strategy on owned channels, sharing insights with our broader team
Work cross-functionally to provide learnings to the creative team, working on our creative testing roadmap and structure
Assign creative briefs for ad creative development across promotional and evergreen initiatives
What Will Make You Stand Out:
Preferred 4-year degree in Marketing, Economics, Mathematics, Finance or other quantitative fields of study
1 - 2+ years of work experience in performance marketing with 1+ year focused specifically on paid social
In-platform execution experience setting up campaigns in Meta ads manager is required
Proficiency with Excel
High level of accuracy and attention to detail
Exceptional analytical skills to drive data-driven decisions and problem-solving
Outstanding written/verbal communication and presentation skills
Proven ability to multitask, deliver exceptional results, and motivate others in fast-paced, dynamic environments
Passion for beauty, technology, and e-commerce
Thrive Causemetics is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

The base pay range for this role is $63,000 - $75,000, with the following factors determining the base pay at offer: skills, qualifications, experience. This range provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. Additionally, this role is also eligible for an annual discretionary bonus based on company and individual performance. Thrive Causemetics provides a competitive benefits package, including but not limited to: comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, a 401(k) plan with employer matching, various paid time off programs, employee discount/perks, life insurance, disability insurance, and employee assistance programs.

title: Media Operations Coordinator
description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

The Global Brand and Communications Operations team identifies and implements the processes, insights, and efficiencies to help the Global Brand and Communications team operate smoothly and at scale. The team works across both Global Comms and Global Marketing to provide strategic, operational and administrative support. The team serves as a liaison to key XFN partners, including Procurement, Finance, Legal, Talent Acquisition, and Human Resources, as well as operationally manages the press inbox and provides media and social analysis insights related to company announcements.
We're looking for strong team players — who are both eager to learn and enjoy problem solving — to support the Global Comms team with our press inboxes. You'll work closely team members from across the globe to review, triage and support a variety of media inquiries. Additionally, you'll help support research and reporting to bring external insights into the team to help inform strategy. You'll also ensure the Global Comms team and our XFN partners are aware of breaking news. Ideal candidates are ambitious, driven and passionate about the TIkTok brand. You have an insatiable curiosity about news and get excited about organization and project management. You collaborate with ease across teams and are able to connect dots.

Roles and Responsibilities
Manage global press inboxes to organize information, distribute to relevant departments, manage spam, report relevant emails to other departments
Regularly check global press inboxes to ensure media inquiries are relayed to the global PR team, and handled in a timely manner
Work with technical teams to ensure e-mail management infrastructure runs smoothly
Track industry and competitive news to ensure the Global Comms team and XFN partners are aware of the latest media cycles
Maintain operational documents and provide summary reports to analyze operations
Assess and refine internal workflows, and share best practices to optimize media operations
Support additional projects/initiatives within Global Brand & Comms Operations team as needed
Qualifications
Qualifications
Experience in Comms or PR
Excellent written, verbal and communication skills
Ability to regularly sort, prioritize, and identify urgent tasks, directing them to the appropriate responder while working independently and efficiently
Strong project management and operations skills
Able to handle confidential information with discretion and maintain a high level of professionalism required
Preferred Qualifications
Flexibility and willingness to support various projects as needed
PR knowledge and experience with media is a plus
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at https://shorturl.at/cdpT2
Job Information
The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $67724 - $97111 annually.



Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.



Our company benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support our employees to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees:



We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care.



Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off (PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability.



We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.

title: Technology Communications and Content Specialist
description:
About Latham & Watkins:
Latham & Watkins is a global law firm consistently ranked among the top firms in the world. The success of our firm is largely determined by our commitment to hire and develop the very best and brightest, creating a team that provides our clients with the highest quality of work and service. We are driven by our core values: respect, innovation, and collaboration.
About the Role:
The Technology Communications and Content Specialist II is an integral part of Latham’s Technology & Information Services team. This role will be responsible for collaborating closely with the Technology Communications Manager, Technology Communications Analyst, Technology Training team, and technical project teams to support the Technology department's communication needs, while creating, proofreading, editing, and formatting communication materials, ensuring approval from Supervisors, subject matter experts, or department management before distribution. This role will be located in either our New York Office or our Los Angeles office. Please note that this role may be eligible for a flexible working schedule that allows for a hybrid and in-office presence.
Responsibilities & Qualifications:
Other key responsibilities include:
Building relationships across the department and firm with managers, senior leaders, and subject matter experts to gather content for internal communications, including email, website content, and other channels
Assessing the audience for each message, crafting communications that describe technical concepts in layman's terms, and adjusting tone and style
Adhering to established style guides and writing standards to maintain consistency throughout the department and firm
Participating in departmental, team, and project meetings, contributing to discussions, and occasionally taking notes upon request
We’d love to hear from you if you:
Have exceptional written and oral communication skills, with a keen eye for grammar and attention to detail
Thrive in a dynamic, deadline-driven work environment while managing multiple tasks simultaneously
Excel at simplifying complex information for a non-technical audience
Demonstrate knowledge of technology, presentation, multimedia design, copywriting, copy editing, or developing internal communication plans and strategies
Love to develop innovative, customer-focused solutions, continuously learn and improve, and stay up to date on current technology and communication trends
Are comfortable engaging with senior-level stakeholders with poise and professionalism
And have:
A high school diploma or an equivalent, preferably a Bachelor’s degree in English, Communications, Journalism, or a related field
A minimum of two (2) years of professional writing experience
Benefits & Additional Information:
Successful candidates will not only be provided with an outstanding career opportunity and welcoming environment, but will also be provided with a generous total compensation package with bonuses awarded in recognition of both individual and firm performance. Eligible employees can participate in Latham’s comprehensive benefit program which includes:

Healthcare, life and disability insurance
A generous 401k plan
At least 11 paid holidays per year, and a PTO program that accrues 23 days during the first year of employment and grows with tenure
Well-being programs (e.g. mental health services, mindfulness and resiliency, medical resources, well-being events, and more)
Professional Development programs
Employee discounts
And more!

Additionally, we have a range of diversity programming including Global Affinity Groups. These groups provide a firmwide platform to share experiences and advice as well as an opportunity to participate in a supportive network with common interests to help make life at the firm even better.

Please click here to view the full job description for this role.

Latham & Watkins is committed to diversity, equal opportunity, sustainability, and pro bono legal services. We draw from a remarkable wealth of talent to create one of the world's leading law firms, and advance these commitments through the work of our Global Citizenship department. Our lawyers, paralegals, and professional staff worldwide comprise a rich mixture of different races, ethnic backgrounds, religions, sexual orientations, cultures, and primary languages. Our diversity makes us who we are.
