title: Content strategist
description:
Introduction
At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities
Your role is to progress our prospects and clients down their user journey. You should use data sources, such as competitive research, a/b testing, user testing, and web performance to inform decisions around conversion, such as asset and product placement on our page templates, messaging, effective layouts, and more. This data-driven approach will allow you to make actionable recommendations across our web footprint at scale, allowing for meaningful improvements in conversion metrics such as our bounce rate and registration rate.
Lead a scalable data-driven merchandising strategy across our inbound web footprint across ibm.com
Make use of our marketing tools, such as web analytics, a/b testing, user testing, heatmapping, and more, to inform your strategies and decision-making
Ensure the adoption of IBM standards and collaborate with governance stakeholders to adjust our standards as needed to ensure that our content shows up as one IBM to the market.
Collaborate with content, design and development teams to implement changes across our footprint that will drive conversion
Collaborate with SEO strategists and user researchers to understand the content needs of our core audiences
Be a resource and mentor for more junior members of the team

North America: IBMReferred_NorthAmerica
MCCJBID
#LI-Hybrid

Required Technical and Professional Expertise
You can demonstrate how you have used data in the past to drive business outcomes at scale
You have experience with leading conversion rate optimization (CRO) programs
You have experience with audience segmentation and personalization to drive user progression within the buyer journey
You enjoy self-driven learning on new technologies
Able to work independently, with a strong sense of responsibility and commitment to teamwork. You have a volunteer spirit with a 'we succeed as a team' attitude.

Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
You have experience with recommendation engines
About Business UnitIBM Corporate Headquarters (CHQ) team represents a variety of functions such as marketing, finance, legal, operations, HR, and more, all working together to solve some of the world's most complex problems, help our clients achieve success and build collaborative work environments for IBMers.

Your Life @ IBMIn a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
Are you ready to be an IBMer?

About IBMIBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

Location StatementIBM offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits program. Eligible employees may have access to: - Healthcare benefits including medical & prescription drug coverage, dental, vision, and mental health & well being - Financial programs such as 401(k), the IBM Employee Stock Purchase Plan, financial counseling, life insurance, short & long- term disability coverage, and opportunities for performance based salary incentive programs - Generous paid time off including 12 holidays, minimum 56 hours sick time, 120 hours vacation, 12 weeks parental bonding leave in accordance with IBM Policy, and other Paid Care Leave programs. IBM also offers paid family leave benefits to eligible employees where required by applicable law - Training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform where IBMers can grow skills and obtain industry-recognized certifications to achieve their career goals - Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups, giving & volunteer opportunities, and discounts on retail products, services & experiences The compensation range and benefits for this position are based on a full-time schedule for a full calendar year. The salary will vary depending on your job-related skills, experience and location. Pay increment and frequency of pay will be in accordance with employment classification and applicable laws. For part time roles, your compensation and benefits will be adjusted to reflect your hours. Benefits may be pro-rated for those who start working during the calendar year. This position was posted on the date cited in the key job details section and is anticipated to remain posted for 21 days from this date or less if not needed to fill the role. We consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable law. IBM will not be providing visa sponsorship for this position now or in the future. Therefore, in order to be considered for this position, you must have the ability to work without a need for current or future visa sponsorship.

Being You @ IBMIBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, caste, genetics, pregnancy, disability, neurodivergence, age, veteran status, or other characteristics. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Communications Specialist
description:
Tesla participates in the E-Verify Program
What to Expect
You will be a key member of the Industrial Energy Growth & Marketing team, which focuses on sales enablement for Tesla’s B2B energy products: Powerpack & Megapack. As a member of the team, you will be responsible for developing and executing internal and external global communications strategy, including press releases, social media (X and LinkedIn), and internal communications, as well as supporting the execution of speaking engagements.
This is a multi-faceted role where knowledge of clean energy technologies and working experience in the energy industry is highly desired. The ideal candidate is an exceptional communicator (both written and verbal), is organized with attention to detail, highly creative, a strong collaborator and can turn challenges into growth opportunities. They should have a proven ability to manage both internal and external stakeholders and to create structure in ambiguous situations.
What You’ll Do
Develop and execute global communications strategy, including press releases in coordination with customers and internal stakeholders, highlighting key company milestones, product launches, and customer successes
Lead internal communication programs including developing internal company newsletters and supporting the creation of Impact Reports and Investor reports
Manage social media accounts, including X and LinkedIn, to engage with our B2B audience, share relevant industry news, promote company initiatives, and foster community interaction
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and implement comprehensive communications strategies aligned with company objectives and industry trends
Cultivate relationships with customers to gather testimonials, case studies, and success stories for use in communications materials and press releases
Drive external engagement including monitoring industry trends, competitor activities, and market developments to identify opportunities for proactive communication
Measure and analyze the effectiveness of communications initiatives, utilizing metrics and analytics to refine strategies and optimize engagement across channels
What You’ll Bring
Bachelor's Degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, or a related field or 5+ years experience in a communications role, preferably within the energy industry or B2B sector
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail and proficiency in storytelling
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate and work cross-functionally with both analytical and creative teams
Strong understanding of social media platforms and best practices for engagement and audience growth
Creative thinking and strategic mindset, with a passion for driving brand awareness and reputation
Thrives in fast-paced environment with a bias towards action
Deep passion for changing the way we use energy on the electric grid
Compensation and Benefits
Benefits

Along with competitive pay, as a full-time Tesla employee, you are eligible for the following benefits at day 1 of hire:
Aetna PPO and HSA plans > 2 medical plan options with $0 payroll deduction
Family-building, fertility, adoption and surrogacy benefits
Dental (including orthodontic coverage) and vision plans, both have options with a $0 paycheck contribution
Company Paid (Health Savings Account) HSA Contribution when enrolled in the High Deductible Aetna medical plan with HSA
Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
LGBTQ+ care concierge services
401(k) with employer match, Employee Stock Purchase Plans, and other financial benefits
Company paid Basic Life, AD&D, short-term and long-term disability insurance
Employee Assistance Program
Sick and Vacation time (Flex time for salary positions), and Paid Holidays
Back-up childcare and parenting support resources
Voluntary benefits to include: critical illness, hospital indemnity, accident insurance, theft & legal services, and pet insurance
Weight Loss and Tobacco Cessation Programs
Tesla Babies program
Commuter benefits
Employee discounts and perks program

Expected Compensation

$64,000 - $240,000/annual salary + cash and stock awards + benefits

Pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.

Tesla is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer committed to diversity in the workplace. title: Web Strategist
description:
This position at WDG/Agital is fully remote for candidates based in the United States

WDG is a Washington DC-based digital agency with a fully remote culture. We plan, design, develop, integrate, deploy and maintain enterprise websites with open source technologies. We are a team of ambitious and experienced strategists, designers, developers and project managers. WDG is proud to provide an impactful customer experience that empowers our clients to refer us for their next projects and throughout their careers.

Join us and work with a diverse range of exciting and respectful clientele across various verticals – from mid-size to enterprise digital properties attracting millions of monthly web visits. Our portfolio is top-notch and includes the likes of the American Red Cross, National Fish and Wildlife Foundation, Barnes & Noble, and The University of Pennsylvania, among many others.

Our Strategy and Sales teams are looking for experienced, detail-oriented, website strategists who are collaborative, curious, and passionate.

At WDG our strategists are, “here to hear.” The strategist anchors the discovery phase, surfaces data driven insights and positions project directives that focus decision making for subsequent production teams. They become immersed in our client’s world by reading, facilitating discussion and conducting research. They strive to understand business goals and to discern the needs of digital audiences — in order to strategize user centered websites.

The deliverables of the Senior Web Strategist influence the user interface and the content management system as there are implications for content strategy and information architecture. They distill complex business requirements into meaningful next steps, informative diagrams and foundational wireframes. Senior Web Strategists are client-facing and must lead an informed approach for purposeful website-framework design, implementation and evolution.

Senior web strategists investigate emerging trends to confidently advise our clients on proven best practices as well as innovative approaches. They are also expected to influence our approach to sales engagements by contextualizing WDG opportunities within prospective digital transformations.

Strategists at WDG are not responsible for project management or technical scoping.
Role Responsibilities:
Research the industry
Document heuristic website reviews
Run and summarize website data
Review digital marketing tactics
Conduct competitive / comparative analysis
Analyze data including Google Analytics
Surface audience insights
Lead client workshops and production team working sessions
Conduct stakeholder interviews
Discover strategic (website) opportunities
Draft site maps
Influence and/or produce wireframes

What we need from you:
Previous client-facing experience in an agency environment
Professionally adept in marketing platforms and tools including SEO, SEM, analytics, and comparative analysis
Background in web technologies
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills
Familiarity with open-source CMS and e-CRM platforms
Ambition and curiosity

Compensation: This role’s salary will range from $90,000 – $120,000 in addition to company-offered benefits. Actual compensation for this role is dependent on several factors, including but not limited to skill set and experience.

No agencies please. WDG/Agital is an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. This job description may not be complete, and roles and responsibilities may change. We cannot offer visa support at this time.

title: Email Marketing Specialist
description:
Company Description

At Xplor, we believe that helping people make the most of each day is the most rewarding way to spend ours.
We give small and medium-sized businesses cloud-based, intuitive technology solutions that enable them to manage all the hassles of running and growing a business, so business owners can get back to doing what they love. With Xplor Pay, we help businesses get paid quickly and securely – without hidden fees. We built the tech ourselves, and our platform delivers secure, transparent, fast, and accurate payments.
We are unified by our purpose of helping people to succeed. So, when you become part of our team, you also become part of the personal connection that strengthens the relationship people have with Xplor products.

Job Description

Are you a skilled digital marketer that loves to roll up your sleeves and build impactful campaigns that drive results? We’d love to hear from you! Our fast-growing payments division is seeking an experienced Email Marketing Specialist to help supercharge our success.
In this role, you will be responsible for building and executing campaigns through Pardot and Salesforce. You will work closely with our Marketing, Sales, and Operations teams to optimize campaign performance and maximize customer engagement.
Manage the email marketing calendar for campaigns, newsletters, webinars, events, one-off communications and more
Build, test, and deploy campaign assets, including emails, campaign workflows, and landing pages with embedded forms
Monitor, analyze and routinely report on key metrics
Present ideas to optimize campaign performance and drive conversions
Build and segment email lists to enhance targeting efforts
Work cross-functionally to scope and document campaign requirements for lead routing
Build and edit email templates and landing pages while adhering to brand guidelines
Consistently seek out best practices and new, innovative ideas

Qualifications
1-3 years of B2B marketing programs experience
Excellent attention to detail and organization skill
Pardot experience required. Certification preferred.
Salesforce experience preferred.
Working knowledge of HTML preferred
Self-starter, willing to roll up your sleeves and do the work
Payments/FinTech experience a plus!
The average base salary pay range for this position is $65,000 to $75,000
May be eligible for a discretionary bonus

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
More about us
Xplor Technologies is a global platform integrating SaaS solutions, embedded payments, and Commerce Accelerating Technologies to help businesses succeed. Xplor provides enterprise-grade SaaS solutions for businesses in “everyday life” verticals: Childcare & Education; Fitness & Wellbeing, Field Services and Personal Services – and a global cloud-based payment processing platform.
Xplor Technologies serves over 78,000 customers that processed over $36 billion in payments, operating across 20 markets in 2022.
Good to know
To be considered for employment, you must be legally authorized to work in the location (country) you're applying for. Xplor does not sponsor visas, either at the time of hire or at any later time.
We kindly ask you to apply through our careers portal or external job boards only. Please don't send your application via email.
To learn more about us and our products, please visit www.xplortechnologies.com/us/careers.
We also invite you to check out our Candidate FAQs for more information about our recruitment process www.xplortechnologies.com/us/recruitment-faqs.
Xplor is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We're dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community.
All Information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Xplor is committed to the full inclusion of all qualified individuals. In keeping with our commitment, Xplor will take the steps to assure that people with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations. Accordingly, if reasonable accommodation is required to fully participate in the job application or interview process, to perform the essential functions of the position, and/or to receive all other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact us via talent@xplortechnologies.com.
We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

title: Communications Manager
description:
Start Date: Targeted start date April 1, 2024
Role Type: Full-Time
Background: Email marketing, non-profit marketing
Location: Remote, Flexible (USA based) - travel up to 15%
Salary: $72,250 - $80,000 per year, plus benefits
Who We Are:
The Modern Classrooms Project is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization that empowers educators to build classrooms that respond to every student’s needs. Founded by two award-winning teachers, we lead a movement of educators in implementing a self-paced, mastery-based instructional model that leverages technology to foster human connection, authentic learning, and social-emotional growth.
To date, we have reached over 65,000 teachers through our free online course and 7,000+ teachers through our Virtual Mentorship Program from over 200 school, district, and state partners. We are an ambitious, idealistic team led by former classroom teachers, and we are passionate about what we do.

Job Description - Why we need you!
The Communications Manager deeply understands teachers. Reporting to the Senior Director of Marketing and Community Engagement, they craft clear and concise messaging that attracts educators to MCP, in addition to strategically supporting communications organization-wide to accelerate the goals of individual teams. This person would be responsible for crafting copy for various use cases, including social posts, blog posts, articles, whitepapers, speeches, video scripts, emails, etc.

Key Responsibilities:
Draft brand-aligned content for various marketing channels (social posts, blog posts, articles, whitepapers, speeches, video scripts, emails) that tell the story of MCP through educator experiences
Manage a bank of MCP’s written content, including all including social posts, blog posts, articles, whitepapers, speeches, video scripts, emails, web pages, recruitment language, etc.
Proactively identify gaps in quality content and develop a roadmap for content creation
Field requests from the broader organization for written content, optimizing proposed content to ensure it supports team and organizational goals and fits into the broader MCP strategy
Write and manage MCP email content for various audiences to measurably accelerate educator awareness, understanding, and engagement
Write and manage MCP blog articles to support website SEO strategy
Support educators in creating and revising articles, conference proposals, and presentations

We are looking for:
Ability to travel up to 15% of the time
Deep understanding of educators and the MCP educator community
Strong facility with the written word and in tailoring communications to different audiences and voices
Strong understanding of email marketing trends and tools
Demonstrate exceptional communication and collaboration abilities
Able to analyze data and provide insights for strategy improvements
Exceptional communication and collaboration abilities
Self-starter who can work independently and think on their feet
Passionate about making the world a better place, particularly through education
Compensation and Benefits

We aim to offer a competitive compensation package, as well as the opportunity to work in a fast-growing nonprofit that is on a mission to improve education worldwide. This includes:
Salaried position: $72,250 - $80,000 salary per year
Employer-sponsored health insurance through CareFirst BlueCross BlueShield
Participation in Vanguard 403(b) deferred-compensation plan with 3% employer match
Paid Time Off, inclusive of: vacation/PTO (20 days), paid holidays, paid parental leave, sick and safe paid time off, "Me Days", and the ability to earn paid Comp time off
Up to $8,000 per year of MCP funded Continuous Learning for the program(s) you request (available after 6 months of continuous full-time employment)
Ability to work remotely and to set own hours (within reason)
____________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
STATEMENT OF NON-DISCRIMINATION: The Modern Classrooms Project is committed to equal employment opportunity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation, nationality, or ethnicity. We are strongly committed to hiring a diverse team and encourage applications from traditionally under-represented backgrounds.
COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY, & INCLUSION: We are committed to the work of diversity, equity, and inclusion so that every day, in every classroom, every student is seen, challenged, and supported. We recognize the impact of educational inequities, especially on historically underserved communities, and will be intentional in developing practical solutions that remove barriers to student achievement. We understand that to effectively promote change, we must be stewards of it in the workplace. We will ensure that diversity, equity, and inclusion are at the forefront of our decision-making, recruiting practices, organization policies, advancement opportunities, and treatment of each other. Through leading by example and continuous learning from teachers, community partners, and each other, we will establish MCP as a leader in developing equity and inclusion in the classroom and beyond.
Ma6la7X6S6

title: Brand Marketing Coordinator
description:
The ideal candidate will be prepared to join the innovative and growing team at Gopuff that will oversee brand marketing & social. This person will help coordinate the day-to-day storytelling of Gopuff and its products, services & partners. In this role, the candidate will organize and coordinate campaigns and activities around calendar tentpole moments. We recognize that people come from diverse backgrounds and skills and welcome all to apply.
You Will
Coordinate and support all facets of the launch of Gopuff brand moments from strategy to execution
Day to day coordination of advertising, media agency or production partner to develop, product and execute production and implement planning
Manage budget and ensure timely PO, invoice, and expense report creation and submission
Source and support social, content & talent opportunities: inclusive of influencer campaigns, celebrity appearances & promotions, and content ideation and creation.
Work closely with Brand Marketing team and cross functional teams to ensure we are putting out best in class programs, promotions and communications
Organize and support marketing campaigns for partner programs across various channels
Steward and implement brand creative guidance & creative ideation
Collaborate with cross-functional teams on brand positioning for select moments and how to bring it to life
Understand how to analyze ROI and success of marketing & social campaigns and articulate through reporting
Ensure legal and regulatory approvals of all communications
Support other miscellaneous Brand & Social marketing initiatives and programs as needed
You Have:
2+ years of brand management and/or agency experience
Willingness to learn, be a self-starter, with a “get-it-done” attitude
Creative Excellence: Have a high level of taste and attention to detail for premium visual and copywriting output
Experience working with internal and external partners
Analytical skills and great attention to detail
Time and project management skills, including ability to work on multiple projects at the same time
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Creative ability to evaluate and/or produce original thinking and ideas
Team player mentality
Salary Range
Gopuff pays employees based on market pricing and pay may vary depending on your location. Compensation for U.S. locations is based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area.
$46,800 - $78,500 USD annually
The salary range above reflects what we’d reasonably expect to pay candidates. A candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future. For additional information on this role’s compensation package, please reach out to the designated recruiter for this role.
At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Arm designs the technology powering AI and global computing – from data centers to smartphones. We're spearheading innovations across the tech landscape and telling stories that capture the imagination.

Make Arm a household name by weaving compelling narratives into messaging and stories that drive adoption and inspire innovation! This role reports directly to Director of Content, working inside global External Communications team. You will work in close partnership with the other team members.

Team up cross-functionally to shape content that moves audiences.

title: Digital Marketing Strategist
description:
Who You Are:
Searching for an exciting way to expand your digital marketing career? Look no further than EDDY's Digital Marketing Strategist role! Not only will you help make PPC, paid social & retargeting/display campaigns more effective for our partner schools, but also, you'll be charged with turning qualified leads into conversions by smartly managing and planning paid media. Plus, the workplace environment here is flexible and cooperative - making it a great fit all around– could this be you?
Here are the abilities we seek out:
Create, execute, and manage digital marketing strategies to drive traffic and conversions on websites and landing pages
Test and improve performance to best suit client goals with a combination of PPC/paid search, paid social, retargeting, and display media campaigns
Work hand in hand with Account Managers & Digital Media leadership to come up with ideas, carry out plans, and then measure the results
Dig deep into the data to uncover trends/shifts in the landscape and potential opportunities to improve performance & ROI
Put different elements to the test – run trials on your ad creative, landing page designs, beta opportunities, new vendors and other campaign elements to maximize results
Identify and present new opportunities/areas of growth to clients that will improve their digital marketing ROI
Manage relationships with multiple vendors, working closely to improvefs budget and performance
Participate in client calls to discuss account performance, interpretation of data, and actionable plans based on findings
Give clients a more complete view of their digital activities by collaborating across channels with other teams and making sure they understand each component's role in the big picture of their digital footprint
Who We Are:
EducationDynamics is a marketing and enrollment management company that is transforming the way students connect with the right school for them. Join our big-hearted team of higher education experts—we specialize in market research, advertising, multichannel marketing, lead generation, and enrollment management for over 500 US colleges with a focus on adult online education.
EDDY is always looking for exceptionally savvy, driven individuals who are passionate about helping our partner institutions understand, engage, enroll, and retain students. Our collective passion and shared mission led to EDDY being recognized as a 2023 Great Place to Work®. Our headquarters are based in Lenexa, Kansas, but our team is expanding every day with over 425 members across the country.
What We Offer:
Our Core Values:
Working Together
We value the people we work with and genuinely enjoy the work we do together.
Working with Standards
We hold ourselves to high standards.
Driving Great Outcomes
We focus on achieving results and making a real impact.
Our Contributions
Our Scholarship Administration Database, Unigo, helps students explore scholarship opportunities and offers a $10,000 yearly award to assist first-generation students in making their college aspirations come true.
Our Commitment to Advancement
At EDDY, we value learning and aim to provide a space for everyone to grow and share their knowledge by giving tuition reimbursements for expenses incurred through accepted universities. With this approach taken, we also recognize the hard work of our team members and promote them when these accomplishments present themselves.
Other advantages to working at EDDY include:
Medical, dental and vision coverage
401K Plan
Pet insurance
Remote work or flexible schedules
Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO)
Training and growth opportunities
What You Offer:
Educational Requirements and Background:
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communication, or Analytics or similar field or comparable work experience is required
Required Skills:
1+ years of experience in managing pay-per-click (PPC)/search engine marketing (SEM) campaigns
Experience with paid search, paid social, display, or other digital media channels
Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, or related certification
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, specifically for trend analysis using pivot tables, vlookups, etc.
In-depth knowledge of other Microsoft Office applications (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
Preferred Skills:
Google Analytics, Facebook Blueprint, or related certification
Experience with 3rd party management tools, such as Marin, DoubleClick Search, or Kenshoo/Skai
Familiarity with HTML and JavaScript
An understanding of the Higher Education and Post-Secondary Education sector
EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY
EducationDynamics, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate against applicants based upon any protected status, including but not limited to race, color, creed, religion, gender, national origin, ancestry, age, marital or domestic partner status, military or veteran status, affectional or sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, gender identity or expression.
EducationDynamics offers reasonable accommodations in the hiring and employment process for individuals with disabilities. If you need assistance in the application or hiring process to accommodate a disability, you may request an accommodation at any time.#LI-ST1

Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off

Monday to Friday

title: Specialist, Consumer Market Insights
description:
Function: Marketing
Location: Calabasas, CA, US
Work Arrangement: Hybrid
Position Title: Specialist, Consumer Market Insights
Location: Calabasas, CA
Scope / Brands: Global OPI Marketing

ABOUT THE WELLA COMPANY
Together, WE enable individuals to look, feel, and be their true selves.
Wella Company is one of the world’s leading beauty companies, comprised of a family of iconic brands such as Wella Professionals, Clairol, OPI, Nioxin and ghd. With 6,000 employees globally, presence in over 100 countries, Wella Company and its brands enable consumers to look, feel, and be their true selves. As innovators in the hair and nail industry, Wella Company empowers its people to delight consumers, inspire beauty professionals, engage communities, and deliver sustainable growth to its stakeholders.
For additional information about the Wella Company please visit www.wellacompany.com.

THE ROLE
The Global CMI Specialist – Global OPI is responsible for providing consumer insights to the global and local teams based on consumer research and analysis of market trends. This person will bring the voice of the consumer to business building initiatives involving cross function teams from Marketing, Trade Marketing, Digital, Creative, PR/Influencer Marketing, and R&D.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Planning and executing, together with agency partners, multi-country primary consumer research to build foundational knowledge and support marketing initiatives.
Analyzing and reporting of market tracking data from various sources, covering different distribution channels including Nielsen, NPD, and Euromonitor.
Updating a reporting tool to track OPI consumer/market KPIs.
Responsible for continuous tracking of relevant consumer trends to help OPI be faster to innovate in areas like new products, packaging, communication.
Providing consumer and market insights to inform decisions regarding brand and consumer strategy, innovations, investment priorities, channel strategy and communication. Support on projects involving local country and global cross-functional teams such as Innovation, Digital, R&D, and Trade Marketing.
Assist in the development and tracking of the annual global OPI Global CMI budget, during the current fiscal year and the planning cycle for the next year.

QUALIFICATIONS
Essential:
1-2 years of professional work experience in Market Research or Consumer Insights
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent with major/ focus in Marketing, Marketing Research, or Business Admin
Strong in Excel and with the potential to easily learn analysis of complex survey data files
Strong analytical skills, ability to extrapolate meaning and conclusions from a large amount of quantitative and qualitative data
Passion and high level of curiosity about the beauty industry, trends, and consumer behavior
Excellent communication and written skills, including PPT presentation skills
Good people skills, good team player
Experience with market tracking solutions, such Nielsen, IRI, or NPD
Detail oriented and has knowledge of/or interested in learning about research design, protocols, and questionnaire development.
Detail oriented, has proficiency or interest in learning a DIY survey platform, such as Toluna

title: Marketing Assistant/Specialist II (Contingent)
description:
Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Amazon via Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Amazon.

Marketing Assistant II

This team oversees the World-Wide Events team. We are responsible for putting together Prime Day, Black Friday, The Prime Early Access Sale that happened last year. We work across the entire company, globally to work with stake holders from all of our different retail and program teams in order to successfully market and merchandize everything for the high velocity events (HVE).

Responsibilities/Duties include but aren't limited to:
Build merchandising campaigns and execute traffic-driving efforts to support High Velocity Events across Amazon.
Audit and raise the bar on partner team merchandising campaigns to ensure flawless campaign delivery.
Serve as a liaison between Worldwide Events team and partner teams to guide marketing campaigns to completion
Report on progress against goals and relevant metrics
Assist with creative asset production (in partnership with a dedicated design team)
Editing (XML, HTML) and publishing content to site via Campaign Management Systems

Basic Qualifications
3+ years of experience creating and executing digital marketing campaigns, including onsite merchandising, on-device/mobile, and/or display
Writing customer-facing copy that is on-brand, relevant, and tailored to the online customer
Proficiency with Content Management Systems and ability to edit basic HTML and XML
Must be comfortable with Excel and capable of manipulating data in order to perform both high level and more granular analysis. This includes familiarity with VLookups, Pivot tables, and other such functionalities.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with proven experience in coordinating teams and communicating to senior management
BA/BS required

Preferred Qualifications
Experience managing large scale merchandising programs
Experience with A/B or multivariate testing
Experience with customer segmentation, profiling, and targeting
Proficiency with analytics tools and web traffic reporting
Have relentlessly high standards and a high attention to detail.
Ability to conceptualize, scope, and execute projects to strict deadlines
Confident, self-motivated individual with strong, demonstrable bias for action
Proven ability to deliver results and prioritize tasks in a fast-moving, dynamic environment

Location: Remote (USA mainland)
Contract length: 11 Month
Pay Range $28-$32 per hour

AGS is an equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer (M/F/Disability/Veterans). We Will consider all applications without regard to race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Display Paid Marketing Specialist - Remote
description:
At UnitedHealthcare, we’re simplifying the health care experience, creating healthier communities and removing barriers to quality care. The work you do here impacts the lives of millions of people for the better. Come build the health care system of tomorrow, making it more responsive, affordable and equitable. Ready to make a difference? Join us to start Caring. Connecting. Growing together.

The Display and Paid Social Specialist is responsible the planning and execution of display and paid social campaigns for the Government Programs Brand and Growth team. Working closely with internal partners, the specialist will assist with executing the approved strategy, campaign set up, campaign optimization and reporting of direct-to-consumer digital marketing campaigns.

You’ll enjoy the flexibility to work remotely * from anywhere within the U.S. as you take on some tough challenges.

Primary Responsibilities:
Assist digital team members with the development of display and paid social campaign strategy
Management of programs to ensure campaigns are optimally structured, setup, trafficked and are tracking correctly
Manage daily campaign optimization, testing, tracking and performance measurement
Oversee creative development and approval process
Develop reporting and key insights on campaign performance
Evaluate and improve internal display and paid social processes to support strategic planning and implementation e.g., cost files, partner billing and audience setup

You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.
Years of post-high school education can be substituted/is equivalent to years of experience

Required Qualifications:
3+ years of hands-on programmatic and/or paid social in either client, agency, agency trading desk or programmatic technology vendor experience
3+ years of experience in digital media either client or agency side running complex digital display programs
2 + years experience across DSPs, DMPs, CRM, ad serving and brand safety platforms (Google Ads, DV360, CM360)
Experience with Adobe Analytics
Experience with DOMO or Tableau visualization and reporting tools
Advanced understanding of digital tactics and measurement is a must - specializing in display, paid social, video and native advertising utilizing both 1st, 2nd and 3rd party data sources
Advanced tracking and analytics knowledge
Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills
Must be 18+ years of age or older

Preferred Qualifications:
Financial services, insurance, or technology experience
Liveramp, DoubleVerify, and Invoca platform experience
Experience in managing complex media projects across multiple stakeholder groups
Understanding of digital direct-response marketing tactics and best practices
Passion for digital marketing with an understanding of the complexity of the digital advertising landscape
Proven constantly learning about the ever-changing digital ecosystem - with a willingness to test new tools and technologies
Proven passionate about results, achieving goals and communicating successes
Demonstrated ability to work within tight time constraints, providing near real-time insights to team members to ensure targets are achieved
Proven highly analytical with advanced problem-solving skills and excellent attention to detail

California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, or Washington Residents Only: The salary range for California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, or Washington residents is $70,200 to $137,800 per year. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to education, work experience, certifications, etc. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

All employees working remotely will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy

At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.

Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.

UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

title: Communications & Marketing Associate
description:
Our Organization
reDirect is a 501(c)3 foundation that works with nonprofits to craft more supportive environments for their staff, volunteers, and the communities they serve. Through our programs, we help nonprofits learn and implement the Supportive Environments for Effectiveness (SEE) framework, to improve organizational functioning and achieve greater impact. As a result of working with us, our nonprofit partners have improved their communications, collaborations, programs, and onboarding/offboarding processes. You can learn more about our organization at redirect.org/our-framework.
Job Summary
reDirect is seeking a communications professional who will help manage and execute the organization’s written and graphical external communications. The Communications & Marketing Associate will help create and review communications strategies that disseminate the organization’s Supportive Environments for Effectiveness (SEE) framework to nonprofits and other core audiences. The position includes writing, graphical design, and email, social media, and content calendar management.
Roles & Responsibilities
Create written content for reDirect
Write and edit copy (blogs and resource articles) that communicates reDirect’s identified core topics: the power of environments (different kinds and why they matter); small experiments as a way to create change; SEE applications to common nonprofit challenges
Pursue external opportunities to market reDirect’s Supportive Environment for Effectiveness framework (e.g., by writing op-eds, or seeking press opportunities)
Create relevant content to share across social media platforms, facilitating continuity of voice and message online
Write, build, and schedule monthly external newsletters, and other email campaigns as needed (using Mailchimp)
Prepare videos for YouTube posting by updating titles, descriptions, hashtags, and keywords
Create graphics/visuals for external communications
Edit and create graphics for all external communications assets (Using Canva, Adobe Illustrator, or other design programs)
Help graphically redesign existing communications assets
Provide input on program-specific assets drafted by consultants, and produce relevant accompanying graphics where necessary
Help manage external communications for reDirect’s audiences (in collaboration with the Communications Director)
Periodically collect feedback from the intended audience of communications materials during their development
Track and record audience engagement with communications assets to understand effectiveness of initiatives
Help manage a detailed communications calendar / editorial calendar and execute day-to-day implementation
Make needed updates / changes to reDirect website (hosted on Squarespace)
Investigate new ways to reach our target audiences
Actively scan for and share (via all digital platforms) relevant external resources for our audience that align with reDirect and our messaging (i.e., “social listening”)
Review reDirect’s Style and Brand Guide, as well as our Annual Strategic Communications Plan
Qualifications
Familiarity with Squarespace (preferred)
Proficient user of Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Creative Cloud, Canva, Photoshop, or other design programs
Experience publishing for organizations on social media platforms – LinkedIn, Instagram, X
Bachelor’s degree in writing-intensive field of study required, Master’s degree preferred
Minimum of 3+ years of increasing responsibility in communications work (i.e., strategic planning, writing, and graphical design)
Demonstrated excellent writing and editing/proofreading skills
Comfortable working across multiple U.S. timezones
Ability to manage multiple communications projects simultaneously
Having a mindset geared toward continual learning and adaptation (as digital tools and production techniques are constantly changing)
Experience using Google Workspace products (e.g., Drive, Docs, Sheets, Slides, etc.), and project management software (Asana preferred)
Working knowledge of how to use and analyze data from Google Analytics
Job Status: Full-time; Must be legally and permanently authorized to work in the United States.
Location: Remote
Compensation: $55-68K/year, depending on experience
Benefits: reDirect provides full medical, dental and vision coverage for the employee as well as a generous leave/PTO policy, a matched 401(k) retirement plan, life insurance, continued/ongoing opportunities for professional development (e.g., paid workshops, trainings) to grow your skillset while in this role, and other benefits.
To Apply:
PLEASE VISIT https://redirect.org/-redirect-employment-opportunities AND SUBMIT THE FOLLOWING MATERIALS:
Please submit your application, including a cover letter, CV/résumé, and references, saved as a single document.
Please submit a portfolio of graphic design work that provides context for which organizations/settings they were created, submitted as a separate document.
Provide a writing sample or portfolio showcasing your ability to craft content for different channels (e.g., website, blog, social media), saved as a single document.
If possible, please provide links to social media accounts you currently manage or have managed in the past.
Applications will be considered on a rolling basis until the position is filled.
reDirect values diversity, equity, and inclusion as essential elements that create and foster a welcoming workplace. All qualified persons will be considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, political affiliation, disability, or any other factor unrelated to the essential functions of the job.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $55,000.00 - $68,000.00 per year
Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Professional development assistance
Vision insurance
People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply
Work Location: Remote

title: Sr. Specialist, CRM & Email Marketing
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!
If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.
Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.
We love all pets like our own
We’re the future of the pet industry
We’re here to improve lives
We drive outstanding results together
We’re welcome as we are
Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong, working together across 1,500+ pet care centers, 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics, eight distribution centers and two support centers.
Principle Duties and Responsibilities:
30% Partners with Talent Acquisition and others across Petco to develop strategic, multi-channel, integrated recruitment marketing campaigns to engage and build the talent community base, increase page traffic and applications.
Evaluate, research, design, develop, test, and implement email recruitment marketing campaigns & newsletters programs segmented by target audience and candidate pools
Develop segmentation and personalization strategy to drive talent community engagement, build lead database and continuous improvement of email KPI’s.
Manage email campaigns and schedules to ensure on time execution. Secure approvals from stakeholders.
Analyze and interpret results from email marketing campaigns, share learnings and make recommendations to drive improvement in campaigns.
Develop a testing strategy for email marketing campaigns, including subject lines, dynamic content, creative layout, targeting, etc.
Stay on top of email best practice and bring innovative ideas to test making Petco’s TA email program best in class.
20% Plans, directs, and coordinates activities of designated project or marketing campaign to ensure that goals or objectives of project are accomplished. Activities include:
Developing or reviewing project proposal or plan to determine time frame, funding limitations, procedures for accomplishing project, and allotment of available resources to various phases of project.
Establishing work plan for each phase of project.
Directing activities of project personnel to ensure on-time and on-budget delivery
Preparing project reports for management or others, and modifies schedules or plans as required; and
Conferring with project teams to provide technical advice and resolve problems.
30% Train and support Talent Acquisition on CRM system and best practices as the Subject Matter Expert to increase system usage & adoption. Develop and optimize existing processes with cross-functional collaboration.
20% Clean, improve and problem solve data quality to ensure the integrity of candidate information within CRM system.

Nature of Supervision
General instruction is given on program and project objectives, and work is reviewed during development or implementation phase.

Planning and Problem Solving
This position collaborates across the TA organization to ensure we are effectively marketing the correct message at the correct time to the correct candidates.

Supervisory Responsibility
None

Education/Experience
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in advertising, marketing and/or business administration or equivalent experience in a related role.
5+ years progressively responsible related work experience or customer/candidate relationship management (CRM) strategy using analytics and data-driven insights with customer/candidate profiles or segmentation, customer/candidate database mining, predictive modeling, and analysis or through an equivalent combination of education, experience and/or training.
Experience with a modern CRM platform such as Phenom, SalesForce, Avature or HubSpot is required.
Direct, hands-on experience with PHENOM CRM is desired but not required.
CRM experience within a Talent Acquisition capacity is desired but not required.
Proven ability to apply best practices, data privacy regulations, assess trends, competitor actions and technological advances in CRM, email and SMS/text-enabled marketing, and related services.
Strong experience with customer/candidate experience design, customer/candidate insights, customer/candidate journeys, the role each brand touchpoint can play in developing awareness and action, in addition to the overall communication plan.
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills.
Experience running and optimizing digital marketing programs and developing strategies to engage and grow leads.
Demonstrated knowledge of email best practices including deliverability, personalization, subject lines, reporting, send time optimization, etc.
Familiarity with data privacy; abides all laws, codes and policies related to data privacy and DMA ethics
Experience working in a cross-functional team and managing multiple projects

Competencies:
Demonstrate Adaptability and Desire to Learn - Works productively in the face of ambiguity or uncertainty. Demonstrates flexibility and resilience in response to obstacles, constraints, adversity, and mistakes. Constructively and resourcefully adapts to changing needs, conditions, priorities, or opportunities. Seeks to learn, innovate and try new approaches and ideas. Invites and incorporates feedback, without becoming defensive.

Perform Professional Analysis - Integrates information from a variety of sources to arrive at a broader understanding of issues (e.g., company reports plus in-store observations). Defines issues clearly despite incomplete or ambiguous information. Identifies the key issues in complex or ambiguous problems. Approaches problems or issues systematically, looking for connections, trends, and potential causes. Probes and looks past symptoms to determine the underlying causes of problems and issues.

Plan and Execute - Develops realistic plans (e.g., action steps, timelines) to accomplish objectives. Acquires and leverages resources, processes, and tools to achieve business goals. Prioritizes and balances time, actions, and projects to ensure accomplishment of results. Holds self-accountable for outcomes (e.g., achieving goals and complying with policies and procedures). Anticipates and addresses obstacles, redirecting efforts to accelerate the work or improve quality. Independently prioritize and accomplish multiple tasks within established timeframes and through team and peers.

Produce Results - Initiates decisive, timely action to address important issues. Demonstrates a strong sense of ownership and a commitment to achieving meaningful results. Sets challenging, clear goals/targets and expectations for achieving business results. Drives initiatives/efforts to successful completion and closure. Takes personal responsibility to make decisions and act.

Demonstrates Professional Judgment - Makes logical, rational, and integrative decisions, and arrives at sound conclusions. Chooses the best alternative(s) based on a review of pros, cons, tradeoffs, timing, and probabilities. Evaluates the consequences and implications of alternatives, actions, or decisions (e.g., impact on sales, returns, customer loyalty). Makes timely decisions, balancing analysis with decisiveness.

Desired Skill Set:
Systems + Tools:
CRM Systems such as Phenom, Avature, SalesForce
Microsoft Office; Microsoft Teams
Zoom

General:
Understanding of CRM technology and platforms
Works in a collaborative manner, builds partnerships across organization
Strategic, analytical thinker
Strong project management skills
Strong, professional verbal and written skills
Take initiative and works in a timely and productive manner

Work Environment
Most tasks are performed while seated indoors at a personal computer.
Limited travel may be required periodically throughout the year.

Reporting Structure
This role reports to the Sr. Manager, Employer Brand (TA) and works with TA Directors, Managers and recruiters. May also interact with medical leadership team (doctors).

Location
Candidates may work remotely and should live in the United States. Relocation and work visa sponsorship are not offered for this position.

Contacts
Internal contacts primarily include Talent Acquisition, Vet Services Leadership, Brand Creative, IT, and vendors.

The above description is meant to provide an overview/summary of the nature and level of work being performed; it should not be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and requirements of the job. PETCO reserves the right to modify the content formally or informally, either verbally or in writing, at any time without advance notice and employees are required to follow any other job-related duties/functions requested by their supervisor. Further, all employment at PETCO is of an at-will nature and, as such, the company reserves its right to terminate any position or employee (with or without notice and with or without cause) within its discretion.

title: Coordinator, Content Strategy
description:
Major League Baseball is seeking a Coordinator, Content Strategy for an immediate opening based in New York, NY. The position will manage distribution strategy and testing around MLB's digital content efforts. In this role, you will maintain a cohesive production and distribution strategy for MLB's content.
You will work on MLB's audience development team to expand the reach of baseball and use data-driven strategies to reach fans. The role blends analytics, editorial, and marketing. You will work independently to spearhead new projects, as well as work collaboratively with MLB's editorial, product, social media, marketing, and design teams.
Responsibilities:
Inform the strategy for engagement and growth both on and off MLB's owned-and-operated platforms.
Integrate industry-wide KPIs, perform audits, and make recommendations for content optimization.
Collaborate with product, editorial, video, social, and various other teams to target challenges and construct both short- and long-term solutions.
Track and optimize search performance, including keyword research, strategic optimization of existing content, competitor analysis, site improvements, and internal SEO audits.
Educate teams with best practices documentation and lead regular SEO training.
Create dashboards, run reports, measure daily performance, conduct post-analysis of editorial initiatives, and share insights with stakeholders.
Monitor traffic following algorithm updates and act fast to recover.
Work with the audience development team to develop strategies to best optimize content across all platforms including but not limited to homepage, social media, newsletters, marketing, etc.
Qualifications:
1-3 years' experience at a news organization, sports organization, media company, or creative agency with experience in content optimization.
Knowledge of off-platform growth strategies and expertise in overseeing engagement metrics, distribution methods, and SEO best practices.
An aptitude for content creation strategies, and the ability to decide the needs of various channels and coordinate and execute the best possible formats for each.
Experience with database queries and analytics, including Adobe Analytics, Chartbeat, Google Analytics, Google Search Console, or similar web/video analytics tools.
Proficiency with data visualization tools, such as Microsoft Excel and Tableau.
An interest in, and comfort with, datasets, testing and QAing performance metrics.
A familiarity with sports and entertainment industries.
Why MLB?
Major League Baseball (MLB) is the most historic of the major professional sports leagues in the United States and Canada. Employees love working at MLB because of the culture of growth, teamwork, and professionalism. Employees who are most successful at MLB take initiative, know how to identify problems and provide solutions, and always put the Team first. For those ready to step up to the plate and join the Major Leagues, MLB takes the same approach as teams do with their players: empowering our "workforce athletes" to be at their best by engineering experiences that put employees in the best position to succeed. Major League Baseball is looking for candidates who are passionate about growing America's pastime to best serve its fans for decades to come.
MLB's vision is to be the global sport of choice for youth to play, fans of all backgrounds to enjoy and a desired destination for employment. With a belief that the journey to growth and greatness is ongoing, MLB gives employees the opportunity to continue learning and honing their skills with programs such as: tuition reimbursement; mentorship programs; lunch and learns; online course subscriptions; paid industry certifications; business resource groups; and more.
MLB provides its employees with exceptional medical, dental, and vision coverage. Premiums are 100% employer covered to help employees focus on being their best!
Major League Baseball is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.
Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is $58,500 - $65,000.
As a candidate for this position, your salary and related elements of compensation will be contingent upon your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision. In addition to your salary, MLB believes in providing a competitive compensation and benefits package for its employees. MLB offers employees a full range of best in class benefits with no employee contributions towards medical, dental, and vision coverage premiums, as well as incentive and recognition programs, life insurance and automatic employer 401k contributions. All benefits are subject to eligibility requirements and the terms of official plan documents which may be modified or amended from time to time.
Are you ready to Step Up to the Plate? Apply below!

title: Senior Analyst-Marketing, Premium Events and Experience
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.
At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.
Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.
Senior Analyst, Premium Events and Experiences

The Premium Events and Experiences Team leads the By Invitation Only Program, as well as product experiences and benefit partner experiences. The team focuses on designing events and experiences for U.S. Gold, Platinum, and Centurion Card Members that bring membership to life. Experiences are a core passion of our Members, and drive loyalty and engagement. The Senior Analyst will be a key member of the team and play a critical role in overseeing the E2E Card Member marketing experience.
The Senior Analyst will manage the overall marketing and awareness plan to support activation initiatives. The role requires strong collaboration across multiple cross-functional business partners, including Product, Brand, Marketing, PR/Social, GCO, Compliance, and Servicing. In addition, the Senior Analyst will work directly with agency partners in building and managing marketing timelines.
Key Responsibilities:
o Lead end-to-end marketing strategy and execution for 100+ events annually, utilizing traditional and alternative channels to drive CM engagement and reach, including:
o Oversee annual marketing tracker
o Secure placements across product and entertainment eNL channels, organic social, newsroom and MYCA
o Create and approve landing pages (internal eHub and partner sites)
o Gather copy and imagery for placements and facilitate necessary approvals
o Oversee proofing and testing of placements
o Record marketing, metrics, and reach
o Manage updates to Ts+Cs and marketing claims
o Oversee the Premium Events & Experiences calendar in partnership with event Managers
o Attend cross-functional marketing and servicing meetings to represent upcoming events
o Facilitate renaming of the By Invitation Only benefit to Premium Experiences Collection in May 2024
o Work with Managers and Director on the team to support events where necessary

Skills:
o Previous marketing background and a creative, strategic problem solver with strong track record of delivering quantifiable results
o Proven track record in managing multiple workstreams, partners and cross-functional teams
o Demonstrated ability to work proactively and drive results with minimal direction
o Strong project management skills with an exceptional ability to prioritize workstreams
o Exceptional verbal/written communication and proofing skills
o Confidence in working with individuals at all levels of the organization
o Proficient in PowerPoint and Excel

Salary Range: $55,000.00 to $105,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:
Competitive base salaries
Bonus incentives
6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
Career development and training opportunities
For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

title: Coordinator, Influencer Marketing
description:
INFLUENCER MARKETING COORDINATOR
LUXURY MARKETING – NEW YORK, NEW YORK

COTY is looking for smart leaders who are tenacious, passionate, and fearlessly kind.

We’re looking for a motivated Coordinator to join the Luxury US Influencer Marketing/Public Relations team. In this role you will report to our Assistant Manager of Influencer Marketing/Public Relations, and support the team in the development and execution of US press and influencer strategies for a portfolio of makeup, skincare and fragrance brands to maximize press coverage, social content and positive consumer engagement (skincare: Orveda, fragrance: Burberry, Calvin Klein, ESCADA, Davidoff). The position requires strong administrative and communications skills, precise attention to detail, creativity, an aptitude for multi-tasking, an innate sense of urgency and a keen interest in media and brand communications. The ideal candidate is an avid social media consumer, who is in tune with digital trends and the influencers and competitive brands setting those trends. The position calls for a team-player and consummate professional with a positive attitude who will represent the department and brands in a positive light and serve as department ambassador both internally and externally, communicating effectively on behalf of the team/brands.

THE ROLE

In this role your key areas of responsibility will be the following:
PR Initiative Management and Execution
Manage a multitude of assignments at once and work with other Coordinators and Assistant Managers to prioritize accordingly
Manage product send outs and product mailings, including beauty award submissions and influencer/editor deliveries
Maintain an up-to-date media and influencer contact list
Liaise with cross-functional teams regularly for all product launch updates
Develop US-relevant pitching materials leveraging global toolkits by writing compelling, yet concise product overviews
Build and foster relationships with junior editors and assistants
Represent the brand(s) and function at local and global events
PR Results Reporting, Analysis & Recommendations
Proactively monitor and record PR results monthly utilizing Zinio and DMR (and supplement with Google searches when needed)
Update pending, confirmed and published placement trackers on an ongoing basis
Manage US press coverage reports monthly with detailed analysis
Recap and help analyze press events, influencer activations, brand events and initiatives
Influencer Initiative Management and Execution
Contribute to identification of US and brand-relevant influencers for paid and unpaid programming
Craft outreach emails and liaise with influencers/agents to secure opt-ins to unpaid mailings
Manage internal and external vendors to execute unpaid mailings in their entirety
Build and foster relationships with influencers and their agents
Represent the brand(s) and function at local and global events
Influencer Reporting, Analysis & Recommendations
Maintain influencer campaigns daily on Traackr
Recap and help analyze influencer activity on a weekly and monthly basis
Business Processes & Forecasting
Regularly forecast and order product, press materials and other assets in a timely manner via SAP/Ariba and Local Influencer Marketing Teams
Oversee product closet inventory
Manage relationship and timely payment of vendors via the creation of Purchase Order
QUALIFICATIONS

Key Requirements:
4-year Undergraduate Degree in Communications or Related Field
1+ years of Public Relations/Influencer Marketing and/or related experience
Interest in the Beauty, Public Relations and Influencer Marketing industries
Candidate should have the ability to commute to NYC office

Special skills required:
Strategic - Planning, adaptation, administration, facilitation, creativity, problem analysis, understanding timelines, cultural awareness, business intelligence, inspiration, collaboration, industry knowledge, detail oriented, organized
Business - monitoring, product knowledge, account administration, automated office systems, multi-tasking, follow-through, analytical, quantitative, organizational, detail-oriented, time management
Creativity and Innovation - Creativity, savvy, originality, brand understanding
Leadership and Personal - Motivating others, initiative, communication, engaged, integrity, dependability, flexibility, agility, tenacity, passion, resourceful, proactive, positive

WHAT WE OFFER

This is unique role with a genuine opportunity to make an impact. You’ll get to work in a diverse environment with a team of professionals who are passionate about the work they do and know how to have some fun along the way.

Coty’s global omni-working policy provides the option to work up to 50% of your month remotely. We believe that a more flexible philosophy of remote working will give everyone the freedom to choose what works for their individual circumstances and empower them to always perform at their best.

ABOUT US

Our people make us who we are. They are the brightest minds bringing the boldest ideas to life every day. If you’re the kind of person who refuses to settle, if you want to think bigger, learn faster and go further than you ever thought possible – we’d love to hear from you.

Coty is deeply committed to Changing the Conversation around Diversity, Equity & Inclusion in an effort to create a more open, inclusive, and diverse workplace where all employees can be their authentic self.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES

We offer equal employment opportunity to qualified individuals without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Coty complies with federal and state disability laws and makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact cotyjobsUS@cotyinc.com . We strongly believe that cultivating a diverse workplace gives a company strength. The combination of unique skills, abilities, experiences and backgrounds creates an environment that produces extraordinary results. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled.
