title: Sr Digital Marketing Specialist I
description:
EBSCO Information Services (EIS) provides a complete and optimized research solution comprised of e-journals, e-books, and research databases - all combined with the most powerful discovery service to support the information needs and maximize the research experience of our end-users. Headquartered in Ipswich, MA, EIS employs more than 2,700 people worldwide, most now working hybrid or remotely. We are the leader in our field due to our cutting-edge technology, forward-thinking philosophy, and outstanding team. EIS is a company that will motivate you, inspire you, and allow you to grow. Our mission is to transform lives by providing relevant and reliable information when, where, and how people need it. We are looking for bright and creative individuals whose unique differences will allow us to achieve this inclusive mission around the world.
Your Opportunity
As a Sr. Digital Marketing Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to develop marketing, merchandising and creative strategies and affiliated programs to promote the organization's products and services through the Internet or other digital channels to increase exposure to and business from the target audience.

This remote position is U.S.-based only (excluding U.S. territories).

What You’ll Do
Manages the implementation of digital marketing programs and analyzes their effectiveness.
Establishes and manages the relationships with search engines and portal sites that are strategically aligned with the digital goals.
Tracks usage trends of the organization's websites, including number and quality of visitors and advertising campaign impact.
Develops and maintains website graphic designs and layout to support the organization's image, identity and brands through a diverse mix of web material, graphical user interfaces and multimedia delivered for the web.
Ensures that the organization's website provides up-to-date and comprehensive product/service information that is easily available to existing and potential customers.
May be responsible for social media marketing and online community management.

Your Team
You will be welcomed as a member of the Marketing Team and the larger EBSCOLearning organization. Our team enjoys the flexibility and greater work life balance working remotely offers. There will be ample resources, tools, training, and support to ensure your success and your development and career growth at EIS

About You
5+ years of direct experience
Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, Canva, Figma, Hubspot, Meta and LinkedIn Campaign Manager

What Sets You Apart
In-depth conceptual and practical knowledge in own discipline and basic knowledge of related job disciplines.
Has knowledge of best practices and how own area integrates with others; is aware of competition and the factors that differentiate them in the market.
Acts as a resource for colleagues with less experience.
Experience leading small projects with manageable risks and resource requirements or project steps within a broader project or may have accountability for on-going activities or objectives.
Demonstrated experience solving complex problems; takes a new perspective on existing solutions; exercises judgment based on the analysis of multiple sources of information.
Ability to explains difficult or sensitive information; works to build consensus.

Our Offer to You
Target Annual Compensation Range: $77,730 - $111,045.
The actual salary offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors including your skills, qualifications, education, training, and experience, as well as the position’s work location.

EBSCO provides a generous benefits program including
Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability Insurance and Flexible spending accounts
Retirement Savings Plan
Paid Parental Leave
Holidays and Paid Time Off (PTO)
Mentoring program
And much more! Check it out here: https://www.ebsco.com/about/benefits

We work hard to embrace diversity, equity and inclusion and encourage everyone at EBSCO to bring their authentic selves to work every day. We have a wide representation of employee resource groups. To learn more, visit https://www.ebsco.com/about/diversity-equity-inclusion

The EBSCO Way
At EBSCO, our culture is defined by ten guiding principles. We put our customers first, and we're always looking for ways to innovate and improve. We make decisions based on facts, communicate openly, and hold ourselves accountable for results. Trust, respect, and care for each other are essential to how we work. Every day, our actions and teamwork shape who we are as a company. To learn more about our culture, visit https://www.ebsco.com/about/culture.

We are an equal opportunity employer and comply with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. We strictly prohibit and do not tolerate discrimination against employees, applicants, or any other covered persons because of race, color, sex, pregnancy status, age, national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, religion, creed, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment.
We comply with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA), as amended by the ADA Amendments Act, and all applicable state or local law.

title: Email Marketing Manager - Petco Love
description:
Create a healthier, brighter future for pets, pet parents and people!
If you want to make a real difference, create an exciting career path, feel welcome to be your whole self and nurture your wellbeing, Petco is the place for you.
Our core values capture that spirit as we work to improve lives by doing what’s right for pets, people and our planet.
We love all pets like our own
We’re the future of the pet industry
We’re here to improve lives
We drive outstanding results together
We’re welcome as we are
Petco is a category-defining health and wellness company focused on improving the lives of pets, pet parents and Petco partners. We are 29,000 strong, working together across 1,500+ pet care centers, 250+ Vetco Total Care hospitals, hundreds of preventive care clinics, eight distribution centers and two support centers.
Essential Job Functions
Recommend and develop the organization’s e-mail and text message (SMS) marketing strategy and annual calendar. Lead, plan, and execute all external marketing and transactional e-mails, including development of creative briefs; segmentation of audiences (i.e., viewers and receivers of e-mail and text messages); and managing e-mail coding production, obtaining approvals, and troubleshooting as necessary to drive incremental value and continuous improvement of email KPI’s.
Ensure all Petco Love’s communications continue to provide compelling content and storytelling to our audiences that align with non-profit mission as well as brand vision and strategy.
Lead the design, creation, and implementation of new e-mail marketing and transactional e-mail initiatives, including personalized and dynamic triggered programs to support new digital tools.
Develop documentation and processes related to e-mail and user data. Responsible for working with vendors, staff and technology teams to configure systems and manage data integrity across MarTech applications, and quickly address any issues.
Work with vendors on e-mail issues, including white/black-listing and e-mail filters. Ensure that e-mail messages adhere to SPAM regulations.
Develop a rigorous testing strategy for email marketing campaigns, including subject lines, dynamic content, creative layout, targeting, etc. Track campaign and message performance and data, prepare campaign reports to present to management and others, and identify and leverage trends and opportunities.
Study and recommend e-mail and text message marketing practices, techniques and methods to maximize inbox placement, responsiveness, and accurate rendering across all major e-mail clients and devices.
Analyze key user segments, identify opportunities within the data and work collaboratively with staff to develop new strategies to improve efficiency and effectiveness of e-mail and text message marketing activities.
Provide supervision to assigned staff: includes activities such as hiring, counseling, guiding, training and delivery of disciplinary processes as required.
Required Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree.
5+ years email marketing experience, including segmentation and testing experience.
Hands on experience with CRM marketing operations, technology, and campaign platforms.
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills. Experience with a web analytics platform such as Google Analytics.
Proven track record of driving results in a fast-paced and ambiguous environment.
Experience leading the design, creation and implementation of new e-mail marketing and transactional e-mail initiatives, including personalized and dynamic triggered programs to support new digital tools.
Light knowledge of HTML, CSS and e-mail best practices.
Experience building logic queries within relational database management system(s).
Ability to analyze data and trends to inform strategy and drive business decisions.
Demonstrated knowledge of email best practices including deliverability, personalization, subject lines, reporting, send time optimization, etc.

title: Marketing Specialist - Supplemental - Remote
description:
Why Mayo Clinic

Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed.


Responsibilities
This position is a new role within the dedicated marketing team supporting the Mayo Clinic School of Continuous Professional Development and its medical education, professional development, and executive education products and services. This position works collaboratively with colleagues within and outside the School. This is a supplemental role that is not eligible for benefits and is estimated to perform 20 hours of work per week.
The Marketing Specialist will provide strategic marketing consultation and guidance to various clients. The Specialist will partner with the Marketing Manager and/or Director to build marketing plans, as well as drive, implement, monitor, and measure results of marketing activities to advance Mayo Clinic’s mission, strategic plan and business objectives. The Specialist will be involved in the strategic evaluation and tactical execution of marketing activities, which may include advertising, collateral development, digital marketing, content creation/assessment, and event management/sponsorship. The specialist demonstrates a strong understanding of marketing, critical thinking, and strategic counseling.
May involve competitive landscape assessments and recommendations. Represents Mayo Clinic internally and externally. Demonstrates project management skills and the ability to manage projects through the entire project life cycle. Proactively seeks opportunities to build and improve positive relationships with colleagues, leaders, and experts. Understands and acts independently to drive functional strategies forward to advance Mayo Clinic’s mission, strategic plan and business goals. Builds credibility with peers and internal stakeholders. Assesses opportunities for improvements and demonstrates willingness and ability to adapt to change.

This Position is 100% Remote; can work from anywhere within the Unted States

** Visa sponsorship is not available for this position; Also, Mayo Clinic DOES NOT participate in the F-1 STEM OPT extension program**

Qualifications
A bachelor’s degree with strong academic performance in a related field, which may include liberal arts, business, marketing, healthcare, or similar field, plus 3 years professional experience in a relevant field.Broad based knowledge of marketing strategies. Requires strong leadership, problem solving, critical thinking, active listening, quantitative skills, persuasive oral and written communication skills, project management, presentation skills, and interpersonal skills. Proven execution ability, including digital marketing experience preferred. Must be able to work effectively in a consensus-style and collaborative environment that expects and promotes teamwork. Must be comfortable in a fast-paced and changing environment. Must possess the ability to inspire trust and confidence, and maintain a high degree of professionalism and confidentiality. Must be able to work independently and collaboratively to prioritize and drive forward multiple projects. Must possess high personal motivation supporting a strong work ethic, flexibility, and creativity. May require experience with marketing automation, understanding data, surfacing trends, and working with digital and advertising channels. Has a positive influence on others. Position requires occasional travel and the flexibility to work weekends and evenings as necessary.

Preferred Qualifications
Leading candidates will possess strong digital marketing, analytic, and reporting skills and demonstrate mastery of Google Analytics, Adobe Customer Journey Analytics or similar applications. Leading candidates will demonstrate excellence using Eloqua or other email marketing applications to prepare and deploy email marketing campaigns, monitor campaign efficacy, and generate relevant reporting. Leading candidates will demonstrate excellence using Khorus or other digital customer engagement platforms to optimize the customer experience, raise awareness and generate conversions. Experience performing market assessments and research is a plus.

This position will accept applications until 3/15/2024

Exemption Status

Exempt

Compensation Detail

$35.97- $50.36 /hrly; Education, experience and tenure may be considered along with internal equity when job offers are extended.

Benefits Eligible

No

Schedule

Part Time

Hours/Pay Period

.008

Schedule Details

Normal Business Hours

International Assignment

No

Site Description
Just as our reputation has spread beyond our Minnesota roots, so have our locations. Today, our employees are located at our three major campuses in Phoenix/Scottsdale, Arizona, Jacksonville, Florida, Rochester, Minnesota, and at Mayo Clinic Health System campuses throughout Midwestern communities, and at our international locations. Each Mayo Clinic location is a special place where our employees thrive in both their work and personal lives. Learn more about what each unique Mayo Clinic campus has to offer, and where your best fit is.

Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer

As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available.


Recruiter

Lynnette Fleshman

title: Coordinator, Marketing Partnerships
location: 151 S Grand Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90012
description:
Title: Coordinator, Marketing Partnerships
Department: Marketing
FLSA Status: Part-Time, Non-Exempt
Salary Range: $24-$29 hourly
Statement of the Job:
Assist the Marketing Partnerships Team with planning, execution and tracking of promotional and corporate partnerships for Walt Disney Concert Hall, Hollywood Bowl, and The Ford seasons.
Essential Functions:
Oversee all aspects of promotional events, including pre-/post-concert receptions at the Walt Disney Concert Hall and tabling activations at the Hollywood Bowl and The Ford.
Support the Corporate Sponsorship teams with on-site activations and sponsor events at the Walt Disney Hall, Hollywood Bowl, and The Ford.
Coordinate off-site promotion activations that help support each season, including logistics, day-of management, and volunteer recruitment.
Act as a brand ambassador at all activations, providing visitors with knowledge on our upcoming seasons and events.
Support the Analytics & Audience Development team with special interest group events (i.e. CODA), as needed.
Regular and reliable attendance.
Other duties as assigned.
Relationships: Creative Services, Digital, Direct Marketing, Levy Restaurants, Sodexo, Music Center Scheduling, Social Media, Walt Disney Concert Hall, Hollywood Bowl and The Ford Box Office and Parking Teams, Walt Disney Concert Hall, Hollywood Bowl and The Ford Operations, Walt Disney Concert Hall Guest Services, Analytics
Reports To: Senior Manager, Promotions & Partnerships
Minimum Requirements
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree required or equivalent experience
Minimum of two years promotional experience in the Los Angeles area
Background in Audience development and hospitality event planning a plus
Communication skills (written and verbal)
Capable of working as a member of a team as well as independently
Passion for music
Availability to work nights and weekends
The Los Angeles Philharmonic Association will consider for employment qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the FCIHO.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY POLICY
The Los Angeles Philharmonic Association embraces and is committed to diversity and inclusion within our staff, musicians, guest artists, audiences, and surrounding communities. The Association does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, religious creed (including religious dress and religious grooming), sex (including pregnancy, perceived pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition or information, genetic information, marital status, gender, gender identity, gender expression, military status, veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. Consistent with the law, the Association also provides reasonable accommodation for disabled applicants and employees in accordance with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and the California Fair Employment and Housing Act, for pregnant employees who request an accommodation with the advice of their health care providers, for pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions; for employees who are victims of domestic violence, sexual assault or stalking; and for applicants and employees based on their religious beliefs and practices.

title: Marketing Assistant/Specialist II (Contingent)
description:

Marketing Specialist II- Creative Studio Traffic Manager

title: Specialist, Global Marketing
description:
Position Overview:
The Global Marketing Specialist will play a key role in helping to plan, execute and track strategic marketing plans for the brand. This person will contribute to the implementation of initiatives designed to deliver against the company's strategic priorities.
The Global Marketing Specialist must demonstrate the following qualities:
Leadership and Collaboration: Ability to manage projects and liaise across a multi-functional global organization.
Business Analytics: Ability to translate data into clear learnings and strategic action plans that can generate a positive impact on business results.
Strong Written and Verbal Communication: Ability to summarize and present key insights, leading to a compelling creative brief.
Proven track record in strong, brand driven and collaborative execution.
Demonstrable passion for luxury marketing, retail and consumer understanding, as well as relevant trends in the luxury industry.
Key Accountabilities:
Initiative Development
Support the development of multiple global marketing initiatives from 360 brief generation through to the development and deployment of their global asset toolkits.
Serve as point of contact for cross-functional project contributors, closely tracking all project timelines and troubleshooting (complex) issues as they arise.
Perform competitive analyses and market assessments as needed to support the projects at hand, thinking creatively beyond adjacent jewelry brands for ideas and inspiration.
Prepare presentations and materials for Senior Management as well as internal calls with Regional Marketing Leaders and cross-functional teams.
Partner with Finance and cross-functional teams to manage and track initiative budgets.
Business Analytics
Conduct complex business analysis, synthesizing cross-channel insights from Tiffany.com, email, organic & paid media and more, with custom data pulls as needed, to measure the success of a given initiative and inform future strategic planning.
Cross-Functional Partnerships
Develop and manage relationships in cross-functional project teams (internal/external), with partners including but not limited to Client Development, Email, Site Content, Visual Merchandising, Media and Category Management to ensure excellence in execution - delivering the initiative and full asset tool kit to the regional marketing teams on time.
Provide on-going support and communication on initiative asset kits, working closely with Project Management and internal Creative teams.
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree with 3-5 years related work experience
Appreciation and understanding of luxury, retail, popular culture, style, and design. Interest in new media is a plus.
Strong communication and analytical skills. Business writing and public speaking proficiency are a must.
Hands-on, “get-it-done”, results-driven, positive mentality complemented by ability to be agile, prioritize and multi-task.
Exceptional organizational and critical problem-solving abilities with experience analyzing data and insights
Demonstrates cultural awareness and understanding of regional differences with the flexibility to work with international time zones.
Proficient computer skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
The hiring range for this position ranges from $74,035 - $100,150. The rate of pay offered will be dependent upon candidates’ relevant skills and experience.

title: Email Marketing Manager
description:
Advanced Academic Programs (AAP), a division in the Krieger School of Arts and Sciences at Johns Hopkins University, seeks an experienced and dynamic Email Marketing Manager to create and manage an extensive portfolio of critical email messages targeting dozens of audiences. This individual will coordinate a vast array of ongoing multi-touchpoint communication flows and single one-off messages based on a variety of characteristics and action-based triggering events. Communication flows will utilize innovative technologies and strategies to maximize engagement and drive prospective students to apply and then to enroll in their academic programs.

Each year, AAP enrolls more than 6,000 graduate students, both part-time and full-time, in more than 25 distinctive professional graduate degrees, post-baccalaureate certificates, and non-credit courses. Over 77% of AAP's enrollments are through the online programs, otherwise classes occur on campus, either in Washington, D.C., or Baltimore. The AAP Marketing and Communications team is also responsible in supporting a significant summer portfolio of courses and programs offered at the pre-college and undergraduate levels. Each year, the Office of Summer and Intersession Programs enrolls more than 4,000 students.

The Marketing and Communications team within AAP seeks to reinforce a vision that integrates inventive marketing initiatives to highlight the value of its educational offerings and the success of its students. Under the direction of the Executive Director of Marketing and Communications, the Email Marketing Manager joins our team of professionals dedicated to supporting new student recruitment and retention, program marketing, and strategic reinforcement of the JHU-AAP brand. This position works closely with the AAP Marketing and Communications team, the AAP Admissions team, the Summer at Hopkins team, and external communications partners in achieving the division's marketing and enrollment objectives for each program. This position is responsible for planning, designing, implementing, and measuring the effectiveness of individually targeted communications, leveraging the latest technologies, and focusing on a superior student experience.

A successful Email Marketing Manager will build a robust network within Hopkins and across the higher education industry and will achieve strong engagement and measured outcomes in the following areas: developing relevant content and calls-to-action at each point of interaction with AAP's messaging, strategically managing any communication overlaps and interactions to ensure a clear voice and message reaches the audience, and leveraging metrics to continuously improve student engagement and progress toward application, enrollment, and graduation.

Note: Please note that two email examples demonstrating written and visual contributions will be requested during all first-round interviews. This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship.

Specific Duties & Responsibilities

55% Content Creation and Distribution

Develop and maintain a communications calendar that aligns with the academic deadlines in order to achieve marketing and enrollment objectives.
Ensure the emails are built and tested for consumption across multiple devices and email platforms. Each email should adhere to responsive HTML design principles.
Create, curate, edit, and manage all email content (written, images, and video).
Address content to specific audiences, including prospective students, current students, and alumni.
Understand various objectives along the prospect and student life cycle, speak to those calls-to-action.
Maintain a consistent voice that aligns well with the University's brand and style guidelines and remains aware of the different audiences' perspectives and touch-points with the brand.
Align messaging with program positioning and the strategic placement of content across media platforms.
Collaborate with internal and external partners to brainstorm ideas and build messaging components.

30% Strategic Planning
Develop a long-term strategy for communicating through targeted multi-touch email communication flows.
Leverage email systems and student databases to enhance engagement and compel progress through the prospect, applicant, and student life cycles.
Incorporate data feeds and trigger-events to ensure emails are relevant, timely, and personalized.
Account for the need to overlap communication flows and one-off messages that continually reinforce the recipient's relationship with our division and the university as a whole.
Evaluate and incorporate new technologies that demonstrate enhancements to the communication flows.

15% Campaign Evaluation and Refinement
Establish and monitor metrics necessary to ensure the critical email channel is operating optimally.
Utilize analytics to monitor the effectiveness of individual messages and collective communication flows.
Analyze campaigns and translate both anecdotal and quantitative data into structured plans for iteratively revising tactical communication efforts.
Consider implementation of test and control methodologies to optimize performance and evaluate new approaches.
Monitor trends and assess the significance of innovative email and digital communication tools, applications, channels, designs, and strategies to further successful audience outreach.

Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in related field.
Four years related experience.
Additional education may substitute for required experience, to the extent permitted by the JHU equivalency formula.

Preferred Qualifications
Experience managing communication outreach for an educational institution, or other service-oriented industry.

Special Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities
Highly effective communicator with an audience-first mindset.
Demonstrated proficiency and creativity in the digital communications space, particularly in the higher education sphere.
Knowledge of communication flow content strategy and creation.
Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills.

Comfort with testing strategies and data-driven metric analysis.
Strong collaborative spirit.
Excellent time-management and organizational skills.
Highly self-motivated and well-organized.
Able to work under deadline pressure and manage competing priorities.

title: Consumer & Market Insights Analyst
description:
AT A GLANCE
Join RVO Health, where insights drive value and innovation! We're looking for a dynamic and proactive Analyst to join our Consumer and Market Insights team. As an integral member, you'll execute research initiatives across diverse business verticals within our extensive portfolio. Harnessing the power of various data platforms, you'll uncover invaluable insights, track project progress, create compelling surveys, generate insightful reports, and develop storytelling through data interpretation.
At RVO Health, you'll dive deep into syndicated and secondary data tools, unlocking meaningful insights into our audiences, clients' brands, and the dynamic markets we support. In addition, this role presents a prime opportunity to develop your primary market research skills and drive your professional growth.
Collaborating with top-tier health advertisers and digital agencies, you'll be at the forefront of our journey towards continued success and rapid expansion. Embrace this exceptional opportunity to join a thriving team within a leading health consumer and media organization.
Where You'll Be
To prioritize togetherness, culture, and accountability, RVO Health operates on a hybrid in-office work schedule. We expect employees to work from our South Charlotte office Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday each week. You are welcome to work remotely Mondays and Fridays if you wish.
1101 Red Ventures Dr Fort Mill, SC 29707
What You'll Do
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to understand, refine, and deliver on project objectives
Employ data-driven insights to strategically position our audiences for business opportunities utilizing various resources and survey tools, including Comscore, Google Analytics, MRI, Qualtrics, Vivvix, and more
Ensure timely delivery of internal insights and market research reports, maintaining clear communication with internal teams regarding project timelines and progress
Provide invaluable support to team members across various research execution tasks, from media plan review to survey testing, data analysis, and report creation
With supervision and coaching, you will be responsible for playing an integral role in overall project quality by monitoring of sample/data while providing updates to internal team
What We're Looking For
Bachelor's degree (Market Research, Psychology, Marketing, Statistics or Social Sciences preferred) or equivalent experience
Minimum one year of consumer/market research experience or college coursework equivalent
Familiarity with digital media or health/pharma industry
Knowledge of statistical software (SPSS, SAS etc.) or Tableau a plus
Strong computer skills: Excel, PowerPoint, Word, or Google Equivalent
Excellent analytical and organization skills, coupled with an attention to detail and accuracy
A resourceful, nimble self-starter, ready to jump in and contribute wherever necessary
A positive, can-do attitude that fosters collaboration and teamwork
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks concurrently, delivering results in a timely manner.
If you're ready to embark on an exciting opportunity where insights drive meaningful impact, join us at RVO Health!

Pursuant to various state Fair Pay Acts, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company. The following benefits are provided by RVO Health, subject to eligibility requirements.
Starting Salary: $64,000 - $78,000
Note actual salary is based on geographic location, qualifications and experience
Access to a Free Udemy for Business subscription—thousands of hours of learning content on hundreds of different subjects at your fingertips
Health Insurance Coverage (medical, dental, and vision)
Life Insurance
Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts
Paid Time Off
Holiday Pay
401(k) with match
Employee Assistance Program
Paid Parental Bonding Benefit Program
Who We Are:
Founded in 2022, RVO Health is a new healthcare platform of digital media brands, services and technologies focused on building relationships with people throughout their health & wellness journey. We meet people where they are in their personal health journeys and connect them with both the information and the care they need. RVO Health was created by joining teams from both Red Ventures and UnitedHealth Group's Optum Health. Together we're focused on delivering on our vision of a stronger and healthier world.
RVO Health is comprised of Healthline Media (Healthline, Medical News Today, Psych Central, Greatist and Bezzy), Healthgrades, FindCare and PlateJoy; Optum Perks, Optum Store and the virtual coaching platforms Real Appeal, Wellness Coaching, and QuitForLife.
We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage, employee assistance program, 401(k) plan and a paid parental leave program.
RVO Health is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or any other basis protected by law. Employment at RVO Health is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications.
We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with disabilities. This includes providing reasonable accommodation where appropriate. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to apply or participate in the job application or interview process, please contact accommodations@rvohealth.com.
We do not provide visa sponsorship for this role at this time.
RVO Health Privacy Policy: https://rvohealth.com/legal/privacy

title: Brand Marketing & Communications Specialist
description:
Looking for a job to get you out of bed?
Casper is seeking a Specialist to join the Brand Marketing & Communications Team. The Brand Marketing & Communications team sits across the marketing organization, driving cross-functional marketing strategy and collaborating on a range of initiatives to grow the business. As a member of the Brand Marketing & Communications team, the specialist will partner with all aspects of the organization, including promotions, acquisition and retention marketing, creative, communications, legal, and tech.
The ideal candidate is a proactive contributor, creative thinker, highly detail-oriented and organized with experience in digital and/or offline marketing, advertising or project management. We're looking for teammates who are curious, goal-oriented, collaborative, and excited to drive Casper's mission forward.
Casper (Casper.com) believes everyone should sleep better. The Sleep Company has a full portfolio of obsessively engineered sleep products—including mattresses, pillows, bedding, and furniture—designed in-house by the Company's award-winning R&D team at Casper Labs. In addition to its e-commerce business, Casper has Sleep Shops across North America and its products are available at a growing list of retailers.
We are deeply committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce so that we represent all those who dream big equally.
When you're not catching zzz's, this is what you'll do...
Promotions (50%)
Play an integral role on the marketing team, working closely with many other Casper teams (such as legal, retail, tech and creative) to bring promotions, projects and business initiatives to life.
Own promotional campaigns from ideation to launch including briefing and creative development
Monitor the competitive landscape and contribute to ongoing research and monthly reports
Support ongoing weekly progress and performance reporting for integrated marketing projects and share learnings with cross-functional partners
Social (35%)
Become an expert on Casper's products and brand identity to respond to all social media inbounds—DMs, customer inquiries, and hilarious reviews—across Casper's Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram channels
Contribute to customer-centric social campaigns to help grow WOM/mentions and harness brand evangelists
Organize our social media management tool and track all user-generated content and document memorable interactions to build robust content library
Serve as liaison between Marketing and Customer Experience team to bridge the gap between touchpoints and provide recommendations on larger company-wide customer support integrations
PR & Influencer (15%)
Respond to day-to-day press/influencer inquiries and product requests and assist in the execution of press, consumer, influencer, and experiential events
Identify emerging awareness opportunities, including areas such as executive thought leadership, product placement, influencers
Oversee continued development of comprehensive library and database of resources (press page, fact sheets, etc.)
Leverage resources to measure and track communications results and creating recaps and reports to share learnings
Our dream candidate is/has...
Bachelor's degree
Minimum 2 years work experience on a fast-paced marketing team and/or managing complex, multi-faceted projects
Highly organized with a passion for detail and ability to adapt quickly to change
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to influence and build strong working relationships at all levels
Strong analytical skills with the ability to streamline and structure many moving pieces
Nice to have: Proficient in Coda or other project management tools
This is a hybrid role, requiring that you work 2 days per week based at our spacious 3 World Trade Center office.
Targeted Annual Base Salary Range: $65,000-75,000 USD
Casper's compensation philosophy ensures that the actual base salary is based on factors including but not limited to skills, education, experience, special training, time in position, and/or years of service.
We recognize that annual base salary is just one part of a total rewards package. In addition, we offer a comprehensive benefits package, wellbeing resources, and other perks including:
Participation in our HQ bonus program for some splurging
Medical, vision, and dental insurance to help you with those coughs or cavities (too many waffles)
Unlimited vacation policy. We believe in the power of rest so take the time you need to recharge.
A full gifted bed set when you join and product discounts for friends and family!
… and more!
If you dream about this stuff this job is probably right for you. We look forward to learning more about you!

title: Marketing Operations Associate
description:
About Frequence
Frequence is an ad tech platform for media companies that connects all aspects of digital advertising—sales, operations, and reporting—from beginning to end. Our software makes selling local advertising scalable and provides users with an all-in-one platform that drives campaign performance.
Our trailblazing technology is always growing, and so are we. We push ourselves further with our belief in collaboration, execution, and ownership. We don't just want to create intuitive AdTech tools—we want to foster a culture of openness and inclusivity that encourages our employees to think bigger and grow higher. Step into the future with us.
The Opportunity:
Frequence is looking to add a Marketing Operations Associate to the Marketing team to build and optimize dynamic B2B-tech marketing programs/campaigns focused on adding customers in order to drive revenue. They will be responsible for leveraging their in-depth knowledge of the HubSpot Platform to create, implement, and optimize marketing automation strategies. They will work closely with the marketing team to track and analyze performance metrics, improve marketing operations and continuously improve sales/marketing initiatives to achieve business goals.
What You Will Do:
Oversee Frequence's website (Webflow), CRM and marketing automation platforms (HubSpot), and digital assets to capture, qualify and manage leads
Partner with sales to optimize sales and marketing funnel performance
Develop and implement automated marketing campaigns utilizing the HubSpot Platform to nurture leads, drive engagement, and increase conversion rates
Design and manage email marketing campaign workflows and lead nurturing processes within HubSpot
Monitor and analyze key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess marketing campaigns' effectiveness and make data-driven optimization recommendations
Utilize HubSpot's reporting and analytics tools to provide regular insights and reports on campaign performance, lead generation, and customer engagement
Stay up to date with the latest trends and best practices in marketing automation and proactively identify opportunities for process improvements and innovative strategies
Provide training and support to team members on HubSpot functionalities, best practices, and marketing automation techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to optimize landing pages, forms, and CTAs to drive inbound lead generation
Capture marketing ROI through reporting and analytics
Develop and implement lead nurture strategies—including a lead recycle program—to ensure we are maximizing the conversion of engaged prospects into sales-qualified leads
Maintain a regular feedback loop with the content, creative, sales, and various marketing team members to drive ongoing improvements in campaign performance and conversion rates
Who You Are:
You have hands-on expertise in the core technologies that drive our digital strategy: CRM and marketing automation, Google Analytics, website management (WebFlow), and email marketing.
You can collaborate across teams to launch and accomplish your campaign objectives and tie those objectives back to company goals and initiatives.
Must Haves:
Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, Marketing Analytics, or a related field
2+ years of B2B marketing experience, preferably in SaaS start-ups with a focus on sales and marketing operations
1-3 years proven experience working with a marketing automation platform (Hubspot a plus) and intimate knowledge of its properties, including workflows, marketing analytics, lead generation funnels, email marketing, lead scoring, and contact management
Strong understanding of marketing automation strategies and best practices
Demonstrated experience in developing and executing successful automated marketing campaigns, operational efficiencies and reporting
Proficiency in data analysis and translating data insights into actionable marketing strategies
Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and time management skills
Familiarity with marketing business analytics and producing data-driven insights and reporting
Eagerness to take ownership
HubSpot certifications (e.g., HubSpot Marketing Software Certification) are a plus
Compensation
The base salary range represents the minimum and maximum of the salary range for this position based on the primary location. The salary for this role is $65,000 - $85,000. Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate's qualifications, skills, competency, experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the total package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work.
Candidates hired to work in other locations will be subject to the pay range associated with that location, and the actual annualized salary amount offered to any candidate at the time of hire will be reflected solely in the candidate's offer letter.
We support each member of the Frequence team with a comprehensive employee benefits package including health and well-being benefits, retirement contributions, 401(k) savings plan, and much more. Eligibility varies based on full or part-time status, exempt or non-exempt status, and management level.
Why Frequence?
Frequence is proud to be certified as a Great Place to Work.
Our people-first culture and distinctive mission set us apart from others in the industry. As our company grows, so does our need to add sharp, ambitious, and talented people to our team. We're approachable, inclusive, and encourage open dialogue within our community. This is a place where your voice matters. Join us and let's see what we can build together.
Some of the industry-leading benefits we offer include:
Competitive compensation
Stock options and retirement plans
Health, dental and vision insurance
Short-term disability, Long-term disability, & Life insurance
Flexible PTO and remote work options
And more
Frequence, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. At Frequence, Inc. we are deliberately trying to create a safe space for people of all races, genders, ages, backgrounds, and orientations. It is the policy of Frequence, Inc. to provide equal employment opportunity to all persons, regardless of age, race, religion, color, national origin, sex, political affiliations, marital status, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, age, sexual orientation, membership or non-membership in an employee organization, or on the basis of personal favoritism or other non-merit factors, except where otherwise provided by law.
Privacy Policy can be reviewed here.

title: Internal Communications Strategist
description:
Summary

Posted: Sep 11, 2023

Weekly Hours: 40

Role Number:200501496

Apple is where people do the best work of their careers. Apple's Internal Communications team is looking for a collaborative professional to communicate to Apple employees globally. Our team informs Apple about our innovative products and services, the values that drive our company, and our industry-leading benefits and support programs. This position works with colleagues in our worldwide communications team, internal partners and subject matter experts to help develop, produce and execute communication strategies. We are a highly collaborative team and you will work extensively with designers, writers, and other creative professionals. We are looking for a creative and skilled communicator who has experience developing effective communications strategies across multiple channels and platforms. If that’s you, then your next home may be here!

Key Qualifications

Key Qualifications
A positive, team-player attitude, passionate about developing and driving short- and long-term communications plans and delivering in a dynamic environment, while building a positive organizational culture around a unified mission.
Natural self-starter who demonstrates creative and critical thinking abilities, can focus and implement, with an eye for details.
Effective collaborator who will work cross functionally across teams and geographies/time-zones while demonstrating integrity and professionalism at all times.
Thrives in a very dynamic, global environment and able to handle multiple projects simultaneously, including crisis and issues management - previous experience and proven track record in this area is a requirement.
Pro-level writing and editing skills, excellent verbal communications skills, and detailed project management skills with an eye to messaging for a range of internal communication channels and audience types.
Strong interpersonal skills, experience in building consensus and driving collaboration by building positive relationships and using data.
Experience in employee communications strategy, implementation, and analytics
Experience working in a fast-paced environment, engaging successfully at all levels of the organization.
Experience working in both program and project management, with exceptional skills in leading complex, cross-functional communications projects for global audiences.


Description

Description

We are currently seeking an Internal Communications strategist to join our corporate communications team. This colleague will be responsible for developing, leading and executing communications plans and tactics across a range of corporate activities - including issues management and crisis response and management. Supports rapid response communications including unpredictable and fast-moving issues with tight deadlines. Draft robust internal communications plans and collateral to inform and engage global team members. Draft stories for internal company news sites, newsletter and video scripts. Collaborate with internal stakeholders throughout the company to gather information for news, announcements and events. Strong ability to drive action through collaboration, proactivity, and flexibility. Able to rally people and influence all levels to get things done. Strong capability to strategize and plan ahead, and a self-starter to provide great insights and ideas. Successfully manage change and ambiguity. Inherently curious and driven, you will always be eager to find a better way to do things and take things to the next level. You will work under demanding timelines and have a keen eye for detail, with an ability to finish projects to the highest level. You will excel at building relationships and strive for excellence in everything you do.

Education & Experience

Education & Experience

Bachelor’s degree preferred

Additional Requirements

Additional Requirements

Pay & Benefits

Pay & Benefits
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $141,100.00 and $212,600.00, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses - including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.

Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics.

title: Communications Specialist - Digital
description:
Why Mayo Clinic

Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed.


Responsibilities
You will be responsible for producing high-quality content for various platforms, such as long form articles, social media, newsletters, and presentations. You will also design and develop visual communication materials, such as infographics, charts, graphs, and videos, to enhance our message.
To be successful as a communications specialist, you should have excellent writing and editing skills, as well as a keen eye for design and aesthetics. You should also have strong communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work collaboratively with different teams and stakeholders. You should be able to manage multiple projects and deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities and needs.
Responsibilities:
Plan, create, and implement effective communication strategies for internal and external audiences.
Write, edit, and proofread clear and compelling content for various platforms including email.
Design and develop visual communication materials, such as infographics, charts, graphs, and videos, using appropriate tools and software.
Ensure that all communication materials are consistent with the company’s brand guidelines, tone, and voice.
Research and analyze relevant information, data, and trends to support communication objectives and goals.
Collaborate with different teams and stakeholders, such as marketing, sales, product, and management, to ensure alignment and coordination of communication efforts.
Stay updated on the latest communication trends, best practices, and technologies, and apply them to improve communication outcomes.
The department is responsible to build, grow and protect Mayo Clinic’s reputation in a way that shapes the external environment and nurtures the culture to help achieve the mission of the organization. Department functions consist of reputation management including thought leadership and issues/crisis response; client communications and engagement programs; staff engagement; content and channels; government and community engagement; strategy and insights; communications services.

The specialist understands Mayo Clinic business objectives and priorities and participates in creating and implementing plans to meet those objectives. The specialist supports client needs and partners with other department team members to drive and measure outcomes. Must develop and maintain relationships with internal and external stakeholders to advance the organization's mission.

Qualifications
Requires a bachelor's degree in a related field plus 1 year of relevant work experience. Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a portfolio of published or produced content including long form articles, formal presentation decks and infographics will be necessary in this role. Proficiency in design and video editing software, such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere, or similar tools is also required.
Related internships will be considered. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate in a way that creates clarity, simplifies messages, and aligns with organizational strategy. Knowledge of channels for communication and the ability to build effective communication and engagement strategies.

Must be a self-starter with the ability to independently identify opportunities, solutions and resolve challenges. Demonstrated ability to deliver impactful results. Requires an attitude that actively seeks out change, embraces critical questioning, innovation, service and continuous improvement. Must understand how to deal with and navigate ambiguity, and act without having the total picture. Adaptable or flexible. Demonstrated professionalism and ethics, with ability to earn credibility through integrity and transparency. Role models service excellence. Motivates others by being present, engaged, attentive, invites diverse perspectives, demonstrates and inspires a collaborative spirit.

Must be able to work effectively in a collaborative, academic environment that thrives on teamwork and collegial relationships. Must possess the ability to inspire trust and confidence and maintain a high degree of professionalism and confidentiality.
This position will accept applications until 3/22/24. This deadline may be extended if the necessary candidate pool is not met by this date.

Exemption Status

Exempt

Compensation Detail

$69,576 - $102,252 / year

Benefits Eligible

Yes

Schedule

Full Time

Hours/Pay Period

80

Schedule Details

M-F, business hours. This position may work remotely from any location within the U.S.

Weekend Schedule

As needed

International Assignment

No

Site Description
Just as our reputation has spread beyond our Minnesota roots, so have our locations. Today, our employees are located at our three major campuses in Phoenix/Scottsdale, Arizona, Jacksonville, Florida, Rochester, Minnesota, and at Mayo Clinic Health System campuses throughout Midwestern communities, and at our international locations. Each Mayo Clinic location is a special place where our employees thrive in both their work and personal lives. Learn more about what each unique Mayo Clinic campus has to offer, and where your best fit is.

Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer

As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available.

title: Marketing Technologist - Remote
description:
Why Mayo Clinic

Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed.


Responsibilities
The Marketing Technologist is responsible for working with IT and other business units to design configure and implement Mayo Clinic’s marketing technology stack including the customer data platform. The technologist will work closely with leadership across the department to understand technology and automation needs and develop and execute recommendations. The technologist will work to ensure the department's data strategy, database management and tactics are in alignment with those of the institution and in compliance with legal requirements.

This Position is 100% Remote, can work from anywhere within the United States
** Visa sponsorship is not available for this position; Also, Mayo Clinic DOES NOT participate in the F-1 STEM OPT extension program**

Qualifications
Bachelor degree required and five years' experience and understanding designing, configuring, and setting up marketing technology stacks. Proven experience with campaign management systems, customer data platforms, customer event hubs, and content management systems are required. Experience with customer segmentation and targeting also is required. Knowledge of how predictive modeling for decision making/data segmentation business needs is preferred as is knowledge of effective uses of machine learning and AI in marketing. Working experience with digital analytics and testing tools such as Maxymiser, Optimizely, or Google Analytics preferred. Must be detailed oriented and provide consistent and accurate output. Ability to effectively influence, prioritize, strategize and multi-task. Excellent communication skills required; ability to define, develop, test, analyze, and maintain sophisticated business and technical applications. Must be self-motivated and able to work alone, making recommendations based on acquired business knowledge. Must manage external resources and vendors effectively to meet department and institutional needs and goals. Manage to budget and deadlines in spite of multiple simultaneous and competing priorities. Awareness and appreciation of cultural diversity and differences in learning styles required.

title: B2B Marketing Specialist
description:
Sony Electronics Inc. is looking for the risk-takers, the collaborators, the inspired and the inspirational. We want the people who are brave enough to work at the cutting edge and create solutions that will enrich and improve the lives of people across the globe. In addition to competitive pay and benefits, we offer an environment and culture that promotes Diversity, Equity and Inclusion. In addition, our team members enjoy innovative work-life balance opportunities including a hybrid home/office workplace, monthly “Free Fridays”, and early shutdowns on Fridays throughout the year (including half-days during the summer).

So, if you want to join a “Best Place to Work” company and make the world say wow, let's talk.
Sony Electronics Inc.'s Image and Professional Solutions Americas group has an exciting position in the B2B Marketing group. We’re looking for a highly organized and motivated marketer to join our team. The Marketing Specialist will work within the Marketing team in the development and implementation of various marketing programs and activities for Professional AV products, marketed to B2B customers. The Marketing Specialist will be responsible for coordinating events, webinars and assisting in the creation and implementation of various marketing programs and communications. The position will also be responsible for market research, organizing internal sales support documents and collateral, proof-reading, and execute other special projects as required. The specialist should be adept at working independently, then consulting with managers and collaborating with cross-functional team members to ensure success. The Marketing Specialist will be required to travel approximately 30% of the time to tradeshows, events, and other Sony locations. This is a hybrid role with 3 days a week in office requirement.
Responsibilities:
Assist in execution of marketing plans to reach audiences through targeted channels
Assist marketing manager in the development and execution of campaigns, including content creation, event planning, and sales support
Create and distribute monthly reports on critical metrics for lead generation, content creation, website traffic, and other KPIs
Coordinate and manage workflows and deliverables effectively and on deadline
Liaise with internal and external teams for planning and executing of marketing activities
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree is required or equivalent, preferably concentrating in Marketing
2-4 years related B2B marketing, event coordination, market research experience
Ideal candidate should possess adaptability, strategic thinking, and a results-driven mindset
Experience planning and executing webinars is required
Professional writing, editing, and proofreading skills are required
Must possess strong written and oral communication skills and have strong interpersonal skills
Must be able to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and be detail-oriented
Must possess strong working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Power Point
Must be willing and able to travel 30% of the time
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience preparing, analyzing, and reporting on market and sales data is preferred
Knowledge or background in CRM, marketing automation, and project management tools is beneficial
The anticipated base pay range for this position is $76,000 to $101,000. The actual base salary offered depends on a variety of factors, which may include as applicable, the qualifications of the individual applicant for the position, years of relevant experience, specific and unique skills, level of education attained, certifications or other professional licenses held, and the location in which the applicant lives and/or from which they will be performing the job.
In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for a bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package including healthcare benefits (medical, dental, and vision), paid medical leave after three months of employment, a 401k plan with matching company contributions, vacation time, education assistance, student loan assistance program, eighty hours of paid sick leave time annually, and up to twelve weeks paid parental leave after six months of employment.
Sony Electronics is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values employees with a broad cross-cultural perspective. We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond. All applicants will receive fair and impartial treatment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, status in the U.S. uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information or on any other basis which is protected under applicable federal, state or local law.

title: Content Specialist
description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
Working at Abbott
At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You’ll also have access to:
Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of .
Free medical coverage for employees* via the Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO
An excellent retirement savings plan with high employer contribution
Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor’s degree.
A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.
A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.
The Opportunity
This position works out of our Lake Bluff, IL or Willis Tower location in the PA Public Affairs division.
Abbott is seeking a full-time communications specialist to support social media employee advocacy program and other communications and engagement efforts for Abbott’s global employees.
The Content Specialist must be a strong communicator – able to incorporate the brand story and communications strategy into engaging and impactful social content, including text, imagery and video. This role requires understanding of social media best practices, community management and social listening, metrics and insights, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
This role reports to the Employee Communications team, a group within the Company’s global marketing and external affairs team. It will also collaborate with the Content (social media) team.
What You’ll Work On
Manage and update editorial calendar
Identify/organize content to be uploaded
Manage advocacy platforms where the content is shared to employees
Develop creative copy and curates imagery to go along with posts
Ensures strategic content cadence is executed
Review and send user-submitted content for approval following the established protocol
Manage intake of user (employees’) questions and inquiries, escalating relevant inquiries
Analyze and report on metrics
Occasional travel, up to weekly visits to other Abbott sites in the Chicagoland area
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree (preferred in Marketing, Communications, Digital or Public Relations, or related field).
2+ years of experience in Digital/Social media Marketing, Communications or Public Relations
Excellent writing skills, with an eye for proofreading and grammar
Passionate about Abbott’s mission and interest in working with a globally diverse workforce
Preferred Qualifications
A creative, critical and original thinker
Strong analytical skills and superior judgment
Strong Project Management skills and attention to detail
Participants who complete a short wellness assessment qualify for FREE coverage in our HIP PPO medical plan. Free coverage applies in the next calendar year.
Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com
Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.
Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

The base pay for this position is $57,300.00 – $114,700.00. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

title: Social Strategist
description:
Social Strategist – The Brooklyn Brothers
Welcome to The Brooklyn Brothers: an earned-led creative agency and communications network made for a new marketing era. We believe brands should add value to culture and customers should be treated like fans. And we believe brands should create ideas that earn attention before buying it.
We work as a connected team of strategists, creatives, and producers, combining the rigor of marketing with the relevance of earned media – creating and distributing work for some of the best and bravest brands in the world.
We're looking for a Social Strategist with 4-6 years of experience to join our growing team, helping lead two of our most important and notable clients on the leading edge of culture. You need to be comfortable working with the most beloved consumer brands, new tech and B2B. You'll be working with the Head of Strategy, Global Group CSO, ECD, account and brand teams and you'll be part of an interagency group of planners and analysts. If this sound like you, then let's talk.
You're a constant observer – You have great instincts, and they start with knowing that, without research, you're not doing real strategy. You love research and digging deeper till you uncover something new.
2. You're fascinated by brands, people, and culture – You want to know what makes brands stand out and grow, and the influences that impact You're curious about consumer behaviors, especially in social media, and the trends that create culture.
You're social at heart – You obsess over social media, platforms, content, and content makers; you love data, especially deciphering what it says about people who make and consume it. You keep up with the latest social everything and want to know why it matters.
You're a writer and a storyteller – You notice our brand world in ways other don't and want to write about it in compelling ways that solve problems and spark ideas.
You're not defined by one thing – You may have other interests or specialties and you're eager to learn new skills and take on new challenges.
You love this stuff – You feed off the energy and ideas of others, and you're excited by the prospect of working in an environment that demands creative collaboration.
The Brooklyn Brothers is always learning, but here are some of the skills we're looking for:
Brand Strategy – A track record of using a variety of inputs to develop research-driven strategies and thought-provoking ideas to solve brand problems and compel people to act.
Brief Writing & Comms Plans – The ability to turn strategy into concise and inspiring creative briefs and effective communications plans.
Presentation Skills – Experience developing and presenting decks with an informed POV that are thoughtfully-researched, thought-provoking, and concise.
4. Social-led – Comfortable with social strategies and content, influencer marketing, understanding best practices as well as nascent trends, AI, research and social listening tools, and the ability to put social thinking at the heart of big ideas.
5. Self-starter – The confidence to own a project from beginning-to-end and act as a trusted client partner and team collaborator.
6. Kindness & Respect – Because we spend too much time with each other, on screens and in-person, not to be nice. Your ideas are amplified by the opinions of your colleagues and the diverse agency culture you push forward.

Salary Range: $70,000-130,000
The Brooklyn Brothers has included the base salary or hourly rate for this role. Actual compensation offered within the range will depend upon, among other factors: actual ranges for current or former employees in the role; market considerations; budgetary considerations; as well as a candidate's background, relevant experience, and qualifications

The Brooklyn Brothers is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Golin recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, ethnic or national origin, protected veteran status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status or citizenship status.
We make our careers website accessible to any and all users. If you need an accommodation to participate in the application process, please contact us at JobAppAccommodation@ipgdxtra.com. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or vendors; rather it is strictly for applicants who require special assistance accessing our employment website. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.

title: Marketing Assistant/Specialist II (Contingent)
description:
Please note that this is a contract role providing services to Amazon via Allegis Global Solutions. If you are selected for this role, you will be employed by AGS and will not be an employee of Amazon.

Marketing Assistant II

This team oversees the World-Wide Events team. We are responsible for putting together Prime Day, Black Friday, The Prime Early Access Sale that happened last year. We work across the entire company, globally to work with stake holders from all of our different retail and program teams in order to successfully market and merchandize everything for the high velocity events (HVE).

Build merchandising campaigns and execute traffic-driving efforts to support High Velocity Events across Amazon.

Report on progress against goals and relevant metrics
Assist with creative asset production (in partnership with a dedicated design team)
Editing (XML, HTML) and publishing content to site via Campaign Management Systems

Basic Qualifications
3+ years of experience creating and executing digital marketing campaigns, including onsite merchandising, on-device/mobile, and/or display
Writing customer-facing copy that is on-brand, relevant, and tailored to the online customer
Proficiency with Content Management Systems and ability to edit basic HTML and XML
Must be comfortable with Excel and capable of manipulating data in order to perform both high level and more granular analysis. This includes familiarity with VLookups, Pivot tables, and other such functionalities.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, with proven experience in coordinating teams and communicating to senior management
BA/BS required

Preferred Qualifications
Experience managing large scale merchandising programs
Experience with A/B or multivariate testing
Experience with customer segmentation, profiling, and targeting
Proficiency with analytics tools and web traffic reporting
Have relentlessly high standards and a high attention to detail.
Ability to conceptualize, scope, and execute projects to strict deadlines
Confident, self-motivated individual with strong, demonstrable bias for action
Proven ability to deliver results and prioritize tasks in a fast-moving, dynamic environment

Location: Remote (USA mainland)

Pay Range $28-$32 per hour
