title: Manager, Social Media Marketing
description:
Department: Marketing & Publicity
Location: Santa Monica, CA, US, 90404
Summary of Position
The Manager directs social engagement across the lifecycle of each title, from greenlight or acquisition through all release windows including theatrical, PVOD, packaged media, and catalog. On assigned titles, the Manager develops and implements the social strategy for the entire organic marketing campaign on owned socials including creative and content placement, live social media event coverage, content capture, red carpet premieres, special screenings, press coverage, junkets, talent long lead content days, events, websites, emails, digital activations, sweepstakes and all other title-based social marketing activity. The Manager provides daily agency supervision on social media campaigns for assigned titles including creative content production, copywriting, ancillary assets sourcing, content calendar development, audience engagement innovations, and overall digital campaign collaboration with title-based cross-functional teams. The Manager works with all internal departments to help promote cross-functional initiatives and priorities through social channels.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including strategy, media, partnerships, operations, PR, and creative departments to align social media efforts with overall marketing objectives
Create and curate compelling and visually appealing content for social media platforms, including text-only posts, static images, motion assets, and interactive media, ensuring high-quality standards and brand consistency
Manage and maintain budgets for all line items related to social media
Co-manage the team's digital coordinator, providing guidance, feedback, and support to ensure the timely execution of campaigns, social toolkit needs, agency support, and asset management
Advise on, communicate and implement best social media practices. Trendspot for emerging platforms and zeitgeist opportunities. Evolve tactics throughout each campaign as new data emerges
Vet, select and manage Social Agencies for title-specific campaigns including creating the RFP
Monitor the general film, entertainment, and cultural landscape as it pertains to social media; including working across Analytics and Strategy to provide relevant reporting and updates
General platform management duties including community management, social listening, etc.
Assist in directing internal resources and third party agencies as needed on social-first design and development of websites, digital activations and, when relevant, display media such as roadblocks and takeovers
Main point of contact for IP or content leaks on socials; responsible for communicating with Agencies, Anti-Piracy Teams, and Platform reps for flagging / takedown
Title Specific Responsibilities
Lead in developing overall owned and organic social strategies and creative for each title comprising of:
Creative & Evergreen Content Messaging
Fan & Community Outreach
Influencer Amplification & Earned Media Opportunities
Talent / Filmmaker Social Strategy & Fulfillment
Work in partnership with Digital Creative Lead and Media teams in supporting social needs for paid social strategies including digital media creative rotations and copywriting
Strategize, build, manage & execute weekly organic social calendars created in collaboration with Strategy, Creative, Media & Publicity
Create social media posting guidelines and recommendations specific to Talent/Filmmakers for actively shooting on-set productions and throughout campaigns as needed
Manage day-to-day relationships with Social Media Agency as it pertains to platform management and execution of the social calendar
Moderate daily Community Management in tandem with Agency
Capitalize on real-time trends and fan activity; including requesting Creative, creating low-lift content, and/or copy
In conjunction with Publicity, communicate special social content concept & requests to Talent reps and teams
Act as the main point of contact in major asset launches including trailer launches, featurettes, clips, tickets on sale, etc. as it pertains to title specific social pages including -
Providing Publicity with assets, posting instructions, and direct contact information for Talent/Filmmakers in case of any issues or questions
Assistance with influencer/tastemaker screening programs including creating and drafting messaging for on-screen cards
Point of contact for International team for delivery of assets and social calendar
Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, or a related field
Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role **at least 1-2 years of film studio experience strongly preferred**
Strong understanding of social media platforms, algorithms, trends, and best practices
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a keen eye for detail and a creative flair
Experience copywriting for a variety of tones and genres
Experience communicating with executives and filmmakers and working closely with talent to capture social content
Solid knowledge of digital marketing principles and a demonstrated ability to develop and execute successful social media campaigns
Familiarity with video editing software and graphic design tools is a plus
Strong project management & organizational skills, with the ability to multitask, meet tight deadlines, and communicate status updates
A passion for movies and a deep understanding of audience preferences and trends
Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced and dynamic team environment
About the Company
Lionsgate (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B) encompasses world-class motion picture and television studio operations aligned with the STARZ premium global subscription platform to bring a unique and varied portfolio of entertainment to consumers around the world. The Company’s film, television, subscription and location-based entertainment businesses are backed by a 17,000-title library and a valuable collection of iconic film and television franchises. A digital age company driven by its entrepreneurial culture and commitment to innovation, the Lionsgate brand is synonymous with bold, original, relatable entertainment for audiences worldwide.
Business Unit Overview
Motion Picture Group
Lionsgate’s motion picture business is a consistent box office market share leader with films that have grossed more than $10 billion worldwide over the past six years. This leadership is driven by world-class talent relationships, a deep and renewable portfolio of iconic brands and franchises, and a diverse and balanced slate that is built to enhance consumer enjoyment of the theatrical experience but also has the flexibility to utilize a broad range of alternative release strategies as the opportunities to monetize films continue to expand. The creator, owner and distributor of great film brands including The Hunger Games, Twilight Saga, John Wick, Now You See Me, Knives Out, La La Land, Saw, Dirty Dancing and Monster’s Ball, among many others, films released by Lionsgate and its predecessor companies have earned 129 Academy Award® nominations and 32 Oscar® wins.

In addition to its mainstream commercial releases, Lionsgate’s Motion Picture Group includes specialty film distributor Roadside Attractions, an industry leader in award-winning prestige movies, Pantelion Films, the U.S. market leader in Spanish-language releases, a top film production and distribution brand in the UK, and multiplatform distributor Grindstone Entertainment.
Our Benefits
Full Coverage – Medical, Vision, and Dental
Work/Life Balance – generous sick days, vacation days, holidays, and Impact Day
401(k) company matching
Tuition Reimbursement (up to graduate degree)
Compensation
$77,000 - $80,000
EEO Statement
Lionsgate is an equal employment opportunity employer. All employees and applicants are evaluated on the basis of their qualifications, consistent with applicable state and federal laws. In addition, Lionsgate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. Lionsgate will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and federal law.

title: Marketing Associate - Digital Communications Specialist
location: ClearBridge Investments in New York, NY 10018
description:
ClearBridge Investments is a leading global equity manager with over $176 billion in assets under management. The firm is committed to delivering long-term results through active management. We have followed this approach for more than 50 years and continue to offer investment solutions that emphasize differentiated stock selection to move our clients forward. Our investment decisions are supported by a robust research platform that conducts in-depth fundamental analysis of individual securities. We integrate environmental, social and governance (ESG) considerations into our fundamental research process in all our investment strategies.
Owned by Franklin Templeton, ClearBridge operates with investment independence from headquarters in New York and offices in Baltimore, Fort Lauderdale, London, San Mateo, and Sydney. ClearBridge Investments has been named by Pensions & Investments Magazine (P&I) as one of the Best Places to Work in Money Management for the twelfth year in a row. These awards reflect the Firm's diverse and inclusive culture, spirit of collaboration, work/life balance and our ongoing investment in our employees.
At ClearBridge, we believe that diversity and inclusion is essential to our success as an organization. We benefit from the sharing of different perspectives and our varied experiences. ClearBridge is proud to be a diverse company that promotes integrity, respect and teamwork and encourages new ideas and viewpoints. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is demonstrated through our various recruitment efforts, employee programs, charitable and volunteer efforts.
JOB SUMMARY
ClearBridge Investments is looking for a Marketing Associate-Digital Communications Specialist to join our New York-based marketing team to develop, oversee and execute email marketing and social media communications plans. The Digital Communications Specialist must be prepared to manage varied tasks and successfully complete projects efficiently and independently on strict deadlines and with extreme attention to detail. This role is part of a small group within the Institutional Marketing team which requires a flexible “can-do” attitude and presents opportunities for professional growth in your areas of interest.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES
Plan, develop and execute email marketing and social media campaigns (organic and paid)
Contact nurture
Specialized campaigns
Event marketing and follow up
Email journey building
Monitor campaigns and results to inform data-driven marketing decisions
Coordinate communications initiatives with external organizations
Grow digital audience, increasing followers and subscribers
Continuously improve and evolve the email and social channels to ensure optimal results
Manage Compliance requirements and approvals
Other responsibilities as needed
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors degree or equivalent
5+ years related experience
Proficient in Marketing Cloud (Salesforce) or comparable email marketing and enablement platform
Experience in social media campaign management, primarily LinkedIn and X
Knowledge of Bloomreach or a similar web content management platform preferred
Knowledge of Hootsuite or similar platform preferred
Comfortable with Google Analytics
Extreme attention to detail
Experience deploying cross-channel marketing programs
Past experience and/or exposure to financial services or similar industries is a plus
TOTAL REWARDS
Our employees have access to a competitive and valuable set of Total Rewards. Our Total Rewards include:
Hybrid work schedule
Health, wellness and risk benefits to protect employees and their families
Retirement savings, stock purchase and other incentive programs to help employees plan for the future
Holiday, paid-time-off and other employee programs that support work-life balance
Support for pursuing certifications, external education and degree programs
Learning, development and career advancement opportunities
Ways to get involved in, and give back to, our communities, including paid time off for volunteering and charitable donation matching
The salary range for this position is targeted for $100,000 to $135,000 plus discretionary bonus. Base pay offered may vary depending on job related knowledge, skills, and experience
ClearBridge is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity for all applicants and existing employees and we evaluate qualified applicants without regard to ancestry, age, color, disability, genetic information, gender, gender identity, or gender expression, marital status, medical condition, military or veteran status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, and any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law, ordinance, or regulation.

Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Flexible schedule
Health insurance
Paid time off
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Ability to Relocate:
New York, NY 10018: Relocate before starting work (Required)
Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10018

title: Partner Marketing Specialist
description:
Nintendo of America Inc.
The worldwide pioneer in the creation of interactive entertainment, Nintendo Co., Ltd., of Kyoto, Japan, manufactures and markets hardware and software for its Nintendo Switch™ system and the Nintendo 3DS™ family of portable systems. Since 1983, when it launched the Nintendo Entertainment System™, Nintendo has sold billions of video games and hundreds of millions of hardware units globally, including Nintendo Switch and the Nintendo 3DS family of systems, as well as the Game Boy™, Game Boy Advance, Nintendo DS™ family of systems, Super NES™, Nintendo 64™, Nintendo GameCube™, Wii™, and Wii U™ systems. It has also created industry icons that have become well-known, household names, such as Mario, Donkey Kong, Metroid, Zelda and Pokémon. A wholly owned subsidiary, Nintendo of America Inc., based in Redmond, Wash., serves as headquarters for Nintendo’s operations in the Americas. For more information about Nintendo, please visit the company’s website at http://www.nintendo.com .

Nintendo is an equal opportunity employer. We offer a welcoming and inclusive environment in service to one another, our products, the diverse consumers we represent, and the communities we call home. We do all of this with kindness, empathy and respect for each other.
DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES:
Leverages strong marketing and industry knowledge to support the Strategic Initiatives (SI) partner marketing team.
Ideates, advocates for, and supports the execution of licensed partner marketing opportunities that deliver meaningful consumer engagement and sell-through
Partners closely with Partner Marketing leadership and internal / external stakeholders to facilitate the development and execution of marketing campaigns for licensed partner products through regular interaction with cross-functional internal and external stakeholders and executional leads
Provides recommendations on how to optimize the use of SI marketing resources to deliver on SI business goals
Works closely with partners to document and communicate their marketing strategy—including overall marketing priorities, key product messaging, and target audiences—and help optimize their plans
Evaluates effectiveness of marketing investments in driving incremental demand, and adjusts plans accordingly to continuously improve ROI
Acts as point of contact between external partners, Nintendo internal departments, and NOA SI for all partner marketing-related matters
Supports integration into internal initiatives generated by NOA Sales and Marketing teams that involve partner content
Supports licensed partners in all marketing, advertising and promotional activities, including identifying integration opportunities
Briefs NOA Sales and Marketing teams on priority products, strategy, and initiatives in a timely and productive manner, including the development of assets and game documentation
Analyzes and understands market, consumer, retailer and industry trends
Drive the management, approval, and execution of partner product integration into Nintendo marketing programs including experiential tactics, PR programs, advertising, retail marketing, live services, CRM, etc., in partnership with leadership
Actively collaborates with Marketing team in proactive and ongoing development of various media plans
Works closely with external partners to document and communicate marketing strategy, including overall marketing priorities, key product messaging, and targeted audiences
Drives collaboration with external partners and internal teams to ensure effective execution across all operations, logistics, legal, staffing, product training, digital, aspects of the program
Delivers ongoing communication to key external and internal stakeholders on marketing activity including development and distribution of status reports, recaps, analysis and other materials
Performs post-program reporting, ROI and PDCA activities
Coordinates product demonstration plans in accordance with key messages and strategy
Reviews and helps optimize external partner marketing strategy and plans
Works closely, effectively, and in cooperation with Licensee partners and internal support staff in reviewing assets, marketing materials, PR and advertising print assets, and digital marketing creative
Reviews marketing materials for accuracy and consistency with established key messaging and strategy
Acts as the secondary marketing representative of SI with internal NOA stakeholders
Oversees partner inclusion in NOA events and trade shows as needed
Supports partner with interactive and resource needs for their own trade/media events
Presents SI priorities to other internal NOA departments
Helps the manager to update and track partner marketing budget and spend
Up to 15% travel

SUMMARY OF REQUIREMENTS:
Five+ years of marketing or related experience in the video game industry or other consumer products
Prior experience leading projects or initiatives
Thorough understanding and experience with most aspects of marketing and communications
Familiarity with licensing structure or previous relations with licensees preferred
Experience working with digital content developers preferred
Familiarity of Nintendo franchise characters and IP
Undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Marketing, a related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience

Applicants must be legally eligible to work in the United States to be considered. Visa sponsorship is not available for this role
This position is hybrid in Redmond, WA. Hybrid positions require regular onsite work following the schedule and guidelines for their division. This position is not open to fully remote status at this time.

This position includes a base salary range of $74,976 - $112,464 annually, potential for a semi-annual discretionary performance bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), and paid time off. Please see our Benefits & Perks page for more benefits information.
#LI-Hybrid

title: Product Marketing Lead, Email & Push
description:
Our mission at Duolingo is to develop the best education in the world and make it universally available. But we've got more left to do — and that's where you come in!
Duolingo is the world's most popular learning app. Beyond our core learning product, we also offer English proficiency testing with the Duolingo English Test, and are bringing new subjects into the Duolingo app, where people can develop their Math and Music skills.
We are passionate about educating our users, making fact-based decisions, and finding innovative solutions to complex problems. We offer meaningful work, limitless learning opportunities, and collaboration with world-class minds. Come brighten your life and over half a billion more!

Delivering creative newsletters and push messages that reflect our brand and product
Partner with our Product teams to improve the effectiveness of lifecycle communications
You Will...
Be the channel expert and own email strategy and campaign execution to help achieve individual marketing team goals
Create, implement, analyze and report on strategies (audience segments, workflows, experiments) to continuously improve performance to business KPIs
Implement and execute a monthly marketing newsletter calendar in support of product launches and other team objectives
Work with our Onboarding, Retention, and Reengagement teams to optimize our triggered flows by coming up with ideas and running experiments
Requirements:
5+ years of email marketing and email operations experience in consumer tech
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills; ability to prioritize and complete multiple concurrent and time-sensitive requests
Experience working closely with marketing, product, design, and engineering colleagues
Proven track record of successfully developing and implementing creative, high-impact email campaigns
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a strong attention to detail
Experiment-first mentality; ample experience with A/B testing and email optimization
Strong subject matter expertise, including base-level knowledge of deliverability; comfortable advocating for the long term vision of an email program
Proficient in responsive HTML and CSS coding
Comfortable working with data and digging into numbers; deep understanding of email KPIs, metrics, and reporting with ability to translate into concrete insights
A love for outside of the box thinking; a creative approach to email content and problem solving
Exceptional Candidates Will Have...
background in copywriting and content creation
Expert HTML and CSS coding knowledge
Experience carrying out campaigns in home-grown email platforms
We invest in and support our Duos! This role is eligible for a robust compensation package of base salary, equity, and Duolingo's world-class benefits. title: Foundation Marketing Specialist, Foundation Administration
description:
Baptist Health South Florida is the largest healthcare organization in the region, with 12 hospitals, more than 24,000 employees, 4,000 physicians and 100 outpatient centers, urgent care facilities and physician practices spanning across Miami-Dade, Monroe, Broward and Palm Beach counties. Baptist Health has internationally renowned centers of excellence in cancer, cardiovascular care, orthopedics and sports medicine, and neurosciences. A not-for-profit organization supported by philanthropy and committed to its faith-based charitable mission of medical excellence, Baptist Health has been recognized by Fortune as one of the 100 Best Companies to Work For in America and by Ethisphere as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies.
Everything we do at Baptist Health, we do to the best of our ability. That includes supporting our team with extensive training programs, millions of dollars in tuition assistance, comprehensive benefits and more. Working within our award-winning culture means getting the respect and support you need to do your best work ever. Find out why we’re all in for helping you be your best.
Description:

Coordinates and assists in all marketing and communications efforts, including comprehensive marketing campaigns, traffic requests, media relations, collateral production and campaign deployment. Manages marketing campaigns deliverables, reports and performance as well as brand activation for events and other projects. Provides support for Marketing Strategies leadership. Liaisons with Foundation leadership, media agencies and donors. Excellent communications skills required and must work independently with little supervision in addition to working effectively in a team environment. Regularly exercises judgement, discretion, and consultative decision-making skills. Estimated salary range for this position is $54322.45 - $70619.19 / year depending on experience.
Qualifications:

Degrees: Bachelors Additional Qualifications: Bachelor‘s degree, preferably in public relations, communications, marketing or journalism. Must be detail oriented and have the ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously, with daily deadlines. A minimum of three to five years experience in a marketing environment, preferably in healthcare. Creative, video production and graphic design skills preferred. Strong project management skills required. Proficient in Microsoft Office product, such as Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Knowledge of Raiser‘s Edge a plus.

EOE

title: US Copywriter
description:
Hey! We’re Huel and we’re pleased to meet you! We're going to start by talking about our exciting new US Copywriter position, but if you'd like the quick low down on us first including our growth story then just head to the bottom of this page!
The role
Here at huel, we are really proud of the brand and reputation and attribute a big part of our success and growth to our Marketing team as they play a pivotal role in building our global group of Hueligan’s! So, to help continue our US growth, we are seeking a creative and talented Copywriter to join our US marketing team.
Here is an insight in to your day to day:

Contribute to brainstorming and creative brief development; copywriters are a critical part of ideation and not just an arm of creative execution
Simplify the science of Huel, the product stories for each, in a consumer-friendly manner—inviting, compelling, never alienating or overly-complicated
Fashion breakthrough copy, infusing ideas with personality and creativity, contrasting and penetrating in a crowded digital landscape
Conceive, influence, and execute DTC growth creative to elevate US business
Partner with creative resources internal and external to create compelling copy, engaging, and on-brand across channels (paid social, site, landing pages, CRM, printed pieces, etc)
Support new product launches and omni-channel marketing campaigns through a marriage of messaging + audience, for the appropriate stage in the consumer journey
Partner with Copy and Design teams in the UK to concept and pitch global ideas, with a bias and a nudge for bold execution—be daring and let’s find the line together
Challenge and elevate the work of creatives and copywriters across the Huel landscape to create a better creative product and a superior customer experience
Re-craft, refine, and maintain localized brand voice and tone to be used across US assets ️
Edit & proof work to ensure tone, style, and brand consistency are met across all content
Not yet convinced it's the role for you? Well, then you can click HERE to read a more detailed job description and learn about the team!

What we're looking for in you
This role is best suited to a copywriting WIZARD . You will be Huel's go to in the creative hub and have an intimate understanding of our audience—needs, motivations, and aspirations. Communication is key for the role , you will also have strong ability to present complex ideas to mixed-level audiences (from execution teams to c-suite executives) Finally, you will have experience in DTC and/or subscription businesses with outstanding writing skills and the ability to write in a range of styles and perspectives
What do we offer in return?
We have a high-performance culture which is balanced evenly with world-class well-being initiatives and benefits that are tastier than our Salted Caramel Black Edition (and trust us, that’s saying something!)
A competitive salary range of $75,000-$80,000 per annum depending on your skills and experience
Flexible working - including up to 2 days per week at home
30 Paid Vacation Days PLUS Federal Holidays
Free Huel to keep you going
️ 2 weeks a year to work remotely from anywhere! One week in the Summer and one week at Christmas
401K Plan
Commuter Benefits
Paid Volunteering Days
Enhanced Family Leave
Dog friendly. The fluffier the better!
️ Monthly gym membership contribution plus we will also give you your own nutrition plan!
Free 1-on-1 therapy provided by BetterHelp
Private Medical and Health insurance for you, including free life insurance
Huel Academy
Quarterly events to celebrate success - Have you heard about Huelchella?
So what next?
If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, then we’d love to hear from you! Click on apply to this job to send us your CV and cover letter and Ellie from our talent team will be in touch with you.

We are Hueligans
We're all made up of our Huel DNA, but what makes us unique is our individual differences. We've created a culture of belonging and we celebrate the diversity our Hueligans add to our teams. We encourage authenticity, different views, and new ideas to enable us to create products that our customers around the world enjoy and love. Read more about our culture here.

title: Copywriter
description:
Gong transforms revenue organizations by harnessing customer interactions to increase business efficiency, improve decision-making and accelerate revenue growth. The Revenue Intelligence Platform uses proprietary artificial intelligence technology to enable teams to capture, understand and act on all customer interactions in a single, integrated platform. More than 4,000 companies around the world rely on Gong to support their go-to-market strategies and grow revenue efficiently. For more information, visit www.gong.io.
Gong is looking for an exceptional copywriter to join our growing Content team. In this role, you’ll be responsible for developing compelling content that helps to attract, educate, and convert revenue leaders – all while upholding the Gong brand narrative and voice. You will work cross-functionally to bring content to life, interpreting briefs and product messaging frameworks to produce long-form guides, thought leadership, blog posts, customer case studies, social, emails, web copy, ad copy, and more. You are an expert writer who can translate messaging into headlines and stories that captivate readers.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Write, write, write! You’ll create content across a variety of platforms and formats, from blog posts and guides to social media and landing pages
Know revenue leaders and sellers alike in order to develop compelling copy (without buzzy business jargon) to successfully engage those personas at different stages of the customer lifecycle
Understand the critical role copy plays in campaigns, acting as a key custodian of the Gong brand narrative to generate awareness and engagement
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to interpret direction and feedback in order to execute projects successfully
Manage multiple projects and timelines to deliver quality content on time
QUALIFICATIONS
4+ years of proven copywriting experience and results with preferred experience in the revenue technology industry
A robust portfolio showcasing strong branded content across formats and channels
Exceptional writing, editorial, and communication skills – you know when to amp up tone but never sacrifice core voice
Innovator who isn’t afraid to challenge conventional wisdom and take risks with copy approaches
Passion for writing about technology innovation and distilling complex concepts into engaging content
Strong collaborator who is easy to work with across teams
Self-starter with the ability to work independently, prioritize, and get things done
Comfortable with making data-backed decisions to improve content development
Seasoned knowledge and appetite to learn emerging copywriting tactics, SEO best practices, and AI copywriting technology
PERKS & BENEFITS
We offer Gongsters a variety of medical, dental, and vision plans, designed to fit you and your family’s needs.
Wellbeing Fund - flexible wellness stipend to support a healthy lifestyle.
Mental Health benefits with covered therapy and coaching.
401(k) program to help you invest in your future.
Education & learning stipend for personal growth and development.
Flexible vacation time to promote a healthy work-life blend.
Paid parental leave to support you and your family.
Company-wide recharge days each quarter.
Work from home stipend to help you succeed in a remote environment.
The annual salary hiring range for this position is $106,000 - $125,000 USD.
Compensation is based on factors unique to each candidate, including, but not limited to, job-related skills, qualification, education, experience, and location. At Gong, we have a location-based compensation structure, which means there may be a different range for candidates in other locations. The total compensation package for this position, in addition to base compensation, may include incentive compensation, bonus, equity, and benefits. Some of our sales compensation programs also offer the potential to achieve above targeted earnings for those who exceed their sales targets.
We are always looking for outstanding Gongsters! So if this sounds like something that interests you regardless of compensation, please reach out. We may have more roles for you to consider and would love to connect.
Gong is an equal-opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, military status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.
To review Gong's privacy policy, visit https://www.gong.io/gong-io-job-candidates-privacy-notice/ for more details.

title: Copywriter
description:
Ref #:
W143603
Department:
Communications & Corporate Affairs
City:
New York
State/Province:
New York
Country:
United States
Pay Range: The pay range for this job is $62500 - $146000 annually; actual pay is dependent on experience and geographic location.
Benefits: Base pay is only one part of our employee value proposition, which includes a robust benefits package, above-market time off, flexible working arrangements, incentive compensation, where applicable, and varied learning opportunities.
Pay Range Max
146000
Pay Range Min
62500
Company Description
Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in five categories: apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands.

At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.
Position Overview
The Copywriter, Digital role is responsible for developing engaging, informative, and brand appropriate content strategies and copy to elevate the customer experience (CX) across Ralph Lauren digital globally. They will work with the product/platform development, information technology, customer experience, content marketing, and digital creative teams to develop content and write copy for digital products, such as Ralph Lauren.com and the Ralph Lauren App. As functionalities and information evolves across regions, they will be responsible for refining and developing CX messaging. The Copywriter, Digital will also lead copy for customer-focused brand initiatives, including hospitality, gifting, and stores. When needed, they will support the digital copy team on the seasonal brand campaigns and special projects workstreams. They will be responsible for concepting content strategies and writing copy for each campaign across all digital platforms—site, email, social, and other digital marketing channels—in partnership with digital design and content marketing teams.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Write engaging, informative, and brand-appropriate CX copy for Ralph Lauren’s digital products globally, including but not limited to RalphLauren.com and the Ralph Lauren App
Establish efficient end-to-end copy processes and workflows with cross-functional CX teams
Advocate for copy best practices while balancing business demands and design/platform capabilities
Adapt CX copy and content as region-specific information and functionalities evolve
Lead customer-focused brand initiatives, including but not limited to Hospitality, Gifting, and Stores
Support the digital copy team on seasonal brand campaigns and special projects where needed
Partner with content marketing, brand creative, and digital design to develop content strategies and optimal messaging to drive global business in line with the global corporate strategy
Write and edit copy for campaigns and special projects across site, email, social, and digital marketing
Partner with digital marketing and digital design teams to bring these strategies to life across digital creative
Present copy in internal reviews and meetings with senior leadership, assuming responsibility that feedback is absorbed and actioned upon
Partner with brand copy and product copy teams when needed to ensure consistent messaging
Use the latest performance metrics and testing to inform content and copy strategy and execution

Experience, Skills & Knowledge
Past experience working in and establishing CX workflows in fashion or retail ecommerce is a must
Past experience writing digital advertising campaigns is a must
Excellent communication, organizational and problem-solving skills, plus the ability to function within deadlines, while working both independently and as part of a team
Strong conceptual skills with knowledge of how copy relates to a customer’s experience and digital designs is highly desirable
Ability to represent Ralph Lauren Agency in meetings with stakeholders from across the company
A personal passion for digital luxury and fashion retail
Computer literate, proficiency with standard suite of digital software and social media
Ad Agency experience a plus

Ralph Lauren will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance laws.

title: Associate
description:
Remote
Full Time
Entry Level

Overview
Looking for a way to get practical experience in public relations or communications? The Associate role is a great way to get an introduction to the demands and opportunities of agency life. You’ll be responsible for a number of reporting projects, working closely with our account teams to track coverage, conduct research, and deliver reports. In addition to your regular tasks, there will be opportunities to begin to learn the ropes of media relations and account strategy as you get familiar with your teams, setting the foundation for your career in public relations or communication. Whether you’re working with us over the summer or part-time after classes, you’ll be a vital member of our team, and we’ll rely on you to perform at a high level and learn a whole lot at the same time (making coffee and photocopies is not part of the job). The Associate role is a paid contract position and is temporary, with potential for full-time hire.

Responsibilities:
Learn and understand how to compose basic formats of PR writing: from press releases to blog posts to social media. Gain exposure and practice to the development of team materials, and an opportunity to improve writing skills.
Contribute meaningful ideas and perspectives to agency conversations and brainstorms, thinking outside the box and drawing on trends to reach target audiences.
Display an ability to individually solve common problems associated with everyday tasks.
A media hound who is up-to-date on current events and news, knowledgeable of trends and can identify outlets and reporters.
Be a reliable communicator, always at the ready to take direction, raise a hand, or ask a question. Be open to feedback and constructive edits, improving with each draft and never making the same mistake twice. Willingness to take criticism and editing constructively.
Displays strong potential in the ability to communicate with team members and seamlessly collaborates with the team in a remote setting.
Manages daily tasks and prioritizes assignments to meet deadlines.
Passionate about video games and the media business, with an ability to convey it strongly to agency peers and leaders.
An interest in learning about public relations, communications, or the gaming industry. No previous PR experience or specific educational background necessary.
Conduct media audits and research to drive new business intelligence.

Compensation: $20/hour

title: Consumer & Market Insights Analyst
description:
AT A GLANCE
Join RVO Health, where insights drive value and innovation! We're looking for a dynamic and proactive Analyst to join our Consumer and Market Insights team. As an integral member, you'll execute research initiatives across diverse business verticals within our extensive portfolio. Harnessing the power of various data platforms, you'll uncover invaluable insights, track project progress, create compelling surveys, generate insightful reports, and develop storytelling through data interpretation.
At RVO Health, you'll dive deep into syndicated and secondary data tools, unlocking meaningful insights into our audiences, clients' brands, and the dynamic markets we support. In addition, this role presents a prime opportunity to develop your primary market research skills and drive your professional growth.
Collaborating with top-tier health advertisers and digital agencies, you'll be at the forefront of our journey towards continued success and rapid expansion. Embrace this exceptional opportunity to join a thriving team within a leading health consumer and media organization.
Where You'll Be
To prioritize togetherness, culture, and accountability, RVO Health operates on a hybrid in-office work schedule. We expect employees to work from our South Charlotte office Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday each week. You are welcome to work remotely Mondays and Fridays if you wish.
1101 Red Ventures Dr Fort Mill, SC 29707
What You'll Do
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders to understand, refine, and deliver on project objectives
Employ data-driven insights to strategically position our audiences for business opportunities utilizing various resources and survey tools, including Comscore, Google Analytics, MRI, Qualtrics, Vivvix, and more
Ensure timely delivery of internal insights and market research reports, maintaining clear communication with internal teams regarding project timelines and progress
Provide invaluable support to team members across various research execution tasks, from media plan review to survey testing, data analysis, and report creation
With supervision and coaching, you will be responsible for playing an integral role in overall project quality by monitoring of sample/data while providing updates to internal team
What We're Looking For
Bachelor's degree (Market Research, Psychology, Marketing, Statistics or Social Sciences preferred) or equivalent experience
Minimum one year of consumer/market research experience or college coursework equivalent
Familiarity with digital media or health/pharma industry
Knowledge of statistical software (SPSS, SAS etc.) or Tableau a plus
Strong computer skills: Excel, PowerPoint, Word, or Google Equivalent
Excellent analytical and organization skills, coupled with an attention to detail and accuracy
A resourceful, nimble self-starter, ready to jump in and contribute wherever necessary
A positive, can-do attitude that fosters collaboration and teamwork
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to effectively manage multiple tasks concurrently, delivering results in a timely manner.
If you're ready to embark on an exciting opportunity where insights drive meaningful impact, join us at RVO Health!

Pursuant to various state Fair Pay Acts, below is a summary of compensation elements for this role at the company. The following benefits are provided by RVO Health, subject to eligibility requirements.
Starting Salary: $64,000 - $78,000
Note actual salary is based on geographic location, qualifications and experience
Access to a Free Udemy for Business subscription—thousands of hours of learning content on hundreds of different subjects at your fingertips
Health Insurance Coverage (medical, dental, and vision)
Life Insurance
Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts
Paid Time Off
Holiday Pay
401(k) with match
Employee Assistance Program
Paid Parental Bonding Benefit Program
Who We Are:
Founded in 2022, RVO Health is a new healthcare platform of digital media brands, services and technologies focused on building relationships with people throughout their health & wellness journey. We meet people where they are in their personal health journeys and connect them with both the information and the care they need. RVO Health was created by joining teams from both Red Ventures and UnitedHealth Group's Optum Health. Together we're focused on delivering on our vision of a stronger and healthier world.
RVO Health is comprised of Healthline Media (Healthline, Medical News Today, Psych Central, Greatist and Bezzy), Healthgrades, FindCare and PlateJoy; Optum Perks, Optum Store and the virtual coaching platforms Real Appeal, Wellness Coaching, and QuitForLife.
We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage, employee assistance program, 401(k) plan and a paid parental leave program.
RVO Health is an equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, creed, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy or any other basis protected by law. Employment at RVO Health is based solely on a person's merit and qualifications.
We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities to qualified individuals with disabilities. This includes providing reasonable accommodation where appropriate. Should you require a reasonable accommodation to apply or participate in the job application or interview process, please contact accommodations@rvohealth.com.
We do not provide visa sponsorship for this role at this time.
RVO Health Privacy Policy: https://rvohealth.com/legal/privacy

title: Marketing Social Media Associate
description:
Work is Sweet!

'Quality without Compromise' is not just a motto at See's Candies. It is the most important ingredient in our recipe for success. See's Candies has been in business since 1921 and maintains a reputation for producing the highest quality candy and providing superior customer service.
See's is a leader in the confectionary industry with over 250 retail shops across the USA. We are seeking friendly, enthusiastic individuals who are passionate about providing great customer service.
Job Description Summary:
Effectively represent the See’s Brand and communicate with existing and potential customers through See’s social media platforms. Leverage creative, strategic and analytical skills to solve seasonal and ongoing business challenges through social media. Grow audience and engagement numbers through community and content engagement is the key focus of this role. The Social Media Engagement Marketing Associate is a self-starter who is passionate about social media and creating sweet social content that builds strong relationships with See’s customers.

The pay range for this position is expected to be $75k-$90k annually however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Job Description:
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. Co-own social media content calendar from ideation to execution with input from Marketing Manager.
2. Use social listening and publishing tools to publish content, identify influencers and opportunities, monitor and engage in conversation and manage assets as well as other content.
3. Strengthen relationship with our online community by responding promptly to questions and comments as the See’s brand, using proper tone and voice across all social media channels and in social direct messages.
4. Work with Customer Care team as needed in relation to customer service-related engagements on social channels. Requires occasional weekend responsibilities during key time periods.
5. Drive community growth and engagement across all channels with relevant hashtags, alignment to trends and interests of the audience.
6. Attend and capture content during specific production runs at factories, onsite events (to include shop Grand Openings, etc.), and any other major See’s Events / Activations.
7. Internal leader of social creative best practices.
8. Research and identify new technology and innovation appropriate for See’s in the ever-evolving digital trends on Facebook, X, Instagram, Pinterest, TikTok and any emerging platforms.
9. Make strategic recommendations to pivot campaigns as needed.
10. Track analytics to establish key success patterns and target demographics.
11. Prepare reports that detail key metrics and make recommendations on strategy pivots based on findings.
12. Assists team with influencer strategy and cultivation.
13. Seek out and coordinate celebrity gifting opportunities.
14. Embrace and express See’s company and brand values.
15. Performs special projects as assigned by management.
16. Responsible for identifying opportunities to enhance technology and innovation that will improve departmental effectiveness.
17. All See’s staff must be committed to the company’s core principles and workplace values, including diversity and inclusion.
CORE CAPABILITIES:
1. Exceptional verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
2. Master of social media best practices
3. Be a strong storyteller with a creative eye for aesthetics
4. Self-starter and resourceful problem-solver
5. Social media curiosity and an affinity for popular culture and content
6. Have a passion for food (sweet tooth helps)
7. Basic understanding of social media analytics
8. Strong customer-facing communication
9. Ability to thrive in a fast paced, always-on social media environment while being detail-oriented
10. Project management
11. Ability to make effective and efficient time management decisions
12. Prepare and assess success of programs against Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
1. Three years of hands-on B2C social media community management experience.
2. Sprout Social, Canva, Google Analytics and Curalate experience a plus.
3. Strong analytic and problem-solving skills; detail-oriented mind-set. Ability to manage multiple projects and priorities.
4. Bachelor degree in Marketing or related field required; equivalent related work experience may be considered in lieu of degree.
5. Proven ability to learn new technologies quickly and manage change efficiently, proactively and in a positive manner.
The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, in addition to a full range of generous medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as vacation, sick time, and parental leave), dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.
See's is an EOE
See’s will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable local, state or federal law (including San Francisco Ordinance #131192 and Los Angeles Municipal Code 189.00).

title: Strategist, Display
description:
Who we are:
Tinuiti is the largest independent performance marketing firm across Streaming TV, Google, Meta, and Amazon, with almost $4 billion in digital media under management and over 1,200 employees. With industry-leading expertise in search, social, Amazon and marketplaces, addressable TV, mobile apps, Influencer, Lifecycle, and more, Tinuiti understands that success requires both strategy and channel expertise. Our goal when we come to work every day is simple - to grow happiness. For our clients, their customers, our people and our partners. Growing happiness guides everything we do and our core values - Unleash Greatness, Never Stop Learning, Ignite Your Passion, Thankful Living, and Inspire Innovation & Change - inspire us to maintain a culture where our people take pride in their work and have fun doing it.
We support 100% remote work for applicants who reside in the United States.
What you’ll be doing:
Working in conjunction to provide strategic media plans, holistic recommendations and top quality services to multiple of small-medium sized Tinuiti clients
Responsible for assisting Senior Manager day-to-day planning, execution, optimization, and project management of digital media plans
Supporting and training junior team members on managing campaigns within DSPs
Assist in preparing & auditing all client facing reporting
Learn & gather information on industry trends & competitive reporting
Nurture & maintain strong relationships with clients
Work closely with Cross Channel Account Managers, Paid Search to Paid Social, to create cohesive recommendations and holistic digital performance results
Assist VP of Display and Business Development team in planning of new business or RFPs.
We’d love to hear from you if:
Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you qualify, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.
Requirements:
5+ years of digital media planning & buying experience with a focus on direct response marketing goals
3-5 years of hands-on-keyboard experience in a demand-side-platform such as but not limited to The Trade Desk
Interest in being a part of a dynamic division with hands on approach to all phases of the media process
Experienced with DSPs, Networks and Site Direct Buys
Experience managing campaigns with GDN
Proficient PowerPoint and Excel skills a must
High level of comfort with quantitative concepts and solid understanding of incrementality testing, in-channel and cross-channel measurement solutions and best practices (ex: MMM, ghost bidding, conversion lift)
Preferred:
Working knowledge of ad serving tools and reporting such as with Google stack is desired
Working knowledge of CRM onboarding tools such as LiveRamp and third party ad servers like Flashtalking
FLSA Classification: Exempt
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Benefits:
At Tinuiti, we want to ensure you have the time you need to rest and recharge. That's why Tinuitians have an estimated 70 days off per year through our time off programs
Unlimited PTO: We encourage all Tinutians to Own their Offline by utilizing our unlimited PTO by working with your Manager to ensure all deliverables are met.
Holidays: We offer 17 paid holidays, if one of your religious holidays is not covered, please by all means take advantage of your Flex PTO!
Flex Fridays: Meetings are minimized and all Tinuitians have the option to start their weekend early at 1pm local time.
Owning Our Offline: Clients are informed and all offices will be closed for 3 total weeks throughout the year to give everyone the chance to truly unplug.
Healthcare: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & Disability, Flex Spending Accounts
Retirement: Match up to 4% of your contributions at 100% with immediate vesting
Perks and Wellness: Fringe, Forma, Thankful giving, Equity
Learning and Development: Mentor program and more
Merit Based:
The annual base salary range for this role’s listed level is currently $80,000 - $90,000. We also offer an incentive pay based on revenue managed (no cap) Grade level and salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. We will provide more information on our benefits and equity upon requests. Disclosure as required by the Colorado Equal Pay for > Equal Work Act, C.R.S. § 8-5-101 et seq.
Disclaimer: This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may vary based on assignment or group. Tinuiti is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.
#LI-Remote

title: Digital Editor/Writer - PR and Marketing
description:
The Digital Editor/Writer is responsible for strategically directing, creating and editing digital content for the Keck Medicine of USC's clinical audiences. This content consists of service overviews, treatment summaries, disease overviews, online ad campaigns and pages, email, search copy and other user-engaged copy. Because our primary focus is marketing, the applicant should be an expert at translating technical details into language that can be easily consumed by patients and visitors. The successful candidate will coordinate day-to-day posting of approved content, develop and maintain audit calendars, communicate progress reports to stakeholders and directors, supervise writers, ensure sites meet usability and Section 508 requirements and validate that all new content is in compliance with legal and branding regulations for the Keck Medicine enterprise.
Essential Duties:
Identifies, analyzes, evaluates, measures and validates the impact of content choices and edits across websites and blogs.
Can create content from reseach (trending topics and search demand) through publications and distribution (adapt for various placements – web, social, email, search).
Leads the resolution of web-based content and strategic issues by applying technical expertise to ensure project requirements are met. Develop and articulate content strategy that reaches social media and other content marketing goals to stakeholders and management.
Responsible for reviewing staff writing for writing and participating in content assignments as it relates to the website content strategy.
Responsible that websites meet usability and Section 508 requirements and validate that all new content is in compliance with legal and branding regulations for the Keck Medicine of USC enterprise.
Responsible for generating reports, audit calendars, image selection and image sourcing.
Measure and validate the impact of content edits and choices across all websites through techniques such as Google analytics and other industry tools.
Executes other duties as assigned or requested. The organization reserves the right to add or change duties at any time.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree Journalism or Marketing, or other related area of study
3 years writing and editing for print publications and/or websites
Understanding of AP writing style. Ability to lead content interviews with clients to gain information for web content.
Excellent organizational skills and a keen eye for detail
Strong work ethic and ability to produce a high output of content
Ability to write quickly, clearly, and concisely for a variety of digital channels – web, social, search, ads
Understanding of basic digital writing principles
Understanding of SEO standard methodologies and principles
Experience using keyword research tools and Google Analytics
Experience with content management systems to update content with a basic understanding of HTML
Preferred Qualifications:
Master's degree
Experience with writing Web content and/or experience in healthcare setting.
Required Licenses/Certifications:
Fire Life Safety Training (LA City) If no card upon hire, one must be obtained within 30 days of hire and maintained by renewal before expiration date. (Required within LA City only)

The hourly rate range for this position is $29.00 - $45.20. When extending an offer of employment, the University of Southern California considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate’s work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, federal, state, and local laws, contractual stipulations, grant funding, as well as external market and organizational considerations.

title: Sr. Analyst - Marketing Channel Innovation
description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.
At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.
Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.
The U.S. Consumer Services Team is responsible for our suite of consumer products, services, and experiences in the U.S., including our premium, cobrand, cash back, and lending portfolios, Membership Rewards, Global Travel & Lifestyle Services, the Centurion Lounge network, our Global Dining and Resy businesses, U.S. Consumer Banking, and best-in-class marketing programs across customer, prospect, and partner channels. The USCS team is focused on making membership an indisputable competitive advantage and helping each other become better leaders every day.
The U.S. Consumer Marketing team (USCM) is part of the US Consumer Services Group and is responsible for making membership essential by creating and delivering world class marketing for our differentiated products and services that drives demand and inspires engaged card members across the customer lifecycle.
The Digital Demand Generation team, within USCM, is responsible for delivering best-in-class marketing through Paid Media, Affiliate, and our proprietary platforms to drive intent & conversion of qualified applicants in the competitive digital landscape.
The Sr. Analyst of Innovation will help to manage and incubate emerging channels, with the goal to find new marketing distribution opportunities to help drive prospect reach and conversion for our U.S. Consumer products. This is a great opportunity to strengthen digital marketing skills and gain external partner management experience.
In this role you will:
Execute end-to-end channel management processes, including creative development, user experience insights, and go-to-market enablement.
Plan & implement marketing programs with a business development lens. This includes managing external agencies, owning end-to-end campaign implementation, and using data and analytics to communicate overall program effectiveness.
Support the day-to-day external partner management and seek growth opportunities to drive value to the partnership.
Build strong and collaborative relationships with key business partners including lines of business, Legal, Compliance, Technology, Finance, and Operations.
Requirements
Highly motivated individual with a positive attitude
Strong project management, and organizational skills with an attention to detail to ensure end-to-end flawless execution
Ability to manage multiple projects at once, operate autonomously, and prioritize effectively
Self-starter with demonstrated ability to work through ambiguity and white space
Passion for performance and digital marketing
Strong cross-functional collaborator, with an ability to navigate the organization and processes independently
Strong relationship building skills with the ability to interact and influence both internal and external partners
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Motivation and excitement to be an active member of a high-profile, results-oriented and fun, fast-paced team
3+ years of marketing experience preferred
Salary Range: $55,000.00 to $105,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:
Competitive base salaries
Bonus incentives
6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
Flexible working model with hybrid, onsite or virtual arrangements depending on role and business need
20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
Career development and training opportunities
Access to Amex Marketing U, a unique learning and development program built for marketers, by marketers. Amex Marketing U inspires marketers to develop their career through flexible and adaptable learning experiences and opportunities which foster collaboration and knowledge sharing across the enterprise.
For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.
US Job Seekers/Employees - Click here to view the “Know Your Rights” poster and the Pay Transparency Policy Statement.
If the links do not work, please copy and paste the following URLs in a new browser window: https://www.dol.gov/agencies/ofccp/posters to access the three posters.
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

title: Internal Communications Associate
description:
Join our Professional Services team in New York
The D. E. Shaw group seeks a talented individual to join its Internal Communications team. This role offers a unique opportunity to help develop and execute internal communications strategy for one of the world’s leading investment and technology firms. The role will involve a wide range of strategic projects, including writing and editing firmwide communications; working with executives on speeches, videos, and other media; and improving knowledge sharing and connectivity across the firm. The person in this role will gain insight into the firm’s businesses and operations, as well as significant opportunities for professional growth, in an inclusive and collegial working environment.
News
Library
Contact
What you’ll do day-to-day
You’ll be involved in developing internal communications strategies and programs designed to support the firm’s goals. You’ll work closely with colleagues across the firm, including the firm’s leadership, to draft key business updates and strategic campaigns. You’ll help edit and improve communications, including firmwide announcements, blog posts, live events, and videos, clearly relaying complex information to various audiences with precision and rigor. You’ll work with a team responsible for drafting, editing, and delivering a wide variety of content, from market analysis to news on happenings around the firm.
Who we’re looking for
Candidates should have a bachelor’s degree, a demonstrated record of achievement, and three to five years of professional writing and/or editorial experience.
Well-developed written and verbal communication skills are required, as is an ability to work effectively with colleagues both within and outside the team.
Keen attention to detail, sound judgment, and a high level of discretion are essential for this role.
Finance experience is a plus but not required; candidates must be able to communicate complex information to a range of audiences.
The expected annual base salary for this position is $100,000 to $150,000. Our compensation and benefits package includes variable compensation in the form of a year-end bonus, guaranteed in the first year of hire, a relocation bonus, and benefits including medical and prescription drug coverage, 401k contribution matching, wellness reimbursement, family building benefits, and a charitable gift match program.
At the D. E. Shaw group, we believe the diversity of our employees is core to our strength and success. We are committed to supporting our people in work and in life, which is why we offer benefits such as a family planning and surrogacy program and a charitable gift match to all full-time employees.
Additionally, our staff-led affinity groups are pillars of our community, helping to celebrate diversity, promote leadership and development opportunities, and facilitate inclusive mentorship. Members and allies organize a wide range of educational and social programming, from expert talks to film festivals.

title: US Copywriter
description:
Hey! We’re Huel and we’re pleased to meet you! We're going to start by talking about our exciting new US Copywriter position, but if you'd like the quick low down on us first including our growth story then just head to the bottom of this page!
The role
Here at huel, we are really proud of the brand and reputation and attribute a big part of our success and growth to our Marketing team as they play a pivotal role in building our global group of Hueligan’s! So, to help continue our US growth, we are seeking a creative and talented Copywriter to join our US marketing team.
Here is an insight in to your day to day:

Contribute to brainstorming and creative brief development; copywriters are a critical part of ideation and not just an arm of creative execution
Simplify the science of Huel, the product stories for each, in a consumer-friendly manner—inviting, compelling, never alienating or overly-complicated
Fashion breakthrough copy, infusing ideas with personality and creativity, contrasting and penetrating in a crowded digital landscape
Conceive, influence, and execute DTC growth creative to elevate US business
Partner with creative resources internal and external to create compelling copy, engaging, and on-brand across channels (paid social, site, landing pages, CRM, printed pieces, etc)
Support new product launches and omni-channel marketing campaigns through a marriage of messaging + audience, for the appropriate stage in the consumer journey
Partner with Copy and Design teams in the UK to concept and pitch global ideas, with a bias and a nudge for bold execution—be daring and let’s find the line together
Challenge and elevate the work of creatives and copywriters across the Huel landscape to create a better creative product and a superior customer experience
Re-craft, refine, and maintain localized brand voice and tone to be used across US assets ️
Edit & proof work to ensure tone, style, and brand consistency are met across all content
Not yet convinced it's the role for you? Well, then you can click HERE to read a more detailed job description and learn about the team!

What we're looking for in you
This role is best suited to a copywriting WIZARD . You will be Huel's go to in the creative hub and have an intimate understanding of our audience—needs, motivations, and aspirations. Communication is key for the role , you will also have strong ability to present complex ideas to mixed-level audiences (from execution teams to c-suite executives) Finally, you will have experience in DTC and/or subscription businesses with outstanding writing skills and the ability to write in a range of styles and perspectives
What do we offer in return?
We have a high-performance culture which is balanced evenly with world-class well-being initiatives and benefits that are tastier than our Salted Caramel Black Edition (and trust us, that’s saying something!)
A competitive salary range of $75,000-$80,000 per annum depending on your skills and experience
Flexible working - including up to 2 days per week at home
30 Paid Vacation Days PLUS Federal Holidays
Free Huel to keep you going
️ 2 weeks a year to work remotely from anywhere! One week in the Summer and one week at Christmas
401K Plan
Commuter Benefits
Paid Volunteering Days
Enhanced Family Leave
Dog friendly. The fluffier the better!
️ Monthly gym membership contribution plus we will also give you your own nutrition plan!
Free 1-on-1 therapy provided by BetterHelp
Private Medical and Health insurance for you, including free life insurance
Huel Academy
Quarterly events to celebrate success - Have you heard about Huelchella?
So what next?
If this sounds like the right opportunity for you, then we’d love to hear from you! Click on apply to this job to send us your CV and cover letter and Ellie from our talent team will be in touch with you.

We are Hueligans
We're all made up of our Huel DNA, but what makes us unique is our individual differences. We've created a culture of belonging and we celebrate the diversity our Hueligans add to our teams. We encourage authenticity, different views, and new ideas to enable us to create products that our customers around the world enjoy and love. Read more about our culture here.

title: Copywriter
description:
Gong transforms revenue organizations by harnessing customer interactions to increase business efficiency, improve decision-making and accelerate revenue growth. The Revenue Intelligence Platform uses proprietary artificial intelligence technology to enable teams to capture, understand and act on all customer interactions in a single, integrated platform. More than 4,000 companies around the world rely on Gong to support their go-to-market strategies and grow revenue efficiently. For more information, visit www.gong.io.
Gong is looking for an exceptional copywriter to join our growing Content team. In this role, you’ll be responsible for developing compelling content that helps to attract, educate, and convert revenue leaders – all while upholding the Gong brand narrative and voice. You will work cross-functionally to bring content to life, interpreting briefs and product messaging frameworks to produce long-form guides, thought leadership, blog posts, customer case studies, social, emails, web copy, ad copy, and more. You are an expert writer who can translate messaging into headlines and stories that captivate readers.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Write, write, write! You’ll create content across a variety of platforms and formats, from blog posts and guides to social media and landing pages
Know revenue leaders and sellers alike in order to develop compelling copy (without buzzy business jargon) to successfully engage those personas at different stages of the customer lifecycle
Understand the critical role copy plays in campaigns, acting as a key custodian of the Gong brand narrative to generate awareness and engagement
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to interpret direction and feedback in order to execute projects successfully
Manage multiple projects and timelines to deliver quality content on time
QUALIFICATIONS
4+ years of proven copywriting experience and results with preferred experience in the revenue technology industry
A robust portfolio showcasing strong branded content across formats and channels
Exceptional writing, editorial, and communication skills – you know when to amp up tone but never sacrifice core voice
Innovator who isn’t afraid to challenge conventional wisdom and take risks with copy approaches
Passion for writing about technology innovation and distilling complex concepts into engaging content
Strong collaborator who is easy to work with across teams
Self-starter with the ability to work independently, prioritize, and get things done
Comfortable with making data-backed decisions to improve content development
Seasoned knowledge and appetite to learn emerging copywriting tactics, SEO best practices, and AI copywriting technology
PERKS & BENEFITS
We offer Gongsters a variety of medical, dental, and vision plans, designed to fit you and your family’s needs.
Wellbeing Fund - flexible wellness stipend to support a healthy lifestyle.
Mental Health benefits with covered therapy and coaching.
401(k) program to help you invest in your future.
Education & learning stipend for personal growth and development.
Flexible vacation time to promote a healthy work-life blend.
Paid parental leave to support you and your family.
Company-wide recharge days each quarter.
Work from home stipend to help you succeed in a remote environment.
The annual salary hiring range for this position is $106,000 - $125,000 USD.
