title: Remote Marketing Proposal Specialist
description:
Join Our Team - Remote Marketing Proposal Specialist Opportunity

Are you a skilled Marketing Proposal Specialist with a passion for making a difference? Glumac, a Tetra Tech company, is seeking a talented individual to join our dynamic team. As the ideal candidate, you bring 3-5 years of marketing experience in the Architecture, Engineering, and Construction (AEC) industry, coupled with a bachelor’s degree in marketing, Business, Public Relations, Communications, Graphic Design, or Journalism.
As a Marketing Proposal Specialist with Glumac, you'll play a crucial role in managing Requests for Proposals/Qualifications (RFP/Qs) from start to finish. Your creative flair will shine as you produce compelling visuals and assist in interview preparations. A key responsibility will be developing marketing qualification packages, showcasing your advanced English writing, editing, and proofreading skills. Proficiency in InDesign and Microsoft Office Suite is a must. We value attention to detail and expect you to have an advanced understanding of A/E/C industry terminology and delivery methods.
Candidates MUST BE LOCATED AND ELIGIBLE TO WORK IN THE USA. The role offers the advantages of fully remote work while ensuring active engagement with people and organizational culture to foster a profound sense of belonging.
Joining Glumac means contributing to a global AEC leader committed to shaping resilient and sustainable spaces. If you're a Marketing Specialist seeking a fulfilling role where your expertise can make a lasting impact, we invite you to apply.

Be part of a team that values innovation, sustainability, and professional growth. Apply now to embark on a rewarding career journey with Glumac.

Salary Range: $64,000 - $80,000

The base salary range represents the low and high end of the proposed salary range for this position. Actual salaries will vary depending on factors including but not limited to location, experience, and performance. The range listed is just one component of Glumac’s total compensation package for employees.

For more information on our company, please visit our website at www.glumac.com.

To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter on the Careers portion of our website at https://www.glumac.com/careers/#open-positions.
Tetra Tech is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Diversity, inclusion, and equity are among Tetra Tech’s core values. Throughout our history, the company has prioritized the equitable inclusion of all people. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, military or veteran status, gender, age, disabilities, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions, genetic information, and any other characteristics protected by the law. We invite resumes from all interested parties.

Tetra Tech is a VEVRAA federal contractor, and we request priority referral of veterans for available positions.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability - No calls or agencies.

title: Marketing Manager, Amazon
description:
2+ years of professional non-internship marketing experience
Experience with Excel or Tableau (data manipulation, macros, charts and pivot tables)
Experience in a marketing role
The Amazon Canada Marketing team is responsible for creating best-in-class shopping experiences for Canadian customers. In the role, you will be responsible for onsite merchandising support key categories, including fashion, consumer electronics, pets, and more.

The successful candidate will plan and schedule content across the site and outbound channels, analyze metrics, and report on performance. They will be data driven, results-orients, and able to effectively manage stakeholders across marketing and business teams.

Key job responsibilities
Drive internal and external traffic
Plan, develop, and execute compelling e-mails and merchandising campaigns
Analyze results of merchandising and traffic efforts
Plan, develop, and coordinate cross-site sales and events
Review and drive improvements to customer experience
Analyze performance of content and email, always seeking ways to improve
Work with vendors and vendor managers to create on-brand, best-in-class content
Analyze traffic patterns and optimize for seasonality, relevance, and selection drive site improvements
We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Arlington, VA, USA | Seattle, WA, USA

Experience working with a Content Management System (e.g. Wordpress, Drupla, Joomla, etc.)
Experience using integrated campaigns to solve brand/business challenges
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $48,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $116,300/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Corporate Communications Analyst
description:
About Rockefeller Capital Management:
Rockefeller Capital Management is a leading independent financial advisory firm – providing wealth management, asset management, and strategic advisory services to ultra- and high-net-worth individuals, families, businesses, and institutions. Led by President & CEO Gregory J. Fleming, the firm offers an elevated experience based on traditional Rockefeller global family office values of excellence and service.

Formed in 2018 following the acquisition of Rockefeller & Co., Inc., the firm is rapidly extending its historic brand into contemporary markets. Based in New York City, it has over forty offices in the United States and London and oversees some $112 billion in client assets.
Position:
Rockefeller Capital Management’s Corporate Communications team engages with media, external stakeholders, Rockefeller employees and the broader community to raise awareness of the firm’s activities internally and externally. This is a small, hands-on team that operates in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment.

In this role, you’ll work collaboratively with the Corporate Communications and Marketing teams and support our firmwide communications efforts including across media relations, social media, and thought leadership. You will play a key role in amplifying our storytelling strategy that touches both internal and external channels by helping develop content, write media pitches, draft communications, and participate in media monitoring. You will also play a key role in our team’s innovation journey, driving solutions by leveraging data and technology to advance our communications capabilities and streamline processes.
Responsibilities:
Develop and execute compelling content for internal and external communications, including drafting, editing, proofreading, and posting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather information and insights for crafting compelling stories, updates, and announcements
Work creatively to define and utilize a range of different mediums (video, podcast, visual, other)
Monitor media and social media channels for relevant news and stay current with industry best practices
Support events, webinars, and other activities to increase brand visibility and engagement
Participate in ad-hoc projects to raise visibility of Rockefeller brand in key markets
Maintain critical documentation and processes that improve efficiency and create opportunity for the team
Support administrative needs of the team including answering phones, scheduling meetings and meeting prep
Qualifications:
1-2 years’ experience
A bachelor’s degree in journalism, communications or marketing is preferred
Financial services experience a plus
Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise manner.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver high-quality results within deadlines.
Compensation Range:
The anticipated base salary range for this role is $65,000 - $75,000. Base salary for the role will depend on several factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and experience, and may fall outside of the range shown. In addition, this role may be eligible for a discretionary bonus. Rockefeller Capital Management offers a comprehensive benefit package including health coverage, vacation time, paid leave, retirement plan, and more. Visit careers.rockco.com to learn more about additional opportunities and benefits offerings.
Disclosure:
Rockefeller & Co. LLC, Rockefeller Financial LLC, Rockefeller Trust Company, N.A., The Rockefeller Trust Company (Delaware), Rockefeller Financial Services, Inc. and all other subsidiaries of Rockefeller Capital Management L.P. (individually and collectively, “Rockefeller”) is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, citizenship, age, military or veteran status, marital or partnership status, caregiver status, legally recognized disability, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state or local law (“protected characteristics”).

Rockefeller Capital Management participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law.

title: Brand Experience Marketing Associate- Nescafé
description:
Brand Experience Marketing Associate- Nescafé
Foods people love. Brands people trust. And a career that nourishes your future like no other.

If you're driven by the passion to do something meaningful that changes lives, Nestlé is the place for you. Nestlé USA is one of seven operating companies that make up Nestlé’s presence in the United States. We're in 97% of American homes, and as the leading food and beverage company, our goals are to continue to deliver quality food and beverage products, strengthen our local communities, and reduce our environmental and climate impact.

We’re determined to challenge the status quo and be better tomorrow than we are today. As individuals and teams, we embrace our entrepreneurial culture and have created a workplace where collaboration is essential, courage is rewarded, speed is expected, and agility is the norm to delight our consumers every single day. Here, you will find limitless opportunities to learn and advance your career and feel empowered to succeed in the workplace and beyond. Because our focus is not only on nourishing our customers, but also about enriching you.

This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.

As a Brand Experience Marketing Associate, you will play a central role in executing the strategy to deliver profitable growth and key near-term operations for Nescafé. Responsible for managing all aspects of annual marketing and business strategy end-to-end including accountability for communications. In collaboration with cross-functional teams including Sales, Operations, and Finance will ensure executional excellence of our annual business plans. This role is accountable for championing the brand’s identity and knowing the consumer deeply to create a north star for all business and brand decisions.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:


Consumer & Customer Intimacy
Develop a deep understanding of the demographics, psychographics, occasions, path to purchase and behavioral drivers of the brand’s consumer through data and research.
Understand, validate and/or develop the consumer’s hidden universal truths to drive relevant communications.
Analyzes data and synthesizes learning into insights to optimize plan and commercial investment decisions to deliver business results
Business Planning
P&L ownership to ensure that key business KPI’s are met—revenue, profit, market share and brand health.
End-to-end cross functional leadership to drive optimized portfolio & value chain
Lead the monthly operating process to deliver business performance and ensure accurate forecasting to mitigate supply challenges. Track sales, consumption, and consumer trends to identify gaps / opportunities
Manage brand’s consumer marketing budget and demonstrate efficient and effective investment approach
Responsible for accurate and healthy demand forecast process including inventory at Warehouse, Customers as well as key demand fluctuations
Brand & Product Experience
Works with the internal teams and external creative / media agencies to develop marketing strategies and plans that increase awareness, penetration and / or purchase frequency
Identifies optimal engagement strategy and campaign structure to reach consumers when and where they are most receptive
Strong understanding of brand foundational tools and ensures the cultural relevance of the brand’s identity, essence, and activations across all touchpoints
Activate brand’s nutrition health and wellness proposition in consumer communication
Works to produce continuous growth out of total demand generation dollars; manages brand’s consumer marketing budget and demonstrate efficient and effective investment approach
Management of budget, as well as evaluate share, sales and profit for the brand
Support packaging changes due to product, graphic and/or formula changes
Commercial Excellence
Partners with Sales and Customers to execute strategy and win the sale in an omni-channel environment;
understands how to maximize the business at retail and collaborates to execute
Analyze promotional programs to maximize effectiveness/efficiency and make on-going recommendations for
improvement / investment
Support packaging changes due to product, graphic and/or formula changes


QUALIFICATIONS / CERTIFICATIONS:
Typically has a University Degree (BA/BS) in Marketing or related business field; or equivalent experience MBA preferred
Knowledge of budget control methods, policies and procedures
Ability to adapt quickly to change and deliver results
Ability to work independently and autonomously
Must have strong problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Excellent communication (both verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.
Ability to prioritize workload and self-manage projects, handle multiple tasks and meet strict deadlines.
Proficient in Microsoft Office Applications

CRITICAL EXPERIENCES:
At least 3-5 years of work experience in marketing or brand management
Experience leading and influencing cross-functional teams and or agency partners utilizing strong negotiation and relationship building skills
Experience leading marketing communication projects including digital and media strategies
Experience leveraging data, research and trends to generate insights to understand consumer behavior (IRI or Nielsen knowledge strongly recommended)
Demonstrated problem-solving and analytical capabilities, with the ability to develop creative/non-traditional solutions for challenging, undefined problems

The approximate pay range for this position is $105,000 to $120,000. Please note that the pay range provided is a good faith estimate for the position at the time of posting. Final compensation may vary based on factors including but not limited to knowledge, skills and abilities as well as geographic location.

Nestlé offers performance-based incentives and a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k with company match, healthcare coverage and a broad range of other benefits. Incentives and/or benefit packages may vary depending on the position. Learn more at About Us | Making an Impact | Nestle Careers (nestlejobs.com).

Requisition ID: 287810
It is our business imperative to remain a very inclusive workplace.

To our veterans and separated service members, you're at the forefront of our minds as we recruit top talent to join Nestlé. The skills you've gained while serving our country, such as flexibility, agility, and leadership, are much like the skills that will make you successful in this role. In addition, with our commitment to an inclusive work environment, we recognize the exceptional engagement and innovation displayed by individuals with disabilities. Nestlé seeks such skilled and qualified individuals to share our mission where you’ll join a cohort of others who have chosen to call Nestlé home.

The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer* seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, gender, gender identity, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, perceived disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other protected status, as defined by applicable law. Prior to the next step in the recruiting process, we welcome you to inform us confidentially if you may require any special accommodations in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience. Contact us at accommodations@nestle.com or please dial 711 and provide this number to the operator: 1-800-321-6467

Note: Nespresso is not a federal contractor and does not maintain affirmative action programs

Review our applicant privacy notice before applying at https://www.nestlejobs.com/privacy

Seattle, WA, US, 98104

title: Employee Communications Strategist
description:
Job Description

We are searching for an Employee Communications Strategist. Employee Communications and Employer Brand (ECEB) is part of Intel's Global Communications Group, a worldwide team of communications professionals working to build and protect Intel's reputation as the world's best semiconductor company. The group spans public relations, reputation management, corporate communications, executive communications, analyst relations, content, narrative, thought leadership, and employee communications.
It's a fast-paced, dynamic, and exciting environment. The employee communications strategist role is a fast-paced, strategic position and with visibility and influence across Intel business groups. You will engage and counsel a variety of stakeholders to communicate some of Intel's most important proof points of Intel's employee value proposition. As an integral member of the employee communications team, you will deliver communication strategies with professional and innovative materials supporting a variety of HR programs and initiatives centered on employee compensation including but not limited to base pay, bonuses, stock, etc.
This communications strategist will:
Deliver foundational employee communications to ensure employees are aware and feel valued and supported.
Develop and deliver clear and comprehensive compensation communication strategy and plan.
Provide counsel to leaders and managers to ensure communications are aligned with approved messaging and overall business objectives.
Handle confidential information with the highest discretion, ensuring that communications plans are executed with sensitivity and integrity.
Your responsibilities will include but not limited to the following:
Building multi-channel comms strategies to inform, influence and engage our employee audiences.
Monitoring campaign effectiveness and employee sentiment by establishing success metrics, analyzing results and benchmarking.
Managing an integrated communications calendar, production schedules and other project management activities.
The successful candidate should exhibit the following skills and behaviors:
Strategic mindset and align well to comms plans with business objectives.
Be able to act as a trusted advisor and handle confidential information with a high degree discretion.
Provide strong leadership presence and presentation skills to influence a variety of stakeholders, including executives.
Deliver expertise in managing multiple initiatives simultaneously and anticipating potential challenges.
Works well in ambiguous situation, with a mindset of ownership and accountability and stays highly organized with strong attention to detail.
Proficiency in problem-solving techniques and flexibility in finding answers to comprehend and address complex projects and initiatives.
Works well under pressure.
Exceptional written and oral communications capabilities, including active listening skills.
Ability to think strategically, analyze complex information, and offer creative, practical solutions

Qualifications

You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.
This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Journalism, Communications, Business or related field
6+ years of internal communications experience
Preferred Qualifications:
6+ years Understanding of communications best practices, employee engagement, and the overall employee experience.
6+ years Proven track record in senior stakeholder management and internal communications.
6+ years Strong ability to synthesize complex information to craft clear narratives and messages for diverse strategic audiences.
6+ years Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines.
Experience working on visible projects with executive exposure.

Inside this Business Group

Global Marketing & Communications is responsible for Intel's brand management, end-user product marketing and go-to-market activation strategy for direct and indirect marketing programs worldwide
Other Locations

US, OR, Hillsboro; US, CA, Folsom
Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
Benefits

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.

Annual Salary Range for jobs which could be performed in US, California: $123,139.00-$203,801.00
Salary range dependent on a number of factors including location and experience

Working Model

This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.

JobType
Hybrid

title: Digital Content Marketing Specialist
description:
The Digital Content Marketing Manager will create, curate, and repurpose engaging content that is on brand, educates, and builds connection with our audience and promotes lead generation.
Description
STATUS: Full-time W2
START DATE: ASAP
LOCATION: Remote (Must be authorized to work in the US)
OPERATING HOURS: Core hours 11-3pm CT, 40 hours/week, with additional hours during launches (4-5 times a year for 9 days each time over a weekend)
SALARY: $50,000-60,000 DOE plus a competitive benefits package - PTO, paid holidays, health insurance stipend, 401k match, remote work stipend, professional development stipend, 2 fully paid retreats per year (one domestic and one international)

Applications Accepted until an ideal candidate is identified.

LS&D is a small startup organization that is 100% online and offers a career development program for career changers entering the field of Instructional Design (see description at the bottom.)

We are looking for the next superstar to help execute marketing strategy for Learning Strategy and Design. This position includes executing an omni-channel marketing strategy, both on and off social media. Channels include social media (Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram), website/SEO search traffic, YouTube, Pinterest, and podcast/blog. This role will be involved with implementing a cohesive content calendar for all channels. This role will involve content repurposing, creating social media posts and stories, interacting with potential customers through social media and directing them to our resources, podcast management, and assistance with email marketing. In addition, this role will be responsible for producing marketing materials and funnels for launches, programs, and lead magnets, through use of a cohesive strategy that aligns with the business and elevates the brand.

The chosen candidate will be in charge of creating all external-facing visuals for the organization, in accordance with brand guidelines. If we have a presentation that needs a visual design or creative touch, this role will be responsible for creating that deck.

This role will work with our Sales & Marketing Lead on the technical execution of our funnels, and will help manage or launch events that happen 4-5 times a year (over 9 days.)

Copywriting, marketing, visual design, and branding experience is preferred. The ideal candidate is someone who is scrappy and isn’t afraid to learn the tools necessary to drive our marketing message home, has an intrapreneurial spirit and will be all-in with our organization as we grow, advancing through the organization in a mutually beneficial relationship. It’s important that you became a true part of our team as your primary role.

Responsibilities include:
Graphic Design
Creating and maintaining program brochures and guides for prospective clients
Creating branded graphics and presentations in Canva for various purposes

Social Media
Repurposing content into social media posts for Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn, video, blogs, and other social platforms
Grow existing channels and build new ones to reach new audiences
Creating and leveraging stories and reels for Instagram
Using Zoho Social or other similar tool to get posts scheduled
Promoting new content that is released on social media channels (blog, YouTube, podcast, etc.)
Keeping up-to-date on trends and changes to social media platforms
Running stats and monitoring the best performing posts
Executing content calendar

Podcast, YouTube. Pinterest and Blog Management
Editing and publishing of podcast with the assistance of AI tools
Promotion and growth of podcast
Writing show notes and creating marketing content/graphics for podcasts
Turning podcast episodes into SEO-optimized blog post with the assistance of AI tools
Repurposing of podcast into YouTube videos and social media content
Editing and uploading YouTube videos
Creating visuals and posting to Pinterest

Website / SEO
Creating and updating sales- and marketing-related pages in Wordpress (testimonials, podcast episodes, blog posts, media segments)
Optimizing all added website copy for SEO

Sales Support
Design of lead magnets, workbooks, and other marketing materials through Canva
Promoting consultations and sales for launch events and Applied Instructional Design Academy through social media
Include the hidden key word connection in your application video
Updating and editing launch graphics in Canva
Connect with our audience in comments and messages with the understanding that content and relationships lead to sales

Relevant Skills and Experience:
2+ years marketing,/copy writing/graphic design/content creation experience
1+ year of experience using at least one video production tool (light)
Intermediate experience using social media (Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube) as a marketing tool for content, engagement, and lead generation and familiarity with what works and doesn’t work on each platform
Experience with basic copywriting
Comfortable with systems and online technology / social media and current on trends
Strong written communication skills
Organizational skills, and the ability to time-block, prioritize and meet deadlines with minimal supervision
Preferred - Bachelor’s degree preferred - though it doesn’t have to be in marketing.
Preferred - Podcast production / AI / SEO / WordPress / Canva experience

You are perfect for Learning Strategy and Design if you:
Are a self-starter and quick learner (you anticipate needs and take action) and thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Have an intrapreneurial spirit.
Are 110% committed to the role with the understanding that there will be ongoing support, training, feedback, and guidance
Have a can-do attitude and thrive on performing at a high level and hold yourself to high standards.
Know that copywriting is your jam and you can take half-baked voice notes and videos and turn them into copy and social media that connects and sells.
Have an eye for branding, and can create designs in Canva that stay on brand.
Are the go-to person for making things look pretty, professional, and polished.
Are detail-oriented and can slow down to proofread and catch those pesky typos before hitting publish.
Are dependable, responsive, and know how to prioritize to meet reasonable deadlines.
Are optimistic, upbeat, and look at the glass half full.
Love to keep things organized, attentive, and detail-oriented.
Can think creatively to problem solve, sometimes outside of the box, and love suggesting new ideas around creative strategies for sales and marketing.
Are a team player with a proven ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Understand the importance of business metrics and looking at the numbers.
Are flexible and adaptable when things change (or a project gets derailed.)
Are inquisitive, love to learn and help others learn.
Are self-aware, love change and growth and have an abundance mindset.
Are constantly looking for ways to innovate, improve, and become more efficient.

About Learning Strategy and Design
Learning Strategy and Design LLC was founded by Jill Davidian, CEO and 20-year Instructional Design veteran. We have a hands-on coaching and mentorship program called Applied Instructional Design Academy for new and aspiring Instructional Designers.

AIDA has worked with over 1000 new and aspiring IDs to teach and support them in learning the practical side of Instructional Design and eLearning Development, so that they have the skills employers want, as well as getting them ready for work with their portfolio, resume, and interviewing skills. Many people come to the program from careers that have burnt them out, and getting into Instructional Design as a second career is life changing for them. Learning Strategy and Design is focused on developing a life of freedom and living life on your own terms, and using Instructional Design as the vehicle for that, so building a freelance business in the field is a big part of what we teach.

You can check out our FB group & Podcast - Jumpstart Your Instructional Design Career

https://www.learningstrategyanddesign.com/.

** Experience comes in many forms – skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your experience is close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

** We know that diversity makes for the best problem-solving and creative thinking, which is why we’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team and encourage everyone to apply. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive organization.
Salary
$50,000 - $60,000 per year

title: Digital Marketing Content Manager
description:
At Henkel, you can build on a strong legacy and leading positions in both industrial and consumer businesses to reimagine and improve life every day. If you love challenging the status quo, join our community of over 50,000 pioneers around the globe. Our teams at Henkel Consumer Brands continuously drive the evolution in dynamic categories: Laundry & Home Care and Hair. With our trusted brands, including Persil and Schwarzkopf, our cutting-edge technologies and our disruptive solutions, you will have countless opportunities to explore new paths and develop your skills. Grow within our future-led businesses, our diverse and vibrant culture and find a place where you simply belong. All to leave your mark for more sustainable growth.
Dare to make an impact?
YOUR ROLE
Create and post original content for our TikTok, Instagram, Facebook and YouTube channels
Manage external content creators and content vendors
Manage activations for 10-20 hair artists and projects at any given time.
Our department’s Digital Leads are responsible for setting strategy and timelines.
Take that strategy, communicate it to the content creators, and commission content that meets business objectives.
Organize monthly education for these artists to learn about our product innovations from our education team.
Spearhead an ambassador program in which we send out periodic product mailings to 100 hairdressers who have expressed working with us, with the goal of driving Earned Media Value.
Continually build a diverse portfolio of partnerships and interactions to support and round out overall digital marketing efforts.
Our ideas to come from our knowledge of salon culture, key brands, influencers and out-of-the-box thinking.
Developing relationships with our contracted influencers and stepping in to help Influencer Manager when needed.
YOUR SKILLS
Must have at least 3 years of experience creating digital campaigns for a major consumer products brand (beauty experience preferred)
A deep and thorough knowledge of current social media landscape
Expertise in running influencer or content creator social campaigns
Cosmetology license a plus

The salary for this role is $75,000.00 - $95,000.00. This is the range that we in good faith anticipate relying on when setting wages for this position. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range. This salary range may also be modified in the future.
Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel's request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.
All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.
At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different races, colors, religions, sexes, national origins, disabilities, veteran statuses, ages, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions, and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Research Analyst, Corporate
description:
TelevisaUnivision is seeking a Full Time Research Analyst for Corporate Research in Los Angeles. Responsibilities include compiling and analyzing Nielsen ratings, reporting on competitive spend, and creating presentations for use by TelevisaUnivision Local Media Sales, News, Finance, and Distribution, along with other departments at TelevisaUnivision.
The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate an interest in media and marketing research, have strong math skills, exhibit excellent written and oral communication skills, be a strategic and creative thinker, a self-starter, and a collaborator willing to learn and share ideas. Training will be provided.
Your Day to Day
Analysts will be responsible for tracking and analyzing Media Research data for the executive, sales and programming teams. They are also responsible for creating research reports and PowerPoint presentations with the goal of increasing sales revenue, Local Media (TV/Radio stations and Multi-Market Sales) profitability, and audience levels.
Analyze Nielsen audience data for Univision stations and its competitors on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Produce audience delivery trend reports and highlights for sales, programming, marketing and all levels of management.
Prepare media one-sheets and customized presentations to support the sales effort.
Running competitive advertising spend data across all media (TV, Audio, Digital) for both standard reporting and ad-hoc projects.
Participation in special projects.
You Have
An eye for detail – this is extremely important for both presentations and accuracy in numbers.
Ability to work independently on big projects for long periods of time.
Strong organizational, project management, and communication skills.
Eligibility Requirements
Must be willing to work from a TelevisaUnivision office at least part-time in Los Angeles.
Employment/education will be verified.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.
Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. Please note the national salary range listed in the job posting reflects the new hire salary range across levels and U.S. locations that would be applicable to the position. Base pay Range $45k-60k+ benefits
Our Benefits
TelevisaUnivision believes that a happy, well-balanced employee is what makes our culture thrive. We offer a wide selection of perks and benefits including PTO; tuition reimbursement; wellness and employee support programs; 401K; and life and other insurance plans. This is all in addition to our comprehensive and competitive health benefits package featuring medical, dental and vision coverage options.
Univision is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
At Henkel, you can build on a strong legacy and leading positions in both industrial and consumer businesses to reimagine and improve life every day. If you love challenging the status quo, join our community of over 50,000 pioneers around the globe. Our teams at Henkel Consumer Brands continuously drive the evolution in dynamic categories: Laundry & Home Care and Hair. With our trusted brands, including Persil and Schwarzkopf, our cutting-edge technologies and our disruptive solutions, you will have countless opportunities to explore new paths and develop your skills. Grow within our future-led businesses, our diverse and vibrant culture and find a place where you simply belong. All to leave your mark for more sustainable growth.
Dare to make an impact?
YOUR ROLE
Lead brand channels.
Develop content calendar that aligns with brand goals and campaigns.
Lead SoMe agency (BSG).
Coordinate with in-house content creation, influencer manager and BSG to create content.
Craft compelling and engaging copy for social media posts, advertisements, and campaigns (with BSG).

Steer SSC in operational day-to-day community management.

title: Marketing Project Specialist
description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 114,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
A healthy heart is essential to good health. That's why we're committed to advancing treatments for people with cardiovascular disease. As a global leader in Cardiac Rhythm Technologies, our breakthrough medical technologies help restore people's health so they can get back to living their best lives, faster. We focus on innovative technologies that can improve the way doctors treat people with heart arrhythmias, or irregular heartbeats.
Our location onsite in Austin, TX, currently has an opportunity for a Marketing Project Specialist to join our onsite Marketing Communicaiton Team
WHAT YOU'LL DO
The Project Specialist is responsible for managing the creative workflow of marketing collateral as assigned. This individual collaborates with communications colleagues who represent Marketing Communications, Digital, Events, PR, Internal Communications, Brand and Creative Services.
Collaborate closely with peers in Marketing Communications, Digital, Brand, Events, Creative Services, Public Relations, Internal Communications and Marketing to align on campaign deliverables, process, best practices and efficiencies.
Schedule kickoff, concept, status and other requested meetings for projects assigned.
Develop timelines and monitor schedules in project management system, update project statuses.
Liaison between appropriate team functions, including Marketing Communications, Creative Services, Events and Digital, to ensure that projects are kept on schedule and that project statuses are updated and communicated to project team members on a regular basis.
Initiate projects in review and approval system and ensure that all content is taken through proper Regulatory, Quality and Legal reviews in compliance with the Ad & Promo Materials Review and Approval Standard Operating Procedure (SOP).
Responsible for final dissemination of assets as needed.
Collaborates with Design team on project specifications, final distribution and asset management.
Proofread to ensure all edits and comments are addressed and completed correctly on designed material.
Archive projects and provide final certification on approved asset in the review and approval system. .
Traffics materials specific to the needs of other Abbott departments such as Training & Education, HCE, Product Marketing, Clinical Marketing, Public Relations, Internal Relations.
Complies with U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulations, other regulatory requirements, Company policies, operating procedures, processes, and task assignments.
Maintains positive and cooperative communications and collaboration with all
levels of employees, customers, contractors, and vendors.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOU'LL BRING
Required
4 Year degree – preferably in Marketing, Advertising and Mass Communications
1 – 2 Years of professional related work experience
Apply Now
Participants who complete a short wellness assessment qualify for FREE coverage in our HIP PPO medical plan. Free coverage applies in the next calendar year.
Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com
Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.
Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews.

The base pay for this position is $57,300.00 – $114,700.00. In specific locations, the pay range may vary from the range posted.

title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
description:
EMPIRE is a premier and dynamic music company that prides itself on the development and support of independent artists. We are a rapidly growing firm that has been making waves in the music industry, with an extensive portfolio that spans multiple genres and reaches audiences worldwide. We have become the largest independent record label in the U.S., with a significant global presence covering Africa, Asia, Europe, Australia, and North and South America. We keep ourselves busy with a large range of music-related services from original content and marketing to distribution and recordings.
Our commitment to artistic creativity, innovation, and progressive business solutions forms the foundation of our corporate culture. We believe in fostering talent, not just in our artists but also within our professional teams. As we continue to expand, we invite you to join us on this exciting journey.
The Role Remix: EMPIRE is looking for a Digital Marketing Coordinator to join our downtown San Francisco office. This role will report into the VP, Strategic Marketing and will assist the Digital Marketing team with various projects and tasks. We’re looking for motivated, organized and ambitious individuals to contribute to our team. This is a great opportunity for someone wanting to develop their digital marketing career in the music industry by working at a top of the line record label and honing their skills.
Assist with the administrative and day to day duties of the Digital Marketing department
Create and implement digital campaigns for album/single/music videos in platform ad managers
Optimize campaigns for best ROAS across multiple ad platforms
Create live dashboards for real-time reporting on ad/influencer campaign performance
Track requests and organize work flow with Asana
Manage communication between digital team and any third party vendors
Distribute marketing agendas and record meeting notes
Prospect to work with other departments including Design, OOH, Socials, Finance, etc.
Any additional duties as assigned
Key Notes for Success:
Music industry knowledge
Strong administrative skills
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
You understand the importance of confidentiality and discretion
A “no job too small” attitude
Ability to juggle multiple projects at a time and complete tasks fully through
You're not afraid to ask questions and learn as you work
You’re extremely detail oriented
You're extremely organized
Be a team player, open to feedback and strong communication
Must be based in San Francisco Bay Area
Bonus Beats:
Experience working with high profile clientele
Experience in the music industry
Experience using task managers like Asana
Experience with campaign analytics reporting
You have experience in or with Adobe Creative Suite
Pay Range: $60,000 - $66,560/annual salary + benefits + discretionary bonus + profit sharing program.
The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.
At EMPIRE, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
If you are passionate about the music industry, and looking for a challenging role in a fast-paced, innovative environment, apply today. We look forward to hearing from you.
Perks Playlist:
Competitive Compensation Package
Competitive Benefits Package
Company Paid Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, and Long-Term Disability Insurance
Company Paid Health Savings Account (HSA) Contribution
Healthcare and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
Paid Time Off (Holidays, Vacation, and Sick)
Company 401(k) Plan
Wellness Resources
Commuter Allowance
Cell Phone Allowance
About EMPIRE: Founded in 2010 by Bay Area native Ghazi, EMPIRE is currently leading through its innovative and progressive approach to the digital music era across its label, distribution and publishing arms.
With its focus on early stage artist development, the San Francisco based company has been instrumental in identifying future icons and launching the careers of both Multi-platinum and Grammy Award winning artists such as Kendrick Lamar, Fireboy DML, Yung Bleu, Migos, Asake, XXXtentacion, and Anderson .Paak to name a few. After this early success, EMPIRE was quickly regarded as a tastemaker in the industry and premier independent record label.
More than a decade in, EMPIRE continues to grow – expanding the Publishing division with a partnership with superproducer Hit-Boy and his Surf Club collective and acquiring Dirtybird Records in 2022 to amplify the Dance arm. EMPIRE has expanded the team throughout the globe on the African continent, Europe, Asia, North America, and South America. With the company and roster excelling at a breakneck pace, EMPIRE has effectively disrupted a stale business model by bringing its energy, expertise, and acumen to its artists and labels.
Through crafting bespoke deals that are always in favor of the artist, EMPIRE is able to form a true partnership with each artist and label on its roster. Coupled with their unique software for analytics, recoupment, and royalties, which is available to every partner, the company offers a level of transparency unprecedented in the music industry.

title: Brand Specialist - Toys, Amazon Canada
description:
2+ years of account management, project or program management or buying experience
Bachelor's degree
Amazon's Canada team is looking for an experienced, enthusiastic, hard-working, analytical and creative candidate to join the Toys team. You will work directly with strategic vendor partners to develop their business.

Key job responsibilities
The Brand Specialist position offers an exciting introduction to our on-line retail business and a broad training ground for future success. This role will work directly with a strategic vendors to grow their businesses and optimize their supply chains while working with multiple internal teams and management. The Brand Specialist will develop skills and work across functional areas (e.g. In-stock, Vendor Management, Site Merchandising) to grow and improve their portfolio. This role is for experienced brand managers with the ability to think strategically and act tactically.

A day in the life
Acting as the ‘business owner’ for his or her vendors in their respective categories, possessing a complete understanding of internal and external variables that impact the business
Owning forecasting, monitoring, understanding and reporting on vendors, along with responsibility for driving strategic supply chain projects and promotions to achieve business objectives
Proactively negotiating costs, promotional opportunities, and other business inputs for the vendor — autonomously
Conducting pricing and ROI analysis and making recommendations for initiatives that optimize profit margin
Managing Purchase Orders and In-Stock analysis for the strategic brands
Optimizing the online presence and content of each product on the brand's portfolio
Developing and executing marketing plans in order to drive awareness and purchases for the brand
Driving cross-category initiatives to improve operational process and deliver results
About the team
Our team has a strong culture of hard working individuals that value flexibility, ownership, and ability to create our own priorities. Success is driven by an ability to operate independently, while sharing learnings, wins, and misses across the team.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Seattle, WA, USA

Experience in process improvement
Experience managing large amounts of data
Experience in financial analysis, retail buying, retail planning & allocation, product/project management, marketing, business development, consulting, negotiation or supply chain
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $47,500/year in our lowest geographic market up to $103,400/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

title: Customer Communications Advisor
description:
Job Description
Join the Clean Energy Revolution
Become a Corporate Communications Advisor at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. As a member of Corporate Communications & Philanthropy’s Customer Communications team, you will lead communications for a portfolio of programs and customer tools and services designed to help customers make clean energy choices. You’ll develop and implement strategic, coordinated communications plans and will distill complicated issues into easy-to-understand content and materials to tell the SCE’s story to our customers and external stakeholders.
In this role you’ll also work closely with team members in Corporate Communications & Philanthropy’s, Corporate Affairs, Customer Service and across the company to communicate in one voice and achieve communications and policy objectives.
A day in the life - Get ready to think big, work smart and shine bright
Develops and leads a portfolio of communications campaigns to influence stakeholders like media, customers and employees.
Provide strategic recommendations and counsel to business partners and leaders on external and internal communication strategies and tactics that will support company and program objectives.
Serve as a subject matter expert for the department on your portfolio of work; review news stories for inaccuracies and work with media team to correct them.
Track the success of various campaigns and course correct as needed.
Build coordinated communications plans, talking points, messaging platforms, news releases, FAQs, media statements, employee communications as well as stories for Energized by Edison, the company’s storytelling platform.
This position will support crisis communications activities, including as a Public Information Officer, outside of “traditional” business hours.
The Essentials
Seven or more years of experience leading strategic communications plans that deliver results for a brand/company, either in-house or for a public relations agency.
Experience adhering to AP Style.
The Preferred
Bachelor’s Degree or higher in Public Relations, Journalism, Communications, Marketing, Business, or related field.
A track record of meeting deadlines and validated ability to handle multiple, challenging priorities simultaneously in a complex, fast-paced environment.
Experience in visual storytelling.
Experienced in communicating and working with a diverse array of team members, including leadership.
Strategic problem solver; self-starter; high degree of creativity to find new ways to achieve team goals.
Excellent written and oral communication skills with a strong attention to detail.
Fluent in Spanish, Mandarin, Korean or Vietnamese.
You should know
This position’s work mode is hybrid. The employee will report to an SCE facility for a set number of days with the option to work remotely on the remaining days. Unless otherwise noted, employees are required to reside in the state of California. Further details of this work mode will be discussed at the interview stage. The work mode can be changed based on business needs.
Visit our Candidate Resource page to get meaningful information related to benefits, perks, resources and hiring process, and more!
Relocation does not apply to this position.
About Southern California Edison
The people at SCE don't just keep the lights on. Our mission is so much bigger. We’re fueling the kind of innovation that’s changing an entire industry, and quite possibly the planet. Join us and create a future with cleaner energy, while providing our customers with the safety and reliability they demand. At SCE, you will have a chance to grow personally and professionally, making a real impact in Southern California and around the world.
At SCE, we celebrate our differences. We are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other protected status.
We are committed to ensuring that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodations at (833) 343-0727.

title: Creative Project Manager
description:
Position Summary/Objective
The Creative Communications Department at Hearst operates within the corporate division, focusing on conveying the brand's message across various platforms. We collaborate with internal and external partners to ensure alignment with Hearst's mission and values. Our work spans print, web, social media, photography, and video while staying updated with current storytelling trends to engage audiences effectively. Our approach is driven by innovation and a commitment to delivering impactful content. We are a team dedicated to communicating Hearst's message through modern storytelling techniques.
The Creative Project Manager oversees and implements a diverse range of design projects, including artwork collateral, campaigns, videos, and websites. This position bridges creative strategies with client management, liaising internally with the design team and key client stakeholders to translate ideas, concepts and business requirements into effective communications tools. Externally, the position sources video production teams, photographers, and other freelance visual talent. This position reports to the Senior Creative Director.
Essential Functions
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Manage designs, campaigns, videos, and website production, leading ideation, organizing shoots/talent, and researching and collating assets.
Collaborate with stakeholders across business units and divisions to develop and implement creative projects, ensuring business goals and requests are satisfied and ideally exceeded.
Oversee project logistics through tracking collateral, managing timelines, and coordinating with designers/editors.
Produce video and photo shoots, book crews/talent, organize shoot locations, create mood board, and negotiate vendor rates.
Manage asset rights, brand library, and creative archive.
Collaborate with the marketing and creative teams on various projects.
Build strong and trusting relationships with internal clients.
Research and organize content, ideas, and vendors for creative projects.
Develop strategies and implement new business systems to increase efficiency across the team.
Author project briefs and overviews for project pitches and tracking
Review completed project successes and learning for future improvements, such as evaluating digital analytics, comparing industry standards, and leading team debriefs.
Assist Creative Communications leadership team in managing creative assignments, and routing projects for review.
Desired Experience & Competencies
5-7 years of project management experience, preferably at an agency or creative organization.
Fluency in project management software, such as Air Table
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
Attention to detail and standards of excellence.
Strong planning and organizational skills.
Demonstrated ability to work calmly and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment, and under tight deadlines.
Creative problem solver with an ability to think, plan, and execute multiple projects simultaneously.
Comfort and ease working with high level executives.
Interest in creative and cultural trends.
In accordance with applicable law, Hearst is required to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation for this role if hired in New York City. title: Marketing Project Manager
description:
RedCloud is seeking a Marketing Project Manager to support immediate client operations. RedCloud Consulting is a business and IT consulting company with local Puget Sound Enterprise and Mid-sized clients. We have been recognized by Seattle Business Magazine and ranked #1 on their “Best Companies to Work for in Washington” for Mid-Sized Businesses list, awarded #1 Fastest Growing Company in Washington by Puget Sound Business Journal, and named on the Inc. 500/5000 list.
Consulting Job Description:
We are seeking a Marketing Project Manager with strong marketing experience and prior experience in gaming. Our Marketing Project Managers also function as business consultants and can think and act beyond applying and managing standard tools. We are entrusted to bring fresh perspectives and best practices for designing or validating project assumptions, goals, approach, and expected returns before executing. Our Marketing Project Managers partner with us to serve clients across industries; individual project details can be discussed with a recruiter or account manager.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Asset collection – partnering with teams to collect the necessary assets to fuel our creative
Creative management – working with teams to distribute assets, drive creative input and reviews with partner teams, writers, and agencies, and circulate for appropriate approvals. Understanding the brand and voice (particularly the distinct voice we have in social) and how to marry that with the brand needs of publishers/titles will be crucial
Execution confirmation – ensure that client is tracking and executing on commitments and collecting proof of execution
Measurement and learning – collect and review data regarding the various placements, distilling insights about what’s working and what’s not, and create reports for internal and partner use
Required Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
Ability to develop a strong working relationship with the client and confirm his/her expectations, including in-scope deliverables, format, status reporting content and cadence, feedback, and transition plans.
Works in a trusted advisor capacity for the client, providing thought leadership beyond expectations and developing a roadmap for long-term strategy (if applicable).
Exceptional ability to implement and evangelize use of project management best practices (e.g., project plans, weekly status reports and meetings, prioritized issues resolution log, risk log including mitigation measures, transition plans)
Minimum BA/BS degree from a four-year accredited university
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Demonstrated experience in developing and delivering management-level presentations
Solid facilitation skills applied across program stakeholder meetings at multiple management levels
Leadership skills (visionary, clarity of purpose, motivated, relentless execution)
Cross-functional group coordination and collaboration
Ability to thrive in ambiguous or rapidly changing environments
Desire and ability to learn quickly and work in a fast-paced environment
Self-starter, working effectively independently and within a team environment
Detail-oriented, process-oriented, results-driven
Compensation range for position is $90,000 - $132,000 DOE.
Benefits and bonus information can be found at https://www.redcloudconsulting.com/careers.html

About Us:
RedCloud is a boutique, business and technology consulting firm providing local companies with expert-level support for over two decades. Whether it’s to solve a specific business challenge or to provide additional support for an ambitious project, we can help bring even the most visionary endeavors to fruition.

Anchored by a foundation of "integrity-based consulting", the RedCloud team of subject matter experts collaborate closely with clients to develop and implement high-level solutions, bringing stability, growth, and innovation together for long-term success. We provide a broad array of business and technology consulting services through RedCloud’s core services: Empower Operations, Empower Sales and Marketing, Empower Customers, Empower Security and Privacy.

Visit http://www.redcloudconsulting.com/ for more info.
#LI-Remote

title: Influencer Manager
description:
At Henkel, you can build on a strong legacy and leading positions in both industrial and consumer businesses to reimagine and improve life every day. If you love challenging the status quo, join our community of over 50,000 pioneers around the globe. Our teams at Henkel Consumer Brands continuously drive the evolution in dynamic categories: Laundry & Home Care and Hair. With our trusted brands, including Persil and Schwarzkopf, our cutting-edge technologies and our disruptive solutions, you will have countless opportunities to explore new paths and develop your skills. Grow within our future-led businesses, our diverse and vibrant culture and find a place where you simply belong. All to leave your mark for more sustainable growth.
Dare to make an impact?
YOUR ROLE
Identify, reach out, and build relationships with potential influencers and brand ambassadors.
Coordinate influencer collaborations and campaigns.
Negotiate contracts and deliverables with influencers.
Monitor and analyze the effectiveness of influencer campaigns.
Act as a liaison for PR agency & event agency.
Collaborate with internal departments such as marketing, sales, and product teams to align PR and event strategies with overall business objectives.
YOUR SKILLS
Bachelor’s degree in marketing, public relations, communications, or related field.
5 years of professional experience in social media and/or influencer relations.
Successful, proven history of elevating brands and influencers In-depth knowledge of current tools and trends in influencer identification and social media.
Initiative-taking, results oriented, and a creative thinker with a high level of passion, with an analytical approach to identifying opportunities.
Highly organized and able to multi-task in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail.
Experience in consumer goods.
Beauty experience is a plus.
The salary for this role is $80,000.00 - $116,000.00. This is the range that we in good faith anticipate relying on when setting wages for this position. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range and this range. This salary range may also be modified in the future.
Henkel does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or employment agencies. Unsolicited referrals and resumes are considered Henkel property and therefore, Henkel will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited referral. At Henkel's request only, preferred vendors may be invited to refer talent for specific open positions. In these cases, a fully-executed agreement with Henkel must be in place and current.
All employees applying for an internal position must have a discussion with his/her manager about their interest in a job posting opportunity. The discussion will not preclude the employee from interviewing if their skills meet the job requirements.
At Henkel, we come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We believe the uniqueness of all our employees is the power in us. Become part of the team and bring your uniqueness to us! We welcome all applications across different races, colors, religions, sexes, national origins, disabilities, veteran statuses, ages, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions, and other legally protected characteristics.
JOB ID: 24061749
Contract & Job type: Full Time, Regular
Contact information for application-related questions: talent.acquisition@henkel.com
Please do not use this email address for sending your application or CV. To apply, please click on the "Apply Now" button below. Applications sent via e-mail will not be accepted.

title: Brand Marketing Specialist, Dockers
description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
You're an original. So are we.
We're a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.
Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we've used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi's®, Dockers®, Denizen®, Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™ and Beyond Yoga.
As Brand Marketing Specialist, Dockers, you will report to the Dockers Director of Marketing for US/Canada. You help shape and implement the Dockers brand presence in the region. Responsible for both Social Media and Public Relations strategies, this professional enhances Brand Equity metrics and fostering positive brand perception. By curating engaging content, working with important partners, and driving media visibility, the Specialist contributes to Dockers' growth and reputation.
About the Job
Social Media
Manage Dockers social media strategy and calendar posts in the US and Canada and to enhance brand awareness, interaction and follower growth.
Responsible for the brand's content on Facebook, YouTube, X, Instagram and TikTok.
Create the differentiated content grid for each Dockers profiles in social media.
Ensure that brand social media comments are answered.
Work with the Media Agency on the paid ads strategy to increase the interaction of the posts and their reach.
Increase the number of followers on social media.
Make social media content in Canva or Microsoft Designer according to each profile.
Craft and release organic content for Reels and TikTok (basic video editing) at Dockers stores near San Francisco.
Present improvement plans for Social Media indicators.
Report monthly, quarterly and annual results to management.
Liaise with global teams to share best practices and define strategies.
Public Relations
Develop comprehensive US PR plans, setting objectives, KPIs, strategies and program roadmaps.
Manage PR agency execution to achieve brand goals, including increased media publications, product placements and engagement with content creators.
Cultivate relationships with Editors, Key Opinion Leaders, Influencers, and Brand Advocates.
Distribute seeding/samples to press, agencies and influencers.
Manage one PR direct report
Billing Process
Ensure submission of Finance process and invoices.
Monitor the billing process with company partners.
Track budget expenses monthly, semi-annually, and annually.
About You
Bachelor's Degree preferred.
Min 4 years of relevant digital marketing, social media management or Creative Agencies.
Fluent in Microsoft Suite, Canva, Photoshop, or Microsoft Designer.
The expected starting salary range for this role is $66,500- $104,800. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range based on the location of the role. The amount a particular employee will earn within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, experience, skills, performance and business needs.
Levi Strauss & Co. (LS&Co.) offers a total rewards package that includes competitive pay, incentive plans, and a wide array of benefits designed to help you and your family stay healthy, meet your financial goals, and balance the demands of your work and personal life. Available benefits vary depending upon the specifics of the role; details relating to a specific role will be made available upon request.
Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, benefits or other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company's sole discretion, consistent with the law.
Levi Strauss & Co. is committed to equal employment opportunity, affirmative action, and recruiting and maintaining a workforce that welcomes and respects people from diverse backgrounds while enabling our employees to make an impact. We value the unique combination of talents, experiences, and perspectives of each employee, making our collective success possible.
We put a lot of thought into our programs to provide you with a benefits package that matters. Whether it is for medical care, taking time off, improving your health or planning for retirement, we've got you covered. Here's a small snapshot:
401K match: $1.25 for every $1.00 you contribute up to the first 6% of pay you save.
Five hours of paid volunteer time per month with nonprofit organizations
Product discount of 60% off regular-price merchandise
Paid Family Leave

EOE M/F/Disability/Vets

San Francisco, CA, USA
FULL TIME/PART TIME

title: Senior Marketing Associate - Technology
description:
Moody’s is a developmental culture where we value candidates who are willing to grow. So, if you are excited about this opportunity but don’t meet every single requirement, please apply! You may be a perfect fit for this role or other open roles.
Moody's is a global integrated risk assessment firm that empowers organizations to make better decisions.
At Moody’s, we’re taking action. We’re hiring diverse talent and providing underrepresented groups with equitable opportunities in their careers. We’re educating, empowering and elevating our people, and creating a workplace where each person can be their true selves, reach their full potential and thrive on every level. Learn more about our DE&I initiatives, employee development programs and view our annual DE&I Report at moodys.com/diversity
Marketing Technology Associate
As a part of the Analytics & Operations function, the Marketing Technology Associate will focus on the effective usage, architecture, and procurement of marketing tools and technologies.
This is a role in Central Marketing’s Analytics & Operations team which was established to create an effective ecosystem of technology, tools, processes, and people with an inclusive and highly collaborative approach to building effective cross-functional processes and productive workflows. The successful candidate will be the key point of contact and SME on the operating model of all tools in the marketing stack, how they come together to support marketing initiatives, and in assessing necessary changes, updates, or additions to our toolkit.
Role & Responsibilities:
Assess and document the current marketing technology stack, including use cases, data flows, integration points and key contacts.
Develop and maintain an organization-wide marketing technology ecosystem map and support model.
Evaluate and recommend new technologies based on evolving business needs. This includes staying current on industry trends and advancements in MarTech, as well as gathering requirements from internal stakeholders to evaluate the necessity for new tools or expanding the use of current platforms in our ecosystem.
Document marketing technology processes and workflows.
Establish partnerships with key technical groups across the organization to implement purposeful cross-functional knowledge-sharing opportunities to evolve understanding of integrations and technology roadmaps.
Create a strong professional network by identifying teams and projects in which you can advocate for the partnership with the Analytics & Operations function.
Experience & Skills:
3-5 years’ experience managing marketing technology tools from marketing awareness, lead generation, through to CRM assignment (Marketo, SFDC, Adobe)
Experience in documenting data flows and a passion for visually representing complex integration points.
Knowledge and understanding of general marketing practices and key definitions, including scoring, nurture, acquisition, attribution and identifying opportunities for optimization and increased efficiency.
A highly effective communicator who embraces the opportunity to manage stakeholder across functions.
For US-based roles only: the anticipated hiring base salary range for this position is $78,500.00 to $110,400.00 , depending on factors such as experience, education, level, skills, and location. This range is based on a full-time position. In addition to base salary, this role may be eligible for a completion bonus. Moody’s also offers insurance and a discounted employee stock purchase plan for limited duration employees.

Moody’s is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, gender, age, religion, national origin, citizen status, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Moody’s also provides reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities or based on a sincerely held religious belief in accordance with applicable laws. If you need to inquire about a reasonable accommodation, or need assistance with completing the application process, please email accommodations@moodys.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only, and cannot be used to inquire about the status of applications.

This position may be considered a promotional opportunity, pursuant to the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.
