title: Associate Manager, Marketing Operations (Hulu)
description:
Are you a project management guru with a skill for managing multiple priorities and timelines? If so, Hulu is looking for their next “Hulugan” to join their marketing operations team! As the Associate Operations Manager, you will lead the definition of Go-To-Market (GTM) plans, dates and scopes for Small and Extra Small Content campaigns, Awards, Events and ad hoc marketing asset needs. In this role, you will partner with Senior GTM Leads, Hulu Marketing, and Disney Streaming to deliver campaigns to market successfully. Additionally, you should be prepared to run day-to-day project management and provide consistent reports on project status and health. Ultimately, you will be an expert in all day-to-day functions, technologies and the trafficking of all marketing asset types across Hulu and Disney channels. In this dynamic role, the Associate Marketing Operations Manager should be thorough, proactive, and understand that the position provides key information to stakeholders.
Responsibilities:
Prepare GTM Leads for key planning meetings with Executive across Originals and Acquired & Licensed Marketing.
Participate in cross-functional scope of work (SOW) meetings with Campaign Management, Creative and Channel Owners to define, document and track the scope of campaigns, inclusive of key deliverables, internal creative teams, external vendors, media partners, etc.
Manage campaign assets, timelines and other critical information in internal tracking systems.
Partner with GTM Leads to ensure all GTM dependencies have been identified and individual team timelines are congruent with the overall GTM plan.
Identify GTM risks and proactively mitigate them in partnership with other business units.
For Small and Extra Small campaigns, facilitate key moments of “recalibration” based on shifting dates, scope or business priorities.
Understand service level agreements (SLAs) for other business units including, but not limited to, product, Legal, Disney S&P, Disney Broadcast Synergy, International/Disney+, On Channel In-Stream, Paid Media and Testing/Insights and communicate them to impacted stakeholders.
Ensure Clearance Reviews for high impact assets are completed with Brand/Creative Operations (CROPS), Legal, Disney S&P, music licensing.
Become an expert in and steward of Hulu brand guidelines, partnering closely with CROPS to develop branding guidelines per campaign and disseminate them to internal creative teams and external vendors.
Manage post-production finishing of all AV and static assets in partnership with Disney studios, external partners, finishing houses, DMED and CROPS.
Gather asset specifications (creative, technical and delivery) from Channel Owners and ensure resources are fulfilling those requests end to end.
Understand the resourcing process and limitations.
Ensure all assets have been sufficiently QC’d and approved before delivery to market.
Consistently distill and provide weekly status reports to all Content stakeholders.
Be aware of and govern adherence team processes whenever possible.
Requirements:
3+ years experience in a fast-paced, professional environment.
Experience in project management with client-facing / service-oriented responsibilities.
Experience creating presentations.
Excellent communication and organization skills.
Sharp attention to detail.
Standout colleague with good problem-solving skills.
Certifications in Scrum or PMP is a plus.
Some experience in post-production finishing is a plus.
Experience and familiarity with video production technical specs and software (Adobe Premiere, Adobe After Effects, etc.) a plus.
Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Adobe Acrobat as well as Google Docs.
Preferred Education:
Bachelors degree in relevant field or equivalent work experience.

The hiring range for this position in Santa Monica, CA is $70,000.00 to $93,800.00 per year. The base pay actually offered will take into account internal equity and also may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. A bonus and/or long-term incentive units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to the full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the level and position offered.

title: Marketing Strategist
description:
SitelogIQ is a rapidly growing energy and facility services company focused on making buildings better. We provide planning, design, and management solutions for organizations that want efficient and sustainable building environments that are healthier and safer for their occupants.
Our Marketing Strategist will work out of our Corporate Marketing Department but support our Commercial & Industrial business unit priorities and success. With a boots on the ground approach, you will partner with the team to drive vertical marketing strategy and execution, overseeing demand generation; lead campaign planning, development, and implementation; and support brand management to increase company visibility and market share. This role will be hyper focused on keeping the sales funnel full!
Target Salary: $90,000- $100,000+ depending on experience
Marketing Strategist Responsibilities:
Oversee any aspect of marketing for the Commercial & Industrial group, including vertical-specific strategy and planning, sales enablement collateral, social media graphics, presentations, Web design, etc. to ensure success (Not to fear, you will have team of colleagues to partner with for the implementation part!).
Design and implement marketing strategies aligned with business unit targets and goals. (You’ll be in a key success role to support sales enablement efforts.)
Manage budget, measure KPIs, and calculate ROI to determine future campaign models.
Oversee the creation of clear and engaging visuals through creative deliverables and storytelling.
Stay current with industry and marketing trends, practices, and standards and understand customer targets to ensure marketing strategies are innovative and effective.
Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics to measure success and identify areas for improvement.
Serve as liaison to greater marketing team to coordinate demand generation activities, including email marketing and search engine optimization, as well as utilization of CRM/automation tools.
Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including customers, partners, and vendors. Your ability to build strong relationships is critical to success!
Marketing Strategist Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, or closely related discipline
7-10 years of related experience; experience in Commercial Real Estate (Multifamily, Hospitality, Retail, Industrial, or Property Management, Automotive, and/or Manufacturing/Distribution markets is a plus
Strong strategic planning, communication, and analytical skills
Demonstrated experience in leading demand generation activities
Keen relationship builder and ability to act as a liaison
Proven competency in mapping and understanding key audiences and developing actionable persona/messaging profiles
Be relentless in rapidly and continuously testing and adjusting marketing messaging and tactics.
No Agencies, please
Benefits
We offer a highly competitive salary, and comprehensive benefits, including:
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Disability and life insurance
401K
Flex time off
12 paid holidays
Tuition reimbursement
Opportunities to drive our DE&I efforts by joining our affinity groups, Veterans and Allies Leadership Organization or Women Inspiring & Strengthening Everyone
Opportunities to give back to our local communities through organized events or fundraisers
More About SitelogIQ
At SitelogIQ, we’re focused on creating a great environment for our team first so that it is more energizing and rewarding to focus on creating a great customer experience. That’s what we call a win-win.
We partner with clients in K-12, higher ed, government, healthcare, multifamily housing, and industry to optimize energy efficiency, improve indoor air quality, address lighting, and improve the customer experience. With offices across the country, it’s rewarding to make a difference in the communities where our teammates live and work.
SitelogIQ is an Equal Opportunity Employer and participates in E-Verify.

title: Marketing Mgr
description:
Opening
Part Time 24hours Grade 054 Institute for Data Science
Schedule
8:30 AM-5 PM
Responsibilities
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Center of Excellence (CoE) in Data Science at the University of Rochester is a center funded by the New York State Department of Economic Development's Division of Science, Technology, and Innovation (NYSTAR). The CoE in Data Science is dedicated to supporting businesses in New York through the application of data science methods and tools that solve challenges and deliver critical insights. The NYSTAR CoE program helps drive regional and statewide economic development by supporting basic research, training, and technology development. The Business Engagement and Communications Manager will foster a cooperative environment with the business community, researchers, and the Goergen Institute for Data Science. The Business Engagement and Communications Manager (BECM) will provide promotional publishing support, webmaster services, and desktop/IT support services to the Center of Excellence in Data Science. Other responsibilities include generating and disseminating information about the Center on a regular basis through newsletters, annual reports, and web page updates as well as creating and maintaining relationships with industry.
Supervision and Direction Received:
Receive minimal direction from the Center Director.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Directly responsible for gathering publication information and creation of publication documents to include (but not limited to): annual reports; promotional materials.
Ensures proper and timely mailing of newsletters and annual reports through constant updates to email distribution and hard copy mailing lists. Ensures proper quantities of promotional materials are readily available on an ongoing basis.
Reach out to businesses and organizations in New York State to introduce the Center. The BECM will work with these organizations to inform them how the Center can benefit their organization.
Identify and implement strategies for securing additional industrial contacts in New York State from new and existing industry partners and ensure integrity of relationships with existing partner companies.
Establish connections between companies and faculty/researchers at UR and other universities in New York to facilitate collaborative work in data science that can create economic impact in New York. Introduce Companies to UR's practicum project resources in data science.
Help match job/interesting opportunities in NYS companies and data science talent at UR.
Represent the CoE at events including NYSTAR funded events.
In collaboration with the ASE Web Team, maintain and improve the CoE website.
Work directly with stakeholders to assess needs and recommend modifications/additions to website.
Monitor various news sources (e.g. UR mailings, local/national newspapers, radio) and produce news for the aforementioned website.
Assist in content creation; including but not limited to: photography and copy creation.
Work directly with CoE Director to create and maintain a departmental dashboard for website.
Create and manage the social media accounts of the CoE.
Manage CoE databases.
Maintain a department contact database, employee/faculty contact information.
Keeps abreast of trends as they relate to the data science field by self-study, attending job related seminars, courses, or conferences which enhance personal development and strengthens the user service function.
Give periodic updates to faculty (e.g., during regular faculty meetings) regarding current industry and business trends in data science.
Other duties as required/assigned.
REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor's degree in related technical discipline and 4 years related work experience, or equivalent combination of experience and education. Experience with Adobe's Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator); an Email Marketing System (Mail Chimp or Constant Contact); as well as a Content Management System (Cascade, WordPress, Drupal) required.
How To Apply
All applicants must apply online.
EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled
Pay Range
Pay Range: $ 68,400 - $102,600 Annually
The referenced pay range represents the minimum and maximum compensation for this job. Individual annual salaries/hourly rates will be set within the job's compensation range, and will be determined byconsidering factors including, but not limited to, market data, education, experience, qualifications, expertise of the individual, and internal equity considerations.

title: Senior Marketing Specialist - CRM
description:
Overview:
We Provide Solutions. Patients and Physicians rely on our diagnostic testing, information, and services to help them make better healthcare decisions. These are often serious decisions with far reaching consequences, and require sensitivity, tact and a clear dedication to service. It’s about providing clarity and hope.

The Senior Marketing Specialist - CRM is responsible for the coordination and development of CRM transactional, lifecycle, and promotional marketing campaigns to support business goals in customer acquisition, loyalty, and retention. The Senior Marketing Specialist - CRM will collaborate closely with internal teams to support the execution of CRM campaigns and operations.
This is a remote opportunity.
Responsibilities:
Agency-executed campaigns: Coordinate with internal stakeholders and agency partner(s) on key deliverables and milestones in the end-to-end email campaign development and deployment process, including campaign briefs, creative development, asset deliverables, internal reviews and approvals of proofs and deployment plans
Internally-executed campaigns: Take a hands-on role in building, testing, and executing email journeys and campaigns in Salesforce Marketing Cloud to deliver multi-touch communications
Help serve as the liaison between internal stakeholders and external agencies
Knowledge of CRM best practices and CAN-SPAM compliance laws
Participate in the team’s day-to-day CRM team protocols and maintain the CRM campaign calendar
Proofread, edit, and fact-check content to ensure emails are accurate, compelling, promotions and disclaimers are correct, and adhere to our brand guidelines
Facilitate the internal review and approval process for emails, and ensure feedback is implemented
Test and complete quality assurance of emails, ensuring compatibility with web browsers and email clients and all links, images, subject lines, personalized fields, and list segments are accurate and working properly
Assist with A/B testing of emails
Qualifications:
Required Work Experience:
3-5 years’ experience in a CRM marketing role
B2C ecommerce experience

Preferred Work Experience:
Healthcare industry experience would be a bonus
Completion of the Salesforce Marketing Cloud Email Specialist Certification would be a bonus
HTML and CSS knowledge would be a bonus
Team-oriented with the ability to work well with diverse, cross-functional teams in a matrixed organization
Capable of working autonomously in a fast-paced environment
Can self-prioritize tasks and context switch as needed
Must be comfortable with a deadline-driven environment

Technical/Job Specific Knowledge:
Hands-on experience with Salesforce Marketing Cloud required, including experience with Journey Builder, Email Studio, and Automation Builder, and some level of familiarity with Ampscript
SQL querying knowledge

Required Skills:
Email marketing and customer journey knowledge
Excellent project management skills, including management of agencies and vendors to ensure execution
Ability to organize, prioritize, and manage multiple tasks with great attention to detail
Superb written communication skills
Familiarity with project management tools, preferably Asana

Education:

Bachelor’s degree in marketing, advertising/public relations, communications, or related field is required.

The base salary range for this position is ~ $90,000- $100,000. Salary offers are based on a wide range of factors including relevant skills, training, experience, education, and, where applicable, certifications obtained. Market and organizational factors are also considered. Successful candidates may be eligible to receive annual performance bonus compensation.

Benefits Information:
We are proud to offer best-in-class benefits and programs to support employees and their families in living healthy, happy lives. Our pay and benefit plans have been designed to promote employee health in all respects – physical, financial, and developmental. Depending on whether it is a part-time or full-time position, some of the benefits offered may include:
Medical/Prescription Drugs
Dental
Vision
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs)
Supplemental Health Plans
401(k) Plan – Company match dollar-for-dollar up to 5%
Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)
Supplemental Life Insurance
Dependent Life Insurance
Short- and Long-Term Disability buy-up
Blueprint for Wellness
Emotional Well-Being Resources
Educational Assistance
Paid time off / Health Time
Variable Compensation Plans
Sales Incentive Plans

title: Marketing Strategist
description:
UPMC Health Plan is looking for a Marketing Strategist to join the Workpartners Marketing team!
The Marketing Strategist is responsible for the development and prioritization of the strategies for an insurance product, product portfolio or defined audience (i.e., Providers, Brokers). Reporting to a Marketing Strategist Lead, Manager, Marketing, Sr. Manager, Marketing or Director, Marketing, this individual is responsible for developing and implementing strategies and marketing activities for their assigned business unit(s), product(s) or audience(s) and supporting revenue and sales growth. The Marketing Strategist must be able to multi-task, work well with internal clients, be able to interpret business unit needs into customer language, and be familiar with the four Ps of marketing (price, product, promotion, place).

Responsibilities:
Provides strategic direction to supporting marketing and campaign teams in order to develop/refine marketing ideas, concepts, and tests.
Works closely with leadership to set strategic goals/objectives, defines processes for market strategies, and establishes measurement standards.
Utilizes market intelligence to understand market segmentation and competitive analysis to develop strategies and measure results.
Consults with product & consumer innovation department to drive strategy and execution around product branding, messaging, traditional and online marketing activities, and measurement.
Monitor performance of market strategy and implementation and make appropriate recommendations to further support sales goals and strategies.
Formulate, direct, and coordinate marketing activities to promote products, new technology advances, and other related services.
Identify, develop and evaluate market strategy that supports business unit sales objectives, addresses market trends, and enhances client and member experiences.
Bachelor's degree in marketing, public relations, business or related field.
Minimum 5 years of marketing, marketing communications or public relations experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Solid understanding of the four principles of marketing (price, product, promotion, and placement).
Knowledge of healthcare market.
Results oriented: demonstrated success in overcoming obstacles and launching campaigns on time and on budget.
Able to build consensus among various internal and works well as team member.
Self-starter; able to work independently with minimal direction.
Online/social/digital marketing knowledge.
Licensure, Certifications, and Clearances:

UPMC is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veteran

title: Associate Creative Director- Copywriter
location: 7850 N Belt Line Rd 2nd FL, Irving, TX 75063
description:
Overview:
Role: Associate Creative Director, Copywriter
Location: Denver or Irving

Tracy-Locke is looking for an Associate Creative Director, Copywriter to join our team!

The Associate Creative Directors responsibilities include brand ownership, team management and the creation of compelling, strategically strong concepts and design solutions that drive commerce.
Responsibilities:
Owner of assigned brand(s).
Effectively manages workload by delegating the right projects to the right team.
Advanced knowledge of assigned brands, category and competitive landscape.
Partners with cross functional team members to creatively solve client challenges.
Actively participates in brainstorms, concept development and execution.
Provides art and writing direction & feedback.
Contributes innovative thinking that’s both conceptual and strategic.
Inspires and guides team in the development of compelling creative ideas.
Develops innovative solutions across all mediums and digital/social platforms.
Build compelling arguments required for effective client presentation.
Proactively identifies and formulates solutions to potential challenges.
Confidence in presenting with collective team to clients.
Supervises & mentors creatives on team.
Qualifications:
Education: BA/BS or graduate from Art/Ad school.
Portfolio which represents abilities to concept and produce compelling work.
7+ years agency experience.
Proficient in Word, Keynote.
A little about us:

We are compelling commerce. We unlock the commercial potential of brands by creative Brand + Buying Experiences. A pillar of Omnicom Commerce, we offer full-service capabilities ranging from innovation to implementation. Clients include PepsiCo, Diageo, Starbucks, P&G, Pizza Hut, LEGO and more!

At the time of posting, a reasonable estimate of the base salary of this role is $105k-$115k. Salaries will vary based on various factors including but not limited to professional and academic experience, associated responsibilities, and other organizational needs. The range listed is just one component of our total compensation package for employees. Salary decisions are dependent on the circumstances of each hire. This is an exempt position. If your requirements fall outside of this range, you are still welcome to apply.

Benefits include:
Great paid holiday schedule as well as vacation, sick and personal days.
Health, vision, dental, 401K, employee stock purchase plan.
Education assistance, paid parental leave, HSA & FSA.
Family forming benefits, commuter benefits, travel assistance and identity theft support.
Omnicom Employee Discounts.
... and more.

We have returned to the office in a hybrid capacity (3+ days/week in the office.) Our office locations are: Stamford (CT), Denver (CO), Irving (TX), and Chicago (IL).

SCAM ALERT:
Our Tracy-Locke & Haygarth US recruiting team will NEVER ask you to send us money, technology or anything else in order to work for one of our companies. If you believe you are the victim of a scam, please contact the FTC at https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/articles/job-scams#avoid.

title: Digital Content Creator
description:
Summary:
Reporting to the Director, Content & Strategy, the Digital Content Creator is responsible for creating and publishing engaging content for the company’s digital channels, including website, social media, email, print and blogs.
The Digital Content Creator will work with the Director of Content & Strategy to develop and execute content strategies that align with the company's overall marketing goals.
Will be a key member of the Marketing team and plays a vital role in helping the company achieve its marketing goals.
The Digital Content Creator is a creative and innovative thinker with a passion for digital content creation.
This is a Hybrid position where you will work 3 days/week in the Administrative office in Irvine and 2 days/week from your home office.

Responsibilities:
Pull together engaging content, carefully proof and edit content, then hand over for publishing or broadcast.
Design graphics and videos.
Capture, produce and edit video content that is specific for various channels including social media, website, emails, YouTube, etc.
Deliver professional, high-quality content to inform and engage various audiences, including prospects, students, alumni and internal stakeholders.
Collaborate with other team members to develop and execute content strategies.
Support other departments through collaboration on story ideas, content collection/production, etc.
Track and analyze content performance.
Research and write content on a variety of topics.
Knowledge of digital marketing concepts including SEO, social media marketing, and email marketing.
Familiarity with marketing automation tools and platforms.
Ensure that all content aligns with the college/university’s brand guidelines and maintains a consistent and compelling voice.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Business or related field.

Experience/Qualifications:
2+ years of experience in digital content creation.
Experience with social media marketing.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Creative and innovative thinker and storyteller.
Experience with graphic design and video editing software.
Experience with storyboarding and planning for capturing video content as well as capturing the content.
Photography and videography experience.
Experience with content management and delivery while adhering to brand awareness.
Experience managing a large and consistently shifting editorial workload.
Experience with content management systems (CMS).
Experience with marketing automation software.
Familiarity with AP and Chicago style conventions, excellent spelling, and grammar skills.
Strong understanding of SEO, social media, email marketing and paid advertising.

title: Global Executive Associate, CNCC
description:
Condé Nast is a global media company producing the highest quality content with a footprint of more than 1 billion consumers in 32 territories through print, digital, video and social platforms. The company’s portfolio includes many of the world’s most respected and influential media properties including Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler/Traveller, Allure, AD, Bon Appétit and Wired, among others.
Job Description
Location:
New York, NY
Condé Nast, the world-renowned media company, is a portfolio of iconic brands (Vogue, The New Yorker, GQ, Vanity Fair, and many more) that champion exceptionality and inspire community. Condé Nast Commercial Creative—our global marketing, creative, experiential and production arm— transforms the stronghold our brands have on hearts and minds into elegant and actionable content, programs, and partnerships.
We are a global network of award-winning creatives; leaders in the fields of development, strategy, production, and talent across all platforms, and operating in 13 markets across four continents.
We are designing the future of our company and our industry, and we’re inspired by the opportunity ahead of us to build a global creative community that can leverage commercial interest and investment to build the next era of success for Condé Nast. Our ideal candidates will be excited to make an impact on that process.
You are…
Our biggest fan & an industry expert- you’re tapped into Condé Nast’s brands and culture, with an interest in the topics that we live and breath: fashion, luxury, and design, music & the arts, food & travel, health & wellness, media & entertainment, and more
A true creative- creativity means a lot more than the traditional sense of the word, and you know it. Whether you’re a visual storyteller or an operations wiz, you know how to add an innovative creative spin/solution to any project.
A team player- we work closely with our cross-functional partners on a daily basis, you are an open collaborator who is willing to take on essential tasks when needed.
A savvy problem solver- you’re able to find innovative solutions and pivot quickly when curveballs are thrown your way.
A people person-you know how to get the best out of a team/client/partner while maintaining great relationships, and approach situations with a positive attitude.
An organized self-starter- you excel at working independently and being proactive, and work through tasks in an organized manner.
A champion of diversity and inclusion- you prioritize diverse perspectives, voices, and collaborators in all regions.
Job Description:
The Associate will directly support the VPs of Condé Nast Commercial Creative (Creative Strategy, Brand, Events, Production & Activation, Creative) with all administrative needs, special projects, and proactive day-to-day responsibilities.
Key Responsibilities:
General administrative support such as calendar management, expense reports and booking travel/hotels for corporate travel, travel itineraries, etc for all VPs.
Act as a bridge between the Commercial Creative leadership team, and all other stakeholders across Condé Nast.
Organize and facilitate Commercial meetings, activities and assemblies-like weekly leadership meetings, All-Hands meetings, etc.
Support with programming and event execution of the commercial organization’s biggest annual projects (e.g. Annual Sales Summit, NewFronts, etc)
Maintain and create department resources (like shared drives, one-sheets, marketing collateral, etc)
Support on materials for proactive multi-market global programs that leverage Condé Nast brand elements and are built for advertiser integration.
Maintain department resources: shared drives, one-sheets creating and updating marketing collateral
Assist teams in managing and reporting individual budgets
Assist VPs in preparing both internal and external materials for special projects (taskforces, tentpoles, etc)
Assist VPs in developing and executing actionable project plans for special projects- providing timely project updates and proactively flagging issues for necessary parties
Essential Skills & Requirements:
BA / BS degree in business, marketing, partnerships or equivalent practical experience
1-3 years professional experience in media, agency, new business, partnerships; with direct experience in a similar role
Intermediate to advanced GSuite/Office and presentation design skills
Extremely organized with exceptional time management skills and able to prioritize efficiently.
Confident and able to communicate with staff at different levels and across different departments internationally.
Excellent written and verbal communication and interpersonal and relationship management skills.
Self-driven and motivated, with an ability to show initiative in all situations and the ability to take responsibility for actions.
Highly agile and flexible working approach, trustworthy and discreet, with a friendly and personable manner.
Helpful to have experience of working in an international environment and building solid working relationships with teams across different countries, time zones and cultures.
Base Salary: $60k-$65k
What happens next?
If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply below, and we will review your application as soon as possible. You can update your resume or upload a cover letter at any time by accessing your candidate profile.
Condé Nast is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Marketing Communications Specialist
location: 5151 State University Dr, Los Angeles, CA 90032
description:
Job no: 533675
Work type: Staff
Location: Los Angeles
Categories: Unit 9 - CSUEU - Technical Support Services, Administrative, Temporary, Full Time
Job No: 533675; 12/7/2023

MARKETING COMMUNICATIONS SPECIALIST
Public Affairs Communications Specialist III
College of Business and Economics Dean's Office

Salary Range: $4,391 - $7,945/Monthly

Work Schedule: Full-Time, Monday – Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.; temporary position, ends on or before one year from the date of hire; may be extended; may become permanent; exempt classification.

Essential Functions: Under the general direction of and reporting to the Dean of the College of Business & Economics (CBE), the incumbent will be responsible for independent performance of the day-to-day communication activities for the College. The incumbent oversees design of all CBE marketing materials including but not limited to: creating, designing and updating CBE marketing content and collateral via marketing channels (e.g., print, rad10, newsletters, web, social media, etc.).; support the College's mission; develop metrics, conduct analyses, and report on progress and value of the College's marketing and social media efforts; oversee marketing content; oversee content production including College photography and videography and manage digital archives of photography/videography; develop and design marketing content via the College's web and mobile marketing presence; oversee the College's social media strategy which includes the administration of Linkedln, MailChimp, Twitter, FaceBook, Instagram, SnapChat and other CBE accounts for the dual purpose attracting prospective students and engaging with current students and alumni; oversee web marketing and search engine marketing on behalf of all CBE programs; use created content to optimize the College's website for search engines; work with College's ITCs and University Social Media Network Group; and revise website content as necessary; lead redesign efforts on behalf of the College; work closely with senior staff to develop and execute the marketing and communications strategy; help ensure consistency of messaging and voice across all media channels; be responsible for helping to develop and bring our brand for the College to life through the varied communication channels and marketing collateral including but not limited to e-newsletters, dean's annual report, marketing campaigns, public relations, and external and internal communications; will collaborate with and support the efforts of various college content providers to ensure that the College's communications content is consistent with the mission and strategic initiatives of the College and University; and will produce written and graphic/visual content to help promote and share the College's activities through interaction with students, faculty, staff, donors, and alumni. Provides lead direction to a marketing communications team of graphics and web designer, marketing assistant(s).

Required Qualifications & Experience: Bachelor's degree or equivalent from an accredited four-year college or university with a degree in marketing, communications, journalism, public relations, or related fields, or similar certified coursework in applicable fields of study. The incumbent must have knowledge of Dream weaver, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat, InDesign, or other software and working knowledge of current web software, databases and browsers including HTML (e.g., Drupal 8). The incumbent must also have working knowledge of copyright and other applicable laws pertaining to publications and the news media. The incumbent must have excellent writing/editing and verbal communication skills with a solid foundation in composing communication for various media vehicles; graphic design skills; self-reliant, sound reasoning skills, good problem solver, and results oriented; exceptional interpersonal skills and networking skills, including strong consultative and persuasive skills to work with internal and external constituents; strong leadership skills; strong organizational skills, and excellent online research skills including use of search engines. The incumbent must have demonstrated ability in drafting, editing, and proofreading documents with advanced proficiency in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook; communicate complex subjects with simple, direct writing that inspires audiences to take action; analyze and select pertinent facts and integrate them into the appropriate communication channels; conduct market analysis, market segmentation, and marketing campaigns as well as marketing campaign analysis that includes marketing ROI a track record in project management and implementation, with the ability to successfully manage a variety of key initiatives concurrently; self-starter, able to work independently and entrepreneurially; enjoys creating and implementing initiatives; energetic, flexible, collaborative, and proactive; be a team leader as well as a team member reliable, with strong attention to detail and a strong work ethic; effectively organize work in order to meet deadlines and time-tables; and to independently identify opportunities to improve communication strategies and processes. The incumbent must have a demonstrated interest and/or ability to work in a multicultural/multiethnic environment. A background check (including a criminal records check) must be completed satisfactorily before any candidate can be offered a position with the California State University. Failure to satisfactorily complete the background check may affect the application status of applicants or continued employment of current California State University employees who may apply for the position.

California State University, Los Angeles, as part of the CSU system, is a State of California Employer. As such, the University requires all employees upon date of hire to reside in the State of California.

As of January 1, 2022 the CSU Out-of-State Employment Policy prohibits the hiring of employees to perform CSU-related work outside the state of California.

Desired Qualifications: Master's degree from an accredited four-year college or university in marketing, communications or related field. Four years of experience in the field of marketing and/or communications. Experience in an academic setting; experience working with HTML email software; and experience in running an integrated marketing campaign. Proficient in use of interactive marketing techniques such as video sharing, social networks, email marketing and blogs.

Closing Date: Review of applications will begin on December 21, 2023 and will continue until the position is filled; however, the position may close when an adequate number of qualified applications are received. A COMPLETED ON-LINE CAL STATE LA EMPLOYMENT APPLICATION IS REQUIRED. RESUMES WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED IN LIEU OF A COMPLETED APPLICATION.

The person holding this position is considered a "mandated reporter" under the California Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Act and is required to comply with the requirements set forth in CSU Executive Order 1083 revised July 21, 2017, as a condition of employment.

In addition to meeting fully its obligations under federal and state law, California State University, Los Angeles is committed to creating a community in which a diverse population can live and work in an atmosphere of tolerance, civility and respect for the rights and sensibilities of each individual. To that end, all qualified individuals will receive equal consideration without regard to economic status, race, ethnicity, color, religion, disability, national origin or cultural background, political views, sex or sexual orientation, gender, or other personal characteristics or beliefs.

Candidates must demonstrate ability and/or interest in working in a multicultural/multiethnic environment. Certain positions require fingerprinting. The University actively encourages qualified minorities, women and persons with a disability to apply. Upon request, reasonable accommodation will be provided to individuals with protected disabilities to (a) complete the employment process and (b) perform essential job functions when this does not cause an undue hardship. We are an Equal Opportunity/Title IX Employer.

title: Content Writer
description:
California School Employees Association
Content Writer - San Jose, CA

Definition
The Content Writer creates copy for CSEAs website and web-based applications, including digital, social or print media. This position creates, curates and manages digital content across multiple channels to market CSEAs brand, values and services to members.

Supervision received and exercised
This position reports to the Director and/or Assistant Director of Communications. It has no direct reports.

Distinguishing characteristics
The Content Writer is required to demonstrate the ability to create copy that engages the reader with imagination, spirit and insight. The writing and editing should adapt to a variety of media to inspire action, interest and connection. This position is characterized by writing brief, precise messages using limited space, as well as presentations or reports that may include tables, graphs, or analysis of data.

An incumbent in this position is required to demonstrate a considerable degree of creativity, collaboration, initiative, attention to detail, and good judgment in carrying out duties. The consequence of error in judgment may be critical to CSEAs image and brand, both internally and externally.

Examples of duties
Collaborates with graphic designers, website technicians, multi-media and video production specialists to write, edit and produce materials that enhance CSEAs visibility and brand
Writes, edits, proofreads copy and promotes content for print, social, and digital media that reflects our values and our members voices
Updates website
Acts as a resource to others in teaching the unions new media and social networking techniques
Develops written templates for use on social media for Field Operations
Develops online expertise of members and staff
Communicates best practices in using social media
Brainstorms creative concepts and ideas to promote membership in CSEA
Recommends new topics
Writes with a clear, distinct voice
Tells stories and writes testimonials
Brings voices to life with language, tone and message
Scripts dialogue, creates characters, develops storylines that reflect our values and our members voices
Records and edits testimonials for audio/video use
Creates, produces and edits themes and messages
Submits copy to editors for input and review
Adheres to guidelines for branding, style and design
Implements an electronic influence strategy to engage members
Monitors, listens and responds as needed via social media channels
Integrates social networking techniques into campaign strategies
Writes messages and themes for use with campaign technologies
Analyzes, reports on social media metrics
Markets services and benefits of membership
Writes to reflect our values and our members voices
Advocates for CSEAs values, mission and services
Uses search engine optimization guidelines to increase web traffic
Writes, delivers presentations
Prepares questionnaires and surveys
Conducts research and interviews
Uses tables, charts, and graphs to inform and influence
Analyzes, reports on trends and issues using statistical data
Participates in strategic planning meetings
Completes multiple projects with short deadlines
Other duties as assigned

Minimum qualifications

Knowledge of:
Web formatting tools
Content management systems
Advertising, marketing
Digital content management
Data analysis
Project management
Search engine optimization
Running social media campaigns on various platforms
Grammar, AP style, Chicago Manual of Style, and/or Strunk and Whites Elements of Style for creative and imaginative writing
Conducting research using multiple sources, including Google analytics and interviewing subject matter experts
Popular culture, and new advertising trends and techniques
Social media and a flair for marketing
Familiarity with social media scheduling platforms like Hootsuite
Translation of written documents into Spanish is a plus

Skills:
Superb writing, editing and proofreading skills
Strong research skills
Excellent written, interpersonal, and communication skills
Proficiency with Office 365 including Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Design experience helpful not required

Ability to:
Improve, enhance member satisfaction
Write with clarity in a simple, crisp style
Research and summarize information or data
Write quickly and perform under tight deadlines
Adapt style to a variety of voices, on many different subjects, to a variety of media
Be creative, imaginative, and curious
Problem-solve
Work well in a team of creative people
Take critical feedback
Show strong attention to detail
Absorb traditional best practices and adapt to future trends
Design or develop apps for mobile devices

Education
BA degree in writing, literature, art, communications or related field.

Experience
2 years experience in writing or producing copy for digital, print or broadcast channels
Experience developing apps helpful, but not required
Additional experience may be substituted for education requirement on a year for year basis.

The salary range for Content Writer is $72,572 - $89,904. Starting salaries are typically at the first step on our salary range, although consideration may be given for candidates with exceptional qualifications and experience.

CSEA offers outstanding salaries and benefits, including 18 paid holidays, 3 weeks’ vacation, medical benefits for you and your family, life insurance coverage, and a pension and 401(k) plan.

Only applications made on our web site will be considered. To apply for the position you are interested in, go to: www.csea.com/careers, upload your resume and write a cover letter to tell us why this ad caught your eye and why we should hire you as our next Content Writer!

Questions? Contact HR at HREmail@csea.com. Please do not send resumes or other documents to this email.

CSEA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, committed to building and supporting a diverse workforce.

This is a non-exempt position under the Fair Labor Standards Act.

title: Digital Marketing Coordinator ($29.04-33.85)
description:

At Irvine Company, we attribute much success to the strength of our marketing team. To build on this momentum, we’re searching for a highly qualified Marketing Coordinator to work closely with them. Perched upon 504 acres of unrivaled coastal beauty, The Resort at Pelican Hill is a world unto itself with seven exceptional dining options, 36 holes of world-class golf and the #1 Spa in California.

title: Senior Content Strategist
description:
Company Description

Merkle is a global Customer Experience Design and Management Agency and serves as the digital consulting arm of Dentsu. We help clients enhance customer relationships and transform customer experiences through combinations of technology, strategy and customer-centric storytelling and design. Our Experience Creative studios provide Service and Product transformation, Connected Commerce experiences, Systems Design, Loyalty and Promotion services, and CRM, Digital Content and Marketing programs. We believe in the power of technology and design to create immense value for brands and transform people's lives.

Job Description

Reporting to the Senior Content Strategy Director, you'll lead strategic agreement between clients and our teams by guiding the creation of audience-centric content for the best customer experiences. You'll grow the Content Strategy capability by establishing tools, best practices, and elevating the value of content strategy in service and product design.
Key Responsibilities
You'll create content strategies that support our client's goals and audience needs, and collaborate with teams to ensure strategic understanding of content throughout the customer experience.
You'll create frameworks and deliverables for service and product design projects including, content audits and models, matrices, and content journey, site, and migration maps.
You'll partner with experience strategists and analysts understand audience needs, data insights, and competitive landscapes across industries to inform goals.
You'll create content governance plans and content supply chain workflows to help clients operationalize and manage content for products and services.
You'll develop taxonomy, tagging, and metadata strategies for content distribution across owned channels and technology platforms.

Qualifications
5 years minimum experience in a strategic content role within an agency environment
Bachelor's degree in a related field
Experience with content management systems and measurement platforms
Experience turning data into insights to refine content strategies for long-term success
Comfortable presenting points of view to leadership and our clients

Additional Information

title: Lead Content Strategist
description:
Lead Content Strategist (Sr. Manager, Web Content Strategy) - This role has a remote option.
Resolute Digital is an award-winning creative agency that creates best-in-class digital experiences for some of the world's biggest global brands. We're looking for a Lead Content Strategist to join the agency's Creative Experience and Technology practice. Specifically, this role is accountable for strategy, development, and execution of content strategy and content design across multiple platforms for clients. The Lead Content Strategist will collaborate with our user experience, search, development, editorial, and solutions teams to provide strategic counsel and data-driven content insights throughout the full project lifecycle. Sound like you? Keep reading!
About You
You are client-facing with experience indirectly or directly leading projects from pitch or ideation through flawless execution. One of the most important aspects of this position is the ability to be the conductor of the team and be a proactive, solution-oriented, and collaborative practitioner.
You must be a self-starter with a passion for digital and collaborating across creative, user experience, account, technology and digital production. You should enjoy working in a team environment and be detail oriented with respect to tasks and communication, across multiple projects and accounts.
You are part wordsmith extraordinaire, part analytic thinker with an insatiable desire for solving our clients' complex business challenges. You have a strong background in User-Centered Design and Editorial working with cross-functional teams. You should be comfortable being accountable for all aspects of content strategy deliverables on large-scale account(s) ranging from content audits and strategic frameworks—and everything in between.
Job Responsibilities
You know you're ready to become a Lead Content Strategist at Resolute if you can effortlessly:
Collaborate with UX, search, and business stakeholders to develop a sound content strategy for website redesigns, brand campaign landing pages, or net new websites.
Creating captivating and engaging client presentations and workshops, including facilitating internal and external sessions.
Partner with content creators to ensure work falls in line with the content strategy: on-brand and consistent in terms of style, quality, and tone of voice, and appropriate for the intended audience.
Serve as a UX Writer / Content Designer on projects as needed, creating engaging and conversational web content for branded and unbranded websites.
Configure and manage content inventories and audits.
Create content templates, outlines, and summaries incorporating metadata.
Edit copy from copywriters to ensure it falls in line with the content strategy.
Liaise with UX designers on crafting wireframes and content models (skeletons) using Figma, XD, or Sketch real-time and offline via annotations.
Optimize content for search engines, accessibility, voice search, and mobile experiences.
Conduct quantitative and qualitative content analysis on current sites, both owned and competitors.
Preferred Qualifications
But you've never just given the minimum in life, right? Ideally you have experience:
Creating navigational models and website taxonomies for large, Enterprise clients
Working within a modular and component-based framework or content management system
Partnering with Search and Analytics teams to make data-driven optimization recommendations
Researching, analyzing, and integrating keywords into copy and strategies
Proposing content balance recommendations for both formats and content types
About Resolute Digital
Resolute Digital is a data driven marketing and technology firm headquartered in New York. Resolute has deep expertise in website analytics, search engine marketing, performance marketing, mobile and web design. Its data-first approach to audience intelligence, customer acquisition and brand engagement has delivered sophisticated digital mobile and paid media solutions for some of the world's leading companies and brands.
Resolute is part of Weber Shandwick a leading global communications and engagement firm in 77 cities across 31 countries, with a network extending to 129 cities in 81 countries. The firm's diverse team of strategists, analysts, producers, designers, developers and campaign activators has won the most prestigious awards in the world for innovative, creative approaches and impactful work. Weber Shandwick is part of the Interpublic Group (NYSE: IPG).
Weber Shandwick is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Weber Shandwick recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, ethnic or national origin, protected veteran status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status or citizenship status.
NYC Salary range: $85,000 - $110,000
Where an employee or prospective employee is paid within this range will depend on, among other factors, actual ranges for current/former employees in the subject position; market considerations; budgetary considerations; tenure and standing with the company (applicable to current employees); as well as the employee's/applicant's background, pertinent experience, and qualifications.

title: Market Research Manager, Innovation
description:

Provides strategic consultation to help client understand the research questions/methodologies to address key business challenges

Completed Bachelor’s Degree, master’s level education an asset
At least 3 years of market research experience.
Advanced proficiency with MS Office Suite; specifically, MS Excel and MS PowerPoint
Superior organizational skills, unflagging attention to detail & demonstrated commitment to the accuracy and completeness of information
Data savvy with a strong attention to detail and accuracy
Basic knowledge of SPSS and/or other quantitative reporting tools a plus
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while maintaining a strong client service orientation
Ability to manage complex, multi-faceted project budgets and to create, manage, and commit to a project plan, schedule and budget
Highly motivated, self-directed & possess a driven personality capable of working within tight deadlines

Excellent written & verbal communication skills with well-developed interpersonal and presentation skills

title: Internal Communications Associate
description:
Blue Yonder Title:
Internal Communications Associate
Location:
Remote – must be located near either Dallas (preferred) or Scottsdale
Overview:
This is an extraordinary opportunity to join our dynamic Blue Yonder internal communications team at the forefront of our industry-leading Supply Chain Organization. As we navigate a transformative season of growth, impacting over 6,000+ global associates and serving renowned customers worldwide, this role presents a unique chance to contribute to our mission of driving improved value, sustainability, and impact. You will play a pivotal role in orchestrating, collaborating, and communicating effectively across our diverse global team. The work you do will directly influence our ability to foster a culture of innovation, engagement, and positive change.

What you will do:
Communications and Content Creation:
Develop and draft engaging and impactful internal communications across various channels, including email, intranet, and other digital platforms.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather information and insights for effective communication strategies.
Multimedia Support:
Assist in the creation of multimedia content, such as presentations, videos, and graphics, to enhance internal communications and engagement.
Project and Change Management:
Support project and change management initiatives by contributing to communication plans and materials that facilitate smooth transitions and updates.
Event Support:
Assist in the planning and execution of company-wide events, including all-hands meetings, town halls, and other internal gatherings.
Stakeholder Engagement:
Foster positive relationships with stakeholders across different regions to ensure consistent messaging and alignment with organizational goals.
Monitoring and Reporting:
Monitor the effectiveness of internal communications through key performance indicators (KPIs) and provide regular reports with insights and recommendations.
Training and Development:
Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices in internal communications.
Participate in training sessions to enhance skills related to communication strategies, tools, and platforms.
What we are looking for:
Bachelor's degree in Communications, Public Relations, Marketing, or a related field (soon to complete bachelor's degree will be considered).
At least 3-6+ years of relevant experience in communications, public relations, or a related field is a plus.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to synthesize complex details into easy-to-understand communications.
Flexibility to work across multiple time zones and cultural differences
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant communication tools.
Ability to work collaboratively in a global, cross-functional environment.
Basic understanding of project and change management principles.
BONUS: Experience with Adobe Creative Suite, E-Learning Development Tools, Video and Audio Production
BONUS: Strong public speaking experience – comfortable presenting to various audience sizes (10-2,500k +)
BONUS: Experience utilizing Office 365 and Intranet content management
BONUS: Familiar with ChatGPT/Generative AI tools for improving communications content and efficiency

Why CHOC?
At CHOC, we strive to be the leading destination of children’s health by providing exceptional and innovative care. We are responsible for the overall health of our community’s pediatric population in our hospitals, clinics, and practices. And because of our breadth of care, your career at CHOC can be as diverse and fulfilling as you determine. CHOC’s compensation structure, benefits offerings, and career development programs are geared to helping you achieve your professional and personal goals. The Assistant Director is responsible for composing special gift acknowledgment letters, donor impact reports, scripting, endowment reporting and other writing that illustrates the impact of philanthropy at CHOC Children's. Research, develop, edit, format, and shepherd

title: Social Media Specialist | Remote
description:
We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Social Media Specialist to join our Audience team. As a Social Media Specialist you will be responsible for developing, implementing, and managing social media strategies across various platforms, including LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, and X.

Strong organizational and multitasking skills to thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.

title: Research Analyst, Corporate
description:
TelevisaUnivision is seeking a Full Time Research Analyst for Corporate Research in Los Angeles. Responsibilities include compiling and analyzing Nielsen ratings, reporting on competitive spend, and creating presentations for use by TelevisaUnivision Local Media Sales, News, Finance, and Distribution, along with other departments at TelevisaUnivision.
The ideal candidate must be able to demonstrate an interest in media and marketing research, have strong math skills, exhibit excellent written and oral communication skills, be a strategic and creative thinker, a self-starter, and a collaborator willing to learn and share ideas. Training will be provided.
Your Day to Day
Analysts will be responsible for tracking and analyzing Media Research data for the executive, sales and programming teams. They are also responsible for creating research reports and PowerPoint presentations with the goal of increasing sales revenue, Local Media (TV/Radio stations and Multi-Market Sales) profitability, and audience levels.
Analyze Nielsen audience data for Univision stations and its competitors on a daily, weekly and monthly basis.
Produce audience delivery trend reports and highlights for sales, programming, marketing and all levels of management.
Prepare media one-sheets and customized presentations to support the sales effort.
Running competitive advertising spend data across all media (TV, Audio, Digital) for both standard reporting and ad-hoc projects.
Participation in special projects.
You Have
An eye for detail – this is extremely important for both presentations and accuracy in numbers.
Ability to work independently on big projects for long periods of time.
Strong organizational, project management, and communication skills.
Eligibility Requirements
Must be willing to work from a TelevisaUnivision office at least part-time in Los Angeles.
Employment/education will be verified.
Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis.
Exact compensation may vary based on skills, experience, and location. Please note the national salary range listed in the job posting reflects the new hire salary range across levels and U.S. locations that would be applicable to the position. Base pay Range $45k-60k+ benefits
Our Benefits

title: Marketing Operations Lead
description:
at Parachute Health
U.S. Remote
In the U.S. alone, over 30 million patients per year are prescribed care via paper and fax. The legacy ordering process is long, complicated, and yields an 83% error rate, resulting in patients ending up in the hospital or worse.
The world is transitioning to Digital Ordering across the healthcare industry. At Parachute Health, we’re leading the charge with a platform that is 10 times faster than the status quo. We connect with major hospitals, payors, and suppliers of life-saving products. Our vision of a "delightfully simple" digital ordering experience for clinicians pushes us forward to transforming the world of post-acute care.
Since launching, we’ve helped millions of patients. Founded in New York City, we’ve grown across 50 states and partnered with 50,000 clinical facilities and over 2,000 supplier locations across 20,000+ products on the Parachute Platform.
About Parachute
Parachute Health is the industry leading ePrescribing Platform for durable medical equipment (DME) and supplies - think everything from state of the art glucose monitors to walkers. And we are changing industry and improving patient care by destroying the ever-present fax that is still used for many of these orders!
The ordering process is convoluted and fax-based, leading to high cost of care, clinician dissatisfaction and poor patient outcomes. While the drug industry adopted ePrescribing long ago, the transition to digital is only now underway for DME, and Parachute Health is leading this transition. At Parachute Health, it is our mission to make sure that every patient gets the medical equipment and supplies they need, when they need it. We achieve this by driving efficiency through digital connectivity into every aspect of the ordering process, making it delightfully simple.
Parachute Health is looking to do the same for our Marketing Operations and are expanding our marketing team: We are looking for a motivated Senior Marketing Operations Associate interested in healthcare and technology marketing to help us tell healthcare professionals and medical equipment suppliers about ePrescribing for DME, and about Parachute Health — and measure the impact of those efforts!
About the Role
The Senior Marketing Operations Associate will support Parachute’s presence at industry conferences and other events and manage a marketing tech stack to help tell the DME industry about Parachute Health! Ideally you understand marketing channels including industry conferences, have built lead gen campaigns in a CRM (Hubspot experience required), set up automated email and social media campaigns, and love to tinker with workflows to get pipelines and reporting just right.
Here’s what you will do:
Drive Parachute Health lead generation at industry conferences and events by owning planning and execution before, during, and after key events
Manage and optimize lead gen campaigns across the marketing funnel
Serve as a subject matter expert for Hubspot and other areas of the marketing tech stack, including email and workflow automation, optimizing our use of marketing tools to drive and convert qualified leads
Manage lead capture & qualification processes to ensure leads are correctly captured, qualified, and assigned.
Create and maintain tracking, attribution, and KPI reporting. Leverage insights to identify and recommend marketing optimization opportunities.. Collaborate with Marketing and Customer Success to communicate performance to the broader company.
Contribute to Parachute Health marketing content and collateral. Leverage experience and observation from industry conferences and analytics to optimize Parachute’s market messaging.
What We'll Expect From You
You have 3+ years of marketing operations experience in a similar role.
Willing to work with ambiguity.
Experience owning execution of lead gen campaigns.
Experience with Hubspot, headless CMS and other marketing software (e.g., customer.io).
Strong organization and project managing skills, comfortable with planning across the event marketing spectrum (marketing funnel, conference and event support, social media and ad campaigns).
Prior marketing and/or customer support role at relevant B2B tech and/or healthcare companies (e.g., enterprise SaaS, API-based, suppliers, providers).
Direct experience engaging various stakeholders, including executive leadership, on marketing and GTM initiatives to achieve goals and keep to timelines.
Self-starter who can independently prioritize workload based on company and team goals, turning big ideas into attainable and budget-driven results.
Thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Knowledge of what it takes to build a successful campaign, how to measure results, and troubleshoot.
Ability to easily switch gears from strategic thinking to tactical coordination and desire to do both.
Based in the U.S.
Benefits
Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
401(k) Retirement Plan
Remote-First Company with the option to work at our offices located in Denver and New York City
Equity Incentive Plan
Annual Company-Wide Bonus (up to 15%)
Flexible Vacation Policy
Summer Fridays - 5 Fridays Off During Summer (Separate From PTO)
Monthly Internet Stipend
Annual Home Office Stipend
Co-Working Space Reimbursement
Annual stipend for education and development
Base Salary Band
$100 -115k
