title: Product and Marketing Manager, US Market
description:
About Us
Trip.com Group Limited (Nasdaq: TCOM) is a leading one-stop travel service provider consisting of Trip.com, Ctrip, Skyscanner, and Qunar. Across its platforms, Trip.com Group enables local partners and travelers around the world to make informed and cost-effective bookings for travel products and services, through aggregation of comprehensive travel-related information and resources, and an advanced transaction platform consisting of mobile apps, Internet websites, and 24/7 customer service centers.
Founded in 1999, listed on the Nasdaq in 2003 and HKEX in 2021, Trip.com Group has become one of the largest travel companies in the world in terms of gross merchandise value.

Key Roles and Responsibilities:
Provide local market intelligence to global headquarters to influence global product and marketing strategy to achieve business targets and growth for Trip.com in the US market.
Explore potential partnerships to develop joint promotions.
Support corporate business development in the region, including collaboration with HQ marketing/BD/product/design functions
Monitor campaign and project performance with a great sense of data analysis and reading abilities with Bi (a-must). By data performance, you can optimize our future campaigns and projects, improve the customer experience, and analyze the conversion rate.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams for multi-projects and multi-campaigns, for example, all performance marketing channels, CRM, BI, UED, operation teams, sourcing teams, and HQ teams, to make sure the campaign and projects can be implemented smoothly.
Work closely with Trip’s global offices to collaborate on marketing and merchandising campaigns

Qualifications and Experiences Desired:
4+ years of working experience
Experience in a fast-paced growth environment with a start-up or scale-up will be a plus
Familiar with e-commerce and travel products
Excellent ability in verbal and written English; strong presentation skills are a must
Strong analytical skills and mindset, and preferably familiar with analytics tools
Results-driven, ambitious, and able to work independently and adapt quickly to changing situations
Good knowledge of technology, e-commerce, and web trends
Willing to travel when required.
Annual Base Salary
The annual base salary range is $94,000 - $140,000. The annual base for this role will vary based on multiple factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, experience, and location. Pay ranges may be modified in the future.

Annual Total Package
Employees in this role are eligible for annual bonuses based on their ongoing, demonstrated, and sustained performance in the role.

Benefits
Trip.com Group offers a wide range of benefits to support employees and their families, including health insurance with 4 PPO options and 1 HMO (CA-based employees only), dental insurance with 2 plan options, vision insurance with 1 plan option, basic life insurance, long-term disability insurance with benefits of up to $5,000 per month after 180 days of disability, and short-term disability insurance with benefits of up to $2,500 per week for up to 26 weeks of disability. We cover approximately 72.64% - 94.28% of the premium for employee medical insurance, and approximately 44.40% - 57.65% of the premium for dependents.
The company also offers a 401(k) plan with a matching contribution of 100% of the employee's deferral on the first 3% of eligible compensation and 50% of the employee's deferrals that exceed 3% but do not exceed 5% of eligible compensation, as well as time away from work for paid holidays (12 business days/year), paid sick leave (40 hours/year), paid time off (120 hours/year), and examination leave (32 hours/year).
Additionally, the company provides allowances and subsidies, such as business travel reimbursement, travel discounts, holiday allowance, and a vacation subsidy of USD 300 equivalent in the form of Trip Coins on Trip.com every year for employees who have completed at least 6 months of service with the company.

Why Trip.com Group
Joining Trip.com Group is like taking an adventure filled with excitement and success. With a group of fellows who are passionate about making every trip the perfect trip for over 400 million customers around the globe, you will be part of a journey of globalization and have a world-class stage to unleash your talent. Opportunities are unlimited, so is your growth. If you also embrace boldness and inclusion as we do, this is the place to leap forward!

title: Senior Marketing Specialist
description:
Senior Marketing Specialist
Location: Remote-New Jersey
If you’re passionate about marketing and digital technology and have marketing and/or advertising experience, we want you as part of our team! Our award-winning energy marketing team is growing and in search of a Marketing Specialist who is passionate about advertising and marketing and excited to learn and build a long-term career. We push the marketing and digital world forward, using technology and creativity to connect people with products and services to help better their lives and the environment. We’re looking for talented people ready to fulfill their potential.
About ICF's Advertising and Marketing Capabilities:
ICF is a consulting firm with the 8th largest independent marketing agency in the country, ICF Next. Our Marketing team is made up of more than 1,700 communications professionals. Within this team, is a marketing account services team who support energy clients through marketing strategy, advertising, and other marketing services to promote energy solutions, with a primary focus on energy efficiency. This team produces award-winning marketing work that changes behavior and ultimately helps individuals, communities, and the environment.
Ready to make a difference?
The Marketing Specialist will be part of the energy account services team and will work on planning, development, and implementation of marketing and advertising strategies and communications activities to support a large utility in NJ. The account services team conducts all aspects of marketing to include advertising, strategic planning, research, social media, events, outreach, and partnerships. To implement marketing campaigns, the team works with a 150-person creative and media services group. We help our clients and communities use less energy, save money, and help the environment through the development, implementation and refinement of marketing and outreach initiatives. We are looking for someone who is as passionate about our work as we are and has the skills and attitude to be successful. This position will be based in NJ but will be a work-from-home position. Minimal local travel is required.
Why you will love working here:
Quality of life: Flexible workplace arrangements, work-life balance
Investment of the community: Donation matching, volunteer opportunities
Investment in you: Tuition reimbursement, access to professional development resources, 401k matching, Employee Stock Purchase Plan
And many, many more (Ask your recruiter for more details!)
What you will be doing:
Assist in the planning, development and implementation of marketing and advertising strategies and activities to support a sales driven division within one of our utility clients.
Work with creative teams to develop advertising assets such as digital ads, direct mail, and social media along with marketing collateral such as forms and brochures.
Help develop presentations and other communications tools.
Assist with the strategy and execution of marketing and media plans within assigned budgets.
Track multiple team deliverables on deadlines using Microsoft Project, Excel spreadsheets, SharePoint, and other digital tools
Track and report on marketing campaign metrics
What we need you to have (minimum qualifications):
A bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, Advertising, or related majors AND 6+ years of working experience in marketing, advertising, social marketing, or related field; experience working in consumer marketing at an advertising agency is a plus.
OR
9+ years of working experience in marketing, advertising, social marketing, or related field; experience working in consumer marketing at an advertising agency is a plus.
What we would like you to have:
Experience in paid media, digital advertising, traditional marketing, and social media environments.
Experience working in a fast paced, deadline driven, multi-tasked environment
Experience working with digital media and providing a creative team with project details and strategic direction.
Experience working with and developing Excel spreadsheets to interpret data
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making capabilities
Experience marketing services or complex programs that may involve working with engineers or other technical professionals
Professional Skills:
Strong attention to accuracy; detail oriented
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to effectively prioritize tasks to meet aggressive deadlines
Strong organizational and interpersonal skills
Strong motivation and ability to learn and understand new concepts and strategies
Ability to work both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Demonstrated ability to work virtually including screen shares, video calls, and online collaboration
Proficiency in MS Office Applications (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Excel)

Working at ICF
ICF is a global advisory and technology services provider, but we’re not your typical consultants. We combine unmatched expertise with cutting-edge technology to help clients solve their most complex challenges, navigate change, and shape the future.
We can only solve the world's toughest challenges by building an inclusive workplace that allows everyone to thrive. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to hiring regardless of any protected characteristic, such as race, ethnicity, national origin, color, sex, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability status, or military/veteran status. Together, our employees are empowered to share their expertise and collaborate with others to achieve personal and professional goals. For more information, please read our
EEO & AA policy
.
Reasonable Accommodations are available, including, but not limited to, for disabled veterans, individuals with disabilities, and individuals with sincerely held religious beliefs, in all phases of the application and employment process. To request an accommodation please email
icfcareercenter@icf.com
and we will be happy to assist. All information you provide will be kept confidential and will be used only to the extent required to provide needed reasonable accommodations.
Read more about
workplace discrimination rights
, the
Pay Transparency Statement
, or our benefit offerings which are included in the
Transparency in (Benefits) Coverage Act.

Pay Range - There are multiple factors that are considered in determining final pay for a position, including, but not limited to, relevant work experience, skills, certifications and competencies that align to the specified role, geographic location, education and certifications as well as contract provisions regarding labor categories that are specific to the position. The pay range for this position is:
$72,402.00 - $123,084.00
New Jersey Remote Office (NJ99)

title: Creative Manager
description:
Overview
Lightship is a clinical trials service provider leading in increasing access and choice in taking part in research to improve equity for all. We design and conduct studies in partnership with biopharmaceutical companies to accelerate bringing new therapies to market. Our approach is to engage people where they are and support them across their journey in a clinical trial, from first contact to study completion. We work to make it easy, convenient, and safe for people to take part by offering visits in clinic, at home, using our mobile research units, and digital health tools. By transforming the way, we conduct clinical research, we can decrease study timelines and reduce dropouts to accelerate development of better therapies.
Given Lightship's distributed model and the remote nature of this position, the Creative Manager must possess a willingness and desire to work independently without significant oversight. Lightship expects each individual to anchor their availability in the standard operating hours for their geographic location, however, true to our values of inclusion and flexibility, this role, along with all others at Lightship, may be asked to flex work hours to accommodate US West Coast, US East Coast, and UK-based time zones, based on business and/or patient needs. In practice, this may translate to days that have a slightly earlier start or evenings that have a slightly later end. Culturally, we aim to balance the ability to operate across time zones with respect for each individual's daily life. Additionally, this position may require occasional travel for visits and key meetings.
The Creative Manager is responsible for:
Produce fresh, innovative work that translates complex ideas into compelling materials and digital experiences for sophisticated audiences
Creating marketing and advertising material for print, digital, electronic and internet distribution that effectively promotes studies to potential volunteers and patients.
Ensure that all of the organization's or client's creative output and visuals are consistent with the overall brand.
Effectively managing advertisements to ensure cost per lead does not increase substantially over time.
Targeting market segments with specific graphics and copy that resonate with the audience in an effort to lower the cost per lead.
Cultivating organic patient engagement on all relevant social media platforms.
Maintaining social media calendar for all patient facing content to leverage the to lower the cost of patient recruitment overtime, with communities and retargeting.
Developing schedules by collaborating with Recruitment Team and study project managers.
Conducting brainstorming sessions with creative team, maintaining strategic thinking to develop innovative and actionable initiatives in a fiscally responsible manner.
Creating ad proposals for each study.
Submitting proposals to sponsors and the IRB.
Creating and maintain an IRB approval tracker.
Prioritizing work and resources across engagements, based on short- and long-term needs.
Other duties as assigned.
The Marketing Manager has:
Required knowledge, skills, and abilities:
Proven success in executing brand and marketing strategies
Prior experience creating and presenting to key stakeholders
Ability to work independently as a team player
Ability to adapt to changing priorities while maintaining demanding timelines
Ability to work simultaneously on multiple projects
Critical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent Attention to Detail
Education and experience
5+ years of marketing management within clinical operations and / or clinical research
Bachelor's Degree, required; advanced degree in healthcare-related field or MBA, preferred
Requisite combination of education, training, and experience
We would like to offer you:
An opportunity to help re-envision how clinical research is executed with inclusivity, increased diversity and accessible at the core
The chance to work with a patient-centered, clinically-oriented, collaborative team to support in the delivery of enterprise grade virtual-first clinical research solutions at scale
An unmatched opportunity to grow as part of an established startup with industry veterans, high-caliber investors, and a massive market opportunity
Great compensation
Generous benefits package, including:
Top notch healthcare (medical, dental, and vision) for you and your family.
Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO), plus paid holidays and bereavement to help support work life balance.
A 100% 401(k) company match for up to 4% of eligible contributions with an immediate vesting.
A home office stipend to set yourself up for success in our distributed working environment
Company provided laptop, your choice of a PC or a Mac
Monthly stipend for internet and phone expenses
Generous paid parental leave
Short & long-term disability
Life insurance and More!
The base salary range for this role is between $95,000-$145,000+, depending on education, skills, and experience. To determine our compensation, we use a market-based approach that is geographically neutral. We believe that this demonstrates our company value of 'believing in people' – valuing the outputs and performance of each team member.
Please note: For the safety of our patients and each other, all positions at Lightship that require travel, in-person participation, or are patient-facing, do require vaccination against COVID-19.
Our commitment to diversity & inclusion:
Lightship is an equal opportunity employer and promotes a diverse and inclusive workplace. Lightship considers all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, disability, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law. EEO is the Law
Lightship is an E-Verify employer. Find out more here: Right to Work Poster E-Verify Participation Poster
#jobs #careers #nowhiring #hiringnow #LI-remote

title: Associate Professional Supply Management
description:
Auto req ID: 23152
Title: Associate Professional Supply Management
Job Function: Finance
Location: Remote
Company: Harley-Davidson Motor Company
Full or Part-Time: Full Time

At Harley-Davidson, we are building more than machines. It’s our passion and commitment to continue the evolution of this storied brand, and heighten the desirability of the Harley-Davidson experience. To keep building our legend and leading our industry through innovation, evolution, and emotion we need the best and brightest talent. We stand for the timeless pursuit of adventure. Freedom for the soul. Are you ready to join us?

We maximize employee flexibility and well-being through a virtual mindset that supports our highly distributed, global workforce. We take an outcome-focused, people-centered approach to winning, including welcoming the best talent - wherever they may be.

This remote role is not tightly linked to a physical location and provides flexibility in where, when and how you accomplish your work. Remote employees are expected to have a dedicated, quiet and distraction-free work space and an internet connection that’s sufficient for completing their job remotely.
Job Summary
Join our team as an Associate Professional Supply Management within the Indirect Procurement team. The position will assist with the development and execution of category plans, contracting and sourcing strategies that include industry trends, spend analytics, project pipeline, cost savings and resource planning activities. This is a remote role.
Job Responsibilities
Negotiate professional services agreements and statements of work.
Engage and collaborate with internal Legal, Risk and Security departments to ensure contract agreement compliance pertaining to legal implications; terms and conditions required to protect the company.
Assist in the development and execute cost savings strategies to support company goals and commitments.
Assist in developing RFx documents, evaluating supplier proposals (scope, cost, timing, resource modeling, risk, etc.), supplier recommendation and qualification.
Support multiple domestic and international indirect spend categories including but not limited to HR, Marketing and Professional Services.

Education Requirements
Bachelor's Degree Preferred
Education Specifications
Bachelor’s Degree preferred in supply chain, marketing, business administration, or equivalent.
Experience Requirements
The successful candidate will have a minimum of one (1) years of demonstrated performance in technical competencies of Indirect Procurement and contract management.
Excellent prioritization and project management skills.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a group or team
Build and maintain strong relationships based on trust, credibility, clear expectations, and open communication.
Professional, clear, and effective communication to a variety of stakeholders via various communication mediums (written and/or verbal)
Position will require up to 5-10% travel for supplier visits, conferences etc.

Harley-Davidson is an equal opportunity employer that continues to build a culture of inclusion, belonging and equity through our commitment to attracting and retaining diverse talent from all backgrounds, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. We believe in fairness and providing a level playing field for all. We foster a culture that thrives on diverse perspectives and contributions to ignite the creativity and innovation to fuel our business and enhance the employee and customer experience.

The pay range shown represents the national average pay range for this role. Your pay may be more or less than the stated range and is dependent on your geographic location and level of experience.

We offer an inclusive compensation package for all full-time salaried employees including, but not limited to, annual bonus programs, health insurance benefits, a 401k program, onsite fitness centers and employee stores, employee discounts on products and accessories, and more. Learn more about Harley-Davidson here.


Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States.


Direct Reports: No
Travel Required: 0 - 10%
Pay Range: $51,500-77,000
Visa Sponsorship: This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship
Relocation: This position is not eligible for relocation assistance
#LI-REMOTE

title: Marketing and Web Specialist
description:
Friends of the Children is seeking a passionate, committed marketer with strong communications skills to join our National Marketing and Communications team. Our organization’s model is proven to impact generational change by empowering youth who are facing the greatest obstacles through relationships with paid, professional mentors – 12+ years, no matter what. This Marketing and Web Specialist position will help us amplify the voices of the children, families, and communities we serve across the country.
The Marketing and Web Specialist reports to the National Content and Digital Marketing Manager and is responsible for working with designated Friends of the Children chapters to support their marketing and communications goals in coordination with Friends of the Children – National. The Specialist will implement the chapter’s digital marketing strategies through social media, website updates, e-newsletters, analytics tracking, and basic graphic design support. This position will work directly with chapter staff within a set number of hours per chapter per month in order to strengthen brand fidelity, storytelling, and to build greater capacity for staff at chapters and at Friends – National.
The ideal candidate will have proven experience in designing, creating and curating content for social media, websites, and newsletters. They will be effective with time management and prioritization as they work directly with chapter staff within a set number of hours per month. The Specialist will be an effective communicator and ensure alignment between our marketing and communications tactics at Friends - National. And they will thrive in an ever-changing environment, advancing strategies proactively while also creating space to respond to the needs of the national team and the network.
Are you this amazing leader? Here's what we have to offer you:
Opportunity to help grow and support an organization that demands equity from ourselves and from our community.
Opportunity to partner with a diverse, growing network of independent chapters across the country to implement long-term, sustainable change.
A comprehensive benefits package.
Compensation commensurate with experience and geographical location: $53k-$57k.
Most of all, you get to amplify the stories of youth and families, showing the impact of an exceptional organization that helps children facing incredible odds change their life stories every day.
Want to know more? The job description is below:
The following statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work to be performed by individuals assigned to this position. They are not intended as a comprehensive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities:
Digital Content Curation
Create social media posts based on content identified by chapter staff, and then post through online tools.
Monitor social media channels, responding to questions and comments and engaging with key stakeholders.
Write and post recurring website news items based on content identified by chapter staff.
Create monthly newsletter based on content identified by chapter staff in Mailchimp and/or Donor Doc.
Track related newsletter data including open rate, click-through rate, and unsubscribes.
Create visual assets, including (but not limited to) social media posts, web stories, and digital and print collateral in Canva.
Work with chapters to plan editorial calendars to schedule content across communications platforms.
Ensure brand fidelity across digital and print marketing and communications collateral.
Assist Friends of the Children – National staff on communications and web projects, advancing best practices in communications.
Analytics and Web
Keep chapter websites current with news items, and updates of staff photos and bios, partnerships, etc.
Track the efficacy of designated chapter websites and make content recommendations based on data from Google Analytics.
Partner with Web Designer at Friends – National to optimize designated chapter websites performance and ensure brand alignment.
Essential Skills and Abilities:
Diverse functional experience including content creation, curation and management; marketing and communications work; social media management; and website editing.
Proven results leveraging social media platforms and email marketing to drive business-related objectives.
Exceptional writing skills with demonstrated experience in storytelling for an organization.
Experience with graphic design (in Canva), and adapting this skill set across digital media platforms.
Demonstrated ability to successfully manage multiple projects, meet varying communications deadlines and priorities, and collaborate with others.
Ability to anticipate problems and focus on details, working both tactically and strategically.
Self-starter with the ability to project manage their responsibilities around social media and web.
Required Education, Experience, and Abilities:
Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, communications or another relevant field required.
At least 3 years of experience working in the marketing and communications field.
Demonstrated experience designing, creating and curating content for social media, websites, and newsletters is required.
Experience with the latest digital tools and platforms is required, including Canva, Adobe Creative Cloud, Microsoft Office, Google Analytics and AdWords, video editing software, photo editing software, and online social media posting and tracking software.
Demonstrated experience using email software is required (Mailchimp and/or Donor Doc are preferred).
Demonstrated experience designing, writing and curating web content is required.
Demonstrated experience with a website Content Management System is required (experience with Craft preferred).
Culture of Belonging:
Friends of the Children endeavors to create a culture where each and every staff knows they belong. From our policies to our procedures and practices, we aim to create an environment that is healthy, safe, accepting, supportive, and kind. Our benefits are one way to depict our value for work harmony, empowerment, health, and happiness.
Benefits: Our competitive compensation, benefits package, and employee engagement demonstrate our values to families, children, healthy relationships, love, empowerment, goal achievement, and equity. We are continuously seeking feedback and researching best practices to meet the needs of staff and their families. Below are ways we actualize a culture of care for each and every staff member.
Health: Friends of the Children had covers 100% of employee only health premium for 2 of the 3 plans
Dental: Friends of the Children covers 100% of employee only premium
Vision: Friends of the Children covers 100% of employee only premium
Basic Life Insurance and Accidental Death and Dismemberment: 100% paid by Friends of the Children
Short Term Disability and Long-Term Disability: 100% paid by Friends of the Children
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA): Employees may contribute to an FSA account: Healthcare FSA minimum of $100 maximum of $3,050.
Employee Assistance Program
Voluntary Benefits such as Critical Illness, Hospitalization, Legal, etc.
401(k) savings plan with a company matches up to the first 4% of earnings that the employee contributes.
Cell phone Reimbursement: Employee is eligible for a cell phone reimbursement not to exceed $50/month.
Internet Service Reimbursement: Employee is eligible for an internet service reimbursement not to exceed $25/month.
Office reimbursement of $150 per year.
Time off: Full-time employees of Friends are eligible for up to three weeks of paid vacation annually as well as paid sick leave. The first year the time is pro-rated.
Career Development after the first year of employment.
Summer hours
Employee Perks and Discount Programs including savings on hotels, rental cars, travel, entertainment, streaming services, electronics, eCommerce, and so much more
Benefits start first of the month on or following employee start date.
Compensation:
This is a newly created full-time position with benefits, and is paid for by participating chapters. The annual salary range for the marketing and web specialists is $53,000 – $57,000 per year, depending on both experience and location.
Location:
Fully remote/virtual
Applications without cover letters will not be considered; please use this as an opportunity to show us your writing skills and convey why you want to be a Marketing and Web Specialist at Friends of the Children! OPTIONAL: Submit samples of marketing and communications work you’ve accomplished including social media, web stories, or newsletter content.
Friends of the Children is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to addressing discriminatory practices, and to working toward racial equity. The equal employment opportunity policy of Friends of the Children provides fair and equal opportunities for all employees and job applicants regardless of race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, marital status, familial status, disability, or genetic information, in compliance with applicable federal, state and local law. Friends of the Children hires and promotes individuals solely based on their qualifications for the job to be filled.

Friends of the Children is growing rapidly as communities across the country are experiencing the power of how “One” changes a child's story: One Friend. One Child. 12+ years. No matter what. #ThePowerOfOne
To learn more about Friends of the Children go to: https://friendsofthechildren.org/

title: Marketing Manager (Remote)
description:
Title: Manager -Marketing @ Remote
Terms of Hire: Contract.
Compensation: $ 40-50/hr DOE.

Job description:
Essential Responsibilities and Duties::
Marketing Reviewer conducts the day-to-day review for a select criteria of materials using the CLIENT logo and company name. :
This role functions as the subject matter expert of the review process, relevant guidelines, and partners closely with Compliance, Legal, and American Express to proofread, review, and approve materials, and to help operate an efficient review process. :
This role also works closely with the Marketing Department and other key stakeholders to ensure compliance with brand, editorial, and visual identity guidelines, regulatory requirements, and compliance policies, as well as other risk-related issues. :
This role requires the quick mastery of CLIENT. various guidelines and the ability to apply them consistently across materials. :
Strong writing and/or editorial skills combined with knowledge of a wide range of marketing collateral and their related sales practices is an asset for this position. :
This role reports to the Senior Manager, Brand Management and Design, and is a key role on the Global Marketing team. Responsibilities and Essential Functions of the Position: :
Candidate will own projects within the marketing review process to help review, escalate, and approve submissions not limited to marketing and sales collateral, documentation, messaging, products, and reports Conduct brand review of global materials as per CLIENTs visual identity guidelines. Proof/review and approve low-risk materials as per compliance and legal rules, using internal guidelines. Obtain brand review from American Express for specified materials. :
When required, escalate high-risk materials to compliance and legal for their review and approval Identify and bring forward in an organized fashion specific questions for compliance and legal to enable an efficient review. The ability to understand the item at hand, to analytically apply CLIENTs processes to it, and then communicate effectively to the review partners is critical for success in the role. :
Diplomatically provide accurate brand, editorial, and compliance guidance/feedback to key stakeholders across the organization including but not limited to: Marketing, Product, PR, and sales teams. The ability to understand the feedback and apply it accurately is critical. :
The candidate will need to successfully communicate required edits, as well as provide the brand, legal or regulatory basis for the changes, and be able to provide suggested alternatives to problematic language. Review all print and digital communications including, but not limited to decks, slides, videos, scripts, images, factsheets, FAQs, white papers, direct mail, RFP answers, newsletters, ads, banner ads, blog posts, articles, emails, web pages, web platforms, UIs, social media, interactive assets, infographics, press releases, speakers notes, event assets, and event invitations.:
Master and consistently apply CLIENT guidelines including, but not limited to: editorial, visual identity, brand, digital marketing standards, MP54 pipeline, video, social media.:
Develop systems to improve efficiencies as the process grows.:
Maintain the records of all approved and declined materials as per internal policies and procedures.:
Keep abreast of brand and disclosure changes across the global organization and update documents accordingly.:
Assist with other aspects of the review program as necessary. Assist the broader content team with ad hoc requests and/or copywriting/editing Complexity: This is an individual contributor role without any direct reports.:
Candidate is responsible for the processes and workflows described above and generally will work autonomously, subject to feedback from constituents and coaching and guidance from his/her manager.:
Working long hours may be required.:

Required skills and experience: :
5+ years reviewing and/or editing marketing communications and external materials. :
College degree or equivalent work experience required :
Exceptional writing and editorial skills Proficiency in Chicago Manual of Style (AP style a plus). Ability to fully absorb and consistently apply brand, legal, and compliance rules across materials :
Strategic thinker who quickly synthesizes new information and can action against it appropriately Ability to apply coaching and feedback from manager and review partners to grow in the role. :
Proven verbal communication skills.:
A Strong relationship building skills and the ability to collaborate well with internal and external partners at all levels and with all personality types. Positive attitude and professional demeanor while working across the organization and across global cultures.:
Strong project management and organizational skills and attention to detail Successfully manage challenging workflow independently within deadlines and with a high level of integrity. :
Can prioritize appropriately across multiple documents and quickly respond to haste requests Highly unflappable and ability to thrive in a high-pressure, fast-paced, deadline-driven environment Proficiency in MS Office applications (e.g., Word, Excel, PowerPoint)Desired skills and experience (these would be a plus): :
Degree in English, Communications, or JournalismB2B and/or B2B2C copywriting, copyediting, and/or collateral development Digital copy experience (email, social, banner ads, website, etc.) :
Ability to write across different types of collateral (PowerPoint slides, scripts, factsheets, digital, etc.):
Experience in the travel industry, financial services industry, and/or an institutional sales organization:
Requirements: SME investment support:
- Virtual- Anywhere in the US:

You Will Enjoy:
An opportunity to be a part of a great culture, an awesome team, a challenging work environment, and some fun along the way!
Apply today to learn more and be part of our Growth story.
All applications will be kept strictly confidential and once shortlisted, our team will be in touch with you for further discussions.

title: Manager, Creative Advertising
description:
Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.
Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.
Who We Are…
When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the storytellers bringing our characters to life, the creators bringing them to your living rooms and the dreamers creating what’s next…
From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.
Your New Role…
Works closely with SVP, Creative Advertising to manage the creative development and implementation of marketing campaigns, including all applicable print and AV materials.
Your Role Accountabilities…
Manages creative assets for the team and tracks deadlines.
Manages distributing creative materials to other departments to create synergy.
Manages and tracks the approval and clearance process on all advertising/marketing materials. Works closely with legal, clearance, music and finishing departments to keep them up to speed on materials going to finish.
At direction of the SVP, develops and manages creative process on social campaigns and digital content.
At direction of the SVP, develops and manages creative process on ancillary content and media sponsorships.
Works with administrator/assistant to keep track of creative assets and spending on all creative projects.
Consults directly with talent representatives to obtain likeness approvals.
Assists in the coordination and logistics of photo shoot planning.
At the direction of the SVP, approves audio mixes and picture color for TV spots, online content, award/presentation reels and other ancillary materials.
Assists with copy and brainstorming stunt ideas.
Qualifications and Experience…
3-5 years’ experience in creative advertising at either a studio or creative agency with project management skills and knowledge of creative advertising and technical processes.
High School diploma or equivalent required.
BA/BS degree preferred.
Must be proficient in all major desktop publishing applications including:
Adobe Creative Suite – InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat.
Microsoft office – Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
Excellent command of graphic design principles, practices, formats, typography, printing and layout.
Understanding of conversion issues present when using applications across all platforms.
Understanding of how to troubleshoot problem files.
Possess a clear understanding of computer networks, both new and existing server technologies.
Some knowledge of Final Cut Pro and Keynote a plus.
Must have the ability to communicate effectively and tactfully with persons on all levels, in person and on the telephone.
Must have excellent follow-up and follow-through skills.
Must have the ability to pay close attention to detail and understand written and oral instructions.
Must have the ability to organize and schedule work effectively.
Must have the ability to work well under time constraints.
Must be able to handle multiple tasks.
Must be able to work in a fast-paced environment.
Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines.
How We Get Things Done…
This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.
The Legal Bits…
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $62,797.00 - $116,624.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.
Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

title: Senior Marketing Coordinator
description:
Overview:
We understand the invaluable nature of culture and not only loving what you do, but who you do it with. We continually invest in building a firm of collaborators, in an environment where our people thrive — together. If you’re interested in joining a dynamic company of people who love where they work, we invite you to connect!

We are seeking an experienced marketing professional to lead marketing efforts for our West Coast region with a focus on Education, Healthcare, Workplace, and Aviation pursuits. Comprised of excellent communicators and enthusiastic problem-solvers, our marketers are committed to internal client service, poised under the pressure of fast-paced deadlines, and have a solutions-focused, flexible attitude.

Key attributes of an ideal candidate include: a proactive, solutions-oriented nature; impeccable time management skills; resourceful; a strong graphic eye for visual communications, design, and layout; has a passion for the industry; and is a team player. This position will report to the Senior Marketing Manager and work closely with other sector-focused marketers.
Responsibilities:
Partners with senior studio members, leading the coordination and production of materials, primarily the response to RFQ/Ps and interview presentation development, award submissions, and other marketing material to support brand building and business development efforts.
Leads kickoff meetings with project leadership to define strategy for pursuit deliverables.
Coordinates interview presentation run-throughs with pursuit team, sharing feedback and identifying opportunities for improvement.
Effectively communicates the brand through development of custom visual and written content that demonstrates an understanding of the industry and a passion for design excellence.
Coordinates with internal team members and outside partners/consultants to understand key differentiators, identifying and collecting information needed to support marketing them.
Effectively prioritizes competing deadlines, maintaining communication with all stakeholders.
Regularly maintains and updates CRM data, SharePoint resource library content, and OpenAsset digital assets (e.g., photography, renderings, plans).
Leads the development of materials that speak to regionally specific needs.
Prioritizes team and firm culture embracing various forms of connection and engagement.
Qualifications:
3-6 years of experience in the A/E/C industry.
Experience in relevant sectors with an understanding of responding to California-specific requirements (DSA, HCAI, OSPHD etc.) is preferred.
Advanced proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, primarily InDesign, as well as PowerPoint.
Working within a strong brand, adhering to brand guidelines and established processes.
Takes a client service-driven and solutions-focused approach to verbal and written communication.
Thrives in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment as a proactive, resourceful self-starter.
Impeccable time management skills with effective prioritization capabilities.
Has strong organizational skills in managing the coordination of large pursuit teams to gather and organize data for complex pursuits.
Excels in relationship building and collaboration, functioning as an integrated team member.
Confidence in facilitating conversations with senior studio members, comfortable offering ideas, providing feedback, and presenting work.
Effectively working with partners in-person and virtually across multiple time zones.

Corgan believes in partnering for success, building on our legacy for the future, and providing an excellent product. Corgan’s project sectors include aviation, data centers, commercial, education, interiors, and healthcare. Our 92% repeat client business record is a testament to our ability to serve clients in a competent, ethical, and professional manner. Corgan offers a competitive compensation and benefit package and in addition to our excellent environment, philanthropic culture and numerous awards, we offer the ability to work with the highest level of technical equipment and programs.

*Only applications received through our website will be considered.* EOE/M/F/Disability/Vet

Base Salary Range: $67,000 - $92,000 annually – Los Angeles locations only

The estimate range represents the general base salary range of candidates hired in LA only. Factors that may be used to determine your actual salary may include internal equity, experience, education, specialty, and training. In addition, base salary is not inclusive of total compensation.

title: Manager, Media Planning and Campaign Management
description:
Overview:
We are the Marketing Acquisition and Campaign Solutions team (MACS), part of the Paramount Streaming Group. We serve as an internal data-driven media planning, activation, and strategy team available to all groups within the company. We work closely with the digital teams at Paramount Digital providing high level, focused strategy and support for initiatives across the company portfolio, including but not limited to Paramount Streaming (Paramount+, PlutoTV). MACS also acts as a centralized hub for all matters relating to data and technology within the digital media ecosystem.

As a Media Planning Manager, you will help primarily support our streaming brands. Working closely with the Director of Media Planning, you will lead the development media plans that focus on brand awareness, consideration, and acquisition media. The ideal candidate has experience from a full funnel marketing perspective within programmatic, ctv, paid social, youtube, and paid search.

You will actively establish strategic media plans and make sound decisions based on business needs to meet critical metrics. This individual will be able to independently make informed decisions and hold themselves and others accountable to the highest standards. The Manager will apply their expertise to interact with peers and interdepartmental partners and will be the day-to-day contact related to campaign needs while being a strong verbal and written communicator. Join the team!

Your Day-To-Day:
Media Planning:
Lead the development of full-funnel paid media plans and audience strategies based on brand marketing briefs to achieve KPIs while meeting internal/external timelines.
Allocate and manage media plan budget mix across platforms.
Create comprehensive presentation decks incorporating any visualizations to effectively outline and communicate media recommendations base of data-driven audience strategies.
Work closely with the activation team and vendors to ensure successful execution of media plans, including negotiating media rates, securing placements, ad operations, and managing media budgets and billing.
Present media recommendations to key partners

Campaign Management:
Project manage campaign timelines to ensure campaigns are hitting launch timelines (for example, creative is received and to specifications, prepping and adhering to brand lift study timelines, ensuring activation teams are following strategy that is set forth, etc).
In partnership with campaign analyst, provide campaign reporting and insights highlighting key metrics, takeaways, and suggest optimizations and recommendations for future campaigns.
Lead cross platform budget optimizations while campaign is live

Thought Leadership and Communication:
Effectively communicate POVs, campaign strategies, and results to internal and external partners.
Make informed decisions independently and provide leadership and guidance in resolving complex issues and challenges related to media campaign strategy and planning, driving innovative solutions and continuous improvement.
Cover or delegate communications and campaign management responsibilities when one of the team is out of office. This includes overseeing and managing ongoing campaigns, ensuring smooth communication with internal and external partners, and making critical decisions in the one’s absence.
Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and standard processes in media planning and strategy, and apply this knowledge to drive innovation and excellence in campaigns.
Implement special projects as needed across all business units.

Basic Qualifications:
4+ years of paid digital advertising and marketing experience, preferably within entertaining/streaming
Experience and knowledge of core principles of digital advertising capabilities across programmatic DSPs, CTV, paid social, YouTube, and Paid Search.
Experience and knowledge of media measurement and attribution tools: Kochava, Google Analytics, Adobe, etc.
Strong verbal communication, inclusive of presenting media recommendations to key partners
Understanding of common marketing key performance indicator metrics, their calculation, and how the metrics pertain to the success of marketing activities
High degree of proficiency with Microsoft Word, Excel & PowerPoint, Google drive, Google document

Additional Qualifications:
Excels in a dynamic, data-driven, metrics-focused environment.
Experience in ad tracking and operations: CM360, Flashtalking, Prisma.
Self-motivated and able to work with regular check-ins and supervision from department leaders or teammates to communicate back progress and updates.
Strong work ethic, proactive in communication and work delivery
Attention to detail to minimize errors.
#LI-Hybrid

Join the Paramount Streaming Talent Community! Get the inside scoop on life at Paramount Streaming and about career opportunities.

Paramount+, a direct-to-consumer digital subscription video on-demand and live streaming service from Paramount Global, combines live sports, breaking news, and a mountain of entertainment. The premium streaming service features an expansive library of original series, hit shows and popular movies across every genre from world-renowned brands and production studios, including BET, CBS, Comedy Central, MTV, Nickelodeon, Paramount Pictures and the Smithsonian Channel. The service is also the streaming home to unmatched sports programming, including every CBS Sports event, from golf to football to basketball and more, plus exclusive streaming rights for major sports properties, including some of the world’s biggest and most popular soccer leagues. Paramount+ also enables subscribers to stream local CBS stations live across the U.S. in addition to the ability to stream Paramount Streaming’s other live channels: CBSN for 24/7 news, CBS Sports HQ for sports news and analysis, and ET Live for entertainment coverage.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

Hiring Salary Range: $74,400.00 - 105,000.00.

title: Marketing Manager - Public & Social Impact
description:
Who You’ll Work With
At Slalom, personal connection meets global scale. Our vision is to enable a world in which everyone loves their work and life. We help organizations of all kinds redefine what’s possible, give shape to the future—and get there. Our Public and Social Impact (PSI) team is working to create strategy on how we go after work locally, regionally and nationally.
What You’ll Do
Manages PSI customer stories and permissions
Leads marketing campaigns for repeatable services and Accelerators (6x per year)
Amplifies Accelerators through PR/media
Develops and manages all sales/marketing collateral for PSI
Helps local markets share our customer stories through local and national media outlets
Manages marketing for US PSI conferences and events
Works with marketing counterparts from key alliances/partners on joint strategies and tactical initiatives description.
Leads planning for government and education conferences (e.g. NASCIO, GovTech, etc.).
What You’ll Bring
Marketing experience in federal, state and local government, and/or education
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage a vast array of information and create structure in ambiguous environments
Adaptable self-starter who is eager to grow their marketing skills in a fast-paced, supportive environment
Highly self-motivated and able to work both independently and in a team
Design experience is a plus (PowerPoint/Pardot), Salesforce knowledge
Able to use marketing tactics to convert activities into top of the funnel sales opportunities
About Us
Slalom is a purpose-led, global business and technology consulting company. From strategy to implementation, our approach is fiercely human. In six countries and 43 markets, we deeply understand our customers—and their customers—to deliver practical, end-to-end solutions that drive meaningful impact. Backed by close partnerships with over 400 leading technology providers, our 13,000+ strong team helps people and organizations dream bigger, move faster, and build better tomorrows for all. We’re honored to be consistently recognized as a great place to work, including being one of Fortune’s 100 Best Companies to Work For seven years running. Learn more at slalom.com.

Compensation and Benefits
Slalom prides itself on helping team members thrive in their work and life. As a result, Slalom is proud to invest in benefits that include meaningful time off and paid holidays, parental leave, 401(k) with a match, a range of choices for highly subsidized health, dental, & vision coverage, adoption and fertility assistance, and short/long-term disability. We also offer yearly $350 reimbursement account for any well-being-related expenses, as well as discounted home, auto, and pet insurance.

Slalom is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. For this position, the base salary pay range is $115,000-140,000. In addition, individuals may be eligible for an annual discretionary bonus. Actual compensation will depend upon an individual’s skills, experience, qualifications, location, and other relevant factors. The salary pay range is subject to change and may be modified at any time.

EEO and Accommodations
Slalom is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to inclusion, diversity, and equity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Slalom will also consider qualified applications with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Slalom welcomes and encourages applications from individuals with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available for candidates during all aspects of the selection process. Please advise the talent acquisition team if you require accommodations during the interview process.

title: Marketing Operations Strategist
description:
Squarespace is looking for a passionate Marketing Operations Strategist to help implement and improve marketing processes and technologies to achieve our growth and efficiency goals.
In this role, you will work across teams and departments to develop and improve processes and tooling, onboard and manage marketing technology platforms, and scope future solutions.
The ideal candidate has solid technical and marketing knowledge; prior experience spearheading process improvements and onboarding marketing technology platforms; and able to help identify long-term and system-wide solutions that scale with the business.
You will report to the head of Marketing Analytics and Operations in our New York City headquarters. This is a hybrid opportunity.
You'll Get To…
Work with marketing, data and engineering partners to scope, implement or improve marketing campaign, operations and technology solutions
Implement and manage tracking solutions across partners and platforms
Create centralized documentation for knowledge sharing and self service
Monitor and socialize marketing data, privacy and security trends and identify implications for Squarespace
Who We're Looking For
3-4 years experience delivering impactful solutions in a marketing capacity (i.e. supporting an in-house Marketing team or working with an advertising agency or ad tech company)
Hands-on experience with common AdTech platforms (Tag Manager, Ad Server, DSP)
Knowledge of one or more MarTech platforms (e.g. ESP, CDP, Analytics Tools) and their respective business applications
Knowledge of media strategy and fundamentals, cross-channel processes and digital measurement solutions; knowledge of CRM a plus
Knowledge of JavaScript and SQL
Outcomes-oriented, operations-minded, proactive and collaborative
Benefits & Perks
A choice between medical plans with an option for 100% covered premiums
Fertility and adoption benefits
Access to supplemental insurance plans for additional coverage
Headspace mindfulness app subscription
Retirement benefits with employer match
Flexible paid time off
Up to 20 weeks of paid family leave
Equity plan for all employees
Pretax commuter benefit
Education reimbursement
Employee donation match to community organizations
6 Global Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)
Dog-friendly workplace
Free lunch and snacks
Private rooftop
Cash Compensation Range: $85,500 - $138,000 USD
The base salary for this position will vary based on job-related criteria including relevant skills, experience, and location, among other factors.
In addition to the cash compensation above (which includes base salary and, where applicable for eligible roles, may include on-target commissions or overtime pay), all Squarespace employees are eligible to receive equity in the company as part of their total compensation.
About Squarespace
Squarespace (NYSE: SQSP) is a design-driven platform helping entrepreneurs build brands and businesses online. We empower millions of customers in more than 200 countries and territories with all the tools they need to create an online presence, build an audience, monetize, and scale their business. Our suite of products range from websites, domains, ecommerce, and marketing tools, as well as tools for scheduling with Acuity, creating and managing social media presence with Bio Sites and Unfold, and hospitality business management via Tock. Our team of more than 1,700 is headquartered in bustling New York City, with offices in Chicago, Dublin, Ireland, Aveiro, Portugal, and coworking spaces in the UK, Netherlands, and Australia. For more information about our company culture, visit www.squarespace.com/about/careers.
Our Commitment
Today, more than a million people around the globe use Squarespace to share different perspectives and experiences with the world. Not only do we embrace and celebrate the diversity of our customers, but we also work toward the same in our employees. At Squarespace, we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, gender, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital or parental status, disability, veteran status, or other class protected by applicable law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.
Thank you in advance for providing the following details about your work history from your resume! This helps us ensure that your candidate information is accurate and consistent during the hiring process.

title: Specialist, Integrated Marketing
description:
As the Integrated Marketing Specialist, you will play a key role within CBS Stations! Your primary responsibility will be to support the development of marketing collateral and sponsorship opportunities across multiple stations within the CBS Stations Group!

Key Responsibilities:
Support Account Executives within your key markets in the creation of marketing materials including cohesive presentations, one-sheets and graphics for LinkedIn.
Help build new sponsorship and integration opportunities for local markets within your purview.
Assist in the project management of marketing campaigns, ensuring elements are delivered accurately and optimally.
Understand the offerings of your markets, and work with your team to continue elevating sponsorship concepts for clients across linear, streaming and digital.
Work with Research to update marketing collateral regularly with the most up-to-date audience information.
Help Account Executives and Managers to support campaign recap efforts.

Requirements:
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in marketing, advertising, or related roles, with exposure within the media industry being a plus.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, able to work well with cross-functional teams.
An understanding of strategies, advertising, and sponsorships, with a willingness to learn and grow within the role.
Excellent organizational and project management skills to balance multiple priorities.
Strong presentation skills and an eye for design and attention to detail.
Basic data analysis skills to collect insights and assist in data-driven decision-making processes.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, adapting to changing priorities and market trends.

CBS News and Stations, brings together the power of CBS News, 28 owned television stations in 17 major U.S. markets, the CBS News Streaming Network, CBS News Streaming local platforms, local websites and cbsnews.com, under one umbrella. CBS News and Stations is home to the nation’s #1 news program 60 MINUTES, the CBS News Streaming Network, the first 24/7 digital streaming news network, the award-winning broadcasts CBS MORNINGS, CBS SATURDAY MORNING, the CBS EVENING NEWS WITH NORAH O’DONNELL, CBS SUNDAY MORNING, CBS WEEKEND EVENING NEWS, 48 HOURS and FACE THE NATION WITH MARGARET BRENNAN. CBS News and Stations provides news and information for the CBS Television Network, CBSNews.com, CBS News Radio and podcasts, Paramount +, all digital platforms, and the CBS News Streaming Network, the premier 24/7 anchored streaming news service that is available free to everyone with access to the internet. The CBS News Streaming Network is the destination for breaking news, live events, original reporting and storytelling, and programs from CBS News and Stations’ top anchors and correspondents working locally, nationally and around the globe. CBS News’ streaming services, across national and local, amassed more than 1.01 billion streams in 2021. Launched in November 2014 as CBSN, the CBS News Streaming Network is available on 30 digital platforms and apps, as well as CBSNews.com and Paramount+. The service is available live in 91 countries. CBS News and Stations is dedicated to providing the highest quality journalism under standards it pioneered and continues to set in today’s digital age. CBS News earns more prestigious journalism awards than any other broadcast news division.

Organizations that wish to receive job vacancy notices from this posting’s television station should contact sf_recruitingsupport@paramount.com.

title: Assistant Manager, Public Relations
description:
About Athleta
For the past 25 years, we’ve committed ourselves and our brand to a single aim: to empower all women and girls. Inspiration. Collaboration. Connection. Inclusivity. It’s what we do best, and we’re on the hunt for people who share our passion for leading an active lifestyle, growing personally as well as professionally, and creating game-changing products and experiences.
We use business as a force for good by putting people and the planet right up there with profit, which is why Athleta is a certified B Corp. Ready to make a move? Join us. Because we know that alone we’re strong, but together we’re unstoppable.
About the Role
In this role, you will work in an energizing, fast paced environment focused on all public relations endeavors. You will be an ambassador for our brands, driving press & brand awareness across all media channels. You will be responsible for creating impactful PR campaigns & influencing editorial coverage. You should have outstanding organizational skills with superior written and verbal communication
What You'll Do
Develop and manage all aspects of PR, including fashion and brand media outreach (national and regional), media and customer events as it relates to product and fashion press and brand sponsorships
Author press releases, talking points, Q&As, and other written materials to manage communication and increase awareness of the brand
Establish and maintain key relationships with editors, influencers, and key social channels to have continual messaging on the brand and product newness through show rooms and consistent outreach
Able to communicate difficult concepts in a simple manner
Participate in projects and assignments of diverse scope
Who You Are
Personality and composure to work with senior executives and major media outlets
Excellent organizational skills and ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously within budgets and on schedule
Ability to determine solutions independently, think creatively, and implement rapidly
Understanding of how brand engagement fits into the larger picture of marketing; Voracious consumer of culture, technology, and fashion and able to create stories/digital experiences at the intersection of all three
Present problem analysis and recommended solutions in a creative and logical manner
Benefits at Athleta
Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Old Navy, Gap, Banana Republic and Athleta, and 30% off at Outlet for all employees.
One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*
Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*
Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*
Employee stock purchase plan.*
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*
See more of the benefits we offer.
For eligible employees
Gap Inc. is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to providing a workplace free from harassment and discrimination. We are committed to recruiting, hiring, training and promoting qualified people of all backgrounds, and make all employment decisions without regard to any protected status. We have received numerous awards for our long-held commitment to equality and will continue to foster a diverse and inclusive environment of belonging. In 2022, we were recognized by Forbes as one of the World's Best Employers and one of the Best Employers for Diversity.

Salary Range: $71,600 - $91,300 USD
Employee pay will vary based on factors such as qualifications, experience, skill level, competencies and work location. We will meet minimum wage or minimum of the pay range (whichever is higher) based on city, county and state requirements.

US Candidates
Please note that effective, June 30, 2022, Gap Inc. will no longer require any of its employees to wear face masks or require proof of COVID vaccination, unless required by local or state/provincial mandates or as part of Gap Inc’s quarantine guidelines after being exposed to or testing positive for COVID. Therefore, please disregard any language in any job posting that refers to Gap Inc.’s face mask and proof of vaccination policy as said policy is no longer effective.

title: Writer I - Service
description:
“I can succeed as a Writer at Capital Group.”
Capital Group seeks a skilled writer with 2 to 3 years of experience in content marketing and creating high-quality customer service content. The ideal candidate should produce engaging and informative content aligned with our brand voice and messaging for investors and financial professionals. In this role, the candidate needs to be receptive to feedback and open to making edits to enhance content quality and meet business needs.

Responsibilities
Develop customer service content, including email, web, FAQs, help or how-to content that effectively addresses customer and financial advisor needs and inquiries.
Work closely with marketing and customer service teams to ensure all content is accurate, up-to-date, and aligned with our brand voice and messaging.
Work in close collaboration with the copy editor, graphic designer and digital author to align compelling copy with complementary visuals, layout and technical execution.
Foster relationships with internal business stakeholders to help ensure messaging aligns with objectives and strategies.
Use performance and engagement metrics to assess and optimize the effectiveness of marketing materials for future campaigns.
“I am the person Capital Group is looking for.”

You have 2 to 3 years of copywriting experience; financial services; or related industry experience preferred, with a portfolio of writing samples that demonstrate strong writing skills or experience.
You have a bachelor’s degree in marketing, English, journalism, communications or related field.
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to write in a clear, concise and engaging manner.
You have an ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.
You have familiarity with marketing tactics and digital channels, including email and web content and print materials.
You have foundational level of investment industry knowledge and an interest in building on that knowledge.
You are interested in being part of a marketing organization and support the customer service team, eager to learn about the needs of our audiences, and will use that information to develop and shape your content.
You thrive in team settings, have good interpersonal skills and experience working with internal stakeholders to develop content.
Los Angeles Base Salary Range: $84,894-$135,830
In addition to a highly competitive base salary, per plan guidelines, restrictions and vesting requirements, you also will be eligible for an individual annual performance bonus, plus Capital’s annual profitability bonus plus a retirement plan where Capital contributes 15% of your eligible earnings.
You can learn more about our compensation and benefits
here
.

We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.

title: Specialist, Shoppable Media
description:
Who we are:
Tinuiti is the largest independent performance marketing firm across Streaming TV, Google, Meta, and Amazon, with almost $4 billion in digital media under management and over 1,200 employees. With industry-leading expertise in search, social, Amazon and marketplaces, addressable TV, mobile apps, Influencer, Lifecycle, and more, Tinuiti understands that success requires both strategy and channel expertise. Our goal when we come to work every day is simple - to grow happiness. For our clients, their customers, our people and our partners. Growing happiness guides everything we do and our core values - Unleash Greatness, Never Stop Learning, Ignite Your Passion, Thankful Living, and Inspire Innovation & Change - inspire us to maintain a culture where our people take pride in their work and have fun doing it.
We support 100% remote work for applicants who reside in the United States.
What you’ll be doing:
Campaign and bid management of Shopping engines, such as Google Shopping, Microsoft Product Ads or Comparison Shopping Engines (Connexity)
Support other media channels with feed-driven strategy to help provide a more holistic approach and connect our Shoppable programs
Create, manipulate, and manage product feeds used for Shoppable programs
Audit product feeds and point out issues and recommendations
Report and optimize Shopping engine performance for clients
Analyze data, identify trends and implement optimizations on a recurring basis
Daily use of third-party feed management platforms
We’d love to hear from you if:
Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you qualify, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch.
Requirements:
2+ years of experience managing performance of Shoppable programs or other digital marketing channels
Proactivity, attention to detail and ability to work with external teams
Basic understanding of ecommerce
Advanced Microsoft Excel
Experience with Google Analytics
Preferred 6 months experience with product feeds
Experience with third-party feed platforms like Feedonomics
Working knowledge of Google Merchant Center
Proficient in Powerpoint / Google Slides
FLSA Classification: Exempt
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
Benefits:
At Tinuiti, we want to ensure you have the time you need to rest and recharge. That's why Tinuitians have an estimated 70 days off per year through our time off programs
Unlimited PTO: We encourage all Tinutians to Own their Offline by utilizing our unlimited PTO by working with your Manager to ensure all deliverables are met.
Holidays: We offer 17 paid holidays, if one of your religious holidays is not covered, please by all means take advantage of your Flex PTO!
Flex Fridays: Meetings are minimized and all Tinuitians have the option to start their weekend early at 1pm local time.
Owning Our Offline: Clients are informed and all offices will be closed for 3 total weeks throughout the year to give everyone the chance to truly unplug.
Healthcare: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life & Disability, Flex Spending Accounts
Retirement: Match up to 4% of your contributions at 100% with immediate vesting
Perks and Wellness: Fringe, Forma, Thankful giving, Equity
Learning and Development: Mentor program and more
Compensation:
The hiring base salary range for this role is ($60,000 - $75,000). We also offer incentive pay. Beginning Q2 2024, this role will be eligible for our new RevShare program comprising a monthly variable commission opportunity and a discretionary annual bonus.
Hiring salaries are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. We will provide more information on our benefits, incentive pay, and equity upon requests. Disclosure as required by the Colorado Equal Pay for > Equal Work Act, C.R.S. § 8-5-101 et seq.

Disclaimer: This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this position. The actual duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may vary based on assignment or group. Tinuiti is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.

title: Senior Digital Communications Associate Chicago REMOTE
company_name: NORC at the University of Chicago
description:
JOB SUMMARY:
NORC at the University of Chicago seeks a talented and experienced digital communications professional to join its Strategic Communications team. This is an exciting role for a team player whose skills range from web production to social media and project management.
