The ideal candidate will possess a passion for digital storytelling, smart branding, and elegant design, with strong writing and editing skills and a keen eye for detail. They will have a solid grasp of the evolving social media landscape and excel in managing multiple projects simultaneously. They will also share a belief in the importance of trustworthy research and data to inform decisions that affect the health and prosperity of society.


DEPARTMENT: Strategic Communications and External Affairs
Strategic Communications and External Affairs supports the entire NORC organization with expertise in corporate communications and creative services, external affairs, internal communications, and select project-level communications.
Our digital work primarily supports the promotion of NORC’s research and people to the public: we work with members of the media to publicize our research projects and our expertise; we support external events where NORC experts present or speak; we maintain the external NORC website, www.norc.org; we support client projects that need digital communications expertise, and we manage NORC’s social media presence on Facebook and Twitter.


RESPONSIBILITIES:
Publish engaging content on NORC's website, ensuring it aligns with NORC’s brand standards for clean design and narrative clarity.
Oversee content development for NORC's social media accounts, maintaining a consistent brand voice and engaging with audiences effectively.
Manage digital communications projects, keeping timelines and budgets on track and updating stakeholders.
Edit and proofread content to ensure accuracy, clarity, and consistency.
Create pixel-perfect, responsive web layouts based on mockups from our design team.
Track and analyze both web and social media performance metrics to evaluate the effectiveness of digital communication strategies.
Collaborate closely with Strategic Communications colleagues, NORC researchers, and other staff and outside vendors to develop and execute high-quality, integrated communications and marketing campaigns in a timely fashion.
Stay informed about the latest digital communication trends and technologies, and explore opportunities for innovation.

REQUIRED SKILLS:
Bachelor’s degree.
8 years of experience in digital communications, with a proven track record of success.
Strong writing and editing skills, with a keen eye for catching typos and a knack for streamlining text.
Sharp sense for design accuracy and a fastidious patience to get layouts exactly right.
Deep understanding of social media algorithms and their impact on content performance, with an instinct for what “pops” in people’s feeds.
Comfort with analyzing and reporting analytics for web, email, and social media, and an interest in ensuring data accuracy and relevance to business goals.
Excellent project management skills and an ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
Proficiency with a variety of website content-management systems (knowledge of Adobe Experience Manager a strong plus but not required).
Facility with graphics editing software, such as Photoshop and Canva.
A knack for using project management tools such as Wrike or Asana.
Ability to work both independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, both written and verbal.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
Flexibility to adapt to changing priorities and work under deadline.
Strong references from prior supervisors.
#LI-AH1

SALARY AND BENEFITS:
The pay range for this position is $ 87,000 – $ 130,000.
The budgeted pay range for this position is $87,000 - $115,000.
This position is classified as regular. Regular staff are eligible for NORC’s comprehensive benefits program. Benefits include, but are not limited to:
Generously subsidized health insurance, effective on the first day of employment
Dental and vision insurance
A defined contribution retirement program, along with a separate voluntary 403(b) retirement program
Group life insurance, long-term and short-term disability insurance
Benefits that promote work/life balance, including generous paid time off, holidays; paid parental leave, bereavement leave, tuition assistance, and an Employee Assistance Program (EAP).
NORC’s Approach to Equity and Transparency
Pay and benefits transparency helps to reduce wage gaps. As part of our commitment to pay equity and salary transparency, NORC includes a salary range for each job opening along with information about eligible benefit offerings. At NORC, we take a comprehensive approach to setting salary ranges and reviewing raises and promotions, which is overseen by a formal Salary Review Committee (SRC).


WHAT WE DO:
NORC at the University of Chicago is an objective, non-partisan research institution that delivers reliable data and rigorous analysis to guide critical programmatic, business, and policy decisions. Since 1941, our teams have conducted groundbreaking studies, created and applied innovative methods and tools, and advanced principles of scientific integrity and collaboration. Today, government, corporate, and nonprofit clients around the world partner with us to transform increasingly complex information into useful knowledge.


WHO WE ARE:
For over 80 years, NORC has evolved in many ways, moving the needle with research methods, technical applications and groundbreaking research findings. But our tradition of excellence, passion for innovation, and commitment to collegiality have remained constant components of who we are as a brand, and who each of us is as a member of the NORC team. With world-class benefits, a business casual environment, and an emphasis on continuous learning, NORC is a place where people join for the stellar research and analysis work for which we’re known, and stay for the relationships they form with their colleagues who take pride in the impact their work is making on a global scale.


EEO STATEMENT:
NORC is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer that values and actively seeks diversity in the workforce. NORC evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity, and other legally protected characteristics.

title: Communications Strategist
description:
Job Description

The Intel Global Communications and Events Group is a worldwide team of communications professionals working to build and protect Intel’s reputation as the world’s best semiconductor company. The group spans public relations, reputation management, corporate communications, executive communications, analyst relations and employee communications. It's a fast-paced, dynamic, and exciting environment. We are looking for thoughtful, collaborative, and disciplined team members who like big, bold goals, think in possibilities, and will thrive with their colleagues at the center of always-on communications.
The Employee Communications team is seeking an experienced Employee Engagement Communications Strategist to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in communications, with an emphasis on employee engagement. In this role you will be responsible for adeptly supporting enterprise strategic initiatives to ensure a cohesive and impactful communication strategy enabling our global employees and managers understand how they contribute to Intel's success.
Your responsibilities will include the following:
Crafting and driving strategic plans that provides a clear vision of the organization's transformation and goals for the benefit of employees.
Developing a cohesive narrative connecting company goals to team objectives.
Managing and coordinating updates, ensuring accurate and timely dissemination of key information to a broad audience.
Building creative and innovative ways to share progress on our transformation and critical milestones.
Developing and executing on communications plans for key strategic initiatives working closely with the editorial team to maintain a continuous drumbeat on content ensuring that our audience is focused on what is most relevant to them.
Recognizing the diverse nature of our workforce and tailor communications to different audience segments.
Playing an active role in the development of Employee Communications as a center of excellence for communications.
The successful candidate should exhibit the following skills and behaviors:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Have a strategic mindset with a focus on aligning communications with organizational goals.
Team player and works well under pressure.
Works well in ambiguous situations, with a mindset of ownership and accountability and stays highly organized with strong attention to detail.
Proven ability to connect with diverse audiences.
Strong project management skills, with the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.
Excellent stakeholder management

Qualifications

You must possess the minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.

This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship.
Minimum Qualifications:
6+ years of communications experience including developing and implementing communication strategies, preferably with a significant number of those focused on employee communications, or similar environment.
Bachelor’s degree in business, Communications, Journalism, or a related field.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working in a global environment.
MBA
Experience with MS Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint

Inside this Business Group

Global Marketing & Communications is responsible for Intel's brand management, end-user product marketing and go-to-market activation strategy for direct and indirect marketing programs worldwide
Other Locations

US, AZ, Phoenix; US, CA, Santa Clara
Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
Benefits

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.

Annual Salary Range for jobs which could be performed in US, California: $123,139.00-$203,801.00
Salary range dependent on a number of factors including location and experience

Working Model

This role will be eligible for our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.

JobType
Hybrid

title: Marketing Associate
description:
About the job

As Marketing Associate at Section, you will be a core part of a small marketing team bringing top-notch business education to thousands of students worldwide. You will be the operational and organizational engine behind our team. You will work closely with the Head of Marketing to plan and manage integrated marketing campaigns that drive revenue, enterprise deals, and student body growth, and execute those campaigns at a high degree of fidelity. You will be responsible for organizing and project managing campaigns for upcoming courses and bootcamps, external events, promotions, and one-off marketing initiatives. You will also manage our partnerships with external partners like newsletters and influencers. You will work closely with our copywriter, designer, product lead, and email specialist to ensure that campaigns are delivered on time and at a high quality. This is a great opportunity for a highly organized, motivated professional who wants a lot of responsibility on a small and growing team. You will have opportunities for promotion, raises, and significant exposure to the executive team above and beyond your level.

Responsibilities

Develop and manage integrated marketing plans for Section’s business courses, including email, social media, paid advertising, and website development
Work closely with marketing specialists – designers, copywriters, growth marketers, and email specialists – to execute marketing campaigns on time
Collaborate with the Email Marketing Manager to maintain the email calendar and manage deadlines
In collaboration with the Head of Marketing, devise strategies to grow our marketing audience and revenue, possibly including but not limited to: affiliate marketing, paid ads, referral programs, etc.
Own and manage our external event strategy, including creating event marketing plans, coordinating with speakers and other stakeholders, running planning calls, setting up event platforms, and reporting out data on event performance
Manage our partnership strategy, serving as the key contact for newsletter sponsorships and influencer partnerships and reporting out on spend and results
Update non-design elements of the marketing website using our Webflow CMS (note: you do not need to be proficient in Webflow, but some HTML experience is a plus)
Oversee the marketing tech stack (including Webflow, Stripe, Wordpress, Typeform, Saasquatch, and other tools) and co-own some technical marketing tasks in partnership with the Head of Engineering and our operational team
Meet quick turnarounds and juggle multiple projects simultaneously
Provide general support to new marketing initiatives and cross-functional projects as they arise
Qualifications

3+ years experience in marketing
Exceptional organizational skills, attention to deadlines, and ability to manage multiple priorities
Strong project management skills and experience managing multi-step projects
Proactive and responsive communication style Passion for delivering high-quality campaigns on time with a high degree of fidelity
A plus if you have experience with components of our marketing tech stack or similar tools, including: Webflow, Figma, Asana, Zapier, Stripe, and AI tools like ChatGPT

Please submit your resume and cover letter.
$70,000 - $80,000 a year
Our beliefs

We believe it’s our job to level the playing field
No matter who you are or where you’re from you should have access to a great education and to other talented people.

We believe people learn best from other people
Technology can’t replace humans when it comes to education. We will always make the learning experience personal, human, and connected.

We believe that to build something new, you have to question everything
The status quo is broken and to fix it we have to shake things up. We might not always nail it on the first go, but we’ll never stop trying to be our best.

Who we are

At Section, we believe that different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences create a whole that is greater than the sum of its parts. A diverse and inclusive team creates a better product.

We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, military or veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.

All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. We encourage candidates of underrepresented backgrounds to apply.

title: Marketing Specialist
description:
Succession Resource Group is a boutique succession planning consulting firm dedicated to helping financial advisors and other small business owners value, grow, protect, and plan for the transition of their business. We provide the most accurate and comprehensive valuation services, turnkey acquisition support, assistance with contingency plans, and personalized succession/exit strategies to clients across the country. We are a young and fast-growing company, dedicated to our craft and focused on providing customized solutions, exceptional customer service, and high quality products to our clients.
Description
The Marketing Specialist will assist the team in all marketing-related functions focused on event management and promotion (e.g. webinars, podcasts, and conferences), design, content creation and marketing collateral, brand management, and social media. The Marketing Specialist will support various marketing initiatives and assist in the execution of marketing campaigns across multiple channels. This role requires a high level of independent work, strong organizational skills, attention to detail, excellent communication skills, and the ability to multitask effectively.
Responsibilities
1. Event Management:
Manage end-to-end webinar and podcast production and other marketing activities, including content creation, speaker coordination, promotion, and attendee communications (pre- and post-event)
Assist in the coordination of third-party conferences, including logistics, swag management, vendor management, promotion, and attendee communications (pre- and post-event)
Manage event timelines, budgets, logistics, and promotion, ensuring all deadlines are met.
Coordinate with internal teams and external partners to develop event agendas, presentations, and promotional materials.
Integrate events into broader marketing campaigns and initiatives
Conduct post-event evaluations and analyze feedback to identify areas for improvement
2. Content Creation & Promotion:
Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure alignment and execution of marketing initiatives
Create, manage, and maintain marketing collateral, including presentations, sales materials, and promotional assets
Translate concepts and ideas into polished visual designs and written content
Collaborate with team to create assets such as blog posts, articles, whitepapers, ebooks, case studies, infographics, videos, and social media posts
Manage content distribution and promotion across various channels, including website, blog, email newsletters, social media, and third-party platforms
Manage content calendars and schedules for social media, email marketing, and other digital channels
Support lead generation efforts through data entry, list management, and campaign tracking in Salesforce and Pardot.
Monitor and analyze content performance metrics, such as website traffic, engagement metrics, conversion rates, and social media metrics, and provide regular reports and insights to stakeholders
3. Brand:
Define and maintain brand positioning, messaging, and visual identity guidelines
Oversee and coordinate marketing campaigns, advertising efforts, and promotional activities to boost brand awareness and equity
Ensure consistency of the brand across all communication channels and materials
Collaborate with the marketing and creative teams to create high-quality marketing assets
4. Social Media:
Execute a comprehensive social media strategy to achieve marketing objectives and enhance brand visibility
Create engaging and relevant content for social media platforms
Monitor social media trends, tools, and applications and recommend strategies to keep the company ahead of the curve
Implement paid social media advertising campaigns and monitor their effectiveness, adjusting strategies as needed to optimize performance and ROI, on occasion
5. Communication and Reporting:
Highlights key metrics, achievements, and challenges, providing regular updates to management
Provides clear updates and action items to team
6. Documentation and Records:
Create, monitor, and complete tasks
Maintain electronic files and records
7. Process Improvement:
Continuously processes and proposes improvements for increased efficiency and effectiveness
8. Research Tasks:
Stay informed of recent industry updates
Stay informed of marketing trends, best practices, and emerging technologies in marketing and apply them to improve campaign effectiveness
Other research-related tasks, as needed
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in marketing, communications, English, journalism, or a related field
Proven experience in event planning and coordination and/or content creation and management, preferably in a B2B, technology-focused environment, marketing or educational setting
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail, with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines simultaneously.
Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills, with a keen eye for detail and ability to adapt content style and tone to different audiences and channels
Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills and a focus on accuracy
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Familiarity with marketing tools such as Salesforce and Pardot (or similar CRM and marketing automation platforms)
Familiarity in event management software and tools (e.g., Eventbrite, Zoom, Microsoft Office)
Basic understanding of marketing principles and practices, including digital marketing, social media, email marketing, and lead generation.
Creative thinker with the ability to develop engaging event content and promotional materials.
Proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.
Positive attitude, eagerness to learn, and willingness to take on new challenges.
The pay range for this role is:
50,000 - 80,000 USD per year (Remote - United States)

title: Copywriter - McKinney Health
description:
Agency Purpose

We are a dynamic and innovative marketing and advertising agency, committed to delivering exceptional client results. Our purpose is to discover and unleash the untapped potential in our world with our SMARTS and HEARTS.
LISTEN. Before anything else, we seek to understand.
PROVOKE. Proactively question assumptions.
SIMPLIFY. Strive to take the complex and make it simple.
PERSEVERE. Expect obstacles. Overcome them and keep going.
BELIEVE. Trust that, together, we can do anything.
LOVE. Love what we do, respect, and lift each other up.
Purpose
The Copywriter will support the Copy Supervisors(s) and Associate Creative Director(s) for their assigned brand(s) at McKinney Health. They will report to the Copy Supervisor or Associate Creative Director for those brands and be responsible for learning and mastering communications to healthcare professionals, patients, caregivers, and other health-related audiences. The Copywriter will be responsible for building a strong understanding of the supporting medical literature for their assigned brands and must partner closely with the Art, Account, Strategy, Medical, and Editorial teams to ensure team success.
Job Responsibilities
Able to complete healthcare communications from project brief to project approval with supervision, with a working knowledge of routing and submission platforms/document control.
Able and/or eager to learn a range of therapeutic categories, including mastery of all corresponding references (Prescribing Information, corresponding publications, clinical guidelines, etc.).
Develop tactics across a multitude of channels, including digital, print, websites, and multimedia creative, as well as activations beyond traditional.
Learns and masters the process of annotating and fact-checking a project to completion, playing a key role in the submission process as needed.
Ensures the Copy Supervisor and/or Associate Creative Director sees all tactics before sending or presenting to clients.
Concepting & Portfolio
Always willing and eager to contribute to concept development for brands and new business opportunities.
Portfolio reflects a range of work reflective of ~1-3 years of experience in the industry. If coming in as an entry-level employee, this will be waived.
Competencies
Creative Stewardship. A high standard of creative work that is award-winning, applauded by the industry and appreciated by existing clients and new business prospects (as much as can be for ~1-3 years' experience)
Relationship Management. A professional role model with positive influence who motivates colleagues. Ability to collaborate with all key stakeholders across all offices.
Cultural Leader. Help activate and foster the McKinney culture and serve as a McKinney Brand Ambassador to the advertising industry.
Entrepreneurial Spirit. McKinney Health is a new entity looking for team members who want to help craft a best-in-class healthcare agency. Candidates who are enthusiastic about shaping company culture, process, and vision will be prioritized.
Experience

1 - 3 years of experience in healthcare advertising, exceptions are made based on level of work pertaining to creative product and creative management abilities. Entry level applicants are welcome. Salary will reflect experience.
Education & Training
A Bachelor's degree is not required, but it is welcome.

Disclaimer
Unlike other health agencies, McKinney Health has fewer levels in reporting structure. The Copywriter roughly equates to one of the following roles: Junior Copywriter, Copywriter, or Senior Copywriter. The title after Copywriter is Copy Supervisor. The Copywriter's salary will reflect their experience.

Salary Range

Our estimated range for this role is $85 - $100k
Compensation packages are based on the skill level and experience each candidate brings to their role. There may also be a more senior or junior position available that could be a better fit with your expertise. Each level has its own compensation range.
We pride ourselves on competitive salaries, and ensuring pay equity exists across our organization. We benchmark each position against existing employee competencies and 4As compensation data which includes geographic and agency size benchmarks. We also meet with department leaders 3x/year to ensure we are supporting employees in living into their full potential. Our promotions are not limited to a specific time per year. Promotions are tied to performance.
Right To Work In The US

You must be authorized to work in the US for any employer. At this time, we are not sponsoring or providing assistance with obtaining work authorization. McKinney is a place where everyone can grow. Studies have shown that marginalized communities such as women, LGBTQ+ and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. However you identify, and whatever background you bring with you, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come into work every day.
We are in the office Tuesday/Wednesday/Thursday on a hybrid schedule. We look forward to meeting you!

title: Digital Marketing Coordinator
description:
Description:
Why AGIA?
AGIA Affinity is an established but growing insurance and benefits marketing partner to some of the largest and most iconic associations and organizations in the country. Our clients include many veterans organizations, and ensuring that our servicemembers have the coverages they need when they need it is at the heart of everything we do. For 66 years we have sought to improve the lives of not only our client members but our internal members as well.
Schedule and Time Off:
This Digital Marketing Coordinator position is remote, but if the candidate is close to the Carpinteria office we'd love to have a few Marketing Team Meet-Ups.
We are hiring in any state, but the candidate will need to be available to work at there preferred time between 7 AM- 9 AM Monday- Friday Pacific time.
We offer 10 days of vacation your first year, and each year you gain an additional day. Each year, you'll be earning more vacation time at a faster rate.
Every associate gets 13 paid and closed holidays each year.
Associates receive 48 hours of sick time which rolls-over each year.
What are the Benefits?
AGIA offers health benefits including medical, dental, and vision, 401K with 100% company match up to 4% of your annual income and an additional 50% match on the next 2% of income, a prefunded optional FSA , 100% covered Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance, Short Term/Long Term Disability, and a $250 Wellness Benefit. Our medical plan has in-network provider coverage for mental health, reproduction, chiropractic, and massage therapy.
Who will I work for?
Christine Raimer is the Digital Commerce Leader at AGIA. With 13 years at AGIA, Christine is the perfect mentor to integrate you into our organization. She is energized by several new AGIA initiatives including our Digital 'Glow-up' and a rebrand of our flagship product, Emergency Assistance Plus (https://www.emergencyassistanceplus.com/).
What You’ll Do:
Reporting to the Digital Commerce Leader, the Digital Marketing is responsible for the development, execution and maintenance of assigned ecommerce website(s), including promotions, coupons, and marketing campaigns. As part of the newly formed Digital Commerce Pod, you will be responsible for delivering reliable and scalable digital ecommerce experiences that delight end-users in their simplicity, while achieving long-term business growth and profitability targets.
Working both as an individual contributor and collaboratively with a team, this role also supports the deployment of our feature roadmap. Responsibilities include writing requirements and user testing, along with the creation and execution of A/B testing on the website to improve overall site performance.
Requirements:
Minimum two years of marketing experience with online and/or ecommerce websites.
Minimum two years of project management or project team experience.
Hands on knowledge of HTML and with using CMS systems such as WordPress
Experience with online merchandising or user experience design preferred
Strong understanding of the marketing funnel including cross-channel management and engagement touchpoints
Knowledge of broad marketing techniques and comfort learning and using new technology platforms preferred
Working knowledge of Google Analytics (GA4), including the setup of tags, triggers and events preferred

title: Copywriter
description:
FabFitFun is searching for a Copywriter to join our Creative team! The Copywriter will be focused on writing, brainstorming, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver copy for our growing DTC Ecommerce brand. In this role you will be crafting persuasive and engaging ad copy for various digital platforms, with a focus on advertising. We are looking for an individual that can develop unique and attention-grabbing concepts that align with the FabFitFun's messaging strategy.
Location: This role is based out of our HQ in Los Angeles where we are operating from a hybrid model of 3 days a week in-office. This role is not eligible for remote.
What You'll Do:
Develop scripts for video advertisements, paid media videos and static ads
Write effective marketing copy for but not limited to landing pages, growth marketing, promotional materials
Generate compelling slogans, campaign titles, and taglines that resonate with the target audience
Create product detail page copy for new SKUs that are added to the Ecommerce site
Produce ad prompts for podcast sponsorships, ensuring seamless integration with the podcast's content.
Collaborate with Creative Leadership and stakeholders to plan and map out creative strategy
Research, monitor, and inform the team of shifts within the industry related to copy and advertising
Analyze ad copy and messaging performance using data and analytics tools
Set expectations for ad copy protocols and best practices across the content creative team
What You'll Bring:
4+ years of proven copywriting experience with a strong portfolio showcasing your versatility and creativity
Adaptability to varying voices, styles, and messaging characteristics, enabling you to tailor your writing effectively
Knowledge of diversity and inclusivity in writing to create messaging that resonates with diverse audiences
Strong research skills to delve into client industries, products, services, branding, and marketing trends
Familiarity with tone variations across different advertising and marketing channels
Previous advertising education / agency experience is highly valued for industry-specific insights
The expected salary range for this position is $85-90K. The compensation package will also include an initial equity grant in addition to a range of generous medical, dental, vision and other perks & benefits. Compensation decisions are determined using a variety of job-related factors such as skill set, geographic location, market demands, experience, and education / certifications. If we extend an offer for employment, we will consider all individual qualifications.
What You'll Get! The Benefits & Perks of FabFitFun...
Uncapped / Generous PTO
Medical, Dental & Vision with competitive coverage options and plans
401K & 401K Match
Pet insurance for any FFF furry friends via Nationwide - covers 90% expenses
Complimentary annual FFF subscription with seasonal $25 credit for e-commerce flash sales
Donation matching program via BrightFunds, where the company matches up to $500 charitable donations per employee
HQ Perks: Paid parking, weekly catered lunch, cold brew & kombucha on tap, additional snacks & beverages
Privacy
Your information will be handled in accordance with our Workforce Member Privacy Notice: https://legal.fabfitfun.com/#workforce-member-privacy-notice

title: Senior Marketing Coordinator
description:
Description:
Join the Clune family where you’re valued as an employee owner! Clune Construction is proud to be made up of passionate, driven, unique individuals who exhibit integrity and value quality in everything they do. We welcome diversity of thought and life experience. As an employee-owned company, we invest in our people and in turn, our people benefit from a culture of shared fate. We believe this has led to us being the fortunate recipient of countless awards for our culture and ethics, including Best Places to Work, a Top Workplace nationally, and the Better Business Bureau’s Torch Award for outstanding ethics.
As a member of the Marketing Team, the Senior Marketing Coordinator will report directly to the Marketing Manager and will be responsible for taking on a variety of tasks that allow for the successful completion of project pursuits as well as planned marketing and communications programs. We’re looking for a self-starter who can manage their time effectively. The role requires drive and a sense of accountability, flexibility and humor. AEC industry experience is required.
What We Offer
At Clune Construction we value each of our employees and care about their wellbeing. We strive to provide best-in-class benefits packages, including:
Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance with 100% of monthly premiums paid by the company
Employee Stock Ownership Plan
401k Retirement Plan with Company Match
Employee Assistance Program
Company-paid and Voluntary Life Insurance Plans
Company-paid Short Term and Long Term Disability
Flexible Spending, Dependent Care and Commuter Plans
Career Development through Mentoring Program, Learning & Development, Continuing Education
Fitness Program
Pet Insurance
Core Values and Behaviors
Clune Construction is proud to have Core Values and Behaviors that all of our employees represent. These Core Values are: Safety, Service, Teamwork, Respect, Excellence, Leadership and Innovation. Performance is evaluated with these Core Values in mind.
Essential Functions:
Project Related Marketing - Coordinate marketing activities related to project pursuits and client relationship maintenance, RFPs / RFQs, interviews and post-construction surveys.
Marketing Collateral – Oversee the organization and formatting of marketing collateral including resumes, project sheets, project lists, and project descriptions maintaining current information and formatting in line with Corporate Brand Standards.
Photography – Oversee the maintenance of the photo library and photography contractual agreements and scheduling of photoshoots and project photography.
Database – Assist with maintaining integrity of the marketing database and conduct reporting’s or audits as needed.
Collaboration with Other Departments - Prepare and assemble high-quality custom packages for internal stakeholders (i.e. Business Development, Human Resources, IT, Training, Safety)
Marketing Education – Provide guidance to employees and stakeholders on the appropriate use of marketing tools and systems
Marketing Team Collaboration – Establish and maintain effective and collaborative working relationship with marketing staff
Special Projects – Assist with special projects and events including but not limited to employee and client gifts, office announcements, and client events.
Requirements:
Conscientious and flexible, with a strong work ethic and team-player attitude
Balances the need for diplomacy and persistence
Strong skills in time management and prioritization
Solid written and verbal communication skills; proven ability to proof and edit marketing materials
Proficient in Adobe InDesign and Microsoft Office. Ability in software such as Photoshop and Illustrator a plus. Familiarity with CRM programs a plus
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and effectively handle multiple requests
Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or related field preferred
5+ years’ experience in marketing with a professional services firm, A/E/C industry preferred
All candidates must provide a resume.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Creative Project Manager
description:
CREATIVE PROJECT MANAGER
Legacy is the leading brand experience agency driving growth through authentic human connections. We bring people and brands together through strategic, creative, and impactful experiences.
In 20+ years as a creative-led independent agency, we’ve brought big thinking to life with unparalleled insights, enduring client partnerships, and unmatched executional excellence. We believe in working hard, creating great experiences, and having fun.
Perennially listed in Event Marketer Magazine’s Top 100 It List and Promo Marketing Magazines Top Suppliers, we also have won multiple Ex Awards, Event Technology Awards and Pro Awards, among others.
Experience is everything.
ROLE
Award-winning, Chicago-based, brand experience agency is seeking a Creative Project Manager. A Creative Project Manager is the glue that helps keep projects – and people – together, is responsible for planning, organizing, managing and executing projects from beginning to end. The project scope can vary from single pieces of collateral to multifaceted, multichannel marketing campaigns
RESPONSIBILITIES
Create long and short-term plans, including setting targets for milestones and adhering to deadlines
Delegate tasks on the project to employees best positioned to complete them
Make effective decisions when presented with multiple options for how to progress with the project
Serve as a point of contact for teams when multiple units are assigned to same project to ensure team actions remain in synergy
Communicate with executives or the board to keep the project aligned with their goals
Perform quality control on the project throughout development to maintain the standards expected
Adjust schedules and targets on the project as needs or financing on the project change
Define & track project timeline, scope and budget
Gather requirements, deliverables, and timeframes from stakeholders to create project plans
Evaluate project plans and workload; resource internal and external creative talent where appropriate
Know the team’s strengths and weaknesses, together and individually, and plan to the team’s skills to ensure end success
Communicate effectively with sponsors, stakeholders, clients and internal teams to ensure that all involved are kept up to date on project plans, priorities, key milestones, deliverables, deadlines and results
Adhere to the critical path and have a plan to mitigate issues that invariably arise
Assess and evaluate project performance metrics and results; produce clear reports to share with stakeholders
REQUIREMENTS
3-5 years creative project management experience (preferably agency-side)
Expert organizational skills
Creative problem-solving skills – able to use logic as well as imagination to make sense of a situation and come up with an intelligent solution
Strong ability to multitask
Outstanding communication skills
Knowledge of project management processes, workflow and terminology
Ability to function well in a fast paced (sometimes chaotic) environment under tight deadlines
Experience with Project Management software, preferred
SALARY & BENEFITS
$70,000 - $75,000/Year
Hybrid office setting (in-office 3 days/week)
Medical, Dental, Vision Insurance
401K w/company match
18 PTO days/year
Paid holiday schedule
Legacy is the definitive one-stop shop for measurable, strategic brand experiences. In 20+ years as a creative-led independent agency, we’ve brought big thinking to life with unparalleled insights, enduring client partnerships, and unmatched executional excellence.
Text "CPM579" to 312-629-4949 to start your application!

title: Creative Strategist, CPG
description:
Responsibilities
TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

About the team:
Creative Lab is TikTok's in-house creative consultancy for brands and creative companies. We work collaboratively with key accounts, creative agencies, and in-house creative teams to inspire creativity and advance TikTok-first thinking.

Responsibilities:
Lead creative consultation with key clients. You partner with Sales and other XFN teams to develop creative strategy work for our most important clients. You proactively prioritize internal business objectives and propose solutions that solve clients' business problems.
Help clients understand how to create for TikTok. Educate and inspire all internal and external partners on TikTok creative possibilities. You do this in many ways: real-time consultation on creative strategies, workshops, best practices, trends presentations, and more.
Inspire the industry. You translate trends and behaviors from our community, updates to our products and platform, and shifts in the broader business and creative industry into larger creative opportunities. You work with brands and agencies to develop best in class creative on TikTok.
Manage your own projects in a fast-growing startup. We don't believe in project managers and layers of bureaucracy. You multi-task and prioritize your own projects, manage your own deadlines, and maintain a positive, collaborative relationship with XFN partners.
Champion our branded solutions. Understand ad product benefits, capabilities, and features that translates to creative recommendations and best practices for clients.
Qualifications

Qualifications:
7-10 years in a creative or creative strategy role
Able to work out of our office in Manhattan, weekly, on a hybrid-schedule
Experience within a top tier creative agency, brand creative group or a creative role within a technology company
Passion for TikTok, the power of the platform, its communities, and the creative possibilities it can unlock
Strong grasp on culture, an eye for trends and a keen understanding of what is relevant in modern media
Excellent written and verbal communicator, with the ability to solve for complex business problems through compelling creative strategies, breakthrough creative ideas, and engaging presentations
Excellent communication and facilitation skills, with a keen ability to facilitate stakeholders towards positive outcomes. Strong people skills and the ability to engage on all levels of the organization.
Proven track record of operating independently, demonstrating creativity, maintaining organization, strong attention to detail, and managing multiple projects simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications:
CPG (Beauty, Care or Food and Beverage) Experience
Experience creating partnerships based on brand goals and content opportunities
Deep interest and understanding of the creator economy
Strong sense of problem solving and a proactive approach to innovative storytelling
Ability to be a concise and clear storyteller
Content
Research
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at gbs.accommodations@tiktok.com
Job Information
The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $106666 - $165000 annually.



Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.



Our company benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support our employees to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees:



We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care.



Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off (PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability.



We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.

title: Content Creator - Corporate Marketing
description:
Let’s be unstoppable together!
Circana (formerly IRI and NPD) is the leading advisor on the complexity of consumer behavior. Through unparalleled technology, advanced analytics, cross-industry data, and deep expertise, we provide clarity that helps almost 7,000 of the world’s leading brands and retailers take action and unlock business growth. We understand more about the complete consumer, the complete store, and the complete wallet so our clients can go beyond the data to apply insights, ignite innovation, meet consumer demand, and outpace the competition.
At Circana, we are fueled by our passion for continuous learning and growth, we seek and share feedback freely, and we celebrate victories both big and small in an environment that is flexible and accommodating to our work and personal lives. We have a global commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion as we believe in the undeniable strength that diversity brings to our business, employees, clients, and communities (with us you can always bring your full self to work). Join our inclusive, committed team to be a challenger, own outcomes, and stay curious together. Learn more at www.circana.com.
What will you be doing?
We are seeking a writer with B2B content creation experience to reinforce a fresh, conversational, and professional voice for the organization and develop high-quality content across owned and paid media. The Content Creator, reporting to our head of Marketing Thought Leadership and Content, will work within our Marketing teams globally and across much of the business to develop engaging content that demonstrates our unique position in the market including our industry expertise and our understanding of the complete consumer. This role will create content for various thought leadership, branding, and product initiatives including industry reports, campaigns, sales enablement programs, events, and more.
Job Responsibilities
Develop and launch marketing content that directly supports our business objectives.
Write long- and short-form content including but not limited to industry reports, bylines and other articles, blogs, newsletters, infographics, social media copy, website copy, landing pages, digital and print ads, video scripts, podcast guides, event communications, and other marketing and sales thought leadership content.
Serve as a ghostwriter for industry experts across the organization.
Make appropriate content recommendations that directly tie into overall communications strategy and goals based on a keen understanding of relevant industry trends and client needs.
Collaborate across internal teams to determine how, when, and what types of content to use to meet campaign objectives.
Understand competitive content and positioning for relevant topics.
Support research on relevant industry topics when needed.
Monitor digital engagement metrics for published content and identify areas to refine/improve.
Proofread and edit various types of content.
Project management including communicating project status, timing, and other important info to internal teams.
Work efficiently in a fast-paced environment and be able to meet tight deadlines.
Requirements
5 to 10 years of copywriting experience in dynamic B2B environments.
BA/MA degree in Writing, English, Communications, or related field.
Excellent communication skills, flexibility, and professional demeanor.
Exceptional writing, editing, and proofreading skills.
Well-versed in AP writing style.
Understanding of SEO best practices.
Ability to write under deadlines.
Previous experience writing for technology, analytics, advertising and/or market research companies.
Previous experience working closely with creative, web, and video teams to create and refine content to align with visual and/or template requirements.
Ability to quickly learn technical information and distill it into easy-to-understand concepts for various audiences.
Experience using project management applications such as Wrike or Monday.com is a plus.
Circana Behaviors
As well as the technical skills, experience and attributes that are required for the role, our shared behaviors sit at the core of our organization. Therefore, we always look for people who can continuously champion these behaviors throughout the business within their day-to-day role:
Stay Curious: Being hungry to learn and grow, always asking the big questions
Seek Clarity: Embracing complexity to create clarity and inspire action
Own the Outcome: Being accountable for decisions and taking ownership of our choices
Center on the Client: Relentlessly adding value for our customers
Be a Challenger: Never complacent, always striving for continuous improvement
Champion Inclusivity: Fostering trust in relationships engaging with empathy, respect and integrity
Commit to each other: Contributing to making Circana a great place to work for everyone
Location
This position can be located in the following area(s): Chicago, IL
The below range reflects the range of possible compensation for this role at the time of this posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. An employee’s position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, shift, travel requirements, sales or revenue-based metrics, any collective bargaining agreements, and business or organizational needs.
The salary range for this role is $61,000.00 $100,000.00.
We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees.
You can apply for this role through our career website.

title: Associate Brand Manager, Agency (sister brand to Curology)
description:
Curology is creating the next generation of skincare through customized treatment plans and formulas with powerful prescription ingredients for acne and anti-aging. We believe great skin shouldn’t be a luxury, but a fact of life.

Most brand management roles at traditional brands are slow and stagnant. You inherit a great history, but end up focused on protecting past success rather than blazing paths for future growth. And most startup brand management roles, well, they don’t exist. The C-suite runs the business, and brand management becomes brand marketing, without a strong connection to business results.

At Curology, we’re changing that. We are looking to hire an Associate Brand Manager to help propel Agency to our next level of growth. Your job will be to support the Brand Lead of Agency to launch 360 marketing campaigns, bring Agency’s brand marketing to the next level and supercharge our evergreen marketing across organic social, influencer, PR and more.
What you'll do:
Analyze the business and develop an in-depth understanding of key drivers
Own performance tracking for new initiatives, deriving insights from the data which will enable brand leaders as they set the direction for brand growth
Size and scope innovation (product + marketing) opportunities through the development of robust forecasts and business models to prove out ROI and size of prize
Partner with the Brand Lead of Agency, to identify net new future growth levers to inflect the business [ex. New audience segments]
Get hands on with execution, partnering with integrated marketing, creative, product/packaging, engineering, consumer insights, medical, legal - to bring plans to life
Lead go-to-market launches of new products, developing and closely monitoring detailed timelines and managing cross functional stakeholders, looking for opportunities to optimize the tools and processes to brief in teamsLead development of world-class briefs that effectively communicated the “what”, “how” and “why” for brand campaigns and product launches
Lead our brand’s expansion into new distribution channels, developing competitive pricing strategies, best in class content to support the launch and managing marketing budget
About you:
You are analytical but able to go beyond the data: you are able to derive key insights from a variety of data points and sources and put them into context to get to the “so what”
You love a challenge and are self-driven: you thrive under pressure and can very quickly become a subject matter expert on any subject through self-drive; you can take on projects and manage them end-to-end, seeking help and guidance as needed
Exceptional communicator: you can clearly communicate complex ideas through different mediums; you are able to build relationships quickly
Humble and a great team player: you are constantly trying to learn from others and you have a flexible approach that enables strong collaboration with cross-functional partners; you have a can-do attitude and will roll up your sleeves to do what is needed for the team
2-4 Years in CPG Brand Management: You have worked in Brand Management at a traditional CPG company, with experience in DTC
Motivated by curiosity, whether solving a problem, pursuing a new experience, or seeking creative inspiration
Results-driven, solution-oriented, flexible, self-driving, and must have the ability to change course quickly
You'll love working at Curology because:
Competitive salary and equity packages
Comprehensive benefits: medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees; flexible spending account; 401k; mental health & wellness programs
$75 WFH stipend (remote employees)
Home office setup stipend (remote employees)
Minimum Time Off policy (unlimited PTO, with at least 3 weeks off) for exempt employees
11 company observed holidays
Additional holidays: Curology days off (1 per quarter), 1 annual floating holiday (employee’s choice), and Gratitude Week (employees take the full week of Thanksgiving off; business critical teams observe different days)
Paid parental leave
Employee donation matching program
Company-sponsored events
Free subscription to Curology or Agency
$81,000 - $120,000 a year
Our mission is simple: to make personalized skincare accessible and convenient for all. Awarded #3 for 2021 Best Workplaces in the Bay Area and 2021 Forbes #4 Best Startup Employers, Curology is a leader in direct-to-consumer eCommerce and has been featured in Vogue, Allure, Harper’s Bazaar, and Business Insider. We collaborate to achieve our goals and strive to embody our core values: Accountability, Team First & Inclusivity.

title: Brand Associate
location: 100 Lafayette St Ste 204, New York, NY 10013
description:
About Edelman Delta:

We live in a volatile and changing world where people demand more of corporations; where leaders know their organizations need to change and build authenticity, resilience, and trust.

That change starts with brand.

Edelman Delta is the brand consultancy of Edelman, the world’s leading communications firm. Our team of practitioners spans Chicago, New York, and London. We support organizations worldwide looking to change who they are, how they act, and how they’re seen.

About the role:

We’re hiring an Associate to join our brand consultancy. We’re looking for a high-performing, early-to-mid-career professional that wants to play a critical role at a young and growing company and can thrive in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, creative environment.

In this role, you’ll work closely with a global, multidisciplinary team of strategists that advises top companies on how to define and implement brand positioning, purpose, identity, and messaging that builds trust. From day one, you’ll be counted on to bring outstanding client service/account management, research, and project management skills to every engagement.

The ideal candidate for this position will have a passion for brand building and 2-3 years of experience in a firm specializing in brand strategy, research, or consulting,
Responsibilities:
This is a hybrid role (avg. 3 days a week in the office) based in Chicago. Standard responsibilities for the role will include:
Research: Conduct background research on relevant companies, industries, cultural trends, and the broader economy; summarize findings in briefing documents
Client Service: Maintain strong working relationships with clients and partners
Presentations: Build clear, well-designed, proofread presentations in PowerPoint for client meetings and new business pitches
Meeting Coordination: Schedule and manage logistics around project status meetings, internal reviews, and client check-ins across projects
Correspondence: Write professional, clear, concise communications to key internal external stakeholders across projects
Project Management: Build and manage timelines; take high-quality notes and develop meeting recaps; ensure delivery of accurate, efficient, and high-quality work
Brand Strategy: Support strategy development by creating competitive presentations, monitoring branding trends, conducting ad hoc research, and contributing to internal reviews and client meetings
Independence: Work autonomously as well as part of a close-knit team
Integrity: Contribute positively to the reputation of Edelman Delta, both within Edelman and externally; display Edelman's core values consistently
Basic Qualifications:
At least 2 years of relevant experience in branding, communications, marketing, consulting, and/or related fields
A bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Location preference for the candidate is Chicago
At least one year of experience working in corporate/B2B branding
Proven ability to manage multiple small or medium-sized projects simultaneously
Experience building and maintaining strong client relationships
Able to perform well under pressure in a fast-paced environment with large teams
Possesses strong organizational and time/project management skills
Creative thinker, problem solver, and action-oriented individual committed to client excellence
Desire to stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and trends
Strong work ethic, attention to detail, and dedication to consistently provide high-quality work for their team and clients
Strong research, writing, and editing skills
Familiarity with Microsoft Office
$52,000 - $77,000 a year
An employee’s pay position within the salary range will be based on several factors including, but not limited to, relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, geographic location, performance, travel requirements, revenue-based metrics, any contractual agreements, and business or organizational needs. The range listed is just one component of DJEH’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, a Paid Time Off policy, and region-specific benefits.
#LI-SL1

Edelman is a global communications firm that partners with businesses and organizations to evolve, promote and protect their brands and reputations. Our 6,000 people in more than 60 offices deliver communications strategies that give our clients the confidence to lead and act with certainty, earning the trust of their stakeholders. Our honors include the Cannes Lions Grand Prix for PR; Advertising Age’s 2019 A-List; the Holmes Report’s 2018 Global Digital Agency of the Year; and, five times, Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work. Since our founding in 1952, we have remained an independent, family-run business. Edelman owns specialty companies Edelman Data & Intelligence (DxI) and United Entertainment Group (entertainment, sports, lifestyle).

For more information please visit: www.edelman.com

Employees must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (i.e., at least 2 weeks after last dose) and, if hired, present proof of vaccination before start date. Candidates may request an accommodation due to disability, sincerely held religious belief or exception required under applicable law.

Edelman is committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage racially and ethnically diverse people, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, parents, individuals with disabilities and members of any and all protected classes to apply.

title: Employee Benefits Marketing Analyst
description:
Insurance is a trillion dollar market that is fundamental to society, yet it has not modernized — until now.

Newfront is building the modern insurance experience.

We've reimagined the experience for clients, prospects, and employees, altering the way people create, understand, select, transact, and use insurance. We're changing the approach so that it starts and ends with the client, not the product, and empowering people for moments that matter.

Our unique approach recognizes both the vast potential of technology and the fundamental role of insurance experts. We're a technology-driven company with DE&I in our DNA and strong values; we believe people matter most.

Our mission is to define the future of the insurance industry, while instilling a high performance culture in combination with living our Work, Love, Play ethos each day. We value balanced lives and are passionate about creating a culture of wellness that results in healthier, happier, and more productive employees, and more successful clients.

The Benefits Marketing Analyst will support the service teams in creating communication materials for Carrier & Vendor Partners and partner with the service team to ensure that all client initiatives are executed precisely and flawlessly.

This position is a salaried, exempt and full-time role and will be reporting to the Data Analytics Research & Development Lead. This is a US Hybrid/Remote role, with the option to work from any of Newfront’s offices. #LI-Remote


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Partner with sales and service teams to understand the client’s goals leading into the RFP process.
Complete the carrier/vendor marketing process from conception to completion for clients of all sizes with varying lines of coverage and funding types.
Be engaged and aware of the latest product offered by carriers.
Organize client census and plan design information to send to carriers.
Review carrier proposals for accuracy and completeness.
Summarize RFP responses into a client ready presentation.
Work with General Agent (GA) partners for small group marketing process outsourcing.
Other tasks, duties, or specialist projects as assigned.
To perform this position successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.
WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TABLE
Efficient at multi-tasking and flexibility to deal with ever-changing priorities and deadlines.
Effective negotiation skills with internal and external stakeholders.
Exceptional communication: written, public speaking and presentation preparation.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Must be able to screen details and identify potential discrepancies.
Exceptional customer service skills, diplomacy, professionalism, and tact.
Proficient knowledge and use of Microsoft Office and advance complexities of features.
Ability to be resourceful, take initiative, solve problems, create solutions, and manage process improvements.
Thrives at working with others in a fast-paced environment and is responsive to co-workers and colleagues. Ability to train, delegate, provide oversight and give feedback.
Adaptability and flexibility to proactively anticipate and address issues and client needs.
Exceptional time management skills and the ability to navigate demanding schedules, priorities, and volumes.
Ability to learn, adopt and train use of technology systems and software applications.
Proficient at strategic project planning including extended time management.
Ability to forge relationships and build trust with clients, carriers, and internal stakeholders.
Ability to provide direction, give feedback and coach others within team.
Active participation as an Newfront team member, suggesting improvements in processes and procedures and ways to make the organization better.
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
Minimum of 3 years of carrier / vendor marketing experience within the employee benefits industry.
Insurance industry background or and knowledge of group products required.
Must continue to meet continuing education requirements for CA Department of insurance license renewal.
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATION
CA Department of Insurance Life License (required or completed within 3 months of start date).
The pay range for this position in California, Washington, Colorado and New York at the commencement of employment is expected to be between $95,200 to $119,000/yr; however, base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including market location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus, restricted stock units, and discretionary awards in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as vacation, sick time, and parental leave), dependent on the position offered. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, the employee will be in an “at-will position,” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

At Newfront, we are committed to hiring diverse talent and supporting an inclusive workplace environment. If you are excited about a role at Newfront but feel you’re missing a few of the qualifications, we still encourage you to apply and tell us about yourself. You may just be the next Newfront team member that we are looking for!

Newfront is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. Diversity is in our DNA and we believe that creating an inclusive workplace elevates the value we are able to bring to our customers and employees alike. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other applicable status protected by state or local law.

If you require reasonable accommodations throughout the application or interview process, please contact us at careers@newfront.com. For information regarding how Newfront collects and uses personal information, please review our Privacy Policy.

title: Marketing Campaign Specialist
description:
About the Role:
Yardi is seeking an experienced Marketing Campaign Specialist ready to take the lead in devising and implementing robust marketing strategies tailored to our unique product lines and market segments. Your role will be central to fostering cross-departmental collaboration, creating a unified front in the production of a diverse array of marketing materials and sales tools. You'll join forces with our in-house creative team, turning collaborative efforts into compelling marketing campaigns across multiple channels including print, digital, and social media. This is a role for a strategic thinker who can also roll up their sleeves to ensure that marketing initiatives are delivered with excellence and align with our company's vision. If you're ready to take on a role that is as challenging as it is rewarding, we would love to talk to you!
What You’ll Do:
Delivers marketing strategy and plan and contributes to the sales strategy and plan for assigned product/market.
Collaborates with sales, services, and product development and teams to continually review and evolve sales and marketing strategy.
Manages production and delivery of all marketing activities for assigned product/market.
Understands the client and prospect base and develops effective sales and marketing messaging.
Oversees marketing efforts (e.g. messaging, promos) and strategy for events
Develops strong calls to action to generate leads and manages the prospect funnel for desired results.
Leverages various marketing systems to coordinate and deliver marketing collateral.
Tracks and analyzes the effectiveness of product/market marketing content.
Understands Yardi corporate culture, messaging and branding.
Communicates and collaborates regularly with project and product stakeholders.
Who You Are:
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field.
A minimum of three (3) years of marketing experience.
Prior experience in business to business (B2B) marketing organization.
Proficiency in MS Office Suite, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Determination and internal self-motivation
Exceptional ability to articulate ideas and compose compelling written narratives.
Superior meticulousness in reviewing and refining content.
Robust ability to oversee projects, balancing and prioritizing concurrent tasks effectively.
Profound skills in building and nurturing interpersonal relationships.
Outstanding aptitude for maintaining systematic and orderly processes.
Proficient in conducting thorough research and providing insightful analysis.
Flexible working approach, capable of thriving autonomously or as part of a team.
Helpful to have:
Experience in specified product/market/industry.
Enterprise software and real estate industry experience
Real Estate runs on Yardi. About Us:
Yardi pioneers the property tech industry by seamlessly blending 40 years of tradition with forward-thinking innovation. We’ve created a team of over 9,000 employees in over 40 locations around the globe dedicated to making great real estate software products.
Discover the Yardi Difference:
Yardi is more than just a software company – we are dedicated to creating a positive impact in our communities. Annually, Yardi extends philanthropic support to organizations chosen by our employees. Our team has contributed to over 350 nonprofits globally, demonstrating our commitment to various causes and communities.
Our award-winning culture, consistently recognized by Glassdoor's prestigious "Best Place to Work", fosters support, collaboration, and growth. We prioritize your well-being with comprehensive benefits, including 100% paid employee medical premiums, company profit-sharing plan, and flexible work arrangements.
Join Yardi and be part of a company that empowers, inspires, and celebrates success. #YardiCulture #BestPlaceToWork #YardiCareers

Annual compensation range $80,800 - $90,900
All submissions for open positions should be received through Yardi’s applicant portal, accessed from Yardi’s corporate website.
EOE/Race/Gender/Disability/Vets

LOCATION
Santa Barbara, CA
BUSINESS UNIT
PHA
DEPARTMENT
Marketing
EMPLOYMENT TYPE
Employee- Full Time

title: Product Marketing Specialist
description:
Job Description:
Reporting to the Marketing Director, this position leads the promotion of health insurance products and services for assigned product lines. It creates and executes upon an annual marketing plan and strategy to retain, increase, and engage members with a focus on personalized marketing experiences. This position leads work that significantly impacts the achievement of company growth and retention goals in alignment with strategic priorities, while anticipating market trends. It partners with the Marketing Director, Sales, Product Development, Agent Experience and other stakeholder to create and manager the implementation of annual marketing and sales campaigns within appropriate promotional budgets and coordinates marketing efforts related to generate leads and effectively promote, educate, engage audiences and ensure successful campaign outcomes.

This role also works closely with creative services, customer services, customer experience and the analytics/Consumer research teams, to oversee the creation of creative briefs; presentations; marketing brochures; direct mail campaigns; web content; digital campaigns, including email; and member communications. Ensures the final products convey the desired messaging and outcome through appropriate design, compelling content, and mediums.
This role is also required to work with analysts to ensure accurate measurement of campaigns and use data to optimize existing campaigns.
Additionally, the Product Marketing Specialist ensures marketing materials meet regulatory, compliance, branding, and legal requirements

This role is also required to work with analysts to ensure accurate measurement of campaigns and use data to optimize existing campaigns

Additionally, the Product Marketing Specialist ensures marketing materials meet regulatory, compliance, branding, and legal requirements.
Please note, this is a hybrid role - primarily remote, but may require some on-site work.
Job Essentials
Marketing Plan and Communication Strategy: Working with the Sales, Product Development and the Marketing Director, this role leads the efforts to develops and execute an annual marketing plan/s go-to-market, and/or communication strategies to support goals and approved initiatives. Identifies and utilizes marketing/communication strategies to acquire and retain customers.
Research Strategy: Through independent and collaborative efforts, uses research methodologies to appropriately position products. Works with the Analytics/Consumer Research team team to understand the product and related opportunities for capturing feedback and determining segmentation that will inform the annual marketing plan, marketing promotion, and communication efforts. Works with analysts to identify target consumers and curate prospect lists. Develops clear measurement strategy to evaluate success of campaigns and provides related reports.
Marketing and Resource Oversight: Utilizes resources from multiple Marketing teams, including Creative Services, Public Relations, and Customer Experience to oversee the development and successful launch of prioritized and budgeted marketing initiatives. Ensures Marketing resources are prioritized accordingly. The individual in this role will attend product staff and project meetings and recognize marketing and communication opportunities and develop strategies to meet objectives.
Project Management: Must be highly organized, forward thinking, and use methods to create project plans for prioritized initiatives to ensure Marketing resources are appropriately allocated to meet deadlines and budgets. Provides status reports and dashboards to leaders and business owners. Manages projects that utilize other teams and may lead cross functional teams in successful completion of projects.
Budget Oversight: Works with the Marketing Director and business owners to support annual budget plan/s and manage to approved budgets each year. Reconciles invoices to ensure they match the bid and are submitted for payment in a timely manner. Identifies and recommends cost reduction ideas. Works with the marketing production coordinator and ensures production bids are appropriate and align with project budget goals.
Management: May mentor other caregivers or interns as appropriate. May also manage vendors and associated projects and budgets, as assigned.
Minimum Qualifications
Demonstrated experience in product marketing, account management, ad agency, or retail promotion, health insurance or healthcare communications or promotion, or communications.
